Review_Text: Wonderful relaxing stay at this Riad which is tucked away yet still walking distance to all the hustle and bustle. Aziz the manager is so helpful and informative with lots of really useful tips and great recommendations. The riad is very comfortable and the breakfast good and plentiful. All the staff are lovely. Would definitely love to stay again.

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Had the most wonderful stay at this Riad. Aziz Mustapha and the rest of Les Trois Mages staff just couldn’t do enough. We were looked after so well we didn’t want to leave. The food was excellent the rooms beautiful and the beds so comfortable. So we can highly recommend this Riad. We are returning in September for another weeks stay and looking forward to another wonderful holiday in Marrakech at Riad Les Trois Mages. I first visited Les Trois Mages 10 year’s ago. I will never forget my first impression on opening the Riad door. I had been invited into a different world and it still feels the same today 10 years on. David and Carol

Review_Date: Rene C wrote a review Mar 20
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Mages is amazing. The manager Aziz and the staff were gracious and kind. Aziz was the ultimate host and was in contact with me from the moment I made the reservation at my arrival and through out my stay. I was taken care of day and night. My every need was met and exceeded expectations. The Riad was close to great local restaurants quite and has a roof top pool which I enjoyed.

Review_Date: Elliot B wrote a review Mar 19
Review_Text: We would highly reccomend this riad. The transport was arranged from the airport upon arrival which took us straight to the riad only a short distance from the airport. Aziz the manager greeted us upon arrival and gave us information on marrakech and anything we needed to know about our stay. We booked day trips to the Atlas Mountains and Essaouira which were very well organised trips that we won't forget. The riad itself is beautiful and a nice sanctuary which is perfect to come back to when you want to relax. We can't say enough about how nice the staff are at the riad they truly made the stay memorable with their generosity positivity and kindness throughout our stay. Everyone was so helpful and always greeted us with a smile on their face. Thank you very much Aziz Eli…

Review_Date: claudia c wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: The Riad was the perfect tranquil spot to come back to after a day exploring the busy streets of Marrakesh. We stayed in the suite for a week which was an incredible experience I’d recommend to anyone the bed was amazing and it was so nice having the extra space that came with it. Breakfast was always a highlight of our day so much delicious fresh food that we would enjoy in one of the comfy seating areas around the Riad. The location was perfect near to everything but off the main streets. Everyone working there was so kind and helpful and made us feel so welcome with lots of useful information and tea and coffee whenever we liked. I will definitely be back if I visit Marrakesh again and recommend to anyone visiting :)

Review_Date: Sharon S wrote a review Mar 5
Review_Text: The moment you step into the calm and serenity of this gem of a riad after the chaos and craziness of the Medina and souls you realise you are in a special place. We loved it here especially after heading out to other accommodation outside the old city which made us realise how exceptional this one is. Aziz and his team couldn't do more to make our stay better. They exude the same calmness of the riad and do everything to make sure your stay is the best it can be from arranging taxis suggesting fabulous restaurants and sightseeing trips and welcoming my brother and poorly sister in law enabling her to rest. Our room was lovely on the first floor overlooking the beautiful courtyard and it's 2 lounges. Breakfast was amazing. Highly recommended.

We just arrived home from our first stay in Marrakech and it was exceptional because of the quality of service provided at Les Trois Mages. If I was able to give them more stars I definitely would. The Riad itself is gorgeous and spotlessly clean. We had a huge room complete with a very cool sunken bed sitting area and beautiful bathroom. There were also many sitting areas where we could lounge and relax outside of our room when we came home from exploring. We loved coming back to the Riad every day and heading up to the pool on the roof where we could relax and enjoy the quiet. It was very hard to believe that the hustle and bustle of the Medina was only steps away. So yes  it is a gorgeous place in an excellent location only steps away from the Medina however it’s the…

Review_Date: Charles S wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: A well located riad close to the Souks and convenient to money changers ATMs  and licensed restaurants. Its location is within easy walking distance of the main sites of Marrakech. The riad is very comfortable the breakfasts are generous and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Aziz the manager is a mine of information and can arrange any trips you require. Best to get him to arrange their driver to pick you up at the airport as it may be hard to find first time. I thoroughly recommend it .

Review_Date: Rodolfo W wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Staying at Les Trios Mages will only make your stay in Marrakesh more enjoyable. The management is incredible friendly and guest oriented. You will be directly contacted after the reservation is made with tips on how to get and helping you to arrange any special activity you may want to undertake while in Morocco. The rooms are clean silent and dark at night so you can well recover from the days activities. The breakfast is one of the best you can experience with real freshly pressed orange juice delicious pancakes and excellent coffee. While at the road tee or coffee will never run out. The location is just perfect the car can drop you within a few meters and at the sometime you are in the medina! Enjoy Marrakesh and the riad

This riad really worth it the room was so beautiful comfy and clean the breakfast was so delicious and all the team were super nice and polite with us also very helpful  they really take care of their guests especially Aziz he made our days in marrakesh so easier. You really get more than what you paid. For sure I will choose them again when I return to Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Eliezer K wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Just wow… read on for more details…
Review_Text: Wow. Simply wow.  I understand that when reading reviews we all look for the same things. So lets get basics out of the way.  - super clean.  - super friendly staff.  - breakfast is great.  - beautiful place.  - hot water works.  - the toilets flush.  Simply put its a great place to stay. End of story.    We actually went to two different Riads and this was our first one. After the second we went back here. Why? Because they just hit the marks here on every level.    In particular Aziz (the manager) is extremely accommodating. He truly understands what hospitality means. If this place is double the price of another Riad I promise it is still worth it.    These reviews matter most when we come from countries in the EU and North America. It does not mean we all have to be snobs just have some basic things that make our stays better and allow us to enjoy experience and learn from the culture. Riad Les Trois Mages is a big step in facilitating this. Book it you wont regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kelsey M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This place is hands down the best place to book. The hospitality is beyond what you would get at any of the other fancy riads. We stayed one night at a fancy Riad and it was so much worse then this place. The breakfast is amazing and the location is perfect. But truly it’s the staff that makes this place so incredible. I would choose this place over any other in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ellie F wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Amazing, homey Riad with outstanding service.
Review_Text: This Riad was amazing. The Manager Aziz and the other staff were so helpful accommodating and kind. They always made sure we had everything we needed and more. The breakfast was the best one we had in our 14 days in Marrakech. The room we stayed in was adorable and they had heated blankets and a heater! You can really tell this Riad is well kept and we felt totally at home here. I can’t recommend this place enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous stay in elegant Riad with wonderful staff.
Review_Text: This Riad is lovely. The courtyard for dining is airy and elegant and the music room with all the instruments and the piano is great- our son loved it. The bedrooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are luxurious. The upper terrace and pool are beautiful and a great place to have breakfast. Aziz Sarah and Saiid were wonderful attentive and kind hosts always there to assist and provide whatever we wanted or needed. A really fabulous stay close to the centre and we would highly recommend to other travellers.

Review_Date: Helen H wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: What a great place for a weekend away. First class service.
Review_Text: We have just returned from a three night break in Marrakech. Aziz was so kind and helpful. He arranged a taxi to meet us at the airport and was at the Riad when we arrived. We were welcomed with tea and cake whilst he explained things to do and see. We then mapped out our itinerary and he booked us a Souk tour of the Medina day 1 Atlas Mountains day 2 and Hamman day 3 all of which were great. He also recommended local eateries and places to see. Nothing was too much trouble. Excellent service. The Riad was very homely and tranquil and convenient for exploring. There were sun beds on the rooftop for relaxing plus rooms downstairs. The bedroom was spacious with nice hot shower and electric blanket. They provided tea or coffee whenever you wanted. All in all we had a lovely break away and felt really looked after by Aziz and the team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barah Hassan wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: It feels like home, tranquility in the heart of the bustling medina
Review_Text: Upon booking Aziz the manager got in touch to arrange for us to be safely picked up from the airport and brought to the hotel.    The hotel is beautiful and incredibly well maintained with a beautiful rooftop and pool. The staff are attentive friendly and incredibly well spoken in several languages!    It was surprisingly cool during our time there but the staff ensured we had a warm space to relax in with heaters and electric blankets available as well as AC present for the inevitable hot summers.    Throughout Aziz and his small team were caring and helped us plan our trip highlighting the do's and don'ts of our stay. They helped us plan excursions and ensured we got a fair deal throughout. Moreover rather than staff looking after guests it felt like friends looking after friends staying at their personal home. I could not have felt more welcome.    The breakfasts offered were varied and very filling for the day and there was an abundance of tea's and coffee's always on offer.    Another big plus for this hotel is its location. It is in the medina within walking distance of pretty much anywhere you need to go both in the old and new cities.    If coming however I would say the hotel is a little tricky to find at first knowing the hosts however they would support any new visitor in assisting them in finding their way so do get in touch as soon as you've booked.    I cannot rate this visit highly enough if visiting the city again I would absolutely chose to stay here without hesitation.

Review_Date: Kathy N wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Highlight of our trip - a top-notch amazing Riad
Review_Text: We absolutely loved Les Trois Mages. It was a wonderful intimate and relaxing Riad and we highly recommend it. We cannot say enough about the excellent service we received - Aziz the Riad manager was a kind and generous host who spent time explaining the layout of the medina and recommending places we would enjoy and we did! Said the night attendant was just as helpful friendly and efficient and we were always welcomed back with a warm smile and a check-in as to whether we needed anything. All staff made us feel welcome and comfortable. Breakfasts was a feast - delicious and served hot and fresh - we loved the traditional pancakes honey & preserves and warm milk with our coffee. The Riad was our sanctuary - the courtyard was a peaceful and welcome respite from the bustle of the medina and the seating alcoves around it were cozy and comfortable - great places to read on your own or chat about the day. Our room was on the 2nd level which I would recommend as it overlooks the courtyard and you can watch birds perch on the railings and foliage through the window. The bed was very comfortable and the room well-appointed. We tried a larger more expensive Riad later in the trip and we definitely found Les Trois Mages to be far superior in terms of service comfort and ambience. We didn't want to leave it felt like home away from home it really was the highlight of our trip. Thank you for making our stay so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick K wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: An extremely calming pleasant and comfortable home base for Marrakech! Aziz and the whole team do wonderful work not just providing a relaxing physical environment but striking a conversational tone that puts you at ease immediately. Breakfasts are delicious and the dinners well worth sampling as well. A wonderful value and a stay about which I am already feeling nostalgic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages for four nights in the Balthazar room and our stay could not have been better. Aziz and Saeed are wonderful - helpful resourceful and entirely genuine. The riad itself is in an excellent location in the medina but just outside all of the chaos and it’s a lovely sanctuary to return to after a day in your feet. The rooftop is comfortable and quiet it was a bit too chilly to use the pool but it was a great place to sit and relax. The ground floor has plenty of tables and couches and the fire was always lit at breakfast which made for a very cozy start to the day. The cleanliness of the entire place is 5 star. Breakfast was a highlight with eggs fruit yoghurt bread and either Moroccan pancakes (top notch at Les Mages!) or crepes along with fresh squeezed juice and coffee/tea. Aziz always made sure to check in on us at breakfast which made us feel very well looked after. We stayed at the Four Seasons in Casablanca and they should take a class on service from Aziz and Saeed truly.  The WiFi strength is good the bed was comfortable the room spacious and the hot water plentiful. As others have mentioned finding the location is a bit tricky with Google maps but maps.me worked perfectly and the picture of the door in a previous review was helpful.  Thanks for a perfect stay we will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Outstanding service and hospitality in mythical Marrakech!
Review_Text: First time in Marrakech and what a stay. The riad is perfectly situated inside the medina but in a less stressful part. Easy walking distance to most of the points of interest like Majorelle gardens Bahia Palace Place Jemma el Fna and of course the souk. Also easy to join tours from this place with 5 min walking to pick up point Place Riad Laarouss.    Manager Aziz is without any doubt the most friendly and service minded hotel manager we have met. Night porter Said is also one staff we would like to highlight with his professional and genuine interest in helping customers. The riads service and hospitality is outstanding and a memory for life.    The riad only has 6 rooms but it also brings out a fantastic atmosphere. Rooms are like in a fairy tale and there are common areas at all three floors. Pool area on the roof terrace to enjoy a swim from May to October (to cold now) or sitting in the sun enjoying your breakfast or afternoon tea/coffee.    To our big surprise the riad is serving wonderful morrocoan food both for lunch or dinner if you order one day in advance    We stayed for four nights and went on one city tour fantastic one-day hiking trip to the Atlas mountains and an excellent half day cooking school with chef Khmisa.    Be aware that traffic in the medina is extreme and it takes at least a day to move more relaxed.    We will be back for sure!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yinzu Nairouz wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Great holiday winter break in Marrakesh thanks to Aziz
Review_Text: Worth every penny! Book here you won't regret it. This is one of the best experiences I have had in a hotel (aka riad in Morocco). The manager Aziz is a very detail-oriented person so everything is perfect clean and organized. All the common areas are fantastic for seating and relaxing. Aziz gave us a map with some suggestions and how to return to the riad easily. He knows well the area and gave us great tips about how to enjoy Marrakech better and how to avoid scams and tourist tramps. We spent Christmas night there and he welcomed us into our room with a card and a bottle of Moroccan wine. Said is the night manager and he is an excellent pupil of Aziz. The breakfast was included and was delicious very nicely served at any time you want it. Aziz helped us find a hammam for couples. The first night we arrived at the riad it was hard to find the correct address as in other Medinas in Morocco the small alleys are a maze where it is easy to get lost. We found it but keep in mind that the signs are small. I added photos of the door so you have an idea of what it looks like.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karolina W wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We had a great 2 night stay at this beautiful Riad. Our room (Jade) was comfortable overlooking the central courtyard. There is a lovely roof terrace with pretty big plunge pool sun loungers tables chairs and chill out area - great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the Medina. The location is good close to the attractions in the north side of the old town and only about 10 minutes walk to the main square. There is a fantastic hammam/spa 1 minute walk away - definitely recommend a visit over there. Breakfast served at the Riad was plentiful and delicious fresh fruit yoghurt eggs pancakes jams pastries bread coffee fresh juice etc. But what's best about this place is the people. Aziz and his team are all super helpful generous and genuine. They helped us with transport from the bus station arranging hammam contacting our tour guides when we had no answer from them and generally made us feel very welcome and relaxed. Best hospitality ever!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Enni Myllymäki wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Very pleased with everything. Driver took us straight to the riad from the airport and we had so many great suggestions for activity in town. The staff was super welcoming and always took care of us individually e.g. by serving vegetarian food on breakfasts and asking us If everything was okay. Room was tidy and we loved especially heated matresses. 100% recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Murtaza F wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Staff Very humble and responsive. Great place to stay. Always welcoming and ready to support and guide tourists like us. Maybe one suggestion is to have front entrance door key with the room key so guests don't have to knock and disturb staff late nights. Other than that I would recommend to anybody and everybody. Breakfast is awesome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Toshi Omagari wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: It was our first time in Marrakech spending three nights at the hotel. The venue is located close enough to the centre of old town and distant enough from the buzz of the main streets. The staff and manager Aziz were all very welcoming and accommodating and they helped us make plans for each day. The place itself looks very traditional clean and relaxing; we didn't try the swimming pool on the roof but absolutely would have if our days were not packed. We didn't have any issue with wifi. The tool is equipped with air conditioner and radiator if needed. Excellent choice all around!  マラケシュは初めてで、このホテルには3泊しました。場所は旧市街の中心にも新市街にも徒歩で行きやすく、バイクの往来の激し表通りからも程よく離れており、バランスの良い立地だと思います。スタッフさんもオーナーのAzizさんもとても親切丁寧で、マラケシュでの予定を一緒に立ててくれました（英語または仏語）。ホテルの中は伝統的で雰囲気がよく、水回りもとても綺麗でしたし、水の勢いや温度も不満はありません。屋上のプールも綺麗で、旅行が忙しくなかったら入っていたと思います。またwifiも全く問題ありませんでした。砂漠気候で寒暖差も激しい地域ですが、エアコンとラジエーターも揃っていました。おすすめです！

Review_Date: Emily A wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: This was a good location to stay. It provide a quite place and break from being in the busy and loud streets of Marrakech. It is located closer to the wall so easy to access the main street. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast is included and was very tasty. We had a very nice stay here.

Review_Title: Great welcome and atmosphere in the heart of the Medina.
Review_Text: Lovely traditional Ryad in the Madina at Marrakech - great welcome and atmosphere . Spent a very enjoyable four days there - much better way to experience the real Marrakesh than in a corporate chain hotel . Fantastic reception and welcome by Aziz and all the staff. To be highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: It was really paradise to me nd my wife. Actually we are little bit tired for Marrakech’s exotic life. But “Riad Les Trois Mages” had get to be paradise and shelter to us. Especially manager Aziz was really kind and careful to us. We were so impressed to him and getting better becuase of him. Lots of staffs had served us fully but he could be a reason to decide to book this Hotel I think. I m very thankful all things I served. In short totally recommended.    정말 좋았습니다. 사실 저와 와이프는 마라케시의 정신없는 분위기에 완전히 압도되어있었고 심지어는 피로감을 느끼고 있었습니다. 그러나 매니저 Aziz가 신경써주신 덕분에 마라케시의 비호감들은 모두 해소  되었고 충분히 좋은 여행지가 되었습니다. 마라케시에 대해 고민하고 계신다면 매니저 Aziz 만 놓고 보아도 Le trois mages 는 모로코 특히 마라케시에 대한 충분히 좋은 대안이 될거라 추천합니다. 정말 감사했습니다.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The 5 stars is for Aziz the host/manager. He has put thd standards in hospitality high that will be hard for other Riads to compete.    I can't say enough about Aziz. He even walked with us to our meeting point for our tour in the Medina on our first day of arrival which took 18 mins.    The next day on our return back to the riad in the evening we got a little lost around the area and I panicked so I called Aziz. He did come out to find us but by the time he came we already made it back to the Raid.    Aziz puts 100% into his Riad and he certainly made a lasting impression on Moroccan Riad hospitality up high in the pedestal.

Review_Date: Hazel P wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: A beautiful hotel, an amazing host - a perfect place to stay
Review_Text: Les Trois Mages is a very special place to stay. The hotel is beautiful - our bedroom was lovely and the communal areas are really comfortable and tranquil. A real haven. But what made the hotel truly special was the sense of warmth and hospitality from Aziz and the staff at the hotel. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so welcome. Aziz spent time talking to us about the local area and places to see. He had a map already marked out for us so we didn’t get lost when we went off to explore. Nothing was too much trouble or too much to ask. The level of service was beyond expectation. The food was amazing and really good value. And there were so many small touches that just made the stay special. I could not recommend this riad highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakesh and our first time at Riad Les Trois Mages. What can I say but simply amazing. Aziz and the entire team made us feel so welcome like being at home. Anything we needed they were there to help. Our room was amazing. We are now going back for Xmas but this time it’s my husband and I as I wanted to share my experience with him. If you want a special place to stay this is it ! Location is fantastic. Walking distance from most attractions and great restaurants near too.  I can’t wait to see you all again at Xmas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed here for a week and couldn't recommend more. It was a lovely calming break from all the chaos of Medina. Aziz and Said made sure we were really well looked after from walking us to exchange money keeping us topped up with mint tea and checking what else they could do to help. They had arranged for a bottle of gin for our arrival so we could have a couple G&Ts on the rooftop before heading out for dinner. Breakfast was excellent and the living room spaces very peaceful to relax in in the evenings
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Peter L wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Staying at Les Trois Mages was such a good experience. The service was 5 stars +  We had booked restaurants from home for every night except the first night as we arrived arrived late to Marrakech so we asked the Riad to make dinner for us.  It turned out to be the best Moroccan food we had in Marrakech and we felt very special too.  Coming in to the Riad after a busy day was just so calm and nice.  Going up to the roof for a dip in the pool was so good to cool down adter a warm day in the souk  We will definitely recommend this Riad if you want to try authentic Moroccan hospitality.  Thank you to Aziz and the team for making our stay so lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicola G wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful stay in a peaceful corner of the city
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here for our anniversary and it turned out to be one of the best choices I had made! The riad was such a peaceful beautiful sanctuary and Aziz and staff looked after us so well. We even got upgraded to the suite to our complete surprise. The food was outstanding and the rooftop pool and terrace were a lovely respite from the hustle and bustle of town.

Review_Date: Mairead D wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: I have stayed at this riad several times and never tire of it. It is simply an oasis of calm in the madness of the medina. Les Trois Mages combines beautiful elegance tranquility and luxury. It is beside the souks & only minutes away from many attractions such as Bahia Palace Ben Yousef school Jmna elFna square etc. The breakfast lunch & dinner were outstanding. The ingredients were fresh and the flavours were unique. We had the fortune of being assisted by the Manager Aziz again whom I cannot praise highly enough. He recommended wonderful trips and fabulous restaurants. He was polite kind attentive and with great attention to detail. He is a unique and very special person! Thank you ! Abdel was so lovely and kind & anything we needed was never a problem. The Riad is spectacular exceptionally clean & very well attended to. Also it should be mentioned that the pool on the top mezzanine was a big hit as always with the boys. Les Trois Mages is a very family-friendly getaway.  The plants  palms & bouganville growing in the courtyard & around the pool are stunning. The staff always look happy and there is a sense that they are treated with integrity and great respect. Nejia the chefwas so kind & showed the boys how to make bghrar pancakes which were delicious! Just run now and book Les Trois Mages! Do not miss this place on Earth!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Martin H wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: First Time in Marrakesh as a Family
Review_Text: Arrived at the the Riad from the airport and met by Aziz (wonderful and welcoming manager - served tea pancakes and other treats on arriving / also very kindly and efficiently sent on some forgotten bits of clothing to our next stop in the Atlas Mountains- always grateful for that my friend 🙏) Provided plenty of great advice about places to eat drink and shop as well as arranging an interesting 1/2 day guided tour of the city. Dinner on the first night was excellent with very generous and hospitable Moroccan portions and breakfast was voted “the best” on our holiday by the kids - lots of pancakes (yum!) and served by the delightful and attentive Mustaffa (big football fan 😁) What made the Riad particularly special were the aforementioned people and the location as it took a 15 minute walk to get to La Place but through more local streets (fab coffee spot on the way through and Cafe Arabe was great for sunset drinks and food. Keep up the great work and hope to see you all again soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We arrived at Les Trois Mages to be greeted by Aziz the manager and were presented with a mint tea English tea and a selection of Moroccan breads and preserves. Aziz then showed us to our wonderfully appointed room. He helpfully drew on a map pointing out the highlights of Marrakesh. We ate at the Riad on 2 nights being served by Mustaffah the marvellous night manager the food was magnificent. Overall I cannot speak highly enough of Riad Les Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. The wonderful hospitality of Aziz and the staff is unparalleled. The food is delicious the space is beautifully decorated and our room was so comfortable. Everyone truly went above and beyond to make our stay special. Fantastic location in the old city easy to walk to all sights within the walls and outside the walls.

Review_Date: Tim Woolmer wrote a review Oct 2020
Review_Title: Fantastic Stay, Beautiful Hotel, Treated like Family
Review_Text: Our very last trip before the pandemic began and what a trip. Anyone looking for all the authenticity of a stay in a Riad but with the comfort we now come to expect in 2020 should look no further. Beautiful rooms centrally located great breakfast and endless mint tea Aziz looks after your every need from before you even leave home and is such a friendly warm guy nothing too much trouble. Couldn't recommend it highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After months of internet searching for the perfect riads for my first big solo trip abroad I settled on Riad Les Trois Mage for the first part of my Morrocan exploration and it set the bar high for the rest of the trip! It was my very favorite stay of my 3 week trip. They arrange for my airport transfer which made things so easy. Aziz met me at the taxi wheeled my bag to the road where mint tea and absolutely delicious cookies were waiting. We sat and chatted awhile as Aziz annotated a map to help navigate the medina. The next morning I had the most amazing breakfast EVER- the pomegranate topped yogurt was to die for. My room was full of character and super comfortable. At first I did feel like maybe the Riad wasn't in the best location on the very far opposite side of the souls from the square but the more I explored the happier I was with the location- easy access to the souks but far enough away from the craziness of the square. It was fairly noisy in the morning but it never bothered me and after staying in other Riads I just accepted it as that's the way it is. I would go back and stay their again in a heartbeat if I could. It was simply lovely everything I dreamed of. As a first time solo female traveler I felt completely at ease at the road and as I stated before it really set the tone for the rest of my trip. As far as things to do it is super close to the Secret Garden which I enjoyed stopping at each evening about an hour before it closed and you felt like you had the whole place to yourself.It was a hike but I successfully navigated to the Square and back on my own walking each day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Joy D wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: The madness of Marrakech the peace of the Riad
Review_Text: We went to Spain and Morroco on our last holiday (Feb 2020). The Riad team is highly skilled at answering pre-booking queries AND everything that can possibly make your stay in Marrakesh a holiday to remember. We felt welcomed as if we were long lost friends coming back to stay in a welcoming retreat.

Review_Date: Alan L wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: A lovely place with kind and caring management & staff
Review_Text: Stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for 3 nights. From the moment we arrived until the time we left was a great pleasure. Aziz the manager and his staff are wonderful. We arrived late evening and pre ordered dinner which was excellent. Our reception was reassuring and comforting and so was our departure. Room was lovely as was the whole Riad. Thank You
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tobi M wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Our stay was absolutely incredible in so many ways. Aziz and his staff were so helpful and hospitable - the location the view etc - everything - was just perfect. Would definitely recommend 100% and would definitely stay if i visit again

We stayed here for two nights and had a wonderful time. The staff are friendly and attentive and always willing to please. Nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast is fresh tasty and filling and tea coffee and water are always available. They arranged airport transfers and a wonderful city walking tour. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a true riad experience in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brandon D wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: My stay at Les Trois Mages was excellent! From pickup to the airport to tips on what to do when in Marrakech food and comfort this was an excellent Riad. The manager Aziz was friendly knowledgeable and always available to help. He greeted me with coffee gave me a tour of the Riad and provided me with a map of Marrakech that he used to show me the key routes to walk and main areas of the city. All of the  staff were incredibly friendly and very accommodating. My room was large comfortable and nicely decorated. The location is good even though it is on the opposite side of the souks from the main square it only about a 20min walk through a well trafficked and well lit area to Jemma El Fna or about three minutes to a nearby taxi stand. The free breakfast was very good as was dinner on the nights I ate there! Airport pickup and drop off was easy. All in all I highly recommend Les Trois Mages I will certainly be staying there again if I return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Brad L wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: A great place in the Medina. Aziz and his team were fantastic. Everything was perfect from picking us up at the airport to having dinner ready when we arrived. Additionally his spot on recommendations and directions inside the Medina were super. The atmosphere of the Riad and attentiveness of the staff were both superior.  I would recommend this place to anyone that was heading to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicole M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Aziz and Mouhsin are amazing and will take good care of you! This was the most comfortable bed of a 2-week trip throughout the country. Loved it. Enjoyed it. Beautiful rooms. Great breakfast.  Nothing else to say. Don’t like this minimum character rule on Trip Advisor. Makes me not want to leave reviews.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for a week over Christmas and could not have been more well looked after. Aziz the manager is a lovely host and gave us clear directions so we had no trouble finding our way into and out of the souk area. The riad is a few minutes walk from the northern end of the souks and close to a cash point and area where taxis are easy to catch. We had dinner twice at the riad and the tanjia was the best meal we had during our week. The room (Jade) is beautiful and we were lucky to have warm weather enabling us to use the roof top for sunbathing. The staff were also good enough to bring breakfast up there for us. I’d recommend this place for anyone staying in Marrakech particularly if you want a chilled out break.

Review_Title: Absolutely beautiful, delicious food & great service!
Review_Text: Can't recommend enough! Great location delicious food (amazing breakfasts!!) and such wonderful service. It's just north of the main area of the souks and Aziz was super helpful with giving a map and directions. We loved it!

Review_Title: Lovely place in Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: Everything was excellent. We enjoyed our stay at Riad very much.  The Riad is really magic place arranged in Moroccan style.  The rooms are spacious and quiet equipped with all modern facilities (Wi fi safe air conditioning etc.). The breakfast was homemade and very delicious.  We were like at home: in our disposition was inner courtyard with drawing rooms around it on the ground floor as well as sitting places on upper floors and rooftop terrace with a pool sun beds and comfortable sitting places to relax.We enjoyed a fireplace in the evening in one of the drawing rooms downstairs.  The Riad manager Aziz and the night manager Mohasin were very friendly and helpful (as well as other staff members). They fulfilled all our desires. We enjoyed all our private tours arranged by Aziz.  The location of the Riad is very convenient just 20 minutes to Koutoubia Mosque.  It was our second time at Riad Les Trois Mages and we hope not the last stay.

Review_Date: Gregory H wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for a 4 night stay. We loved this place. First of all it is a couple streets away from the main areas. Clean less pollution from motorcycles and quiet. The staff took great care of us and anticipated our needs. While it was a bit cool outside we still spent time up on the roof deck. They even brought me some much needed coffee while on a business call! The rooms were nice the bed was comfortable but the staff makes this place a 5 star...BRAVO!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at Suite Bahia that proved to be a perfect choice.  We happened to be the only guests of the property during the three day period of our journey to Marrakech so we had the great pleasure to feel it as our private hotel!  The Riad manager Aziz and the night manager Mohasin were more than excellent in helping us feel at home and easily overcome the shock of our first time outside Europe.  We loved our room though all the rooms of the riad are impeccable.  We enjoyed the fireplace in the evening and the breakfast in the room or the dinner in the "private" lounge downstairs.  We were really charmed par les trois mages from the day we returned home we are thinking when shall we go there again.

Review_Title: Friendly Hide-Away with Lots of Charm
Review_Text: My wife and I chose Les Trois Mages Riad for a 3-day visit in celebration of our 30th Wedding Anniversary. What a perfect choice for us! The Bahia suite was amazing. The professional and caring staff led by Aziz was ready to help us with everything we needed. For example they arranged our airport drivers a romantic & delicious dinner our first night at the riad a private guide to walk us through the Medina and an adventurous full day tour to the Atlas Mountains. Breakfast was great too within the open-air courtyard or a side relaxing room. Fresh roses fresh mint tea French crepes and scrambled eggs greeted us each morning. We enthusiastically recommend Les Trois Mages!

Review_Date: Pam O wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for one night at the end of our vacation. The Riad was beautiful and our room was spacious and romantic. The service was excellent. My only gripe was that it was not as centrally located as the first Riad owe stayed at during the start of our trip. The friendly service and excellent breakfast more than made up for this!

Everything during our stay at les trios mages was perfect from start to finish. Before we arrived We received an email helping us to arrange airport transfers. Khaled greeted us on arrival and had really helpful information on where to go how to keep ourselves safe and what prices we should expect to pay for taxis etc. The riad is so beautiful inside. Our bedroom on the ground floor felt luxurious and comfortable with lovely toiletries in the bathroom. Khaled also helped us book dinner reservations which was really helpful. We had lunch one day in the riad on the roof terrance which was nice. It's a quiet haven on the terrace with a pool if you fancy a break from the busy medina. The riad is close to the souks.  OH and breakfast was also lovely. We really appreciated the staff having breakfast for us early in the morning on the day of our departure. Definitely will be recommending it to others! Wish we didn't have to leave
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We definitely recommend this Riad. From start to finish excellent service. The hotel manager offered collection at airport meals excursions in a welcome email before arrival. On arrival we were greeted with tea and welcome chat about Marrakech map etc.  Room lovely breakfast really good. We had dinner one evening on roof terrace they arranged a lovely vegetarian tagine.  Staff could not have been more helpful.

This is a lovely place to stay made more delightful by the kindness and patience of the staff. I’m struggling to think how they could have been more hospitable? The Riad itself is an oasis of calm and tranquillity set away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas but a comfortable walk through the souks if you want to get to them if that’s your thing. The room had all we wanted (UK plugs anyone?) we slept like the proverbial breakfasts were delicious etc. so would heartily recommend.

Review_Title: Great staff and located in heart of Medina
Review_Text: Lovely place to stay. Hotel staff very helpful proving maps and diner reservations.    The outside of the Riad is Completely at odds with the calm oasis inside.    A few places to eat within a 10 minute walk.    Roof top and pool wonderful to chill between Excursions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Clair K wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We enjoyed the stay @ the Riad Les Trois Mages very much.  The Food prepared by Saida was the best Food we had twice during our week in Marrakesh. Our Bahia Suite was comfortable and always very clean.  The best was the Team looking after us very well supporting us throughout our stay.  Especially we would like to thank Khaled. He was a brillant help for us always available and very friendly.    We would stay there again and recommend the Riad for anybody looking for a pleasant comfortable accomodation in a very good Location.  Clair & Markus
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful quiet haven away from the hustle and bustle of the centre oif the medina.
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here from Sat 28th October for 4 nights as part of a moroccan tour. Our spacious room was on the ground floor and opened into the courtyard where you can relax and have breakfast. The bed was very comfortable and there were some lovely toiletries in the bathroom. All the staff from the reception to the cooks in the kitchen were wonderful-friendly and helpful. We took our breakfast up on the upper terrace where there is plenty of shade. Our bed was made each day and we were given a bottle of water which we kept in the fridge in the room. We did not get to meet the owner Aziz who we were told was on holiday during our stay. There was air conditioning in the room which was quite noisy and on the last night there we managed to get a fan. It was unseasonably hot during our stay-38 degs. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here rather than in one of the hotels outside the Medina. It was a true Moroccan experience and just a short walk to the Souks.

Review_Date: Judy H wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for three wonderful nights.  An elegant clean lovely place to stay yet close to the dust and noise of the souks.  A little oasis of calm.  We were looked after brilliantly. The manager spoke excellent English and we were given mint tea or coffee whenever we wanted it. The room was lovely with an amazing shower room.  All the things we wanted to do were a quick and easy walk and the airport was only 20 minutes away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Daniel K wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Fabulous place. So peaceful and relaxing away from the hustle and bustle of the streets of the Medina.    The staff are fantastic knowledgable and go out of their way to help you. Moshin was brilliant.    Just on the North West of the Medina it provides fantastic access to the souks palaces and new town. Everything is within a 30 minute stroll.    I only hope people keep staying in the Riad’s rather than the many new hotels Marrakech has to offer. They are an individuals business. Their livelihood. And they care about their city not profit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: very well-intentioned but rough around edges
Review_Text: For Morocco Trois mages offered luxuries of actual hot water and excellent water pressure best hotel breakfast I had in two weeks impeccable cleanliness peace and quiet and good intentions.    Opposite end of Medina from main square. Must walk thru two vacant alleys with homeless people which I didn’t feel comfortable doing after dark (and wouldn't do at home) even though "probably" ok....When I tried to ask if possible to arrange for escort back to riad door at night I was simply told “marrakesh is safe” (um you're not tourist target and/or single woman). So each night back before dark.    Even with “full strong signal” WiFi can be slow (couldn’t post 30 pics after more than one hour) -- as was not uncommon in Morocco. Though I didn’t care about tv when booking I actually liked watching Moroccan tv on this trip - so would have appreciated tv if staying in at night for safety and with iffy WiFi.    Upon check-in I was not informed that first breakfast was not until 830. Night manager made breakfasts for me so that I could cab to Bahia Palace by 9a opening time to beat crowds (then on departure day to catch early train) - but now reading other reviews apparently never had their full breakfast. Best to go to nearby car park on your own and ask for metered taxi (instead of relying on riad-arranged transport which was both extremely rude and inflated).    After day in heat dust and grime only reason I came back midafternoon on day 2 was to shower and start to enjoy Bahia suite (upgrade for last night in Morocco not available previous night) but room still not ready at 345p. For almost another hour I was repeatedly told "only 10 minutes” and had to repeatedly beg to pay for stay then for change. Mgr very graciously offered bottle of wine for this inconvenience (that I didn't actually have time to drink). Bahia AC is NOISY. As otherwise noted rooftop pool is no more than waist high (other hotel pools had deep ends and were mysteriously freezing).    Final meal at le jardin which then served worst tagine I had in Morocco (but at least offered 50% discount). Over 3-4 days in Marrakech best value tourist restaurant was at cafe nomad.

Review_Date: Lynn N wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here as it was recommended by a friends previous stay and we were not disappointed! We were impressed with this lovely and quiet Riad an easy walk to the Médina. Khaled happily arranged our appointments for spa treatments nearby and also made dinner reservations at a restaurant we wanted to try.  Khaled spent a fair amount of time with us upon arrival showing us a local map and pointing out areas of interest. That was most helpful!  Our breakfasts each morning were made to order at our leisure allowing us to enjoy sleeping in a bit. Delicious fresh juice fruit yogurt and bread were set while we enjoyed fresh coffee. Eggs to order were offered but we were well satisfied with what was already offered.  We loved watching and listening to the small birds that have made their home in the Riad. Just delightful! The rooftop pool and quiet seating areas were most welcome after browsing thru the maze of streets and souks of the Médina!  We inquired about having some clothes washed as we had been traveling for about 10 days. They were happy to oblige and the cost was minimal.  Upon leaving again Khaled assisted us by scheduling a taxi and even walked us to the correct awaiting taxi.  We would definitely recommend a stay here and we would be happy to stay again in the future.

Review_Date: Martin W wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The room was wonderful the staff great and the breakfast excellent. Food is made when you are ready so always freshly made and tasty. Good location in the Medina close to shops and the main square. They also provide dinner if you wish to eat in the Riad. We sat on the rooftop terrace and took a dip in the pool when it was hot.

Review_Date: Louise C wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The rooms were great. We loved the pool on the roof  small but enough to cool you down after a hot day in the souks. The breakfasts were plentiful with yoghurt fruit eggs and freshlymade bread. Tea and cake seem to be provided every time you came back in but the main attraction was the people. The staff couldn’t do enough to help you with great recommendations and attention.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Indira D wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here at the end of my 10 day travels in Morocco as I wanted to experience the much talked about traditional riad stay. Obviously made the right choice in picking this place. Situated right in the middle of the old walled city with the hustle-bustle all around an entry from a small alley away from the main street leads you to this traditional and elegant riad with great care taken in it's decor and detailing. The central courtyad the relaxed lounges the terrace with a splash pool and uniquely designed rooms added to its charm. Moreover all main attractions are within a 30 minutes walk which was very very convenient.    The staff too were all super helpful and took extra effort to make us feel at home and indeed the experience is that of staying at a home rather than an impersonal hotel. Breakfast too was always a welcome treat and something to look forward to.  They also organised pick up from the train station and drop off to the airport saving us the trouble of haggling with the infamous Marrakesh cabbies.    Would definitely recommend .

This is the second time we have stayed at Les Trois Mages and this time was equally as good. The Riad is typical Moroccan and beautifully furnished. We stayed in the Bahia Suite as this visit was a 50th birthday present from my partner. The Suite really is superb with lots of room a lovely sunken bed and a large bathroom. There was plenty of room for a second bed for our 3 year old daughter. The staff really make Les Trois Mages special though. Khalid was extremely helpful and arranged taxis dinner reservations suggested places to visit and was also on hand to help out. We had lunch and dinner in the Riad and the standard was very good. Standards of housekeeping were excellent with the room cleaned and made up every day. a special mention goes to Mouhsine the night manager who really is the nicest man you will meet. He has a beautiful nature and like our last visit he helped us many times. Mouhsine - thank you. He was always willing to go the extra mile to help guests and everything he did he wanted it to be perfect for the guests. Even if the (free) bottled water wasn't cool enough he would go and chill it in the freezer. Mouhsine stayed on late on his last morning to ensure he could serve us breakfast to our liking before he finished his night shift and this was almost 10am! He even walked me to a local pizza shop one evening when we wanted to stay in and relax.  The location of the Riad is ideal as it close enough to walk into the Medina but not directly in the hustle and bustle. The mantra of - "whatever the guest wants" is loud and clear here. You can eat breakfast at any time you want eat wherever in the Riad you want (roof terrace was our preference) have free tea/coffee/water any time of day or night and have bookings made on your behalf without charge.  Overall another great experience at Les Trois Mages.

We couldn’t recommend this Riad highly enough. It was our first stay in Marrakech but won’t be our last and we would definitely stay here again.    It is in the residential area to the north of the Medina and is therefore very quiet and relaxing. The pool area on the roof a fabulous escape from the hectic souks.    Khalid and all the staff were extremely helpful. We would recommend eating here too - we had both lunch and dinner and the food was the best we had in Morocco. Respect to the superb chefs!    Thank you so much to you all for looking after us so well - your care and attention was much appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Such a beautiful Ryad like an oasis in the middle of the madness of Marrakesh! Everyone was so helpful and went out of their way to make our stay perfect. Easy access to the souk and brilliant recommendations for supper! Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had an excellent time in Riad Les Trois Mages. Situated in the north of the Medina it is an oasis of peace and quiet but yet within an easy walk of the souks and the main square. The rooms are beautifully appointed and all had air conditioning which was pretty vital in the heat of August. The plunge pool on the terrace along with the pool towels and recliners made for an ideal spot to do a bit of sunbathing and relaxation after a busy day bargaining in the souks. The sitting rooms were very nicely appointed - although we did not spend much time in them.    Aziz and the team were outstanding. Aziz took the time to help orientate us and made many sensible recommendations for eating and for visiting. The whole team in the Riad could not have been more helpful and accommodating.    The breakfasts each morning were sumptuous and ensured that we got off to a great start each day.    Overall a fantastic Riad which made our stay in Marrakech all the more special.

We stayed here for our first trip to Marrakesh.  Everything about this riad is just perfect.  Location within a short walk from the souqs and Jemaa el-Fna.  They arranged transportation for us to and from the train station for not much money. The driver was very friendly and helpful and I would recommend everyone to take them up on the offer to get picked up at the airport or train station.  The riad itself is beautifully decorated calm and quiet. A perfect place to escape to after the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh market. It is like entering a very pleasant calm quiet oasis in the middle the heat and noise in the city. The pool and lounging area on the roof terrace is a life saver in the middle of the day.  Breakfast was delicious. Eggs pancakes fruit yoghurt bread honey jam fresh juice and anything else you might desire.  The staff was super nice friendly and service minded (without being pushy). They gave us good guidance on the city and sorted anything we needed during our stay. Always with a smile.  Thank you guys for giving us such a wonderful time in Marrakesh. We hope to be back.

Review_Title: The best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We had an abosultely wonderful time at this Riad! We received fantastic service. The people working here were very kind and the accommodations were great. We would highly recommend staying here to everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Guenther M wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I had never been to Marrakech before and had some dreamy expectations for my trip. Staying in this riad and its wonderfully exotic Bahia suite meant my expectations were exceeded. While not the biggest riad in the medina Riad Les Trois Mages is a quiet oasis after busy days in the medina.    The manager Aziz was terrific; from arranging my transfer from and to the train station; to explaining the medina and other sightseeing options; and to arranging several day trips and local guides which I recommend using.    And what a wonderful roof top patio where I spent many hours in the evening after a busy day enjoying the pool the mint tea and the soft sounds of an evening in Marrakech including the call to prayers.    Saida cooked me a wonderful Moroccan chicken tagine one night. It was so delicious that I asked her for some recipe tips and promptly got a tagine pot when I got home and made a chicken tagine dish.    Thank you so much to everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights. We arranged transportation for 150 dirham (less than $14) from the airport. Driver was waiting outside of terminal with sign. Upon arrival were greeted by Khalid. Our room was not ready because we arrived early. we waited in one of the lounges and Khalid arranged for tea and small bites. Room was comfortable. The only thing I would add is benches for your luggage. We left it on the floor since we did not want to dirty the bench cushions. Also there is no TV. The place is lovely and well kept. After long days of walking we did enjoy sitting in the rooftop at night or in the lounge areas. We received good recommendations for dinner and our favorite was Kuizin - belly dancer and food. We did not care for Jardins - too busy and service can improved. The ladies that clean and cook are very nice and hospitable. The whole staff is what makes your stay very pleasant. The place is not centrally located but we had not problems walking here at night. The only issue we had was with kids trying to divert us from walking through a path due to "prayer time". It was a hoax since we had just came from the same path but turned back to check something out. You will also get people to go to special markets as you are coming our of the Mammounia (one person told us he worked there but it was not true). It was hot when we visited so bring a hat and umbrella to avoid the sun. Also ask people if you can take their picture and try not to photograph them. They will get offended even if you are not taking a picture of them but someone they are in the background. We walked a lot. First time and Morocco and it was pleasant one. Thanks Donna Aziz Khaled Saida Moushine Najia and Laila for your hospitality. If we return we will stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Second visit, there is a reason why we come back!
Review_Text: Thanks Aziz Mosin Khalid and everyone at Trois Majes. This is the second time we have stayed here which says something in itself. Great hospitality the rooms are beauitiful and there is a small pool on the rooftop which is very unusual for a Riad in the Medina    We love it and will keep coming back!! It was my birthday when we were there too and then decorated the room with bunting!! Where do you buy bunting in Marrakech :) BRILLIANT!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma C wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We had the most enjoyable stay here and were made to feel very welcome and were so impressed by the service and experience  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we were sad to leave after four days  Great position for visiting souk and old town and easy to get to other areas too  Will definetly return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is the second time I had been there- but not since five years ago. It was just as lovely - nothing had changed. Staff so friendly and kind. Lovely breakfasts. Rooms and rooftop both still perfect. I highly recommend staying here you will be well looked after and it’s really a great spot. All the restaurant recommendations by Aziz were good too as was the driver for our day trip to Atlas Mountains. Looking forward to going back again soon I hope!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is an unbelievable place to stay - right in the heart of the medina but a little respite from the craziness. easily walkable to everything and the rooms are so comfortable. Thanks to Aziz Mouhsin and the whole staff for making us feel so welcome providing so much helpful information and cooking the most delicious food. From having a cab waiting for us sitting down with us and making us feel welcome and offering travel suggestions and being a smiling welcome face at the end of the hot day this was fabulous. I can't say enough about the kindness of Aziz and Mouhsin - both wonderful and made the stay that much better. Thanks guys for going above and beyond!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have never actually left a review on TripAdvisor but I felt compelled to do so after staying here. Marrakesh is not what I would call a chilled out holiday. What with the hustle and bustle of the city the array of spicy smells the mopeds and the crowds. That doesn’t detract from it being a amazing experience. However what really made the holiday for us was staying at this Riad!! Before we had even arrived Aziz (manager) arranged for us to be picked up by a taxi at a very reasonable price and had already emailed me to advise me on the best way to get currency and prepare for the trip. During the email exchange I had told him that it was my partner’s birthday on the Saturday.    From the very moment we arrived we were made to feel very special. We were greeted by Khalid (Assistant manager) and after a very early start we arrived at around 11am. We were tired and hungry but expected no breakfast as it was getting towards lunchtime. Before we could say anything Khalid gave us some lovely mint tea and offered us a full breakfast which was most welcome and unexpected.    Whilst we were waiting for breakfast he gave us a full rundown of the area that we were in restaurants to try places to visit and all the local tourist attractions.    I took my partner to Marrakesh because it was her birthday. I booked the Bahia suite. All I can say is wow what a room!!! So much space an amazing sunken bed so very traditional a big bathroom with an amazing shower and bath.    After breakfast on Saturday we went up to the terrace to enjoy the Sun and the pool. When we got back to the room they had arranged a birthday card a bottle of wine and had put some banners up for my partners birthday. They then knocked on the door and brought in a birthday cake with candles and sang her happy birthday. I was really blown away by the effort that they made and it really did make her day.    Both Khalid and Aziz are such genuine and friendly people and the Riad is an oasis and a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. I have stayed at some amazing hotels in my time but this really is very special.    The photos on the website do not do it justice. Needless to say I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending this stunning accommodation for any visit to Marrakesh. Book the suit it’s amazing!!    Thanks again Aziz Khalid and in fact all of the staff. You are ambassadors for the world renowned Middle Eastern hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison O wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Our expectations were well met! I agree with all the other great reviews this is a lovely riad and Aziz Khalid and team are wonderful. Khalid spent time with us when we arrived going over a travel route through the souks shared points of interests and even walked us a little bit of the ways so we wouldn't get lost on day one. The riad itself is really nice- it's quiet except for the chirping of lovely little birds (which we really enjoyed in the mornings) it's a great place to relax and the rooms are very comfortable. We spent afternoons on the roof sitting in the shade or in the pool and the staff was always available if we wanted tea and was great at accommodating early breakfasts when we had day trips. It was a great home base and we felt very safe in the area- not to mention it's centrally located a short walk to the shops to the garden and to the pick up spot for a lot of day tours. We very much enjoyed our week here and would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charlotte M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at this Riad. The staff are exceptionally helpful and go above and beyond in every way. The Riad is really lovely with a beautiful rooftop terrace. Room and breakfast were both excellent. Would highly recommend and will definitely return. Thank you to all the staff for a lovely stay.

Our stay at Riad les trois mages was wonderfull! Aziz & co were very friendly always there to help. They booked some restaurants for us hammam airport pick up... the room was super nice very calm courtyard and on top a nice swimmingpool with beds. at any time we could have mint tea or coffee and breakfast was very nice!  when coming back to Marrakech we will definitly stay there again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wayne M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We were delighted with our stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. Nothing was too much trouble for Aziz and his team from mint tea whenever we needed it to an intimate meal for two on the tranquil courtyard everything was perfect.  As an escape from the mayhem of the souks Riad Les Trois Mages can not be bettered and as soon as the front door closes the atmosphere of tranquility comfort and individual caring attention just washes over you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nadia D wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Chosing from more than 1500 different Riads in Marrakesh is a real challenge. We made a good choice with "Les 3 mages". The welcome was very personal with home-made pasteries and very detailed and useful information on this vibrant city. All positive things we had read about this place before got confirmed worth highlighting once more is the wonderful breakfast which was definitely above standard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Will definitely be returning to this gem!
Review_Text: We booked the Bahia suite and pictures don’t do justice! It was lovely. The entire staff was so accommodating and genuinely wanted to make the experience special. It is very close to the parking lot with taxis ready to whisk you away to your destinations. The location was perfect with the entrance to the souks down the street from the taxis. Going the opposite way took you to the money exchange with the best rates. In the direction of the money exchange is a very nice food souk where the locals buy their grocery. And further from that across the bus station is a fantastic supermarket to pickup local products. Breakfast was varied and served eggs prepared to how you like it. I will be returning to this riad with my family!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: an ideal place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Marrakech is a magical city with unique atmosphere captivating colors and smells it only makes sense to stay in Riad to make this experience complete; I was lucky to choose Les Trois Mages; it starts when you enter the Riad and you are greeted by wonderful Hosts Mr Aziz and Khalid. Then you get to feel a unique atmosphere of the place and get to know the rest of the Staff Mr Hassan and Ladies who prepare your meals always smile and are so kind. There is roof terrace and a lobby/yard with tables and sofas a piano plenty of interesting books about Morocco and others where I spend every free moment seeping tea reading. Birds fly in through an open roof and sing - a foretaste of paradise. Mr Aziz and Khalid told me a lot about the city gave me useful hints and directions how to go around and not get lost in the maze of Medina souks. I will be back to Marrakech and Mages one day. Thank you for hosting me and making my stay so enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Wenke L wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: A true oasis in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights at Les 3 Mages Riad in the Marrakesh Medina as part of a 2 week Morocco trip with our 12 year old son. The room we had was magical our son loved the little pool on the top terrace and there are lots of quiet cosy sitting and chill out areas everywhere. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and did everything possible to make sure their guests were happy. Coming “home” from the madness of the souk just round the corner is literally like stepping into a different world a true oasis of calm. We loved it and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the Medina. Fabulous place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My friend and I were here for 3 nights and 4 days and couldn't ask for a better experience. Khaled Saida and Aziz were extremely kind. Aziz and Khaled went above and beyond to meet our needs. There weren't any hidden costs meals were delicious and they were very helpful with setting up our tours. Even our tour guides they chose were extremely nice and helpful. We plan to visit Morocco again and when we do we already made the choice of staying here again. Our accommodations were situated within walking distance of the Souks an atm and an exchange place. I've never felt so welcomed from such hospitable people before and would recommend staying here. We even bumped into other guests who also enjoyed this Road as it was there 5th time there! Once again thank you Aziz Khaled Mouhsine and Saida!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a great time when we stayed with our three girls last week. The rooms were beautiful and spacious the food was delicious and the rooftop pool and lounge area were perfect for relaxing after exploring the city.  We had a an evening meal on our first night which was exceptional...pastilla and Tanjiia.....  The staff were all brilliant too (especially Khalid and Aziz) Helpful and informative...would highly recommend this Riad it’s a short walk from the souks and Place so perfectly located for exploring
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Liliane B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: It is really true people: Mr. Aziz and his team go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. We first had email contact and Mr. Aziz answerred promptly every time. When we arrived everything we agreed upon beforehand was taken care of and even more.  I can not tell you enough how we liked our stay and never experienced such a level of hospitality before! Thank you Mr. Aziz it was unforgettable! O and it is a budget accommodation but you get 5 star hotel quality!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As this was our first trip to Marrakech we were very lucky to find ourselves staying at Riad Trois Mages which was an oasis of calm & spotlessly clean in a fabulous but very busy dusty city ! Aziz & his wonderful staff looked after us very well. We especially enjoyed lazing on the roof terrace by pool where the lovely ladies Nadja & Leila looked after us & served our delicious breakfast. I would also recommend the evening meals as also excellent ! A great experience & thank you all the staff at the Riad who made our stay so pleasant & relaxing. We will defiantly be returning soon !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Madison F wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This was the most wonderful place we stayed at in Morocco. The staff was SO accommodating (bringing up breakfast on the roof tea at any hour of the night free laundry) plus the quaint atmosphere was above and beyond. Loved the food. Loved the rooms. Loved the pool. Would go back in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Aziz and his team provided tremendous service during our recent visit to Les 3 Mages. From the time we arrived to the time we left we felt like we were family. The riad is small and intimate and it is about a 10 minute walk to the souks very convenient. Our room was on the second floor and it was well appointed comfortable bed and vert quiet for sleeping at night. We had dinner one night there and it was excellent. We really enjoyed the breakfasts each morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Connie Y wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Wow what a perfect spot and such a lucky find by chance. My welcome to the riad was so warm and friendly Aziz helped me with a map how to negotiate the souk to the square. Offered me a good recommendation for dinner.  My room was more than comfortable I slept so well. The freshly cooked food was amazing. Such a perfect spot that I will return to as well as recommending to friends and family. My stay next time will be longer for sure.  I can't find fault. Thank you to Aziz Khaled and the rest of the team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Wonderful break at Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: Just back from a wonderful break at Les Trois Mages! I have stayed many times at the riad and we never want to leave. Aziz Khaled Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila Are always very welcoming and can’t do enough for us. My daughter’s friend came with us this time and enjoyed every minute. Breakfast was enjoyed on the roof terrace and dinner was in the courtyard. Gorgeous home made food by Saida. Thank you mouhsine for being on hand when we need more coffee always so hospitable and the log fire in the evening was a bonus!  A brilliant break as always.....  We will definitely be back ..... 😊xx  Maureen Noreen April and Shannon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: You have got to stay here
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights. What a gem of a find. I think my title says it all. We arrived around 8pm and had a pre ordered Lamb Tagine. It was beautiful and so flavoursome. As the riad does not have a drink license Aziz the Manager offered to buy in wine/beer for us. The Moroccan wine was lovely. We stayed in the Bahia suite which is decorated to true Moroccan charm. Along with a sunken bed it was cosy. I wouldn’t recommend the sunken bed if you have any walking difficulties or have any stiffness though. Breakfast was freshly cooked with lovely Moroccan bread and freshly cooked crepe-like pancakes. The roof top is very relaxing if you want to get some sun or just relax in the covered areas to read. The pool is small - suitable for a dip rather than a swim. The staff have to be complimented. Nothing is too much for them. We booked a nearby Hammam which I would recommend to try. Aziz even walked us to it so we wouldn’t get lost. The riad is near the edge of the Medina and walking distance to the souks. The main square is approximately a 20 minute walk if you don’t get lost but if you don’t want to walk a taxi can be called and it’s easy to get a taxi back from square (but negotiate fare first!). All in all I would recommend you staying here if you want top class service along with a true traditional Moroccan riad that is central to everything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An amazing intimate Riad ideally placed in Marrakech
Review_Text: Our frist trip to Marrakech and the Riad Les Trois Mages. To say we were blown away is an understatement! The Riad is absolutely stunning and the rooms were sublime we stayed in the Bahia suite. The staff bent over backwards to help up no request was too much effort from having breakfast al fresco on the rooftop terrace every morning to arranging for guides and transfers as well as the obligatory Sunset Camel rides.  They even gave my wife a lovely birthday card and complimentry bottle of wine during the stay.  The food was absolutely first class just ensure you pre book it as its all cooked fresh daily so they need to know what they need to order in. Please don't confuse this place with a standard hotel/restaurant affair you'd have beck home. This is a much more intimate place where you are looked after and treated like royalty during your stay.  We absolutely loved it and will definitely be recomending them to all of our friends.  Thank you Aziz and co.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The wife and I were here for a full week. I’d come back to Marrakesh for this Riad alone. I want to climb Toubkal in the future and I would make sure I returned here for a night or two whilst in the area if I do. It was perfect. The location is ace. The souks of Marrakesh are a magical maze but Les Trois Mages is positioned as such that you can walk a pretty straight line from one end through to the famous Jamaa el-Fnaa with minimal opportunity to get lost. We didn’t need to grab a taxi once. Even attractions outside the old-town like the Majorelle Garden was walking distance from the Riad. The pictures on TripAdvisor of the Riad don’t oversell it. It’s beautiful. And there’s something to the tranquil ambience of the place that can’t be captured on camera. I don’t know whether it’s the birdsong or the comparative silence to that outside but it has a lovely atmosphere. Most of all the service was unlike any my wife or I have experienced before. Anywhere. The whole team were so friendly. You couldn’t feel more welcome. Room was great breakfast and mint tea was fantastic and the social spaces magnificent. I can’t speak highly enough of this tremendous Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Top Class Accommodation and Customer Service
Review_Text: Just home after a long weekend stay at Les Trois Mages. Our stay in this Riad was top class. Our room was clean large and very comfortable. Not so sure if I would like a sunken bed on a permanent basis though. The food was excellent tasty and plentiful. The location was very central. Most of all the Staff were top class courteousfriendly and always willing to help. I would highly recommend for anyone to stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We could not recommend this Riad enough.From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the manager Aziz until we left he took care of everything for us.The Riad is beautiful the Rooms are all different and beautifully designed in traditional Moroccan colours and fabrics.  We had excellent breakfasts freshly prepared by the resident cook who also cooked dinner if you wanted.
