We had an evening meal on our last eve in the Riadthe menu had very traditional dishes and it was difficult to decide which one to try as they were all tempting!! We were not disappointed our food was delicious.The Riad is in a great location in the Médina close to all the Restaurants Spuk and square.There is a really fantastic choice of really good places to eat .Again Aziz recommended and booked these for us.  We also went on a trip into the Mountains there are several to choose fromwell worth doing .  We stayed four nights and were sad to leavewe shall return again though.Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so special !! 🌹
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A Real Gem! Excellent location, Excellent food, Excellent staff.
Review_Text: Received a warm welcome from the managerAziz upon arrival who could not have been more helpful. This was before sitting down to a delicious meal in the Riad. The food was outstanding throughout our stay. The Riad is in an excellent location in the Medina. Very clean very comfortable & even has a small library of books to read/swap and plenty of Moroccan travel books to browse.The Riad is so peaceful but yet is near the souks. Khalid went through the map with us after we arrived and gave us some really good tips & advice. All the staff were ever so helpful & friendly throughout our stay. Thank you all so much for making it such a wonderful holiday. Looking forward to my return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: David D wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: A unique and beautiful stay which is made special by the warmth of the staff. On check-in the manager Aziz spent 30 minutes with us going through the map of the Médina marking out helpful landmarks and points of interest. We have never had this level of assistance before at any accommadation and it is much appreciated as you enter the maze of the Médina for the first time.  It is a perfect location on the edge of the Médina within a short walk of the souks as well as the new town and Jardin Majorelle.  The breakfast each morning is delicious and the dinners at the riad were as nice as we had anywhere and very well priced.  The room was beautiful in true riad style and the property has a great rooftop with a small pool for catching some sun or having breakfast or relaxing.    Aziz Hadid and all the staff make the riad feel like a home from home and you will be sad to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tea S wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Perfect place to stay if you want to stay in Medina.
Review_Text: It was our first time in Marrakech so we relied on review of other for our accommodation. We found this place on trip advisor and were impressed that they seem to gain a very good review from previous guest bad at the same time with a sensible price.    It was a good decision we asked for airport pick up as our friend warned us about the warrant-like medina especially if we have never been. Unlike many Raid in the medina this riad can reached by a car well almost(1 min walk)    The raid is set in a quiet lane off a small road. The raid is small with only 6-7 rooms. Our room was on the ground floor and were initially worried about the level of noise in the morning but all the staff was very quiet and go on their business without any noise.    All the staffs were wonderful helpful and very accommodate.    We will certainly come back and not reluctant to recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really outstanding management from Aziz Khalid and the whole staff. We felt we were in good hands before we even arrived and the staff were always there when wanted. It's more cozy than palatial (reflected in the very reasonable prices) and you probably won't want to stay in your room all day as ours had only a small window which along with the door provided the only ventilation but that's hardly a problem since the riad has so many nooks and rooftop spaces for lounging around. And you will definitely want to lounge around after battling the insane motorbike-donkey-cart traffic of the medina. Aziz will be there to take the edge off bring drinks and patiently listen to your tale of how Siri led you astray (use google maps instead he suggests or the paper map which he'll helpfully annotate for you) and bring you a drink. And when you wander out rather too relaxed leaving your expensive camera on the table Khalid will run after your taxi to make sure you don't leave it behind. Breakfasts are simple but excellent and our lamb tagine dinner was also delicious. Thanks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Looking for the perfect Marrakech location? This is it!
Review_Text: We wanted the authentic Marrakech experience and found it in this Riad. The location is perfect for exploring the old town and souks and easy walking distance of all the must see sights. However once inside the Riad the atmosphere is quiet and calm perfect for relaxing and the rooftop sun terrace and heated pool were a real treat.    The manager Aziz welcomed us with traditional mint tea and pastries and was most helpful with local advice. He booked us a day trip to the Atlas Mountains which is a must if you have time and recommended an excellent nearby Hammam. All the staff were most attentive and friendly and customer service was excellent.    The room and bathroom were large and comfortable and the food was home cooked plentiful and delicious. We had the best tagine of our stay here on our last night enhanced by a very pleasant bottle of local wine on the house. It is the little touches like this that merit its 5 star rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakesh and Riad Les Trois Mages was the perfect base to explore from. It’s centrally situated within the Medina the old walled city which is a maze of hectic markets and activity.    The Riad was really beautiful traditional and tastefully decorated and the ambiance was lovely quiet within this busy city. Our room was very and comfortable and quiet. The Riad has lots of communal spaces to lounge about in and a lovely heated pool on the roof terrace. The staff couldn’t have been more helpful and gave us so much local knowledge that I feel we experienced a lot in the three days we were there.    Within strolling distance of the Riad was Jardin Majorelle and the Berber Museum adjacent to the new Yves Saint Laurent museum all well worth visiting.    The manager of the Riad also arranged a day trip for us to the Atlas mountains and it went really smoothly and was a highlight of the trip.    After a day exploring the maze of markets and busy pedestrian streets it was great to come home to the peace and quiet of the Riad and the food served was incredible.    Breakfast on the roof terrace with the sun low in the sky is a really good memory for me peaceful and quiet and then out into the hectic old city which starts as soon as you leave the door.    I can’t rate this place highly enough and it will be where we stay when we go back to Marrakesh for sure.

We loved our stay here. The staff were so lovely. They were always happy to help and very accommodating. There was always someone available English speaking to help with recommendations and reservations. The room was beautifully decorated with traditional decor. It was immaculately clean and well equipped. The guesthouse has really nice areas to sit and relax including a courtyard lounges and roof terrace with pool. We really enjoyed eating our breakfast on the roof terrace. Breakfast was freshly cooked and included eggs pancakes bread fruit and yoghurt. The guesthouse offer complimentary tea coffee and bottled water at all times which is a nice touch. The guesthouse is within walking distance of the main sites but set a little distance away which is perfect because after a day in the busy city it's great to have the peace and quiet of this little haven.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andrea M wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We were treated with excellent service by all staff members during our 4 day stay in Marrakesh. An airport pickup was arranged in advance and we got into the Medina in a comfortable Mercedes Van late at night. The interior design of the hotel is very tasteful with color coordinated gathering rooms where you can relax by the grand piano or enjoy some quiet time. We had breakfast on the rooftop as well as in the riad - always very private and relaxing. The staff always asked how we would like our eggs and surprised us with small changes in the breakfast menu. Aziz showed us the map and was giving helpful advice. He also made dinner reservations for us. We stayed in the Bahia suite with plenty of room for our luggage a splendid bath room with shower and tub and the most romantic bed room. I liked the fact that the suite was equipped with a safe and plenty of outlets. We also took advantage of the rooftop pool (bathrobes were provided) to wind down from the busy souks and noisy streets. Within the riad we didn't hear any noise from outside. Quite amazing. We had a wonderful time here and would recommend it any time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved this place it was everything previous reviewers had claimed. Great facilities with rooftop terrace for dining chilling out in the sunshine or indeed take a dip in the small pool plus numerous other places to sit and read relax whatever takes your fancy. Stayed in Balthazar as the Bahia was already booked.    A 10 minute walk from the souks about 20 minutes to main square. 20 minutes to Yves St Laurent Gardens.    Other than breakfast - a lovely spread of pastries and egg option - we only dined in on the evening of our arrival day and the tagine was very nice lovely - and unexpected - to be offered a bottle of wine to go with it. Otherwise we dined at various TA recommended local restaurants and enjoyed the experience.    Any 'points for improvement'? Well not really but do remember that roads are ex private homes and not purpose-built hotels. The only way this really makes itself felt is with noise you are aware of others around you. Not an issue with noise conscious adults but we were very aware when three small children arrived and started using the pool it did rather discourage us from using the rooftop terrace. Certainly not a big issue but to be aware of is you're used to quiet adult-only hotels....    Best point without a doubt were the staff. Without exception they could not have been friendlier and more helpful always going the extra mile to ensure that our every need was met. The owners should be justifiably very proud of all their people.    Always the decider would we go back?. In a shot without any hesitation. We haven't sampled any other Marrakech raids but this place is everything I think you could need at a great value rate.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mary H wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The Riad is superbly situated in the centre of the Medina. A very lively and animated area. Most attractions are a short distance away and easy to get to on foot. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was great fresh fruit yoghurt a variety of Moroccan breads pancakes freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a beautiful roof terrasse with a heated pool where we had breakfast on a few occasions. We had 2 excellent evening meals served in the central courtyard. The tajine's are really good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Phil Bowden wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: A real Marrakech experience not to be missed
Review_Text: My wife and I wanted a great Marrakech experience and were not disappointed. The staff provided excellent customer service especially Aziz and Khalid who gave us useful local advice especially for restaurants and Hammam. To help us settle in Aziz walked us through the Medina so we could orienteer ourselves and not get lost. The roof terrace and pool provided relaxing relief from the city's hub bub. We ate in the Riad on our last night and had our best tagine washed down with a bottle of wine courtesy of the Riad. Breakfasts were filling and tea or coffee was on tap throughout the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First and foremost: the hospitality.  We were greeted warmly offerred tea and made to feel very welcome upon arrival. That continued throughout our stay. Manager Azziz was very attentive to every need and was happy to arrange a guide excursions taxi run an errand on the street or provide us with whatever advise or assistance we required.    Les Trois Mages (the three wise men) is located just off-Avenue Lakza which is a main artery into the souk (markets) area and just a 5 minute walk out of the Medina.  The Riad has 6 rooms that are sufficiently comfortable. There is no noise from the bustling nearby streets. The only sound is the mosque’s early morning call to prayer which is hardly avoidable anywhere in the Medina. The rooms include a safe a blowdryer bathrobes and shampoos. A large bottle of mineral water is provided in the room daily.    Breakfast is simple but sufficient: coffee/tea bread yoghurt fresh fruit jam and honey and traditional pancakes. The staff was happy to make eggs of our choice.    The riad has a rooftop terrace with a small pool beach chairs and a lounge area. The staff was happy to serve water or tea on the terrace.    In all fairness we have to mention that there were some minor issues. The toilet bowl was leaking some water (temporarily solved with a towel but not fixed despite us mentioning this on two occasions). Also the bath tub /shower could use a curtain to avoid the water from splashing over and wetting the mat. We found the closet space a bit small for our taste.  All in all these issues were tiny in relation to the overall experience which was definitely very positive.    A special note.  Manager Azziz was aware that we were celebrating a special wedding anniversary in Marrakech. Not only did he surprise us one evening with a bottle of wine in our room he also had our room decorated and wrote an extensive and very sensitive card that made us feel very lucky and happy to have chosen this riad.    The personal attention at Les Trois Mages is a real treat!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katrina P wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: What more can I possibly say about our stay at this lovely riad!? Aziz the manager and every one of the staff here went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. The breakfast was delicious. I rated comfort only a 4/5 because I found the bed to be hard. The riad is located within the medina and is about 20 minutes' walk to Jmaa El Fna and 20 minutes in the opposite direction to the Jardins Marjorelle with plenty to see along the way. The decor here will make you feel like you are in a private oasis with plenty of mint tea to go around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I had a delightful time at Les Trois Mages. We were exceptionally well taken care of by Aziz and the entire staff. The team is super responsive whether over e-mail or in-person making for a very stress-free visit. We will happily stay again on our next trip to Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at this Riad whilst on a journey through Morocco during February.  We decided that using trains and staying at Riad’s would form a central part of our journey theme and are awfully glad we did.    Our main advice and booking was aided by Andy and Dawn Rediscover the world UK. They work with “Plan-it Morocco” to make bookings.    For Marrakech we were very pleased to stay three nights at Les Trois Mages.  It is very cosy exudes true authenticity and is cosy. Breakfasts were delightful and it was the only Riad of the four we stayed at which truly understood the needs of a gluten intolerant guest.    They had a supplier of gluten free “breakfast breads” and they were all very good. Indeed it was hard to tell that they were not the ‘real thing’.    They take customer care very seriously and go to great lengths to make certain that their guests are orientated with the help of annotated street maps. This assisted us greatly.    They have a cook who seems to be able to magic the most lovely dishes in what is rather a small kitchen. I would heartily recommend eating here but be warned they do need some notice as all ingredients are freshly purchased on the day based upon specific menu orders.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eleanor, London wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Long Weekend in the Winter Sun
Review_Text: We had 5 nights here. We really like the Riad the staff were so helpful and looked after us. Khaled (Asst Manager) talked us through the map so that were able to navigate our way through the souks and allies. Mouchine (nights) and Laila provided us with any refreshments when we wanted. The rooftop pool and seating area was great to relax after a day out and was also a lovely place to have breakfast. We would definately recommend this to our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Top class Riad in a great location in Marrakech. The staff were outstanding breakfast was nice and the room was well appointed and very clean. They can also organise tours for you if required. Would recommend to anyone staying in the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. Everyone at the Riad was so helpful and kind nothing too much trouble. We had a delicious dinner one night with a good bottle of white wine and breakfasts were lovely too. All arrangements with the Riad went smoothly (airport transfers trip to Atlas mountains cookery course). I would definitely stay again. Thanks so much to the team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ian M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Booked this place on the back of trip advisor. We were not disappointed good location to soak upon the Marrakesh experience. Situated in the old town a great place to laugh your adventure from. Pre visit was fab with the team an the Riad making sure all things were taken care of taxi pick up as well as refreshments on arrival.The team at the Riad also sent details of trips to take advantage of which we took and found them to be well worth a go. There was nothing that they would do to make sure the trip was the best experience ever. Meals were good quality and the time spent on the roof top one not to ignore. Would recommend this place to any one. And a big thank you for making our stay in Marrakesh a memorable one. Keep up the good work.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: melanie a wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We spent a very happy 5 days in this lovely Riad. We had a beautiful room. We were welcomed by Aziz and his team who were so helpful and made us feel at home very quickly. The dinner on our first night and breakfasts each morning were lovely. We will be returning back there soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: BRONIUS S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: It's a lovely Hotel in the heart of Marrakesh. Excellent location. Typical Marocan style friendly and helpful staff. So You can feel yourself like at home. Maybe it was some problems with the breakfast - it was December and the breakfats was served in the inside yard so the temperature was not very high but for me it was some kind of adventure. Everything is OK with this Hotel

Review_Date: Catherine S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Gorgeous Riad in a great location not far from the souk. We pre-ordered dinner for our first night and are we glad we did! It was the best chicken Pastilla we had in our entire journey throughout morocco. We ordered it at other restaurants throughout but could not find one that was as fantastic as this one. Breakfast was delicious too.    The night manager Mossuine (sp?) was so helpful and accommodating as was Aziz during the day who gave us great restaurant recommendations and thorough walking directions.    Our stay was wonderful! I hope to come back someday but thank you for such wonderful memories!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Neal A wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: My favourite thing about this Riad was how attentive the staff were. They couldn't do enough to make mine and my partner's stay enjoyable. I mentioned to the Riad manager that it was my partner's birthday which is why were visiting Marrakech and then went up to enjoy the sun on their beautifully secluded roof terrace with heated pool. Once we returned to our room we were delighted to find a tray of olives a bottle of wine and birthday card waiting for us. It's fantastic gestures likes these which help me create fond memories of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: M P wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Great place to base one's visit to Marrakech!
Review_Text: The riad is lovely - very unassuming on the outside and warm and welcoming on the inside. There is a common space in the center and a rooftop terrace with a pool. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. The manager and staff were so so helpful. The manager arranged our transportation (which I highly recommend as this is a small boutique hotel and not easy to find the first time) and even walked us to our restaurant the first night. He also gave us a map and pointed out sites and landmarks.    We were within walking distance of the main square which was important to me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed for a few nights to celebrate New Year and our experience was way beyond our expectations. The Riad was in a great position and so beautiful - as a result you can easily dip into the Marrakech hustle and bustle and then retreat into this beautiful calm and comfortable oasis - a lovely contrast. The rooftop pool is a lovely touch too.    What makes this Riad so wonderful though is the truly caring and outstanding customer service from every single member of staff. Under the professional care of manager Aziz the team of five provide welcoming and attentive hospitality always with a smile.  The food is delicious whether at breakfast or specially ordered meals and Aziz’s invaluable advice on trips or just how to make the most of Marrakech makes all the difference.  They bend over backwards to help - offering tea and coffee whenever you wish and even sourcing wine for you if you would like! Literally they think of everything.  A fabulous stay - thank you to everyone. We hope to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Home away from Home in Magical Marrakesh with some wonderful Hosts!
Review_Text: Well where do I start?? We spent 3 nights in Marrakesh at this wonderful Riad. Right from the time we checked in the service and warm friendly nature of the hosts was fantastic. We were greeted with some fresh mint tea and delicious cookies made by the chef when we checked-in and the host Mouhsin explained all the required details clearly and patiently answered all the questions. On a particular evening when we were sitting in the charming lounge area downstairs we felt a bit chilly and Mouhsin immediately bought us some logs and created a warm fire at the fireplace. Coming to the manager Aziz he is truly a remarkable person! He checked on us every day inquired about our day and offered us some very useful tips. I had a small personal issue in Marrakesh and Aziz went out of his way to help translate with the required people to help solve the issue. Even after I left the Riad he contacted me pro-actively to check if I needed any help and even helped to translate on a couple of occasions. For this I remain truly thankful! The location is very good and within walking distance of the main square souks etc. Our rooms were very charming with a lot of character and there are several common lounge areas where guests can relax and have a chat. The breakfast had a lavish spread of Moroccan pancakes bread fresh juice home made yoghurt with fruits made to order eggs and tea/coffee which was absolutely delicious! Every evening when we returned after a long day of exploring the city and its delightful souks the fresh mint tea and cookies would be waiting for us.To summarize I have traveled quite frequently across the world the level of service warmth and the personal touch offered by the friendly staff of Aziz Mouhsin & others are second to none and made it a truly memorable experience for us in Marrakesh!! Also a personal note of Thanks to Aziz whom I regard more of a friend now than the Riad manager!!  I highly recommend this Riad for a wonderful stay in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wow!!  We stayed for one week over Christmas 2018 and had an amazing time!  The riad is beautiful centrally located and a very lovely example! The roof terrace is fantastic We ate breakfast each day in the sunshine and loved it!  We availed ourselves of some organised tours and also just let loose in the Médina - the riad is located in the Larousse area of the Médina and is within the walls of the city ideal if you like exploring the real Marrakech!  We particularly would like to mention the staff they really made our stay special they look after guests like royalty! The managers are real professionals the ladies in the kitchen are warm and generous we felt like we were welcomed into a home from home!!  This place is highly recommended we will be returning!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything was excellent. The rooms are spacious and quiet. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They fulfilled all our desires. The breakfast was very delicious. Lunch and dinner is also excellent.  The location of Riad is very convenient just 20 minutes to Koutoubia.  We were like at home: in our disposition was inner courtyard with drawing rooms on the ground flour as well as sitting places on upper floors and rooftop terrace with pool and comfortable sitting places to relax.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very helpful staff. Good location in a quiet part of the medina. Typical Riad well done. Very clean. Lots to do nearby. Hard to find but staff will get out of their way to find you and bring you home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Priyanka T wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I have traveled to many cities but have never seen such hospitality. Mouhsin and rest of the staff took such good care of us. We had to leave early but they ensured we got breakfast before that. Gave us good recommendations even helped us buy sweets almonds etc. Breakfast is so good I’m gonna miss it loved the pancakes & pomegranate + yoghurt. I can go on and on about this place. Would definitely recommend to stay here. Feels like home :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Great place to stay at Morocco
Review_Text: This riad gets everything you may need and want for an excelent time in Morocco. The attention is great rooms are very comfortable and with exquisit taste in decoration. All the staff is great and Saida is the best cooker.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jayne L wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: A perfect stay in the bustling Marrakech Aziz and his team couldn’t have made us more welcome with recommendations refreshments and a lovely meal. The riad is beautiful and has everything you need for a short break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Peaceful haven away from hustle and bustle
Review_Text: What a perfect place to stay. Aziz (the manager) was a wonderful host. Nothing was too much trouble for him including lighting the fireplace in our suite and giving my partner a card and gift for her birthday during our stay. Life in the Medina is fast paced and chaotic but an amazing experience. To have this Riad to come back to was fantastic. Beautiful accommodation with a rooftop pool superb breakfast polite and efficient staff just a stone's throw from all the sites (and chaos). Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for three nights in this tiny (just six roomed) hotel was just beautiful. The staff were helpful and friendly. It is in a great position to be able to explore the Medina and pre-marked maps from reception helped to get us orientated. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay and felt very at home. Everything was so comfortable and the location in the Medina was perfect for us. The staff were very efficient and friendly. We particularly enjoyed the wonderful breakfast. We highly recommend this lovely riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Crispin F wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at Les Trois Mages.    It's in a perfect location just a short walk from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. This means you can wander in to explore and then retreat to sit by the pool and relax before heading back in!    The rooms are comfortable and stylish and the staff are amazing. Aziz is really attentive and gave us lots of tips on life in Marrakech. The rest of the staff looked after us exceptionally well. We only ate there once but it was the best meal we had all week.    A perfect place to relax and enjoy this amazing city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in November 2018 friendly staff and beautiful building I would recommend staying here to anyone planning a stay in the city. The guide provided for our tour of the Medina was exceptional. Enjoy your visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Such a beautiful Riad at an awesome location. Aziz and the other staff at the Riad are so amazing and made our stay so comfortable. Will highly recommend this place and the price is very reasonable. Didn’t want to leave at the end of our vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jackie D wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Our stay at Les Trois Mages was exceptional. Everything was first-rate: the room the breakfasts the accommodating staff the lovely open environment of the Riad including the sunny terrace. We stayed 3 days October 27-30 and then our last day November 8. We were picked up at the airport and taken back when we left.    This is a wonderful riad- decor sitting room spaces open patio and terrace. The manager Aziz was particularly important as he treated us like guests in his house.    Our delicious dinner in the Riad on our arrival after a full day of travelling was perfect. Even though our first day in Marrakech was rainy Aziz helped us get around in the rain and find a garden restaurant with a clear roof cover.    Our last day at the end of two weeks in Morocco before returning home was an opportunity to walk around and re-visit the Souks and Medina and again enjoy the hospitality of the staff..    We highly recommend the Les Trois Mages Riad and commend Aziz for his commitment to great service.

Review_Date: Victoria T wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: It is only a short walk from the taxi drop off to the door but once inside the Riad feels like an oasis of calm amid bustling Marrakech. On arrival after delays at the airport we met the night porter who was friendly relaxed about the time and brought us a delicious dinner served by candlelight. The manager Aziz was very welcoming and helpful with advice and an annotated map. Our room was carefully decorated and felt both traditional and modern. The location is just a short walk from the souks but once inside the Riad it is quiet and relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helen L wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: When I began planning my first trip to Morocco I was overwhelmed by the choices. We were 2 women traveling alone and I wanted to feel secure in my planning. After reading many Trip Advisor entries I wrote to Les Trois Mages. The owner answered immediately and put me in touch with Aziz the manager who from that moment on  helped to plan a perfect stay in Marrakesh. Aziz arranged our airport transfer a guide for the Medina and a day trip to the Berber villages in the High Atlas Mountains.  The Riad is charming. Small very clean and nicely decorated it is a quiet oasis. Within a day of our arrival we felt as if we were home. We had two delicious dinners at the Riad prepared by Saida who shops during the day for the evening meal. Mouhsin and Abdou rounded out the team and were cheerful and helpful for any need that we had answering questions and accompanying us when necessary. In total we spent five nights at Les Trois Mages and I highly recommend this Riad to anyone traveling to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Well where to begin with our review about this wonderful Riad. Firstly I was a little apprehensive about staying in a Riad right in the Medina but as soon as we arrived it felt like a home from home and it didn't even really feel like we were staying in someone else's property.    The Riad - it is in a really great location and right in the Medina nowhere in the Medina was too far to walk and we never had to use a taxi to get back to the Riad. The building itself is clean and well looked after. There are a couple of lounges to relax in with board games books and musical instruments (including a piano). The central courtyard is a lovely place to eat and unwind and the roof terrace is a lovely extra. One reason I picked the Riad over a bigger hotel was because this one has a rooftop pool. It is only small but means that you can relax on a sunbed and cool off in the pool and for me that was a big extra because being somewhere hot for 7 days I wanted/needed an area to relax with a pool but I wanted to experience a more traditional hotel rather than just a big hotel outside the Medina where you could be anywhere in the world.    Room - we stayed in the Melchoir room and picked it from the website. The only thing I hadn't looked at was what floor it was on and it was on the ground floor. This wasn't an issue apart from on a couple of breakfast times where other guests had opted to have an early breakfast and then chose to sit at the small table directly outside our bedroom door. When we had an early breakfast we made sure to eat at the table furthest from rooms and be quiet - others were not the same and maybe in the future early breakfasts should be served in the lounges/roof to be away from peoples rooms - this wasn't a massive issue for us as we are early-ish risers but I can see how this might annoy other people it is happened throughout their stay. Otherwise the room and bathroom was spacious clean and we really really liked it.    Food - I think that this is the hidden gem of the Riad. Breakfast every day was lovely and a good balance with fruit yoghurt pancakes eggs fresh orange juice (this was amazing!). I never ate everything but you would be very full if you did! We had lunch once and dinner three times and all the food was delicious. My husband even said one of the stuffed chicken dishes we had was one of his favourite meals ever! The cost of lunch and dinner was also so reasonable that we didn't mind eating there at all (whereas a lot of hotels we have stayed in B&B have charged higher than normal prices for other meals). The added bonus of inclusive tea coffee and water actually made a big difference for such a small gesture; being able to take water out with you for the day and coming back and having tea on the roof terrace was all lovely.    Staff - the manager Aziz was on holiday and was covered by Abdou Abdou was so helpful during our stay; always checking if there was anything we needed if there was anything he could do helping us with restaurant reservations and tips on the best ways to places in the Medina. He gave us a map marked up with all the key places we might want to see and we used this the whole time we were there. I have forgotten the names of the night manager chef and domestic staff but all were so welcoming and friendly and couldn't do enough for us.    We had a really wonderful stay at the Riad and the holiday went so slowly (in a good way) as we felt like we were relaxing at home. I would recommend the Riad to anyone wanting to visit Marrakech whether for a short time or longer like we did.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Philippa M wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Excellent Riad, fabulous location with wonderful food
Review_Text: Such a wonderful Riad. The Bahia Suite was stunning. The location was excellent and so quiet after the craziness of the Medina. The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble - and the evening meal was better than anything we had in Marrakech Medina and better value. Highly recommended for couples.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matty D wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: A perfect retreat of peace & quiet away from the hustle ‘n bustle of the Medina.  We were made to feel right at home from the minute we arrived.  The roof top dipping pool was welcome relief from the heat of the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simone F wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Perfect position to visit all the special parts of Marrakech. A door tucked down a small road leads to peace wonderful service useful information. There is always someone around even at night. Our breakfasts were tasty and filling provided whenever you want it. The rooftop pool was a lovely welcome back when the heat got too much!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We really enjoyed our time at Les Trois Mages.    The host was very welcoming and keen to tell us about the things we can see and do in Marrakesh.    The Riad is nicely furnished and our room was very clean and comfortable. We even found the time to use the swimming pool which they have on the roof terrace!    All in all it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend Les Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We felt comfortable at this riad. It's a great location. You can walk to the medina Jemaa el Fnaa Jardin Marjorelle....The staff at this riad do whatever to make you happy. they made reservations for us at restaurants and spas they arranged transportation to and from the airport.  Thank you for this lovely stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a VERY lovely place to stay. It is calm and pretty and peaceful. Aziz is softly spoken kind helpful and informative. A lovely man. The roof with plunge pool is a huge bonus and the breakfast is utterly delicious. All staff have a sweet smile. Should we be lucky enough to return to the wonder that is Marakesh we would stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: m m wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: My husband and 2 adult children stayed in two separate bedrooms on the bottom floor - very comfortable beds and we loved the quiet calm atmosphere. Aziz and the staff were very hospitable and made our stay very enjoyable - nothing was too much for them. When we arrived very late due to airport delays we were very hungry and thirsty. Despite not having pre-ordered any food we were given a delicious hot late breakfast. Aziz had the foresight to anticipate we would be starving to have been able to rustle up something so quick and lovely. We loved the rooftop pool and outside lounge. The place is an oasis within the very busy Medina. A lovely start to our 10 day holiday. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: david w wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: we spent a very enjoyable two nights at Les Trois Mages. The accommodation was typical for a riad and was very clean & well cared for. Aziz and the rest of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and we had the offer of water mint tea or coffee whenever we wanted - great to come back to after a busy day in the city.  we would highly recommend this riad and I don't think you'd find a better place to stay for the money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just come back from a fantastic stay in Marrakesh Morocco and cant thank the staff of the riad les trois mages enaugh for making us so welcome. We really appreciate the way khalid found the time to answer our queries and check out how we were getting on.we also thought the accommodation was excellent with exquisite furnishing and pieces of islamic art work.  The riad is probably one of the best! great staff great food great decor clean and homely!! Thank you everyone Ellina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel B wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: LES TROIS MAGES A MUST VISIT
Review_Text: Beautifully authentic clean 5 star accommodation. Staff were a delight always helpful friendly and polite. Nothing is too much for them. Will be recommending to all my friends. Easy walk into square beautiful roof top pool. Couldn't have asked for more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Perfect riad and I have stayed in alot!!
Review_Text: Great location staff and riad. Thanks Aziz Leila and everyone else at Trois Majes. The large rooftop with a pool is very unusual and was the icing on the cake. Great location too    We willl be back !! Thankyou
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakech booked into a small hotel in the new town for the first night and the next day made enquiries as to where we could stay in the old medina. We were given the contact details of Sarah the new manager of Riad Les Trois Mages contacted Sarah.  Lovely staff and very efficient and helpful english management. Smart decor throughout and lovely bathrooms with very good plumbing ! Breakfast on the sun terrace is a perfect    I was very surprised to hear of any negative comments made about the Manager of this Riad. I was fully intending to write a review on Trip Advisor shortly after my return back home
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As others have said this is a small charming riad in the old city. We can not say enough about the attentiveness of the staff. Marrakech can be confusing especially the old city which is full of winding alleyways motorbikes galore noise and many folks (including cab drivers) who speak only Arabic or Berber. Aziz the manager was extremely attentive helping us to settle in reviewing with us after breakfast (and what a lovely breakfast every morning!) our plans for the day making helpful suggestions and ensuring we knew where we were going and how to get there. The breakfasts were delicious: fresh-squeezed juice the best yogurt I've had anywhere fresh fruit eggs a different kind of local crepe/pancake every morning french rolls and croissants Moroccan mint tea or French-pressed coffee. We had dinner at the riad the first night and had the best lamb tangine we're had anywhere. The riad is organized around an open courtyard full of flowering plants and birds flying in and out. There are several sitting rooms one with a piano which open onto the central courtyard as well as a rooftop garden with a small pool. Our bedroom was lovely -- dark cool (had AC but largely unnecessary) quiet and great for sleeping -- and the bath was clean and commodious. Overall this was one of the loveliest places we've ever stayed and I can't say enough about the quality of service from Aziz right through to the night manager and the kitchen staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ann B wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Small, lovely and wonderful staff and service
Review_Text: The Riad Trois Mages is a wonderful small riad in the middle of the "old city." We had a wonderful and comfortable room. Our stay included a wonderful breakfast every day and a dinner if we requested it. The host Aziz and his staff were welcoming knowledgeable and very patient with us. I would go there again in a heartbeat. When we left I felt that we were leaving some old friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kimberley G wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We were greeted at airport by the nicest driver and taken to the Medina. At Les Trois we noticed an antique door which opened to to a world of Morrocain living. The riad was in the Moorish style--courtyard with birds singing rooms above and comfortable spaces in Morrocain decorum. We loved the friendly staff that greeted us with warm mint tea and Morrocain treats! Each day the rooms were clean fresh towels provided and delicious breakfast served by friendly staff. Aziz and staff were outstanding! We felt the love...Les Trois is trult home away from home. We highly recommend early bookings to stay in this boutique riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I really liked this place for a short term stay. Unique location in the old city which was a little challenging to find and return to at times! Nice breakfast wtih roof top area to enjoy. We even had a private dinner that they prepared for us and was quite good and reasonable in the main courtyard. The Bahia Suite was just OK in my opinion as the bed was a little difficult to get into and out of being on a raised platform with surrounding marble! Had to actually sit down on the marble and swing legs into bed to enter and then to exit. However the decor was very interesting and Moroccan. The absolute best thing about the whole experience at Riad Les Trois Mages was the property manager. There was nothing too difficult for him to do for you. I am in the hotel business myself and there exist very few people as dedicated and as helpful anywhere. Give this place a try -- you will not be disappointed by the overall experience.

A lovely small Riad with the best service and care taken. Nothing is too much trouble for Aziz and his staff. For sure we will stay again next year and look forward to it.  The riad is in a quiet area near riad Larousse area easy access to everything. The rooms are spacious enough and the breakfast cooked by the wonderful ladies was delicious and kept us going until mid afternoon lunches @ some great cafes and restaurants.  We asked for recommendations for eating shopping sight seeing etc and were always pleased with our outings.  Thanks a million for making our stay memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Les Trois Mages offered us everything we wished for from a stay in a Marrakech riad. Secluded peaceful and within easy walking of all we explored both in and out of the Medina. Special thanks to Aziz and his kind staff for making our stay so enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble for them such as mint tea on the roof terrace answering questions about the street map or making a dinner reservation. My family group occupied 3 of the 6 rooms and it was the perfect place for a private relaxed gathering. All in all a great treat and a happy contrast to the UK in May!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Karen P wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Once again this delightful Riad delivered on all sides. Usually I visit alone but this time my family came with me and we all had the most wonderful time. On arrival we were greeted with a late breakfast and then Aziz the Manager came and went through all our trip plans and confirmed requested bookings. He had booked a guide whose English was excellent to take us on a walking tour and this was relaxed informative and fun and we visited places I had not been to before. Our restaurants were booked for us for dinner in the evening and due to Aziz’s diligence in checking reviews we altered a booking to another restaurant he recommended and it was absolutely a good choice. As this was a birthday celebration trip we had brought champagne and glasses were found for us the wine chilled and served on the terrace. Some of us had early departures but full breakfast was still served at 6:00 am! All transfer taxis used were very punctual and good quality. All the staff contributed to yet another wonderful holiday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Wonderful riad; the manager Aziz is particularly welcoming. Was so prompt at communicating with us before our arrival and sent lots of handy information. We arrived in the morning and they served us breakfast even though we didn't even ask! On that note the breakfasts were delicious with plenty of variation every day. Aziz was so good at explaining what to see and making sure we didn't get lost. As opposed to some in the hospitality industry in Morocco he was genuinely nice and interested in helping us have a pleasant stay. The rooms are nice enough they are refurbished to a more authentic style rather than a luxury style but good value for what you pay! Plenty of space in room. Roof terrrace was lovely for afternoon naps and relaxing breakfasts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the start the staff at Riad Les Trois Mages were fantastic! Great communication helpful and friendly.  They arranged for someone to meet us at the airport and take us to the riad. We were warmly greeted by Mouhsine the night clerk. Our first impression of the riad is a good one! It's full of character and charm. When we were finished registering we had our dinner that we had pre-ordered since we were arriving late in the evening. Siad's cooking is devine! We ended up having all of our dinners at the riad!  Breakfast was just as delish as dinner! And everything is so fresh!  Our room was exactly what we had booked and met our needs!  Aziz the manager is fantastic! Takes the time to chat with guests. Is always there to answer any questions you may have. He was able to arrange a camel ride for us (something my mum had been wanting desperately do!) he walked us to the taxi area and waited with us to make sure we got in the right one!  He walked us to a shop and relayed to them what we needed and walked us back to the riad.  They were very accommodating and let us have a photo shoot at the riad!  The only fault I can see looking back on our visit is that we didn't stay long enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gabi P. wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: In this small and quiet Riad everything is made possible. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and include all you need. The rooftop is an Oasis in Marrakech. The staff is fantastic. The Manager is always there to answer your questions and to offer you coffee or tea to relax.  Everywhere there are places to sit and lay to relax.  The breakfast is gorgeous and of course: no problem to get it at 6:00 if your flight is early in the morning.  We extremely recommend this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohammad A wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: I really enjoyed staying in Riad les trois mages.staff is very polite and very helpful.Aziz the manager is really nice and very helpful. I would defiantly stay again here and I would recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lie in, and listen to the birdsong...
Review_Text: I stayed in Arabesque a wonderfully spacious and very well appointed room in the first floor. The whole Riad is an oasis of calm and a beautiful place to retire to after a busy day in Marrakech and beyond. Breakfast is delicious and the staff and beyond helpful. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble for them. Highly recommended

Review_Date: steve c wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Everything was excellent - the third riad and probably the best. The warmest welcome from from Aziz and staff were great throughout. Quiet away from the Medina if you want to relax but close enough to the Medina (and easy to find - not always the case with previous riads!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is my idea of perfect! Who would believe that the medina is just outside the door. The rooms are spacious and quiet. There are plenty of gorgeous places to sit and relax. Aziz is incredible - attentive and responsive. The other staff are friendly and wonderful. If you come to Marrakech stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sara P wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: A beautiful Riad with wonderful staff
Review_Text: From our pick up at the airport to our farewell several days later we felt cared for and welcomed. Aziz responded quickly after I made our reservation and made sure everything was set for transportation meals and excursions. We were welcomed with tea and a lovely lunch on the veranda on the roof. He went over a map and gave us tips on how to navigate the city.    Our first room the Bahia is absolutely stunning and yet very comfortable. The whole Riad is beautiful and yet very comfortable. We felt very much at home.    We left Marrakech for a 3 day tour out to Merzouga and then returned for out last day/night in Marrakech. It was so nice to come home and be welcomed by Mouhsine Najia Saida and Laila. They went out of their way to make sure we got breakfast early in the morning before our trek and our departure and that all our needs we attended to.    I highly recommend Les Trois Mages. The location is ideal the staff wonderful and it is beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Where can I start. We returned to this wonderful Riad for our second time after a three year absence. Les 3 Mages has surpassed all our expectations. I would challenge anyone to find a more friendly Riad with exceptionally helpful and tentative staff. From the moment we booked to the moment we left nothing was too much. Aziz the manager made us feel at home as soon as we walked through the door. Mint tea coffee and cakes were always offered after every days sight seeing and bartering in the Souks. The Riad is authentically appointed and is very comfortable. Breakfast served on the terrace to a rising sun was a great start to the day. We ate dinner there one night and it was lovely. All the staff here work tirelessly to ensure your stay is nothing less than perfect.  If you are looking for a perfect retreat from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech then I would highly recommend you seriously consider Les 3 Mages you won’t be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent an amazing few days here were looked after from the pick up from the airport to being returned three days later.  For those who have never been to Marrakech before it is ideal both on location and the advice and guidance given by Aziz.  Everyone who works here made us feel welcomed and we were looked after wonderfully.  The Riad itself is a serene haven  much needed after the amazing but overwhelming streets of Marrakech. We spent the middle of each day and evening on the roofwhich is clean comfortable and ideal to lounge around for an hour or two.  And the food is the best we had during our stay.  Lovef every second of our time there
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Punita B wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Felt right at home from the start! Lovely vibe.
Review_Text: We felt extremely comfortable at this riad. It's a great and central location. We walked to the medina Jemaa el Fnaa Le Jardin Marjorelle etc. from this riad. Aziz and the other staff at this riad do whatever it takes to help you. For example they made reservations for us at restaurants and spas they arranged for our transportation to and from the airport they guided us on how to spend our time wisely and what to be careful about and how to avoid crowds. They are super accommodating. Also we loved the morning breakfasts. The rooms are all very nicely decorated and each one has a unique touch. It's a really good riad for people who want to feel comfortable and aren't very familiar with Morocco so need some help with planning and navigating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kolja D wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Wonderful Riad, excellent and nice service!
Review_Text: We stayed at the riad for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The owner Aziz makes sure there is everything you need and the overall service is excellent. The riad is nicely located inside the medina and the rooms are beautiful and the perfecting resting place after a day in Marakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad management was super! Very kind helpful came to our taxi to escort us to the Riad helped us find a guide on short notice and attended to our needs. The attention was decorations in the Riad was impressive. We had the suite which was beautiful  clean and inviting. For older people who may wish for the suite the only caution is the bed is sunken and more or less level with the floor on an elevated platform. It could be hard to get in and out of for people with disabilities or who are older. In that case just choice any of the other rooms with regular beds.  Breakfast was lovely. The roof top area is quite inviting for lounging and an evening rest.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 2 day stay at Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: Excellent Riad comfortable clean great and very friendly staff led by Aziz and delicious breakfasts ! Nothing was too much trouble for them e.g. preparing a delicious salad with ingredients that we bought opening and serving drinks etc. I have no hesitation in recommending this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: we stayed here for 5 nights in February with my 3 year old daughter. Aziz and all the staff were fantastic and looked after us really well making us all feel very welcome and were also very knowledgable with lots of helpful advice on places to visit eat etc. Unfortunately we didnt have the best weather whilst we were there but the rooms were well heated and there was a cosy open fire in the sitting room area every evening. The food in the hotel is great the rooms lovely and its a great location for accessing both new town and medina. I would highly recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Eleanor S wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights in March. Its a good location just inside the Medina (so easy access to the new town) and around 10 minutes walk from good restaurants and the souks and the square. Overall the service in this accomodation was really excellent. As it was a quiet week after the first night Aziz kindly upgraded us to a suite which was lovely! Every morning we had breakfast on the roof terrace which is so peaceful and a perfect place to relax and just chill out which we did on the big sofas there for hours at a time! There is a very well maintained small pool on the terrace too which we didn't venture into but i was surprised at how clean and nice it was. If it wasn't March I would have definitely been in there! The food at the Riad was amazing. We had lunch once and dinner once and of course breakfast is included and the food was some of the best we had in Marrakech and great value. Although in the Medina alcohol is generally not sold Aziz made sure there was a good stock in the Riad for us (at prior request). The security aspect here is very good. There is always someone on the front door (which is always locked) and we were told we didn't need to lock our room which took some getting used to but actually was true! The general area was good too and we always felt safe. If you haven't been to the Medina before it takes some getting used to finding your Riad is in a little passageway behind a door in a wall(!) but once you get inside it opens up and is lovely and bright. We found the whole experience there brilliant. I would recommend spring as obviously the weather is more pleasant (not too hot) and the 'hassle factor' had not yet reached fever pitch in the square and souks. This Riad is a lovely oasis of calm no matter when you go though. Aziz and the staff could not have been more pleasant and we would definitely recommend staying here. Great value good location lovely people and a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Max V wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: What makes a good Riad? A nice location? Check. Nice well-furnished rooms? Check. Good food? Check. Good common spaces? Check. Nice heated pool? Check. But the thing that makes it a great place to stay is the service. Aziz El Faker the manager is one of the most guest-friendly and competent managers in a small hotel we have seen. He is attentive knowledgeable and personalized the stay to meet our needs. His staff is qualified and considerate. One feels personally cared for and it is true. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sinéad C wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: I visited the Riad with some friends over the Easter break 2018 I had and excellent experience in 2016 when I visited so my expectations were very high and they were exceeded from the welcome to the endless refreshments the advice and the recommendations the helpful tips about navigating the town the staff are second to none in the world always smiling and helpful its like they are a family welcoming you back home on a practical note the Riad is very clean ideally located and oh my god the food do yourself a big favour and order some home cooked moroccan lunch here and enjoy it on the roof top terrace away from the hustle and bustle of the town you won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Gorgeous riad with lovely roof terrace. Great staff. Delicious food.
Review_Text: We got a very warm welcome at this lovely Riad. It's about a 15-20 min walk to the medina.  After a busy day of sightseeing it was heaven to return to the rooftop and swim in the pool. The food was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emily K wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We stayed one night in the Bahia room (amazing bed huge stone tub). We got there a bit late and were offered tea and shown the room and the rooftop (which has a super clean small heated pool). The bahia room had this sunken bed with steps up to it which was amazing and it was really comfortable. There was water waiting for us in the room and a safe (which was nice and wasn't in our other Riad).    There was lots of hot water and an AC in the room (not super necessary but nice in the summer I'd imagine).    In the morning we were greeted with breakfast and Aziz told us to keep the room till our flight (we were leaving at 3PM) which was helpful as we could clean up and chance before we left. He had a cab waiting for us when we needed to leave which was spacious and clean. I was amazing that even the cab ride continued the upscale and top tier experience of this place :)    Definitely stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed in this riad with two others for 3 nights 29 Mar to 01 Apr 2018. This was my first time in Marrackech. The riad is very well kept all food we had was excellent quality. Each member of staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The riad feels very safe and was a great spot to relax. I highly recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay. We were met at the airport as arranged and upon arrival were greeted by name (and tea/pastried) at the door by the friendly and knowlegable Aziz. The whole stay was wonderful. Our triple room suited our family of 3 beautifully and was the most beautiful of all the rooms we stayed in during our 3 week stay in Morocco. The riad is conveniently located to the hustle and bustle that is the medina but just off the beaten path to allow for privacy and quiet. Aziz was great about providing a detailed map as well as offering suggestions for dining and how to make the most of our time in Marrakesh. Highly recommended for comfort/hospitality/location/price!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Mages is truly a hidden gem tucked away from the hectic frenzy of Marrakech. Our warm host – Aziz – made us feel so welcome that we actually left an excursion to Essaouira early to return to the Riad. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - recommending places based on our personal tastes arranging transfers and excursions for us at a moment’s notice. This exclusive property is tucked away right off of the Medina’s main hub. It’s a refined mix of traditional and modern with lovely gathering spaces including a central courtyard; rooftop with a pool; private nooks to enjoy breakfast tea read or just relax. The room was spacious with every amenity including heating blankets for cool nights. We highly recommend Riad Les Trois Mages and hope to return soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kevin F wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Warm Hospitality - Beautiful Riad - Special Location
Review_Text: The entire experience was a pure delight. Our communication with Aziz prior to our arrival was exceptional. Aziz arranged our pickup from the airport including the driver guiding us straight through the medina to the doorstep of Trois Mages. Aziz greeted us with tea and snacks and his staff prepared a delicious lunch on the roof of the riad. We booked two rooms both were spotless and tastefully decorated. It's clear that they pay attention to the details not something that is true of most places. The riad is convenient to the hustle and bustle that is the medina but just off the beaten path to allow for privacy and quiet. Aziz was great about providing a detailed map - but I would highly recommend hiring a guide for at least the first day I would also highly recommend booking your stay in Marrakech at Trois Mages!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sherry G wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: From start to finish Aziz and the staff at the Riad made us feel so at home and welcome. Nothing was too much trouble. The riad is lovely and clean the breakfast lunch and dinner were delicious. Perfect location walking distance to the square and souks I would thoroughly recommend this boutique Riad to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Many things to rec. about this Riad.
Review_Text: Holiday family trip to Morocco with our two adult sons. It was our first visit to the country scheduled rather hastily and we didn’t know what to expect. Would we feel alienated? Should we be concerned about matters of safety or comfort? We planned a quick visit – 4 days – hardly enough for more than a taste. We would focus our trip on Marrakech. I did what I usually do when trying to get a feel for a place pre-visit. I read TripAdvisor deeply. That’s how I found Les Trois Mages.    The good reviews did not disappoint and I highly recommend so many things about this riad which are detailed below. I add our assessment to the thread in an attempt to help other travelers and am greatly appreciative of the advice and appraisals from the travelers who came before.    I booked two rooms for 3 nights between Christmas and New Years. Prior to our arrival I exchanged many emails with the manager Aziz. He helped identify the appropriate rooms for our group. We took the two rooms on the ground floor. They were perfectly fine and opened up to a lounge area/lobby which was convivial and allowed us a place to sit and chat together. Each room was equipped with heaters and electric blankets to provide relief from the desert chill during the winter months. A must. I would also recommend bringing a pair of slippers or heavy socks to wear. You will want to remove the shoes you wear about the city at the threshold of your room! The bathroom was fine and clean. The entire place had an old-world charm and was kept spic and span clean by the industrious staff. The rooftop offered a lovely dipping pool and several lounges on which to sunbathe. Aziz made sure we were brought tea if we wanted and during our last afternoon he brought us our luncheon to eat in the sunshine.    The Riad is in the Medina so you are right in the middle of the hustle and bustle though it is located down an alleyway so something of a refuge. Once inside you will find comfort and coziness.    Azzis arranged for our transportation to/from airport and for a tour of the Medina and a day-long trip to the Atlas Mountains. All drivers and guides were excellent. We had an excellent trail guide in the Atlas Mountains – had never been out of Morocco but could converse with our group in three languages! He brought us to his home to meet his wife (who was very nice but did not stray from the kitchen to engage with us) and his adorable son who was whip smart and practicing his math problems on his only toy – a chalk board. This day trip was extraordinary and we felt like we were really able to make a connection with the Moroccan culture. Most illuminating cultural day.    The food at the Riad is excellent. In fact the dinner we had at the Riad on our second night was probably our most delicious and we were eating at very good restaurants. I would definitely recommend dining at the Trois Mages Riad but you need to book at least the morning of because they will shop and cook your meal to order.    Just another shout out to Azzis. He is a real pro as a manager and super nice young man. He runs an excellent establishment. Allow him to suggest things to do and places to go. He will steer you in the right direction and take good care of you. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tim M wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: A smart but characterful riad in an interesting and bustling part of the medina. While the streets outside are busy with locals going about their business Les Trois Mages is an oasis of calm. Very helpful staff with Aziz informative about life in the city. A great rooftop space on which to take breakfast and relax in the sun. Each morning we were sufficiently rested and recharged to once again take on the many sights and sounds of Marrakech. Thank you !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect welcome and perfect start to our holiday
Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our holiday and had all of our expectations exceeded. Aziz and the staff were so helpful welcoming and attentive. The Riad is beautiful and has everything you need. It's location means you are close to the 'action' of Marrakech but at the same time feel very safe and able to get away from the hustle and bustle when you want/need to. Would gladly return and would recommend to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucy R wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I read about Read Les Trois Mages in a travel blog and liked the sound of it so booked for two nights in half term. Our stay was at the end of a 10 day road trip so being welcomed in by calm and perfectly mannered hosts was even more appreciated. We had breakfast on the roof both mornings and enjoyed the pool between trips out to the souk. Aziz was so attentive and helpful and Anna sorted out my change of plan in such a friendly nice way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed in Les Trois Mages in March 2018. The staff - particularly Aziz - couldn't help us enough. The service really was amazing much better than I've had in any 5 star hotel.    The room was nice clean and a good size. There's really nothing I would change or could suggest to improve. The room came with a heater heated blanket and air conditioning - though we found the temperature fine and didn't need any. It also came with a good sized bathroom and a bath.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve T wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Top quality hospitality from Aziz and his staff.  He organised everything for our long weekend as agreed before we had even arrived. Airport pick up orientation private guide and even the wine for dinner. We ate in for lunch and dinner both days and the food was amazing. We ate in different locations from the pool landing and courtyard.  Absolutely nothing is too much trouble and I can't recommend staying here highly enough.  My daughter will be visiting Marrakech at the end of June and I have asked Aziz to look after her and I am totally confident that he will.  Thank you and we will see you again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Catherine C wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: The staff could not have been more accommodating the food was great and the experience was just lovely! We really had a wonderful introduction to the culture of Morocco. Marrakech is a wonderful city and although we didn't know our way around the staff guided us to the correct locations and sent us on our merry way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Viva M wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Due to a complication in my flight schedule back to the USA I had to stay an extra night in Marrakech; and boy I am glad that I did!    Before even arriving Aziz made me feel welcome by sending me an email almost immediately after I made my reservation. This was wonderful and I almost thought I was being punk'd (do people even say that anymore in 2018?) since I had made the reservation through Expedia. Anyway needless to say this made me feel comfortable since it was going to be my only night alone in a foreign country.    Upon arriving Aziz arranged to have a cab take me from my old Riad to les trois mages which was great. When I entered the Les trois mages I was greeted with a warm welcome from Aziz and he offered me my favorite Moroccan mint tea! So again yay! Love me some Moroccan mint tea :-)    Aziz then sat down with me and showed me the dinner menu asked what I wanted and then as I requested arranged an appointment for me to go to a very nice hammam that afternoon! Aziz also gave me a map and carefully showed me how to navigate the medina in case I wanted to further explore it!! When it was time for me to go my hammam appointment Aziz even walked me there!    My dinner was exquisite! I had the lamb tangine. Again the staff went above and beyond and had a nice fire going on and delicious food. I did not want to leave.    Last but not least my room. Anyone that knows me knows that I have a 'thing' about hotel rooms and I am very particular about them and especially hotel beds. Well I certainly did not have any issue here. The room was beautiful and comfortable and I felt like I was at home.    In the morning my breakfast did not disappoint by being a delicious treat and my cab was arranged for me on time to go the airport!    I have to say my last night in Marrakech was one of my best and a highlight of a very wonderful trip and this was largely due to Aziz and his wonderful staff! I want to go back to Marrakech just so I can stay at this wonderful place.    If I could give this place 10 stars I would.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mariusz S wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We stayed in Les Trois Mages for 2 nights and I wish we could have stayed there longer. I could not agree more with all the fantastic comments this Riad receives from its guests. The place itself is beautiful and peaceful but it’s all about the fantastic team that is willing to go the extra mile to make your stay a wonderful experience. The hospitality from Aziz and the staff was simply second to none!  It is easy for me to plan my next trip to Marrakesh as I know that there is a place there which makes me feel like home!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A few days after we got the hotel’s booking confirmation we received an email from Aziz (the manager of the hotel) with all information about the directions to the guesthouse tours taxi services and Marrakech itself.    Just before arrival we decided to take bus 19 from the airport to town so we wrote an email to Aziz the day before. Aziz promptly gave us instructions on where to get off and how to find the hotel (it’s 10min walk from Bab Doukala bus stop). When people saw us walking with luggage they came and wanted to guide us to our place - especially kids. Fortunately Aziz already advised us on how to handle them as they may bring you to the wrong accommodation or as for money for the “guiding service”. This was the only time that we really felt harassed as those kids were pretty annoying to say the least. But once we arrived at the hotel we felt like we were in the other world.    Upon check-in Aziz welcomed us with mint Tea and local pastry his air of tranquility made us calm down very quickly. He gave us a detailed map and explained us the way to go from and back to the hotel including some recommendations for places to visits restaurants bars.    The Guest House is situated inside the Medina and it’s easy to reach every where by walking. The area was good and we didn’t have any problem walking around at night. Shops and restaurants opened quite late and there was always people walking at night.    The place was nicely decorated - moroccan style spotless cleaned and many area for you to sit and relax. You can ask for tea coffee any time. The staffs were very friendly helpful and hospitable.    Our room Bahia Suite was very well decorated spacious with a separate shower room. During our stay was a bit cold but they provided us electrics blanket which was very helpful. There was an air-con unit which you can adjust to warm or cold. Bottom line we had a very good sleep there.    Wifi in the room worked very well. There was a bottle of water in the room daily.    Breakfast was very good; fresh squeeze orange juice coffee tea fresh yogurt with fresh fruits freshly cooked egg bread butter and Jam. On our last day we had a chance to had breakfast at the roof terrace as it was sunny and sufficiently warm.    During our stay was my husband birthday i asked Aziz if he could help me to prepare a small piece of cake for my husband during breakfast next morning. He promised me. After we came back from our tour that day we found a bottle of red wine olives and a small card from Aziz. We were very touched.
