Next morning we were at the roof terrace for breakfast and suddenly Aziz and his staff brought my husband a big chocolate cake with candles. My husband was very surprised and impressed.    On the day of our departure we arranged the hotel’s transfer service - we left the hotel in the morning and left our luggage there. The driver collected the luggage and then picked us up at the restaurant in the new town where we had lunch with a very nice Mercedes Vito. Couldn’t get any better than this.    We would like to thank Aziz and his team for such a wonderful flexibility and hospitality. We highly recommend this place. You won’t be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James B wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: This is our second visit to Les Trois Mages and it is every bit as good as the first time . Tucked away it is an oasis of peace and quiet. The real stars however are the staff all the staff are so welcoming helpful and caring . It is a real pleasure to stay here and unbelievable value for money .  We would heartily recommend Les Trois Mages .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mighty Quinn wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We had a first-rate experience from the reservation process thoughout our stay. The owner Anna promptly and happily provided detailed responses to our numerous questions and the manager Aziz made us feel at home from the moment we stepped in the door until we left.  He went above and beyond  going to the train station to get us tickets and graciously refusing to receive a tip. He was one of the warmest and authentically gracious people I've met and made the stay a very enjoyable and memorable one.  The cook Saida I believe was so warm and made us the best chicken tagine we had the entire trip.  The other staff were also amazing  giving us an authentic smile each time we walked by. We work in labor rights and could tell that they were treated well and felt valued. The breakfasts were fresh and plentiful with multiple courses of fruit  pancakes  eggs to order and tea brought up to to rooftop terrace or down to one of the well-appointed lounges downstairs. We stayed in the Badia suite and felt like we were actually in one of the rooms of the Badia Palace. Even though it is a historic house it is well appointed with multiple outlets AC and hot high-pressure showers. I could go on and on but will just say that I cannot speak highly enough of the Riad and the service!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A little bit of peace in central marrakesh
Review_Text: A nice experience where they seemed to go above and beyond in terms of hospitality. Very reasonable very central. Peaceful in a city that is definitely not so peaceful when you step outside and start dodging motorcycles mopeds cars and donkeys. Very nice breakfast tea every afternoon. Very grateful for the tips they gave us which helped our find a way and also (mostly) avoid a scam artist. Only one caveat--the wifi everywhere in Marrakesh seems a little wonky and the internet here though better than most of the medina was also wonky at times. Went off a few times signal was weak other times etc. All depended sometimes it worked well. But other than that a real pleasure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was definitely one of our most memorable holidays. We booked three nights in Melchior and two nights in the Bahia suite. In between we did a few days excursion which we arranged through the Riad.    On arrival at the airport we were met by a driver who took us to the hotel and indeed this was the same driver who took us to the excursions. Riads are very common in Marrakech and include a central uncovered courtyard - which allows you to escape the heat during the day. On the roof they also have a small dipping pool with some sun loungers. It is lovely to dip into the ice cold water during the middle of the day when it is searingly hot.    We traveled with my fifteen month year old son and had a great time. Moroccans are very child friendly and this was certainly the case in the Riad. The breakfasts were very enjoyable and definitely a highlight. They offer home cooked traditional Moroccan meals for lunch and dinner as well. These were reasonably priced and we often availed of this option.    The excursions that we arranged through the hotel were also excellent. This included driving in an air conditioned four by four with our driver Mohammed. It included a visit in the mountains / gorges as well as night in the dessert (with a camel ride).    We really enjoyed the service from Aziz and his team. Aziz speaks perfect English and they whole team are very accommodating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lynn M wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: A quiet retreat from the bustle of the Old town - Fantastic place to stay
Review_Text: Every aspect of our stay was superb! Aziz the manager emailed us before our stay to give us some details of what to expect in the Riad but also tips for Marrakech. They arranged a taxi to collect us from the airport and although we had to walk down a short alley to reach the Riad Aziz came up and escorted us from the taxi giving helpful landmarks to find our way around.  The room was clean and beautifully decorated with a very comfortable bed.  The food was delicious with an endless supply of mint tea on request - no need to go anywhere else!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Michael M wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed in the Bahia suite for 5 nights in early January - although this place is down an alley and a fairly good walk to the main attractions in the old city it’s well worth it. Aziz the Manager was so kind and helpful (so were all of the staff) that we felt like family. The Bahia Suite has a working fireplace and since it was chilly we made full use of it. It’s an old house and so don’t expect every modern amenity but it makes up for this with loads of charm and staff who do everything to make your stay enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alex N wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Incredibly warm staff and Fantastic Riad
Review_Text: I've done quite a bit of traveling stayed in 1000's of hotels/hostels/etc and rarely leave reviews. From the second Aziz greeted us he was incredibly warm and welcoming (in the back of my mind I thought there much be a catch or an upsell coming soon). Nope I was completely wrong and he was just about the warmest most genuine and friendly Moroccan(human) you will come across your entire visit to Morocco. Everyone travels for different reasons but for me it's always been about the people and meeting people like Aziz really inspire me to be kinder and a more welcoming person. We had only planned to stay one night but we immediately booked to stay more nights at the Riad once we had returned from exploring other parts of the country. The Riad itself is beautiful the rooms are comfortable the breakfast and staff are all incredible. The location is in the medina but some might feel it is a little far from the main plaza but I personally prefer being a little farther from the main area's of interest. If you are reading this just stop hesitating and click reserve! I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else if I went back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lie-in and listen to the birdsong
Review_Text: I stayed in Arabesque a wonderfully spacious and well appointed room on the first floor. The whole Riad is an oasis of calm and a beautiful place to retire to after a busy day in Marrakech and beyond. Breakfast is delicious and the staff are beyond helpful. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble for them. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jezrel S wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We arrived at around 11AM so pretty early for check-in. However the moment we arrived Aziz grabbed our luggage and invited us to sit at the courtyard. He offered us some drinks but ended up getting a MASSIVE spread of delicious breakfast that was just to die for. It was such a wonderful gesture after a long morning of travel.    Pros    + The facility is just amazing. It's oozing with character and charm. There is a music room with a piano and other instruments. There are also a variety of board games and books travel guides that were available to use.    + The rooms were fantastic. There were electric blankets and space heaters that came with it. Our twin room came with a small living area.    + The bathroom was great. My only minor complaint is that on our first day there was no hot water during the day which was a bit annoying. But the rest of our stay was fine.    + The daily breakfast was just fantastic. It was light healthy and refreshing. This was hands-down one of the best breakfast spreads I've ever had in my entire life.    + THE STAFF. Aziz is a gem. From the moment we met him I knew this was going to be a memorable stay. He was charming knowledgable and extremely helpful. He recommended places to go eat and see. He was also very interactive which was absolutely nice. He made sure our stay was perfect. The rest of the staff were just as wonderful. I can not say enough good things about the service at this Riad. Along with the breakfast it's more than enough reason to come back.    Cons    - WiFi was a bit slow and kept kicking me out of my phone. It was a little bit annoying since I had a lot of emails to send and work to be done at night so that somehow limited my ability to perform these tasks.    - Location was a bit of a walk from the main square and since it's a little far from the main street you have to haul your luggage to get to your transport.    Overall a fantastic stay. Without a doubt will recommend this place to anyone and will definitely come back. Hopefully the WiFi situation is better. I'm getting hungry just writing this review thinking about that breakfast spread and missing the amazing service. m
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Amazing riad in the Northern Medina
Review_Text: I have been raving about this riad since we left. Aziz and all of the staff at the Riad Les Trois Mages were incredibly helpful and attentive. From arranging cars for us to keeping track of our schedule and helping us make reservations they were outstanding. The facility is beautiful and located in the northern part of the Medina a little bit away from the craziness but still a pretty easy walk to everything you might want to do. All of the rooms face in to their courtyard in the traditional style and I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet and peaceful the riad was in spite of how noisy the city could be.  Make sure you order dinner in one evening - their chef who's name escapes me is an amazing cook and it's a great way to get home cooking in Morocco. Her breakfast cooking is outstanding too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Annagiulia Z wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: The Riad is beautiful and walking distance to the souk and Jamaa el Fna square. Our room was beautiful spacious and very clean but the most remarkable thing is Aziz and his team: they are extremely kind and always ready to satisfy every possibile need you have. You really feel at home. We had dinner in the riad on Dec. 31 and everything was perfect: the food the music they even got us a bottle of wine (usually the riad does not serve wine unless you ask for it in advance). On our last day we had to leave early in morning and they served us breakfast (delicious) at 6am. We would definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Les Trois Mages for just two nights and would have loved to have stayed more. Aziz the manager was incredibly helpful and friendly and the rest of the staff was beyond wonderful. Our room and the common areas were more than comfortable and felt like an oasis to return to amid the bustle of the medina outside. Aziz arranged for the friendly cook to prepare lunch for us when we arrived and it was delicious (and more than we could eat!) and the night caretaker made us an early breakfast on our last day so that we could get out and explore as early as possible. We plan to stay with them the next time we are in Marrakech and have already shared our recommendation with my parents for their visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sue L wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed in the Balthazar room and we had a lovely experience thanks to the manager Aziz. I don't think it's the largest or nicest room but it was a last minute booking and all that was available but it was still very nice clean romantic and beautifully decorated. As soon as I made the booking Aziz reached out with additional information offered directions menu options etc. And we were there celebrating our anniversary and Aziz was kind enough to arrange a beautiful gift for us in our room it was such an unexpected and lovely surprise! Overall he and the rest of the staff were extremely helpful the breakfast was superb the location was very convenient and we had a beautiful stay. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nate R. wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: This Riad is cozy and very personal. They attend to all your needs. I loved staying here. Each morning they would ask me what I wanted for breakfast and everything was fresh hot and quite delicious. It is in the heart of old Marrakech. The rooms are very cozy and clean. No tv but who had time to watch tv with so much to do and see!! Lovely pool on the roof where I would eat breakfast each morning. Great wifi too!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Maribel I wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Our stay in Riad Les Trois Mages was an unforgettable experience. We stayed two nights in Jade room a very well decorated beautiful warm and comfortable room with a very nice bathroom. The breakfast was really delicious. Saida is an excellent cook and she prepared for us a very tasteful lunch.  The riad is very conveniently located at walking distance of the most interesting sites in the Medina. It's a haven of peace once coming back of the bustle of the souks.  We enjoyed a lot sipping a delightful mint tea in its relaxing lounges.  Aziz and his wonderful team made us feel at home and offered all the assistance we required.  We heartly recommend this lovely riad and for sure we will repeat our stay here again when we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for 3 nights in December and highly recommend the riad. The property is centrally located the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the staff is incredibly warm and helpful. Overall we had an excellent experience.    A very very special thank you to Aziz and Mouhsine for your kindness and hospitality!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect stay, wish I stayed longer!
Review_Text: After 4 days in the Sahara Riad Les Trois Mages was very welcome. I chose the Riad based on all the wonderful reviews and i'm glad I did. I stayed I in the "Gaspard" room which was clean spacious well lite and warm! After a few cold nights in the desert the warmth was much appreciated. The room was well stocked with towels and electrical outlets.  With only one night there wasn't enough time to enjoy the terrace but I did enjoy the lounge spaces and several meals. Super hats off to the ladies in the kitchen; breakfast lunch and dinner were delicious!! It was a relief to know great food was easily accessible after escaping the labyrinth of the city.  Aziz and the staff made me feel very welcome as a solo traveler and can't wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Les Trois Mages is a delightful retreat in the middle of the chaos that is Marrakech's medina. The facilities are elegant and comfortable. The manager Aziz and his crew are an amazing resource helping with travel arrangements airport transfers sightseeing suggestions and even walking me to key areas in the medina so I didn't get lost. The breakfast each morning is extremely generous with a variety of fruit eggs yogurt and breads. I'll stay here again the next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We recently stayed at Les Trois Mages and had an excellent experience. Our travel arrangements got messed up a bit and the staff was so accommodating in adjusting their schedule to pick us up at the airport - very appreciated! The Riad is beautiful and our room was perfect. Highly recommended if you're visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laleh F wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: We stayed three nights in this Riad. The riad is lovely with cozy lobby in first floor. When we arrived Aziz welcomed us with mint tea and homemade sweets and explained where and how to visit all the attractions in Marrakesh. Aziz was extremely helpful.  Riad is in walking distance from touristic sites 15 min walk from Souk and 20 min walk from Market.  The breakfast was great fresh juice and fruits and warm bread with eggs and ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our second trip to Les 3 Mages and this time we stayed for a week.    Although the Riad is both beautiful and peaceful as others mention what makes this experience outstanding is the staff team. From Aziz's kind generous and informative welcome everyone in the team is thoughtful kind and adopt a 'nothing is too much trouble approach'. We look forward to seeing you all again and thank you for a wonderful holiday.    Paul and Cindy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis in the centre of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Fantastic service everyone made us feel very welcome and could not have been more helpful. Lovely rooms. Great location with a peaceful roof terrace and pool if you want to chill after a hectic day in the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: TT K wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Wonderful Stay at Les Trois Mages!
Review_Text: We had an amazing time at Les Trois Mages! Aziz and the entire staff are very kind and helpful. Everyone is going out of their way to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as they can at the same time they were never overbearing. We stayed at the Riad for a week and everyday we were looking forward to our breakfast and dinner at the Riad. The chef Saida is a fantastic cook! We ate outside of the Riad a few times in Marrakech and Saida’s cooking is still our favorite! We have a very sensitive stomachs so we always are very careful of where we eat and Saida’s cooking definitely took our worries away and was super delicious! Not to mention dining in a beautiful and tranquil environment of the Riad was a treat for us. In addition I had an asthma attack badly one late night and Mouhsine was on night duty that evening and he was very helpful and caring. Many thanks to Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila at Les Trois Mages! We had a great time in Marrakech and the team was the main reason. We definitely would stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the first email contact to the last morning breakfast served to us at 5:45 am due to an early morning flight this Riad was amazing. This is a beautiful place well decorated clean and a great location away from the loud crazy streets but within walking distance to all. However the highlight of this Riad is Aziz and his team. THEY make your stay special and unique. You feel like family coming home. I would definitely recommend this wonderful place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Outstanding riad in easy walking distance of centre of Medina
Review_Text: We stayed for two nights to round off a trip to Morocco that started with trekking in the High Atlas and summiting Jbel Toubkal. We had booked the Bahia suite as a little treat to ourselves after the trek and we really could not have asked for better.  On arrival the manager Aziz gave us tea in the courtyard and chatted about what to expect in Marrakesh and how to avoid bother what Riads are and how they came to be facilities and food at the Trois Mages and some notable things to do before showing us to the suite.  The suite was superb ('stunning' and 'gorgeous' were the words used by friends on facebook when we posted photos) beautifully appointed and very comfortable. Marrakesh is a noisy city yet the magic of a riad is that it somehow keeps the noise at bay giving guests a tranquil base to return to after the fun and madness of the souks and Place Jemaa el-Fna. Breakfast in the courtyard each morning was perfect for the day ahead - filling but nothing too heavy - fruit yoghurt bread and pastries and Moroccan pancakes and eggs if you wanted. For later the roof terrace (with its swimming pool) provided a very relaxed spot to catch up on reading.  Aziz also arranged transfer to the airport for us at a very reasonable charge.  Indeed I would like to make a special mention of Aziz - from his initial email contact after our booking to our arrival and throughout our stay he looked after us (and the other guests) very well (including leaving a complimentary bottle of wine in our suite when he realised from our registration form that my wife's birthday had passed the day before - thanks again!)  Not only would I heartily recommend the Trois Mages but my wife and I are certain that we will go back for more Marrakesh fun and this wonderful riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I cannot speak more highly of this Riad :)
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages which exceeded our expectations.  The staff were truly amazing - going above and beyond in every way!  The position was excellent and we were able to walk to all main sites.  Check in was smooth and efficient. Aziz went out of his way to explain all required details and prepare us for our visit so that we got the most out of our time marking all details on a map for our use including landmarks to ensure we didn’t get lost and patiently explaining all necessary details.  We were very appreciative of the offer to arrange a taxi driver to meet us at the airport (name on sign) and take us to the train station on our departure (fixed price and very economical).  The staff all went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed and provided excellent advice.  Our room was authentic and exquisite - the highlight of our 5 weeks of travelling.  We stayed in the Jade suite.  Breakfasts were included and were wonderful.  Lunch and or dinner were available if pre-ordered (excellent).  Lovely rooftop area incl a pool and sun lounges.  All recommendations were exceptional including sites restaurants spa money matters etc etc etc  Lastly on our way to the train station I discovered I had left my prescription sunglasses behind (the taxi driver was unable to turn back to retrieve as he had another booking). When we arrived at the station I phoned the Riad and with very limited time the staff brought the sunglasses to me at the platform entry.    I cannot thank all the staff enough for their excellent care and attention to detail.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chrissie G wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: It will be no surprise to read that we had the most wonderful welcoming stay at Riad Les Trois Mages and that Aziz and all the team made our visit one of calm and relaxation and that we felt really spoiled. We loved our room Bahia Suite which was traditionally appointed and romantic. Saida cooked us some fantastic evening meals and we loved having refreshing mint tea on the rooftop enjoying the sumptuous surroundings and sunshine. The riad was a very welcome haven of peace after spending hours getting lost in the souks! We would stay here again without a second thought - heartfelt thank you each and every one of the staff who could not have been more helpful considerate or efficient.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My fiance and I stayed here from 31st October to 4th November 2017.    We absolutely loved our stay!    From my first email to Aziz about transfers from the airport I knew I'd picked the right place. His response came on he same evening.    When we booked we got an email quickly from Aziz with our booking confirmation and staying payment was to be made upon checkout of the Riad. It also included an information pack on lunch and dinner menus excursions and a map. The transfers from the airport to the riad were sorted in this email too upon receipt of flight numbers and times etc.    There were a could more emails which were responded too almost immediately.    On arrival at the airport we were met by someone holding up a sign with the name of the Riad on it and taken swiftly to the Riad. Took about 15 minutes.    We were greeted by Aziz with mint tea and Morroccan biscuits. I'd been told about the mint team but it was more amazing than I'd expected. Aziz sat with us for around 20 minutes telling us about the city where to go for sights and souks and restaurants. He gave us a map which he drew routes to the main square Jemaal El Fnaa and also drew landmarks on it so we could easily find our way around.    We stayed in the Melchior suite on the ground floor which was perfect for us. Nice comfy bed shower in a cool cubicle thing. Safe in the wardrobe aircon etc.    We had dinner at the riad that night - we had the Chicken pastille which was lovely! The cooks    We had breakfast on the roof every morning which was lovely in the run under the sheltered seating.    The rooftop was also nice in the evening after a dip in the pool lounging on the sunloungers.    Aziz had arranged a guide on our request who took us around the city telling us some history and also took us in the museums etc. He also took us around the souks to places dint think yu would see if you didn't have the guide like the leather auctions and into rug making shops. Be weary though if you do have a guide that he will take you around the souks who will try to get you to bug all their stuff... we did buy some things but we think the guide was definitely worth it. perhaps don't buy anything whist you're with him as the shop keepers add on commission to their prices to pay the guide.    We asked Aziz for recomendstions on restaurants and he suggested Le Jarden Secret which was sooooo good! Aziz is full of so much information about the city so take advantage of this!    Every afternoon and evening when we came back the staff made us mint tea even late at night too! Nothing was ever too much trouble everyone was friendly and more than happy to help.    There is nice cool sitting areas to chill in just off the courtyard which have a chilled and relaxed ambiance.    I would have no second thoughts to returning this Riad should we return to Marrakech and I will be recommending it to anyone who intends to visit the city.    So many thanks to Aziz and his team you made it so wonderful!    Kind regards    Nick and Julia
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pascale B wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Riad Les trois Mages has always been my favourite in the medina after 4 visits to Marrakesh. Especially because of the central situation and the outstanding professionalism of the manager Aziz and his team who will be there to take care of all your desires and questions. This is especially what you need for a first experience in the old city which could be tempting.. Price quality here means you get one of the best of the medina.  You are ensured of a genuine Berber experience. Enjoy 1001 nights at Riad Les Trois Mages. Love for Marrakesh ❤️
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: What a wonderful lace to stay!
Review_Text: We loved this place from the moment we stepped through the door. Saida greeted us with water coffee pancakes cakes jams etc and Aziz gave us a lot of helpful hints and tips on what to see and where to go. We were then shown upstairs to our room the Bahia which was spacious and nicely furnished in a traditional Moroccan style. There was a sunked bed which was very comfortable a sitting area a fireplace wardrobe fridge safe bathroom with WC washbasin hairdrier bathrobes towels shower and sunken bath.    Breakfasts consist of fresh orange juice fresh fruit and yogurt eggs various breads pancakes and pan au chocolat etc with tea or coffee. Lunch and dinner are also available but give some notice. On the first night we had decided to eat at the riad and ordered our meal before hand. It was delicious! Thank you Aziz for the wine!    There is a lovely sunbathing area on the roof terrace with sunbeds and towels tables chairs sitting area and plunge pool. We sat up there at night to read before going to bed. Downstairs there is a sitting room with fireplace books and games are available. In another room there is an electronic piano and other mucial instruments with music. In the entrance there is a wide selection of books maps and information on Morocco for guests' use.    The riad is within easy walking distance of the souks the main square the Jardin Margorelle the Saadian Tombs Bahia Palace Baadi Palace Koutoubia Mosque and gardens and most other must-see sights. Taxis are nearby as are some good restaurants. The door is always locked so the only people who can gain entrance are the guests and staff. There is always someone on duty.    This was our first trip to Marrakech and we found Aziz's map and advice invaluable. All the staff were so friendly helpful and eager to please. Nothing was too much trouble for them.    After being in the hustle and bustle of the town it was so nice to get to the peace and quiet of the riad to relax. It was our little oasis of calm in the cocophany that is Marrakech.    We would gladly go back there as we were made to feel so welcome and at home there. I would give it more than 5 stars if I could!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 3 night at Les Trois Mages and it was fantastic. All the staff were wonderful and helpful and couldn't do enough for you. It is a beautiful Riad and so peaceful and quiet despite the business of the outside city. I would recommend anyone coming to Marrakech to stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Brilliant stay at this hidden gem. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff (thanks Aziz!) - all really friendly and provided great advice as well as complimentary tea water and coffee. The rooms are spacious and clean. The pool at the top was great and the food really tasty. Can't really recommend enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael D wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Very comfortable quiet and well located riad within easy walking distance of the souks and the square. Food was excellent and the service even better. Aziz the manager could not have been more helpful explaining where everything was recommending and making reservations for dinner. The rooms are very comfortable and the riad even has a nice dipping pool on the terrace of the roof. Our stay could not have been better!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Yudan C wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Everything was brilliant! All the staff with special mentions to Aziz were amazing so attentive and polite without being overbearing and nosey. All the rooms were spectacular and the bahia suite in which we stayed was incredible. Food was amazing and the location was perfect for us still in the medina but away from the throngs  the place was like an oasis of tranquility which we could retreat to! And at an amazing price too! Could not recommend more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eric F wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Lovely oasis in a buzzing city
Review_Text: Wonderful weekend at Riad Les Trois Mages - we were met at the airport - Everything at the Riad was clean and ready and comfortable - the rooftop area was perfect with a pool - The food was top notch - Aziz was very helpful with supplying maps and information on the city - and everything else we asked for advice/help with - it was 5 star quality service all the way from Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila.  They helped make our weekend stay to celebrate my 50th birthday unforgettable ... thanks to all the staff

Review_Date: Susan M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Back again this year and so happy to still find this Riad as amazing as ever! The accommodation is fabulous and the food is so delicious here I'm missing it already. It was great to see all the staff again. They really make the experience here. They are all so helpful and friendly and fantastic cooks 😄 I look forward to returning soon. I would totally recommend this place for a peaceful and relaxing break in the middle of Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: I wish I could give Les Trois Mages 10 stars!
Review_Text: We were in Morocco for three weeks in July and this was our favorite stay by far. We stayed for 6 nights at Les Trois Mages and it was extraordinary. The place itself is gorgeous with lovely spots to rest and relax. We were welcomed with cookies and mint tea in a luxurious spot in the shade.    The Bahia Suite is AMAZING. I couldn't believe how beautiful and spacious it was with the sunken bed and its own sitting area. And loved the shower too! There was one day when the heat and my blisters combined to make me loathe to move that I stayed in the riad all day while my husband attended his conference. I was soooo comfortable! The AC worked like a charm (Thank G-d-- it was brutally hot!). It's also wonderful that unlike a lot of places we stayed it had a small fridge in the closet. So we could keep a little food there too. Later in the day it was lovely to go for a dip in the rooftop pool.    And I loved loved loved the breakfasts with Moroccan and French bread yogurt fruit and coffee. We could have it anywhere we wanted and we ended up moving around trying different spots. Layla who served us each morning didn't speak much english but it didn't matter. She was so sweet and eager to please. NOTHING was too much trouble.    That was true of all the staff. Muneer the night manager even made us ice cubes from bottled water because we mentioned that the water was always pretty warm.    Aziz the manager was always ready to help whenever needed whether recommending a cooking class (Cafe Clock was awesome!) a restaurant or just giving us directions. Even after we left when I needed a specific kind of receipt for our stay Aziz was quick to respond to emails and get me what I needed. The staff was always asking us if we would like (complimentary) coffee tea or water and if there was anything at all they could do for us.    As I said to Aziz at the time-- I do not understand why Les Trois Mages isn't a 4 star hotel-- it certainly looks and acts like one! I can't thank Aziz Muneer and Layla enough (and sorry it took so long to write this). Betty-Ann
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is exquisite; the rooms are all glorious; we were in Bahia the best but all others are fine. The food is lovely and the rooftop pool such a lovely way to spend the afternoon. We had a slow morning wandered into town saw a few sites rested on the roof and then enjoyed dinner either in the Riad or in a nearby restaurant. It could not have been a better week. The staff are so pleasant and friendly and the service is outstanding. We loved every minute of our week in Marrakesh and cannot believe there is a better place to stay.

In Marrakesh it's necessary to be able to get away from the noise and chaos from time to time and the ideal is to have a riad near the main tourist areas but tucked away and quiet. Les Trois Mages fulfils this perfectly and adds the calm and excellent service of Aziz and his colleagues.    The small touches also help UK plug adaptors supplied in our rooms for example. Another guest had a birthday one day and they made their evening meal a memorable one to help mark the occasion including a birthday cake.    The food is very good and the rooftop terrace with it's plunge pool is perfect for some relaxation before diving back into the city again. The rooms are kitted out well with good showers A/C safes and plenty of hangers in the wardrobes (a bug bear of mine!)    I can recommend this riad and it's friendly service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helen C wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Mages is a beautiful little sanctuary in Marrakech. What's even more is how the staff exemplifies the heart & soul of Moroccan hospitality.    I celebrated my partner's birthday there. Aziz the manager arranged absolutely gorgeous fragrant flowers in our suite. Then surprised us with a bottle of wine the next day with a Happy Birthday banner. The birthday dinner at the Riad was delicious and we all sang happy birthday with a French cake and candles. We felt like a small family.    The staff here puts heart & soul into their work. Even the way they place a dish in front of you they are like artists placing everything just the right place to show the aesthetics. This serene beautiful culture also makes all the guests honor and respect the place even more. Everyone is quiet and respected each other's space. So even when the Riad is fully booked I felt we had the Riad all to ourselves.    If you are looking for parties this Riad is not for you but if you are looking for a beautiful retreat and want to feel the essence of Moroccan hospitality this is the place to be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christopher G wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Wonderful environment the staff really go above and beyond (which helps in a new country). Special mention must go to the food - home made and wonderful! We rarely eat at the same place twice on short holidays but we made an exception for this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: June S wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: I booked this riad after the rave reviews it had received on Trip Advisor even though it appeared to be more expensive than many others. I wanted the first place that we stayed before our 13 day On the Go Best of Morocco tour to be a memorable one and it certainly did not disappoint. In fact it set the bar so high that none of the other riads that we stayed at came close. It was worth every cent that we paid.  The quiet and calm of the riad is in direct contrast to the hustle and bustle of downtown Marrakesh which is only a 10-15 minute walk. We had been warned by friends how it was impossible not to get lost in the maze of alleyways around the town but Aziz gave us wonderful instructions on the first day and we were able to find all the tourist attractions and return back to the riad quite easily. All of the staff are very professional yet friendly. Aziz speaks excellent English is font of local knowledge and the pride in his country shows. Nothing is too much trouble for him and he goes out of his way to ensure that your stay not only in this riad but in Marrakesh in general is a really enjoyable experience. Make sure that you experience at least one of Saida's fantastic meals. She has been trained in France and it shows in everything she produces from the delicious cakes for afternoon tea to the melt in your mouth shortcrust pastry in the vegetable flan or the delicious blend of aromatics she uses in her tangines. We sat and had a candle-lit dinner (competently served by the night guard/waiter) complete with wine and romantic background music and savoured every mouth-full of her delicious food (as an ex-chef and foodie I am not easily impressed). The portions of the food were so generous that we were not able to finish them and requested them for breakie the next day as they were too yummy to throw away.  The owners of this riad have exceptionally good taste in the style in which it has been decorated and even better taste in all the staff that they have employed.They are a credit to the riad and I hope that they are all fully appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can't say enough good things about this Riad:  Service?  Impeccable. I think this was possibly the best service I have ever experienced in all of my extensive travels. Helpful and prompt without being overbearing in the least. Aziz you are incredible.  Rooms?  Amazing. In fact I had booked the Melchior room originally as the website indicated that it had a bathtub. Upon arrival I discovered that the room just had a shower which was actually fine as the room was still lovely. But our hosts promptly upgraded us to the Bahia Suite for the rest of our stay. FYI: the suite is awesome and worth the small extra cost!  All in all the deco of this riad was so charming I would have been happy to call it a second home (or first. Who am I kidding?)  Breakfast?  Delicious plentiful and whenever you are ready to eat it. Amazing! A couple days we did not even eat lunch we were so full from the delectable breakfast.  Location:  Fantastic. Easy walk out to the Ville Nouvelle (meh) or the Botanic gardens (worth a morning visit) but just a few minutes walk into the souks where we spent much of our time shopping (aka bargaining) and wandering around. In a city as difficult to navigate as Marrakesh Old Town can be this hotel was always easy to get back to. And some days we couldn't wait to get back.    And the roof deck with pool (small but oh so welcome in the July heat!) was a wonderful bonus.  Book this place now!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kayla W wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during our stay in Morocco. We do a great deal of traveling and this has to be one of the most hospitable places we have ever stayed! We were blown away by the courtesy of the staff! We only had a short time in Marrakesh so they were sure we made the most of our trip by helping us plan out our itinerary. There are staff around 24/7 to help you if you need anything. The night guard was especially kind. He walked us half way to our restaurant on our first night to make sure we didn't get lost fixed our AC unit for us in the middle of the night after we accidentally turned it off and made an early breakfast for us on our last day because we had an early flight. I cannot find any of my pictures of the riad but it was beautiful even better than the pictures. The rooms were very comfortable this was the best sleep we had our whole trip. Great location close to lots of popular sights but still quiet inside. I cannot say enough good things about this place! Thank you again to all the terrific staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandra K wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: This Riad is just perfect. Aziz was friendly informative and so polite and kind. We were upgraded to the Bahia room which is incredibly beautiful; the bed was so comfortable excellent AC and free water tea and coffee provided at any time. We were the only ones staying so had the place to ourselves and were treated like royalty. Breakfast was lovely a superb meal was cooked just for us at any time we wanted it and they also gave us a free bottle of wine for my birthday. We had the rooftop pool to ourselves all day comfy sunbeds and towels provided. The Riad is in the Medina close to the main square the Secret Garden and round the corner from a small square where you can get a petit taxi to wherever else you may wish to go. It is a haven of peace and tranquility midst the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. We were only there for our last night in Morocco but it was a perfect end to a fantastic trip - don't miss it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Alicia O wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Calm and nice place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My friend and I spent 3 nights at this lovely riad. We had a pleasant time while over there and the attention from Aziz and the rest of the staff was fantastic!! Aziz gave us great directions and suggestions on how to get to the places we wanted to visit.  Breakfasts at the rooftop were great and the patio indoors was lovely!  The room was confortable I liked the Moroccan decoration in both the Gaspard room and the bathroom.  Really charming and magical place to stay over in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: such a lovely riad a real stand out for the attention to detail paid by staff and the little touches in the rooms.. oh and the rooftop wading pool! we just kept saying got each other 'isn't this a great riad? we've really lucked out here'. i'll definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We enjoyed out stay in the luxurious Bahia suite. This is a charming riad with the added bonus of a pool on the roof. This was very welcome after the hurly burly of Marrakesh. The staff were all very helpful and nothing was too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful read, amazing staff, amazing stay!
Review_Text: My son and I had the wonderful opportunity to stay at Road Les Trois Mages in June. The staff was so welcoming and made our stay in Morocco very pleasant. They went out the way to make sure we had a great first visit to Morocco (i.e. comfortable room great service recommending places to eat - even walking with us to help find where we were trying to go setting up our camel ride with transportation to/from). I know that other places may do the same but there was something special and more caring about this place. I travel quite frequently and the care here was in the top 1% of people building relationships with their guest. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fabulous place to stay, amazing staff!
Review_Text: Where do I start from our initial booking there was no question about the customer service - Aziz promptly responded and provided advice when asked. Upon arrival we had arranged for airport pickup and when we got to the road there was Mint tea and wonderful Moroccan biscuits. We met the great staff and had a fabulous dinner cooked by Saida - fresh fish salads and amazing desserts! The breakfasts would feed a small army - fruit yoghurt local pancakes crepes eggs and fresh croissants/bread tea and coffee. Also worthy of mention is the extremely pleasant Mohassain who is at the Riad overnight and always answers the door with a great smile! Our room was clean well appointed and comfortable. When asked Aziz also arranged for a tour to Essaouria and was extremely helpful in providing guidance on how to get to various locations and indicating in a map preferred routes and landmarks (such as the large palm tree or double arches! Extremely useful for those of us who don't read Arabic and given limited number of street signs we found this invaluable! We spent a couple of evenings in the terrace around the pool - very nice and a little bit of a getaway after a busy day of touring. Should we return to Marrakech we would definitely stay at Riad Les Trois Mages again. It's a gem - you won't be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I spent 4 days here with my sister in June and I can't say enough good things about this place! The riad is beautiful with plenty of lovely outdoor spaces a rooftop pool and air-conditioned rooms. Breakfast was included each morning with yogurt fresh fruit eggs pancakes juice tea and coffee. We were usually full until dinner. The location within the media is great; it's only a short walk to the souks and the main square and it's a good base for day trips to places outside of the city.  However what sets it apart the most is the staff. They were beyond welcoming and available to help us with recommendations reservations or mint tea anytime. Our time in the medina was so much better because of their hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Should I be telling you how good this place is ?
Review_Text: We have just spent 4 fantastic nights here in what is a charming riad - with many lovely touches. We were there over the two days of the Eid festival - so some attractions in Marrakech were quiet but our time relaxing at the riad was amazing. One thing that sets this place aside from many other riads is the fantastic staff who we can't praise highly enough: Aziz Mousaine and Saida in particular who were so helpful with tips directions and even in booking me an amazing Hamam (if you haven't tried one do it!) Rooms are beautiful clean and romantic (Hotel web site gives an accurate reflection) and the pool on the roof is super for cooling off and lounging in the heat of the day ( it was over 40 while we were there.) The shared spaces are great too with musical instruments board games and a library. The location is brilliant for getting into the city and out for the Gardens and Palmerie. Breakfast is lovely and should set you up for the day until the evening - we will definitely try the in-house cooking on our next visit. Amazing time we will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kristen A wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: My friend and I spent a few days in Marrakech and we were recommended this riad by another friend and I'm so glad we stayed here! The place is very charming and we were greeted by a warm welcome and delicious mint tea. The location is also super convenient being located in the medina and just steps away from the souks main square etc. Our room was very comfortable and quiet had air-conditioning a pool on the roof and the breakfast (which was included in the rate) was delicious. We also really appreciated the manager's advice recommendations and helpful tips for getting around the medina. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lorraine H wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: We stayed here for one night in the middle of our holiday. Everything about it was fantastic - from booking through to departure. We were sorry to only stay one night!    The roof terrace and pool are a lovely place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city at the end of the day. The location is also great a little further out from the main square but we found this much better than a previous riad we stayed in which was just off the square.    We stayed in Jade room which was very comfortable. Breakfast was also excellent.    Aziz and the rest of the team here provide an excellent level of service. I would not hesitate to come back the next time I visit Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: M A wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: A Beautiful Small Riad with A Big Heart
Review_Text: My and my fiance have stayed here for a week and it has been the best part of our little break.    The service is the best I have ever received anywhere. Aziz Muohsin Najia Saida and Ashanti have made us feel at home all week.    This little riad does not offer a small service. The service was consistent throughout our stay. Everyone was fasting through out our stay with the temp averaging 39 degrees and never did it impact the service as we were always greeted with a smile from everyone. I struggled in the heat and can only give everyone my utmost admiration.    On our last day we ate our lunch and dinner in Le Troi Mage's and we could not fault either. In fact it was one of our favourite meals. The price for the quality is definitely reasonable. If possible I would highly recommend you eat a meal here.    We stayed in the Bahia room which was beautiful. It was clean and the bath was a mini pool. Our beds were made everyday and the room tidied.    I cannot recommend this little oasis of a Riad enough. Thank you to Aziz and everyone for the best hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mehmet t wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Where to start! This place was actually the shining light of our stay in Marrakech. The city is so bonkers and relentless yet coming back to this place of an evening we were able to unwind and forget all the chaos outside. The manager Aziz the night guard Mohsin Saida Ashanti and Naizma ( I hope I've pronounced these correct ) are all so welcoming and go above and beyond toake you feel welcome and safe. Aziz booked our taxis restaurants spa etc and ensured we had tea and coffee at all times. Mohsin would ensure we were okay in the evenings and would often make us a nice evening tea and still be there to give us our breakfast.  The location is perfect as everything is within walking distance yet you are away from the crowded souks and the dreaded jemaa el fna.  Aziz is always on hand to greet you have a chat and check that everything is okay. He's ready to assist at all times as is everyone else.  The rooms are gorgeous and each one has a different style. The suite is something else. There's a lovely little pool on the roof and loads of little chillout spaces on the mezzanine and ground floor. You can have the lively breakfast on the roof terrace and we also chose to have lunch and dinner on our last day cooked by Saida and the crew. The food was amazing we were very surprised by the high standard as we did ask for it at quite short notice.  If you want a great value place to stay in marrakech with lovely decor and amazing attentive staff look no further.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Samantha S wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: We were truly blown away by our stay at the Riad Les Trois Mages. Aziz & his entire staff could not have taken better care of us from the moment we booked our reservation to our final good byes.    The riad itself is positively beautiful. My brother father and I stayed in the Bahia Suite and it was incredible. The breakfast every morning was delicious and authentic and the staff who prepared it were incredibly accommodating and kind. They essentially mapped out our entire 3 day stay for us as well! They booked both a camel ride in the desert and a trip out to the Atlas Mountains in Imlil (highly recommended -- we had our own private guide as well) for us. We truly didn't have to lift a finger.    The Riad was very close to tons of sites in the city as well -- souks palaces gardens just about everything. Taking a late afternoon swim on the roof's pool was always lovely too.    Would absolutely come back again and again. Thank you for the most wonderful visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Graham B wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: We had an amazing holiday. The rooms were great so clean and so unlike standard hotels. The staff are friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the refreshment service. Nothing too much for them. Thank you to Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila from G P K & K!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beyond expectation excellent riad with very good price/quality
Review_Text: N31°38'115" W7°59'612" There are thousands of riads (houses with a courtyard garden) within the city wall of Marrakesh and on TripAdvisor many of them with solely 5 star reviews. These ratings did not help us with the selection. After selecting the highest rated riads judging their response on our email-booking request and looking at their websites Le Trois Mages offered the best quality/price ratio. We received a discount for direct booking bypassing well-known internet booking websites. We paid €74 per night including breakfast in May 2017.    We planned to take the train between Marrakesh and Casablanca airport but due to cancellation and repeatedly not communicating schedule changes by Royal Air Maroc we could not return in time by train to the airport. Bus lines do not exist where train lines run and the airport transfer service did not answer our email requests. We were left with hiring a car. Not our first choice reading all the horror stories about car hire in Morocco on the internet. CarTrawler offered us a small car from Hertz. Remarkably the insurance fee for no risk at all was more than the car hire fee. CarTrawler did an excellent job informing which documents we needed at the Hertz franchise in the airport to prevent any problem. Of course the Hertz franchise tried to sell us unnecessary additional insurance to lower the amount of temporarily withdrawal of MAS 14400 from our credit card. The new Fiat Panda delivered us in 2 1/2 in front of Les Trois Mages. The toll road expense was MAD 80. Staff from Les Trois Mages understood our transportation problems worked with us to solve these in advance and sent GPS-coordinates and a map to the car park. The night guard Mouhsin was waiting for us to park the rental car in a secure car park for MAD 30 per day.    The original riad is 200 years old but the present owners living in the United Kingdom renovated it very nicely after purchasing this property 10 years ago. It has 6 rooms with good photos on their excellent website. Two rooms on the ground floor and four on the first floor. The terrace and the pool are on the second floor. Our room called Jade on the first floor with ensuite bathroom was romantic decorated with nice stylish touches a four-poster bed - personally the mattresses were a bit too hard to be romantic - small couch two wardrobes - one with hotel safe - and a split air conditioner. The bathroom had an excellent large shower with nice smelling shower gel and shampoo and a hairdryer. An additional advantage of this riad is the width of their rooms. Some riads offer narrow shallow room the width of a double bed. Not Le Trois Mages.    Breakfast is served where you want it downstairs in your room or on the roof terrace with coffee tea yoghurt fruit bread and eggs in any form. Nice beginning of the day. Every morning Aziz the manager was present to answer questions and offer tips on visits to Marrakesh and surrounding areas. His explanation of the map of Marrakesh and the routes through the medina to the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square was simple and effective. We never lost our way and the second day we walked with a sturdy pace to the square without any map like locals. We radiated confidence and no shopkeeper bothered us on our way.    All staff members (Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila) did their best to make our stay memorable. They served tea on the roof terrace and offered us a cup of Harira soup. Service was very personal and beyond our expectations. Overall the quality/price ratio was very good. We wished we could have stayed longer but we had to return the rental car to Casablanca. Very recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed bere for our wedding anniversary in May after reading the reviews and looking at the location.  When we arived we were surprised at the location as it was down a scruffy alley we need not have been as this is an Oasis in a crazy mad wonderful city.  All the team  headed by Riaz were phenomenal in there attitude and their willingness to help.    The room was traditional Moroccan and exactly what we wanted breakfast is a huge meal and we didnt miss the traditional english cooked but rather enjoyed the breads eggs yoghurt and fruits etc.    All in all a wonderful holiday made bettter by the Riad team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Natalie M wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: The staff was quite hospitable starting with our flight getting in early and they were able to come straight away to pick us up to having lazy breakfast on the rooftop which we could eat at whatever time we pleased. We even were able to enjoy the small pool on the rooftop. It's an easy walking distance to all the major sites and the quietness of the riad provides a nice reprieve from the souks and marketplace. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a delightful riad in a great location in the medina – easy walking distance to the souks and Jemaa al Fna. Marrakech can be a bit overwhelming for the first time visitor and this riad was a lovely calm retreat at the end of the day. The riad is beautifully decorated in a traditional manner with a very welcoming ambiance. Aziz and his staff were quick to offer mint tea and make sure that all our needs were met. They arranged for us to be picked up at the airport including a return trip to retrieve our daughter’s lost luggage. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was delightful. Aziz was extremely helpful in organizing a visit to a hammam/spa and even walked us over to make sure we had no problem finding our way. I would highly recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Thomas G wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: This was our favorite Riad of our two week stay. The service was excellent from start to finish: Aziz directed us to and picked us up from a parking lot near by and Mouhsine helped us carry our luggage back. Aziz greeted us with mint tea and gave us a map of the Medina to get around. We had dinner there the first night (by the way the couscous is huge so come hungry) and there Harira soup was the best we had in Morocco. One downside is they are serious when they mean you need to let them know the day before or that morning for food on the upside that means it's fresh and delicious.    As for the hotel there is an open courtyard in the middle with salons on each side. Also on top there is a terrace with a pool two tables and lounge chairs. They will let you eat wherever you would like so make sure to take advantage of the changes in scenery. Their daily breakfast is very filling and delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A charming Riad and great service
Review_Text: We were welcomed with Mint tea upon our arrival at the Riad. The courtyard was nicely decorated with beautiful furniture and plants and the middle was an open space where you can see the sky. On the rooftop there is a pool and tables where we enjoyed breakfast in the mornings and wine in the evenings. On the first day we had a dinner at the Riad. Everything was good especially the Moroccan Salad and Harira soup was excellent.  Besides that what makes this Riad special is the personalized service. When we brought back wine they set up the table for us and they would accommodate breakfast at the time or place of your preference. It was alway nice to receive a bottle of water when we were back from the walk around the city. Whenever we had questions Aziz or Mouhsine were there to help us.  The room was clean and very quiet and the air-conditioning worked well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for our first two nights in Morocco. It is a beautiful place and we had wonderful hospitality. Aziz and his staff were very helpful in giving us information about Marrakech. I had told our tour operator that it was my husband's birthday that day and they had some balloons and a bottle of wine waiting for us in our room. We had dinner there that night and the food was wonderful. I would highly recommend the Chicken Pastilla! They also had a small birthday cake at the end of our dinner. The only thing I have to say is it was delicious but TOO MUCH FOOD for the two of us! Anyway we enjoyed our stay here very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Riad with Great Personal Service!
Review_Text: My brother and I stayed at Les Trois Mages before our tour to the desert. It was beyond my expectations with a great price! Aziz the manager went above and beyond in meeting all of our needs as well as flexibly assisting us with last minute plan changes. He helped us find a private and safe parking lot close to the Riad and picked us up from the lot to personally take us back to the Riad. I wanted a covered parking spot as we would be leaving the car for two days but since there were not any available Aziz made sure the parking lot attendant saved us a spot and called him when it opened up. He even moved the car for us so that we didn't waste any of our exploration time. Additionally we were provided with complimentary drinks throughout our stay. Aziz recommended several "hidden gems" in the Marakkech medina for lunch and dinner. He also provided a detailed map so that we would not get lost on our adventures in the old medina as well as highlighting the important sites of the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our time in this very clean and tastefully decorated Riad with a wonderfully welcoming staff. I highly recommend it to all and we will definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The Bahia room at Trois Mages is lovely-- very cool and comfortable. In 100F heat we appreciated the escape from the Medina! Aziz was very helpful and prompt in emailing us instructions about how to arrive (and was also happy to call a cab for us if we wanted). The breakfast was great and we took a dip in the rooftop pool in the evening-- great experience. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Lovely authentic riad on the north side of the Medina
Review_Text: We stayed for 2 nights just before Christmas. Be aware that nights here are cold at this time of year (and a riad is a traditional house built around an open courtyard) but we had a lovely warm room with electric blankets and a four poster bed. We ordered an evening meal for the first night when we arrived tagine naturally which we ate by a wood fire. Breakfast was excellent. Pancakes yoghurt fresh fruit scrambled eggs (boiled eggs are always hard in Marrakech) which we took sat on the roof terrace warmed by the early morning sun. Aziz couldn't have been kinder and his clues on how to navigate the maze of roads were absolutely essential. Its the wrong side of town for the main square but that is still only 15 minutes walk away. A calm oasis in the fabulous madness that is Marrakech. Recommended.

Review_Date: Seán W wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: I stayed with a group of friends at this magical Riad in April 2017.
Review_Text: The location of the Riad in the old town of Marrakech is very convenient especially to some of the cities best restaurants.    The Riad itself is beautifully maintained and well staffed.    The room was a spacious double with its own bathroom. It overlooked the atrium of the premises and was very comfortable and cool. It has airconditioning but I did not need to use it.    The main draw of this accommodation is the service. The manager and staff were available all day and night to tend to our needs. Tea coffee water and soft drinks were available 24/7 and included in the price.    The manager and staff were beyond helpful yet not intrusive.    The common areas are plentiful and very comfortable. There is a small rooftop pool with very comfortable lounge and dining areas. The pool itself though small was very useful for cooling down during the hot day.    This riad is an oasis of coll and calm in the hectic city of Marrakech. If I return to the city I will stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A wonderful trip staying at the Riad Les Trois Mages that really made it a special holiday. Aziz and his fab team of Hazzan Saida( the amazing resident chef) Mussem & all were so hospitable & helpful arranging everything from taxi's restaurant bookings personal guides. They were also on hand day & night with cold water freshly brewed Moroccan Mint Tea or Coffee & a pleasant chat to enquire how our day had been.  Saida's skills in the kitchen were superb - some of the best quiche & the salads tagine & griddled chicken skewers were all delicious. You can eat & relax in the courtyard on the ground floor in one of the 2 lounges on this floor. I had fun enjoying the music room with its grand piano guitars lute bongos...  The Riad is sympathetically designed in a traditional yet contemporary Moroccan style ( see photos) and was an oasis of calm away from the vibrancy & hustle bustle of the Medina.  The main square Jemma el F'na Souks Secret Garden Medina Gardens Majorelle (Yves Saint Laurent) are all within a 15 minute walk. I have recommended this Riad to friends and hope to visit again. As a food blogger the food in Marrakesh is fab & I will be writing more about my experiences on taste2taste.com- this is a little taster!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Aziz and his team we are always helpful and kind. Always there to answer any questions and help in every way. It was my daughter's birthday and they surprised her by decorating the room dedicating a card and flowers to her! Our room was spacious and comfortable and very quiet. Breakfast on the terrace was a luxury we will miss. We were extremely happy with everything at Trois Mages. We hope to return someday!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband and I spent 3 wonderful nights at this gem of a riad. Aziz and his team really do run a wonderful hotel. It is a gorgeous haven from the heat and madness of the medina and in a great location. We arrived quite late on our first night so arranged to have dinner and what a treat! Beautiful food and plenty of it the same can be said about the breakfasts. Our room was very charming comfortable bed air conditioning plenty of storage fluffy towels robes etc. They also have a lovely terrace and pool on the rooftop - lovely to relax there after a day in the souks.    Communication with Aziz was very easy from before we arrived. He gave us lots of pointers and tips and arranged for a taxi to take us from the airport to the riad and back at the end of the break. He was very helpful about providing information and recommending restaurants while we were in Marrakech. On our second full day we had a trip to the Atlas mountains organised by Aziz. The driver we had for the day was very good and we had a lovely day seeing a very different part of Morocco.    I can't recommend the Riad enough not only for its cleanliness and comfort but also for the amazing staff who couldn't do enough for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent 4 nights here with my wife. Everything was perfect. The riad is in a great location the room was comfortable and clean the lounge and rooftop terrace are wonderful oases of calm to relax in. And Aziz and his staff were always on hand to help offer advice and provide mint tea. I would thoroughly recommend this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chloe C wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Everything was truly perfect with this charming boutique hotel. Communications prior to arrival were flawless- very responsive clear and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful. My room was a dream. The communal area is gorgeous as is the rooftop pool area. Service was exceptional- everything from arranging dinner reservations to excursions. Polite helpful friendly. I have been to Morocco dozens of times and this is the best hotel experience I have ever had. Special thanks to Aziz the hotel manager.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Clean, relaxing riad in a convenient location
Review_Text: Spent 3 nights with friends at this british family owned riad located very close to one of Medina's gates.    Special thanks to Aziz and his team who run a very smooth operation. The place is spotless clean and has all the ammenities you'd expect.    Service was always ready to accommodate our needs. Be it recommending cultural and dining sites or setting up a barbeque on the riad's rooftop terrace.    With its more than reasonable rates it is definetely a place to take into account when planning a trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What a wonderful place. A peaceful haven amidst the chaos of the Medina. From the minute we arrived we felt at home Mouhsin the night manager welcomed us and as we arrived late evening we ate at the Riad (chicken tagine yummy.) Aziz was incredibly helpful organizing taxis to and fro the airport giving advise about the souks and arranging a tour to the Atlas mountains. Breakfast at the riad was plentiful fruit yogurt pancakes eggs juice. Our room was beautifully decorated and cleaned every day the ladies work really hard in the Moroccan heat.The rooftop pool was a perfect place to relax in the afternoon after exploring the city and water mint tea and coffee is complimentary.  Thank you Aziz and all at Riad Les Trois Mages for making our stay wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can't recommend Riad Les Trois Mages enough! It's a beautiful peaceful haven within the Medina but easy walking distance to all the key sites. We stayed in the Melchior room just off the courtyard - it was beautifully decorated in traditional Moroccan style and was very clean. Aziz (hotel manager) was extremely helpful both before and during our stay. He organised a taxi to and from the airport and sent us details of possible excursions - we went on a half day tour of the Medina with Jouad on the first morning of our stay which helped us orient ourselves in the Medina and souks and gain confidence to go it alone! He also had very colourful personal stories to accompany his commentary on the Bahia Palace. His English was excellent too! On our second day we went on the Berber Village - Atlas Mountains tour which was a wonderful way to explore the stunning countryside including a walk up to the top of a beautiful waterfall a tour of a typical Berber house Argan oil/jewellry purchases directly from the Berber artisans for a much cheaper price than the souks in Marrakesh and a very memorable camel ride! Breakfast at the riad is delicious and plentiful - fruit yoghurt freshly squeezed orange juice pancakes French pastries and bread (plus eggs on request). Free mineral water and mint tea are available on request. Aziz is happy to recommend and book restaurants and explain how to get there! The pool on the roof is a wonderful haven for relaxing after a hot and busy day in the Medina. I travelled with my daughter and hope to return with my son and husband too to this wonderful Riad. All this at a very reasonable price! An enormous thanks to Aziz (and Mouhsin the night manager) for a totally wonderful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My family and I stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for a week. If you're visiting Marrakech you should consider staying here. The staff was fantastic and the manager Aziz is one of the best we've come across. Very friendly and helpful. He made sure we had everything we needed from giving us advice to setting up dining reservations to having delicious mint tea ready whenever we requested. He also coordinated cabs to and from the airport. The riad was very laid back and beautiful with fresh roses out every morning and lots of space to spread out and relax. One of my favorite things to do every day was to come back to the riad to have tea and play games that were provided by the riad. They even coordinated for us to have dinner when we came in the first night after a late flight. The wait staff was very kind and accommodating. Delicious breakfast every morning with yogurt strawberries pastries eggs bread fresh oj coffee crepes pancakes etc. there's a nice pool on the terrace for swimming along with lounge chairs and beautiful flowers. Can't say enough about it. Moussain(sp?)the evening manager was also great. Friendly helpful and very accommodating. Rooms were a decent size with AC and comfy beds. Bottles of water mint tea coffee were complimentary at all times. Needless to say we had our fare share of mint tea. There's also a piano if you enjoy playing. Location was good...about 10 min walk to souks and restaurants. Watch out for shady folks trying to steer you in the wrong direction when you come out of the riad...but that's everywhere. Quiet comfortable stay. Really enjoyed it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emma P wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Perfect for a mid-price stay in Marrakesh. We were two friends travelling together and felt incredibly safe and welcome at Riad Les Trois. We were greeted with mint tea and cookies on arrival after a taxi was arranged to pick us up at the bus station and deliver us directly to the door. Aziz the manager was on hand daily to assist with any request recommendations or advice. The food and service was exemplary. The roof top pool a sanctuary. A calm oasis in the heart of the Medina. Would absolutely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After a very difficult Spring passage over the Atlas (snow fog rain bad truck traffic - and resulting bad car accident) we reached les 3 Mages late at night - and instantly all the stress melted. We stayed in Arabesque where my wife took a warm bath while I sipped mint tea and dreamed of caravans in centuries past - this is how Marrakech must have felt after a three month camel trek from Timbuktu. An excellent nearby dinner recommendation completed the decompression stage.  Next morning Aziz helped us with taxi and bus arrangements on to Essouira but not before a wonderful breakfast and a change in our reservation for the return to Marrakech - no way we were going to top our experience at "les 3" so why waste the night elsewhere?  Upon our return 3 days later we checked into Jade - another slice of heaven! Another excellent dinner recommendation (different restaurant same perfect vibe for the night) another excellent breakfast and a surprise to discover the rooftop pool - how did we miss that the first time around?  All the rooms in this riad are wonderful (yes I peeked) - fantastic interior design (even the stairwells and keys encourage your imagination!) perfectly clean and absolutely silent all night long. Unlike other riads we stayed in the bathrooms are clean dry and pleasantly fragrant - no funky plumbing here. The entire staff is more than helpful. Food is superb. This is a luxury hotel experience at half the price and a far better location than the nouveau-riche tourist barns outside the medina.    This will be my home base whenever I come to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mishal M wrote a review Mar 2017
