Review_Text: We stayed here 2 nights in March 2017.    Aziz the hotel manager was very kind and hospitable. All our needs and requests were taken care of promptly. He along with the other staff made our stay a delight.    Mint tea was served to us whenever we wanted free of charge. On one afternoon after returning to our riad we were served with complimentary chocolate cake along with our mint tea. The place felt like home.    The room was not 5-star luxury but was neat with all fixtures and fittings functional. The quality of the service more than made up for this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick A wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Stayed for 3 nights as a solo traveller. Aziz the hotel manager spoke fluent English and was a welcoming host. He was able to arrange transport to/from the airport guides and tours as needed working with me both before my trip via email and during in person.    I was greeted on my arrival with some mint tea and cookies and Aziz walked me through the basics of Marrakech and helped me get my bearings inside the Medina.    The room was spacious and well appointed. Breakfast was served either on the ground floor of the riad or on the roof terrace wherever you preferred.    Overall I had an excellent stay at the riad and would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Nice and peaceful Riad in the heart of the bustling Medina. The manager Aziz as well as the whole staff was very helpful and welcoming. They really took care of us by arranging excursions and make sure that everything was ok during our stay.  Breakfast with yoghurt and fruit salad was excellent start for the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: R Eileen T wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: The best possible introduction to Morocco!
Review_Text: My first two nights in Morocco were in Marrakech at Les Trois Mages and I couldn't have chosen a better start! Aziz the riad's manager was fluent in English and immediately made me both welcome and comfortable. My bags were taken to my room while I sipped the mint tea offered as soon as I stepped inside. I was given a tour of the riad and then shown on a map where we were and where I might want to go. A car was sent to pick me up at the train station and one was arranged to take me back. Breakfast was superb and filling and the entire staff couldn't have been nicer. A special note - have a reservation made for dinner at l'Attitude. Wonderful service ambiance and great food!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Louise N wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights and had a wonderful stay. The Riad is lovely and peaceful and we particularly enjoyed the rooftop terrace and heated pool. Our room was beautifully decorated and warm enough in the cool February nights thanks to heaters and an electric blanket. Aziz was a fantastic host and gave us lots of helpful tips a personalised map organised taxis for us and was always on hand to offer refreshments. The Riad is in a good location and walkable to most sights in Marrakech. We would recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Garry S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We only had a few nights there but it was such a great experience. Great location (only minutes walk away from the souks and Jemaa el-Fna Square) but somewhere quiet enough inside that you don't hear any of the crazy news in the Medina.  Aziz was always extremely hospitable and the staff were very kind. Anything we asked they were able to provide without hesitation. Whenever we came back from a long day of wondering around they always provided us with delicious Moroccan mint tea to welcome us back. And I was even surprised with a bottle of wine for my birthday!  The room was amazing as well we stayed in the Bahia room. The nights are cold in Marrakech but the room had multiple heaters as well as electric blankets in the bed! We'd just turn them on a little while before sleeping and then the beds would be nice and warm when we tucked in! We couldn't have asked for a better experience. Aziz and his staff were perfect. Even the rooftop pool was heated!  We would definitely stay there again without a doubt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amy M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: This Riad made the upmost difference in making our stay in Marrakech positive and personalized. They helped organize everything from taxis to and from the airport tour guides and made excellent restaurant recommendations. In addition to the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff the Riad was lovely and had cozy areas as well as a rooftop pool and sun area. It was truly a wonderful place to stay and I would highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Lovely Riad with very welcoming staff nothing too much trouble. Breakfast good and plentiful room very nicely decorated in Moroccan style . Location good near to all attractions and great restaurants. We would be happy to return one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristal L wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful riad with wonderful staff that makes an excellent stay
Review_Text: We stayed 2 nights at this beautiful riad in February. The staff was friendly and helpful. Committed to ensure our stay is comfortable. Strategic location in the medina. Walking distance to most attractions. Lots of recommended restaurants nearby. Love the patio especially. We had almost the entire riad to ourselves which makes the experience even more personal. Definitely stay here again if I am to visit Marrakech next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Roisin T wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for 3 nights in early February. From the moment of arrival to the time of our departure we felt warmly welcomed and well looked after. Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila run a beautifully decorated and lovingly maintained Riad in Marrakesh's Medina. The rooms are very comfortable and the food is delicious as well as beautifully presented. We would happily recommend this wonderful riad to any visitor as have no doubt that all needs will be catered for warmly and professionally. Thanks all at Riad Les Trois Mages:)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stay two nights in this little hotel but it was worthy. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Always making sure we would get the best of Marrakech for the short time that we were staying. The rooms are beautifully arranged and comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: janet O wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Marrakech is both manic and colourful so when you go through the door into Les Trois Mages it is like stepping into a little piece of heaven with its tranquil atmosphere. The staff are second to none and nothing is too much trouble. We enjoyed two meals at the Rhiad which were both delicious and plentiful. Transport was arranged to and from the airport as well as other tours if required. Rooms were clean and comfortable with rich coloured furnishings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakech is a blast of colour sounds smells and chaos in contrast Les Trois Mages is a peaceful haven of tranquillity with clean rooms attentive staff and tasteful Moroccan design.  The roof terrace is large with a pool and is a perfect place to spend the afternoon after tramping the Souks and before going out for an evening meal.  Aziz was a fabulous source of local information and booked us a fantastic guide (highly recommended on your first visit).  It is cold in January once the sun has gone down but the room heaters and electric blankets were more than adequate.  We will be revisiting at the earliest opportunity...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Simply perfect, beyond our best expectations
Review_Text: Simply perfect: the location the atmosphere the service - everything at this riad seems to be purposely arranged to fullfill the desire of quiet intimacy and relax. Our room (named Melchior after one of the 3 Magi) was immaculately clean spacious welcoming and furnished with a mixed of traditional Moroccan style and modern comforts. The en-suite bathroom with shower was a little jem decorated with fine tiles and elegant bronze bathroom fittings.  Everything at Les Trois Mages is arranged and taken care of into detail. The manager Aziz is exceptionally welcoming professional and helpful - he took care of our excursions and made sure everything during our stay was perfectly arranged for us to only enjoy our anniversary (he even treated us with wine flowers and a surprise anniversary cake!). All staffs are as discrete as present and helpful and OH WELL! the food is to die for! Genuine Moroccan home-made food which the chef of the riad Saida - who's as discrete again as magical at her creations (the tagines are PHENOMENAL - we tried them all meat and vegetarian versions!!!) is served in the common rooms downstairs fireplace and jazz music included. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace next to few comfortable beachchairs tends with cushions and a little swimming pool.  We had a truly fantastic time here and we would highly recommend the riad to whomever expects the most romantic quiet and warm stay in town while discovering the buzz of Marrakech just outside.  Simply a jem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great staff and Riad with major sites within 20 minutes walk.
Review_Text: You can't go wrong if you pick this riad and they will arrange transport to and from the airport; serve a lovely breakfast on the roof terrace and provide free coffee on request often served with cake. The manager Aziz speaks excellent English and gives you a map to help you find your way around and I trust him to give you the best advice. He will arrange tours for you or ring other tour companies to check on time of departure etc.    Most of the major sites are within 20/25 minutes walk from the Riad and most admission prices are less than £2 e.g. El Badia Palace & Saadian Tombs. The Riad is also only 20 minutes walk from Jardin Majorelle that will cost around £8 to visit the garden and the Berber Museum but it is worth it. We enjoyed a meal in the evening at the Riad but we also highly recommend Lattitude 31 about 4 minutes walk from the riad that serves top quality food at very reasonable prices. A fabulous 3 course meal costs around £25 plus they gave us a free drink. A few minutes from the riad you can also exchange sterling into dirhams and get a much better exchange rate than at the airport.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A little gem in the heart of the bustling market. A beautiful traditional riad that is very peaceful despite being situated in the old Medina. Great hosts accommodating to all your needs. Aziz was very helpful on our arrival. Will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A gorgeous riad with the most hospitable hosts
Review_Text: Riad les trois mages has to be one of best choices we've made. From the moment we walked through the doors I knew this place would be amazing.    We were welcomed with traditional drinks and sweets which were freshly made by the staff and went down a treat. Aziz the main man then spent time with us to explain the city. Marrakech isn't the most easiest of cities to go around however the fact that he sat us down explained the souks and provided us with a detailed map made the entire experience worthwhile. WE DID NOT GET LOST AT ALL!    By staying in this Riad I noticed how personalised the entire stay was. The hospitality of all the staff is next to nothing. The riad itself is decorated so traditionally and uniquely. It's such a beautiful place to stay and I can't fault it on any grounds.    You know your in good hands when your staying at riad le trois mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Annette D wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: We loved staying at this riad and highly recommend it to anyone heading to Marrakech. The staff are super friendly the food is great the decor is gorgeous and the riad itself is super quiet. You could not ask for a more welcoming and warm place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The service was impeccable with prompt help via email with Aziz even before we travelled out there. We were collected from the airport as arranged and arrived to mint tea at this beautiful Riad. The two living rooms and courtyard downstairs meant there was space for our two children (aged 1 and 4) to play although we spent a lot of our time on the roof terrace and in the pool. We stayed in the Bahia Suite which had the comfiest huge bed another bed and travel cot and still space to live in for the week also the bathroom had a massive bath and shower big enough for all of us! The layout of the Riad meant we could sit up on the roof terrace or downstairs once the children were in bed and relax with a glass of wine but still hear them if they needed us. All the staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs and would have arranged day trips had we wanted it. This was a lovely haven in contrast to the mayhem of Marrakech and a great spot from which to explore the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and cannot say enough good things about it. We would definitely come back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Goldie R wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with the warmest host
Review_Text: The property is truly stunning and a wonderful place to stay. Is very central in the Medina down a quiet street away from the bustle. Aziz was a wonderful & generous host and could not have been more helpful

Review_Title: What more could you ask for??
Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad for a week and enjoyed every moment. The room was beautifully decorated comfortable and clean. The atmosphere was calm and the staff were unbelievably helpful and welcoming but special mention must go to Aziz. He made our holiday. Nothing is too much trouble for Aziz. Maps advice recommendations restaurant bookings information - he has it all. As a result we found our way round the Medina easily and ate in some fabulous cafes and restaurants. The Riad is in a perfect location and you can walk to just about everything from there. And the breakfasts were excellent! I would highly recommend Les Trois Mages to anyone travelling to Marrakech. It is the perfect base and the service is exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A delightful oasis at a reasonable price
Review_Text: This little hotel is a gem in every sense of the word. Tucked away in a nondescript side street away from the crowds the dark carved door opens and you feel as if you enter into another era. The beautiful Moroccan tiled floors the intimate center courtyard the well appointed rooms all reflect the artistry of the Moroccan culture. After a very long journey to Morocco it rained my first day and my room was the perfect cocoon in which to rest. While I could write pages about the well appointed decor what MUST be discussed is the outstanding service. From the head concierge Aziz to the cook Zaîda the staff is nothing short of marvelous and almost miraculous. No request is too small and they seem genuinely happy not only that you are a guest but that they can be of help. The week before I had been in Morocco and had done a great of sight-seeing so Les Trois Mages became a great haven for rest and further explorations. The food was absolutely fantastic and it was better than ANYTHING that I ate in a restaurant while in Marrakesh. Breakfast is copious and delicious as was lunch but the dinners were outstanding. For such a small intimate hotel I was astounded by the quality of the cuisine--even my fish was beautifully cooked. Aziz will welcome you with a beautiful smile and warm personality--he makes sure that you are taken care of: from a massage to a great excursion to shopping tips. I simply cannot rave enough about this fantastic little gem tucked away in Marrakesh. Les Trois Mages is one a handful of hotels in which I want to stay again as much for the wonderful people as for the hotel itself. If you are okay with walking about 15 minutes to the old main square and souks this is a memorable hotel for your visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Susanne L wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Lovely riad with very friendly staff
Review_Text: This was our second time at Riad Les Trois Mages and it was still this nice and cosy place as it we have it in our mind from our visit four years ago. The rooms are beautiful decorated with Marrocan furnitures and carpets. The staff was as always very kind and helpful. From the roof terrace you have a terrific view over the Medina of Marrakesh and you can have your delicious breakfast there. This was certainly not our last stay in this riad hopefully we will be back soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I recently enjoyed 2 days in Marrakech (my first visit to Morocco) and as anticipated (from reading reviews online) Riad Les Trois Mages was a superb "base station" for my wanderings around the medina. Starting with a taxi waiting at the train station for me to being greeted by Aziz with mint tea and cultural/historical orientation and bottled water in my room through the balance of my stay I can very strongly recommend this riad to your readers. The accomodations were very comfortable. The food was wonderful. The service was personalized with close attention to detail. With Aziz' advice and map I was able to navigate the medina without any issues. I was pleasantly surprised with how quiet it was not only in my room each night but also in the central courtyard. I look forward to returning and will once again make Les Trois Mages my "base camp".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Katherine M wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: I recently stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages with a friend during our trip to Morocco. The Riad was beautiful and a really relaxing place to stay in a very busy city! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel very at home. The food was delicious and we really enjoyed the complimentary afternoon teas! We could not recommend this Riad more highly and would definitely stay here again should we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Gorgeous riad that ticks all the boxes
Review_Text: We had booked the Jade Room for four nights but on arrival were upgraded to the Bahia suite as we were the only people in the riad. Our welcome here was very warm and friendly and we felt immediately at home. The Jade Room did look gorgeous but the Bahia was another level again with a bit more room. The whole place is charming and stylish.  We had already pre ordered dinner and enjoyed this on a table set up for us in front of the fire - a private dinner party. The food was delicious but the quantities are huge so be careful how many courses you order!. (we had the Marrakeshi lamb) A main for two is really enough for four unless you have a huge appetite.  We enjoyed breakfast everyday up on the roof terrace in the sun so relaxing. A wonderful Moroccan spread with the option of poached eggs a nod to western visitors. It was so pleasant it was hard to get moving and go exploring. The riad is inside the old medina and is close to everything.  It was great to be welcomed back with tea and biscuits after exploring and there was plenty of information and advice available to help with any trip planning. Aziz kindly booked some treatments for me at the Heritage Spa. Felt extra pampered on return by having dinner again in front of the fire. This time we had chicken bastilla. Saida packed up the leftovers for us to take as a picnic lunch on the bus to Essaouira.  It was tough to check out but we have booked to go back in January 2017. Hopefully we wont have to share the riad with anyone else!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tina M wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: If you want a truly romantic and wonderful experience in Marrakech stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. Even before we arrived the service was first class with a welcoming email and offers of arranging transfers which made our stay even more special.  The customer service the entire staff at Riad Les Trois Mages gives is top notch nothing is too much trouble.  We stayed in the Jade bedroom a beautiful room with a four poster bed and the little touches like the electric blanket (which was so needed at night) and the complimentary tea when we got back from a few hours of walking made our stay more welcoming.  It's location was great although be aware of the early morning prayers every morning something that anyone staying in the centre of Marrakech will be subject too as they have literally 100s of mosques dotted around the centre. Ear plugs recommended :-)  Marrakech is a wonderful place to visit so if you are heading there soon have a great time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nisha S wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Lovely homely riad with a great staff
Review_Text: The riad is cosy and homely - decorated in a very traditional way. Location is great...walking distance to the souks and main square (if you don't get lost along the way lol). Most of all - the staff are fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ian F wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Stay was by recommendation and no hesitation in doing the same.
Review_Text: Superb Riad  Aziz is a man that does and all staff are so polite  attentive and helpful.  The room was spotless very well presented and full of charm.  The staff will provide you with free tea ( and often cake :-) ) at a moments notice with a genuine smile and breakfasts were lovely. Saying that a kettle in the room for that "pre talk to the world" cuppa would have made a welcome touch.Though I bet if had asked for one it would have magically appeared.  Location was just right for visiting old and new parts of Marakech .  We failed to notice the lovely pool facility when we booked so didn't take swim gear do looked so inviting.  No need to take a map Aziz provides you with a map that far surpasses one I bought to take and anything in any guide book.. Though as a tip we preloaded maps of Morrocco to our phone ( windows) and the accuracy particularly in the narrow Souk streets was totally accurate a welcome back up when you realise you are totally lost.  Trip Advisors suggest to say what you liked the best and the least well I cant think of a least so will stop there. A wonderful experiencein a lovely riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucy M wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We had a wonderful experience staying at Les Trois Mages last weekend. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate whatever we needed from day trips to the Atlas Mountains to a delicious breakfast on the roof every morning! Aziz was so helpful throughout the whole experience and advised us good places to eat and drink in the medina. The room was super exotic comfortable and clean with the addition of a four poster bed and lovely big shutters opening out onto the central courtyard. The roof is kept beautifully clean with white linen beds and chaise lounge dotted around a small but pristine plunge pool. We ate dinner on the roof the first night which was a delicately flavoured tagine followed by Moroccan pastries all delicious and great value for money.  Overall a really great place to stay for couples or families and only a 15 minute walk to the main medina. Service is next level! Loved it x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Brilliant environment, really authentic feel for Marrakech
Review_Text: My girlfriend & I stayed here for 2 nights and were very impressed with how helpful & attentive the staff were. No problems at all with the room or service & the food was also excellent! Aziz was a great help on day 1 with suggestions where to go & also arranged for taxis to take us to & from the airport. Very reasonable prices for the service we received & a really authentic feel for Marrakech you wouldn't get from staying in a normal hotel. Great location very easy walk to main square the souks & le Jardin majorelle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a fabulous 3 night stay at the Riad les trois mages.    Everything was super smooth - from the email contact before the trip to being picked up at the airport. Arriving at 9.30 pm we had a warm welcome and were served a delicious homecooked meal in the courtyard. Definitely the best Morroccan food of the entire hoilday.    What really stands out about this place is the service. Forget 5* hotels this place was warm and welcoming and nothing was too much to ask. 'oh you'd like some crisps we don't have any but we will get some' - 5 minutes later the drinks and snacks were served!    The photographs don't really do this place justice - it is even nicer than it looks.    there are a lot of Riads to choose from on tripadviser - I spent ages looking. You won't be disappointed by this one.    the proximity to the souks is also ideal.    take the guide on the first day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A place of peace and relaxation
Review_Text: We spent 3 days in this fantastic and well-located riad. Aziz the manager made us feel extremely welcome and was very accommodating for any particular wishes. We will return to this place of peace and relaxation as soon as we can!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert L wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Excellent all round. Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Marrakech. We had a friend with us who had been to other Riads and Les 3 Mages by far the best. Aziz Moison and their team were all faultless. Loved the rooms endless mint tea and water and particularly enjoyed the heated plunge pool on the roof. Will stay again..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Their Key word is 'perfection', we loved this Riad!!!
Review_Text: Just returned from an unforgettable 4 night stay with my grown-up daughter at Riad Les Trois Mages which is British owned. It's a lovely court-yard style Riad with all modcoms chill decoration (you want those lamps:) and with a just-right rooftop pool with umbrella's lounge beds azure towels & thick white bathrobes in the room) in a very safe location while close to everything. Manager Aziz & his attentive staff went beyond to make us feel welcome & the pampering lasted until waving us out when the airport transfer was there. The breakfast is more than you can eat (fresh OJ to die for fresh local fruit + yoghurt T or coffee eggs any style pancakes etc. etc.) served wherever you like: in the shady courtyard halfway on the verandah or on the rooftop in the morning sun with a view over Marrakech. We had the Balthazar room on the 1st floor which comes with an extra bed but we were fine in the large double 4-poster fitted with excellent bedding in every way. The Riad provides airport transfer and Manager Aziz will answer all questions you have in advance & during your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sandra N wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We have just returned from a wonderful 4 nights in les Trois Mages and can honestly say this was one of the best holidays we have ever had. We travelled with our 3 yr old daughter and Aziz and the lovely ladies in the riad were so welcoming and friendly that we have no hesitation in recommending this riad to anyone. Aziz was so knowledgable in advising us on suitable activities and places to go he really made our stay extra special. We had 2 amazing day trips to the Ourika Valley and Essaouria. Despite Aziz's great restaurant recommendations (and we can recommend Latitude 31 just around the corner) we found the food so good in the riad we did not venture much further most nights! Saida's food really does live up to other reviews descriptions. We have already been recommending this riad to friends and family and are already planning a return trip but looking at taking the whole riad which would be amazing!!! Apparently you can book the whole place for up to 14 people. Can't wait!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emma T wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Me and my partner spent a simply wonderful time at this gorgeous Riad for my half term break in October. We were greeted with smiles and incredible cordiality - and our room was simply gorgeous. Our first evening meal was spent here in the spectacular courtyard dining space and it was absolutely delicious. We were never without what we needed and our the service was exceptional. At every opportunity the staff were quick to help and very hands on in all respects. I simply cannot fault this extraordinary place at all; in fact it was the bench mark of all that is best about Morocco. I would return here at the drop of a hat. It was a divine stay from beginning to end and I want to congratulate the Manager on his exemplary Riad and his welcoming informative hospitality and ever satisfying attitude to his guests. 5 Stars in every way possible. Amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elizabeth R wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: My 11 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights. Many riads understandably don't facilitate under 12's. All riads advertise themselves 'oasis of calm' from an often frenetic Marrakesh. I too expected this as I've stayed in other riads.    The first morning I was woken at 09.15 by 5 very young children including a baby. Their parents chatted loudly over breakfast ignoring the fact that they were in fact sharing accommodation with others. I was shocked that the owners have an open policy on children with no minimum age whatsoever. I exchanged many emails with the owner until she relented that perhaps they need to review their policy.  I had a very pleasant stay otherwise the building staff and food were perfect. However the first morning cast a shadow over our stay. This is my first ever negative review but I felt the owner was rather dismissive and abrupt in her emails and would not be happy to deal with her again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Thinking about staying here? Do it
Review_Text: It's pretty awesome here. Genuinely. The breakfast was only bettered by the helpful staff. The small rooftop pool provides a refreshing place to plunge.    Stay here. I would again.    Other reviews mention a dark lane to walk down to get there. This seems to be the case with all riads that I have stayed in. We had zero trouble with this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Aziz and his team were what made this such a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are comfortable the shared spaces elegant and welcoming but the staff at Les Trois Mages were beyond expectations. Unobtrusive but absolutely available providing maps advice drinks and delicious food they catered to our every need. And by the way Saida's couscous is out of this world!  I was in Marrakech alone with my two daughters (aged 3 and 5) as my husband had to leave our holiday early for work. The calm and friendly atmosphere at Les Trois Mages made the experience memorable for all the right reasons! Thank you :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Liv F wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We cannot recommend this wonderful riad enough!  The beautiful decor and the more-than-friendly-and-helpful staff was the absolutely best part of our 10 day trip to Morocco!  We started off with only 3 nights booking and we ended up staying in total of 7 nights lucky enough to be able to extend our stay. We tried 4 different rooms (because we hadn't booked in advance so Aziz was helpful enough to squeeze us in where they had a vacant room) and they were ALL beautifully decorated comfortable and spacious. The courtyard is quiet beautiful and with comfy corners of couches in the shade. We also spent a lot of time on the rooftop. We loved the tranquil of this riad in an otherwise hectic city.  But actually the best part of our stay wasn't even the wonderful facilities but the extremely friendly and VERY helpful Aziz and his staff. Aziz helped us several times with arranging tours that we were very happy with and with absolute no hassle or problems on the way. The rest of the staff was also very friendly and helpful.  All in all we felt like royalties and had a wonderful time! We will definitely be back one day. Thank you Aziz and your team!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emily L wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: This riad is located within the Medina in the midst of a residential neighborhood. Upon entering the riad you escape the hustle & bustle of the Medina's streets and find a place of sanctuary & beauty. The staff are all friendly & kind and Aziz the manager is absolutely wonderful. Aziz works diligently to make sure that you have everything you need and is willing to assist you in any way that he/his staff can. The food is delicious and they provide large portions. Breakfast is included and it can't be beat. The decor within the riad is lovely and it is quiet throughout the day -- even with the open courtyard.    Since this riad is within the Medina there is plenty to see and do. This riad also offers a range of tour packages that you can elect to take for a fee. We booked the half day tour of the Medina which covered the souks and several historic sites and it was well worth the money. Our guide was informative very helpful and provided us with details that we wouldn't have known had we toured and ventured out on our own.    We had a wonderful time in Marrakesh and staying here was part of that amazing experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a four night stay in this beautiful riad. It was a complete haven in the wonderful hubbub of mad and marvellous Marrakech. The property is beautifully presented decorated and maintained. The team that manage and run the riad genuinely want your stay to be the best it can be. We slept soundly and peacefully in the dark comfortable and quiet bedroom. Relaxing in the salons at the end of a busy day with a mint tea was the perfect end to each day. We would stay here again without hesitation and cannot recommend it highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A fantastic hidden quiet gem in the bustle of the Medina in Marrakesh
Review_Text: The Riad had everything to offer - comfort great location wonderful breakfasts and a very warm welcome from Aziz and his team. Always keen to offer advice and help to book restaurants experiences and taxis. The Riad was extremely comfortable and beautifully decorated with a great roof terrace featuring a plunge pool and plenty of space to relax and catch the sun. Beautifully located in Larouss a mere 30 mins from the airport and a 20 min walk to Place Jemaa el-Fna and the Souks of Marrakesh.  I would highly recommend Les Trois Mages for a group of friends (we were 10) but I'm sure you'd get the warmest welcome no matter how many you were.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Hazel H wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: The riad was perfect as were it's staff. I don't think I can suggest any improvements. Aziz is very careful to make sure you can find your way to all the tourist places and of course find your way back too. Marrakech is truly mad chaotic and colourful mix . Afternoons spent by the pool sipping a glass of wine ( which the riad kindly bought in for us) were fab. Would 100% recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jill C wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Wonderful Stay at this Central Riad
Review_Text: A group of 10 of us booked the Riad Les Trois Mages for 4 days/3 nights. An ideal quick break from London. From being picked up at the airport then stepping into this quiet oasis off the busy streets to the end of our stay we were truly treated like Kings. Aziz the manager was superb providing us with detailed maps of routes and places to visit arranging meals massages taxis whilst ensuring constant supplies of peppermint tea and smiles! A short walk takes you to the souks the main square and the main sights. Though central the riad seemed very secluded and peaceful. The bedrooms lounges and chill out areas are all stylishly decorated and the roof-top pool area a great place to relax. Thanks Aziz Marcel and the rest of the staff for helping make my first visit to Marrakech so special. I will definitely be back - great place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I cannot recommend this riad and the manager Aziz enough. I have travelled to Marrakesh several times before but had previously stayed in la Palmarie as I'd thought staying in the medina would be too noisy. This riad was the perfect oasis - close enough to the souks cafes restaurants and attractions but quietly secluded from the chaos. We took the whole place over as a party of 10 (accommodates 12 I believe) but you can also reserve by the room also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Suma K wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: The staff at Riad Les Trois Mages and in particular Aziz the manager really know what it takes to make guests feel welcome and at home. We had a delightful 5 days in Marrakech thanks to the attention and professionalism of the staff We felt each evening that we were coming back to a beautiful and restful home. Aziz was very helpful with maps and directions for getting around Marrakech and the arrangements he made for our day in the countryside and for the pickup and drop off were efficient and well planned. We felt truly taken care of including with a last- minute dinner on a night when we were just too exhausted to go out. Thank you Aziz ! That was a life-saver! And the food at the Riad is truly wonderful!.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susan W wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Manager Aziz is the reason to stay at Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: Les Trois Mages is a wonderful intimate Riad in the northern section of the Medina. It is a little hard to find but the manager Aziz will help you find it. If you are arriving from the airport I would recommend that Aziz arrange a taxi for you. All of the five rooms are Moroccan themed and very comfortable with bathrooms that I thought were wonderfully decorated. The aromas coming from the kitchen will make you want to stay for dinner one night as we did and it was one of the best meals we had in Marrakesh. Aziz is a sophisticated and knowledge guide and will answer any questions you might have and give you very good recommendations for sights and restaurants. And to top it off the Riad has a wonderful rooftop garden and pool
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Janine K wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for 4 nights and absolutely loved our stay! The staff is definitely the best thing about this Riad and are so helpful and willing to go beyond to ensure you are comfortable satisfied and answer every question you may have. I cannot say enough about Aziz and the rest of the staff. The cooks are also amazing and one of my favorite meals during my entire trip to Morocco was the lunch they prepared for us. Breakfast is amazing as well and always prepared so beautifully either on the terrace or downstairs. The location is perfect as well right inside old Marrakesh walls so easy walk to the medina and souks and down to Jemma el Fnaa square. Place seems a bit small at first but is actually perfect and I would go back in a heartbeat!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Frances M wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We had the loveliest stay here for a pre-baby get away when I was six months pregnant. The staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The pool on the roof was so warm and inviting and breakfast in the court yard every day was just wonderful.    The gorgeous flowers on my birthday was a particular highlight!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Area: perfect quiet centrally located.  Staff: courteous professional gracefully accommodating.  Room: comfy firm bed silent very dark at night - so a great sleep.  Roof: sunny and lovely with a cute pool.  Would recommend and return again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Theresa H wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful and relaxing place to stay
Review_Text: We stayed here for five nights in total. The riad was the perfect antidote to busy days walking around Marrakech or doing excursions to the Sahara - as soon as you step through the door you will feel relaxed and at home. The bedrooms lounges and rooftop terrace are all beautifully designed in a contemporary Morrocan style. Even if they were fully booked you would still have plenty of space to yourself. Things like hot water & air conditioning all worked well and it's in a great location (about 20 minute walk to the souks area felt safe).    Breakfast was delicious - fresh fruit pancakes and pastries - and we also had a great dinner there one evening. The staff are very welcoming and always on hand to provide advice. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff was amazing here. I was a couple of streets away called the riad and Aziz came out to meet me to take me to the riad. I was offered non-alcoholic beverages and cookies upon my arrival. Aziz gave me a lot of great places to try around the area.    I was there for only a short time because my flight was early in the morning. They served me breakfast at 6:30am and called me a car to take me to the airport. Everyone I met was very pleasant and helpful!    However the physical space itself seemed like it could use some work. My bath tub didn't drain very well and it was leaking on the bottom so water got all over the bathroom floor. When I reached for the bottle of shampoo there were some long curly hair strands stuck to the space between the cap and the bottle.    If you stay here you might also consider ear plugs. The walls are thin and you can hear everything outside of your room including prayer calls (there is a minaret close by) people walking downstairs (as the riad has an open courtyard like others) people talking in the room next to yours.    The room temperature is comfortable but there's also air conditioning if necessary. A safe box is provided though the riad only allows in its customers and your things will be safe with the staff. Bedding was extremely comfortable!    Overall a very decent stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: most amazing stay with the most accommodating staff
Review_Text: Could not have picked a better Riad. Close to the Souks and restaurants. Aziz was incredibly accommodating helpful and genuine. Had breakfast waiting for us every am and arranged car services for us. The lunch and rooftop pool were an added bonus. Would stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gordian F wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Staying at riad les trois mages really made our stay in Marrakech so much more enjoyable. Aziz and his team went beyond everything to help and advice us. From delicious home cook meals and beautifully decorated rooms to useful advise and info on sights and attractions we really were cared for exceptionally.  The central location makes it easy to explore the city and relax at the tool top pool when it gets too hot over noon.  The riad certainly ranks amongst the best of our hotel experiences!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have visited Marrakech before and our return was even better. Les Trois Mages is a superb riad the rooms and amenities wonderful and you are encouraged to feel at home and treat the property as your home during your stay. However it is the staff who are the real stars. Mousin and the ladies are quite wonderful people who looked after us magnificently. Quite honestly I could run out of superlatives suffice to say I would recommend this riad wholeheartedly - I would prefer to keep it secret but...    Ali - Northamptonshire
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katrina F wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Title: Oasis in the heart of the red city
Review_Text: -lovely quiet Riad with pool and we were welcomed with tea and cookies.  - the air conditioning and pool were welcome reprieve from the August heat.  - water was always available Aziz made us feel at home with the daily offer of tea and coffee. Breakfast was delicious.  - Manager Aziz gave us wonderful support information and was very accommodating. He made our stay that much better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I like Marrakesh. I believe it is one of those cities where you will never be bored. We have been there but decided to go again to admire the endless beds of roses have a go to souks enjoy Arabic cuisine and catch up with the news. We were not disappointed! We decided to stay in the Riad Les Trois Mages because we loved the location and the place last time. I have to admit that the level of service was as good as ever!!! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Courtney S wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad for my first week in Marrakech as a solo traveller visiting Morocco for the first time. From the moment I arrived at the airport I was so well looked after and made to feel at home. I had a fantastic driver who delivered me to the Riad where on arrival the night manager was waiting at the door ready to greet me. The staff here Aziz Mouhsin and Leila are the most wonderful and helpful people who go out of their way to make you feel welcome and help you with anything you may need. I can honestly say I have never had such attentive and kind service in any of my travels. Nothing is too much for these guys. On top of that there is an endless amount delicious coffee beautiful mint tea and cold water on offer at any time.  The Riad itself is beautiful the photos don't do justice. Very authentic Moroccan style with modern twists such as amazing air conditioning units in every room. Very clean and well kept. Great location too with just a ten minute walk to the big square souks and many other attractions.  Thank you so much for having me and I will most definitely be back. Can't say what an amazing experience I had!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Fin Mc wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: A superb riad, exactly where you would want to be!
Review_Text: Our third time in Marrakech saw us chose our favourite riad yet Les Trois Mages. Fantastically situated about five minutes walk from the north end of the souks and with the most friendly and helpful staff of Aziz Mouhsin and the ladies. A very restful beautiful place in a really quiet location despite being so central. Food was fantastic and the restaurants recommended in the hotel welcome pack were all bang on. Recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my second visit to Les Trois Mages for a week of total relaxation and calm. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The food in the Riad was delightful.  The Riad is very well situated being just a short walk to the main sights and attractions  My favorite part was relaxing by the rooftop pool with a good book and a nice glass of wine.  Exceptional!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Head & shoulders above any other hotel we have ever stayed at.
Review_Text: We recently spent 5 nights at Les Trois Mages as a group of 6 to celebrate a friend's birthday. Aziz and his team treated us like members of their family providing exceptional service throughout. The riad is spotlessly clean and every room was unique and beautifully decorated.Wifi access was fantastic even on the terrace by the pool and we will definitely be returning again. I would advise having at least 1 meal in the riad as the food was amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Martha F wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: I booked the riad for my 50th birthday and couldn't have been more spoilt. Aziz and the team made our long weekend truly special and the riad was lovely. Every room was lovely and a birthday upgrade to the suite was even more of a treat.  The rooftop pool and whole roof are even nicer than the photos suggest and the location was wonderful. We ate one night and evey breakfast at the riad and the food was delicious too. thanks for a lovely stay. We'll be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a lovely time at this beautiful riad which is a very comfortable walking distance from all the main sights but in a quiet corner of the city. Aziz and the other staff were exceptional kind and genuine making us feel at home and welcome in Marrakech. As we visited at a very quiet time of year (in July just before Eid) the Riad was quiet and we were upgraded for free to the Bahia room which was beautiful! Amazing Moroccan breakfast every morning on the roof terrace exploring the city in the afternoon followed by cooling off in the roof top pool before heading out again for dinner is an excellent way to spend time in Marrakech. I would definitely recommend this Riad to family and friends and would love to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic riad right in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at Les trois Mages for 3 nights. The staff was amazing they attended every single one of our needs and made us feel so welcome with their personal little touches. The en suite bedroom was very tastefully decorated in the Moroccan style and was spotless. We are going to recommend it to all of our friends. We will definitely be back for this very special "away from home" home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful riad tranquil and nice rooms. I felt safe here and the riad had many lounges you could relax in the pool in the ceiling was also lovely but all the towels on the lounge chairs appeared to be stained and there were cockroaches in my room and the night guard was not too sympathetic although he did assist me in removing them. I accept that in a hot african country you'll encounter cockroaches but this was the first and only time I did in a two week holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Kristy D wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Fabulous tranquility in a busy, exciting city!
Review_Text: We hired the whole riad and stayed in the Arabesque room. Considering ours was one of the lowest priced rooms it was perfect.    The riad staff were incredibly helpful and made our stay so relaxing.    After mornings exploring the souks and market square we would head back to the riad to relax on the rooftop terrace and in the pool.    It was so lovely and I have recommended it to everyone I know!    Thank you everyone at Riad Les Trois Mages!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect base for a long weekend
Review_Text: I really cannot fault the Riad Les Trois Mages. Our party had 5 of the 6 rooms available and so I can say that they are all lovely. Comfortable beds wooden shutters to block the light. I slept better there than I do at home! The roof terrace and pool were beautiful difficult to leave. The pool was shallow but much bigger than I had imagined. The food was delicious and excellent value. The staff attentive and friendly. I don't think I have ever felt better looked after. This trip was with friends to celebrate a birthday but I would definitely return with my family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My stay was perfect from the moment I arrived! The staff was very friendly the food was amazing the Riad was clean and beautiful and they were kind enough to help me with booking all my tours! Perfect location for shopping sight seeing and walking to restaurants. I highly recommend staying here and will book again if I return to Marrakech ;)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Louise K wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Myself and two friends loved staying at Riad Les Trois Mages! The room was beautiful and we loved the rooftop terrace and pool. Aziz the manager took good care of us and ensured we had everything we needed to make a stay a pleasant one. I would stay again next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Phil C wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Great location superb hospitality and excellent facilities  A perfect Riad close to sights and markets from which to explore old town  The staff were very attentive and friendly and went out of their way to make us all feel at home.  Pool and chill out zone on roof terrace were great additions  thoroughly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The team headed up by Aziz made our experience relaxing friendly .  Food was typical Moroccan. Room. The staff went out of their way to ensure we were made to feel comfortable and looked after. Aziz helped plan site seeing trips around the city. I would look forward to returning again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a few days in Marrakech and staying at Les Trois Mages made our holiday really special as the place is lovely and the staff are wonderful.    We stayed in two different rooms and I really recommend staying in the Bahia suite even for a night as it is stunning.    Aziz and the ladies made us feel very spoilt they are so kind and helpful. Breakfast was very good we also had dinner and lunch once. The couscous and the chicken skewers were excellent.    The best thing about the riad was the rooftop terrace and the plunge pool. I don't know where the other guests were but we never had to share the terrace and pool with anyone else! I would definitely recommend a riad with a rooftop pool as opposed to a pool downstairs in the courtyard like in a lot of other riads. It can get quite 'cold' downstairs and it is in the shade.    Location is good but you are not as central as other riads which are closer to the attractions. However we walked nearly everywhere so it isn't that far.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location in the Medina with very straightforward access to all the sites/the souks. Food (both breakfast and dinner) was excellent and the service from Aziz (the manager)/all the other staff was friendly and very helpful. Roof terrace with a pool an added bonus!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ricardo W wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: I stayed here this past summer and it was simply amazing. The caring staff really made it feel like home. They even did our laundry for us free of charge. The breakfast was always an experience. At night do yourself a favor and go up t the roof and enjoy the view.  10/10 would go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 2 nights (9 & 10 May 2016) in this beautiful Riad. Every room is so beautiful and unique. We are the only guests during our stay the manager Aziz offers me and my friend to one room each although we didn't accept his great offer but we really appreciate his thoughts. Aziz and his team are so helpful brought us to the good restaurant for dinner and spa for hammam..    I would highly recommend this beautiful Riad if you're staying in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A group of us have recently returned from this blissful retreat in the heart of the bustling Medina in Marrakesh. The Riad is a perfect oasis to unwind in having several areas to do so including a piano room and the rooftop pool. The bedrooms were decorated lavishly in a Moroccan style which I think you may miss if staying in a Hotel however we definitely felt that we had all the luxuries and comforts of a five star hotel.    The staff deserve the most recognition. We were humbled how kind they all were from Aziz who took care of all our needs to the cooks who ensured we got what we wanted when we wanted and where we wanted (we ate on the roof several times).    Thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Les Trois Mages for providing a much needed relaxing and welcoming break.    Some of our favourite places were Pepe Nero (scrumptious Italian food (Prawn risotto aubergine ravioli and apple tart)) Lotus Bar for drinks and entertainment and The Heritage for a wonderful spa day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: The best Riad in all of Marrakech!
Review_Text: I urge people to stay at this wonderful Riad.  Everything contributes to such a wonderful stay here - the room the location the rooftop pool the breakfast the staff and first and foremost - Aziz.  We stayed here for just a night but were lucky enough to have two full days at this Riad.  From the moment we arrived off the plane and were collected from the airport we fell in love with it.  Upon arriving at Les Trois Mages my boyfriend and I were presented with the most wonderful breakfast - such a huge selection of pastries pancakes eggs typically morrocan sweets fresh orange juice and probably the best mint tea I had during my week long stay in Morocco. (we were only staying one night so really weren't owed an additional breakfast!)  Aziz is a truly wonderful host. He gave us lots of really great tips and advice and knew exactly where was worth a visit.  The location of the Riad is perfect be it on foot or taxi its really easy to find (once you've got the hang of it!) Its walking distance to some wonderful sites including Les Jardins Majorelle.    The breakfast the following day on the roof was absolutely perfect the roof terrace is decorated so nicely - I can not describe how kind and accommodating the staff are.  The room itsself the bathroom and the decorations of the place is just so special with every detail accounted for. ( I think we were in Saffron - again it's worth asking for a room on the first floor that leads onto the balcony rather than the terrace itself)    An example of their kindness is that after doing a bit of travelling around we were back in Marrakech and sadly couldn't afford to stay here again but emailed them to see if we could pay to use the pool (which is absolutely gorgeous!!! - pictures don't do it justice at all) buy drinks & food as it was so hot. baring in mind we were no longer paying guests at this Riad I got a rapid response that that would be no problem - we should just pay for drinks etc. After spending an afternoon there in the 38 degree heat and having lovely tea & cake! brought up to us they generously declined any payment - just an example of their hospitality and kindness at this Riad.    All in all I know there are millions of Riads in Marrakech but stop deliberating and book this one. Its really worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This can't be beaten as a place to stay right within the walls of the Medina in Marrakech. The staff are the best we have had in any hotel in the world always there when you need them but never intrusive. The food is first class and their is always plenty of it. Manager Aziz. will ensure you make the most of your stay by giving you local knowledge or organising trips. massages places to visit etc etc. The riad benefits by being small and beats a big impersonal hotel by miles.Breakfast on the roof in the Moroccan sunshine is the perfect start to any day! Top notch!. Mike and Sarah
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kerry W wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: WONDERFUL STAY IN RIAD LES TROIS MAGES
Review_Text: We were recommended this Riad by a colleague and when we recently stayed here in Marrakech we were certainly not disappointed! From the moment I contacted them to book the service was professional and informative. Aziz and his team ensured that all our requirements were met to utilise our time in Marrakech. From organising airport pick ups to organising trips out of Marrakech with reputable companies as well as organising lunch and dinners in the Riad. Nothing was too much they catered for every need which was appreciated when your time is limited and you want to get things organised efficiently. The Riad evokes calm yet warm with the friendliness of the wonderful staff. The rooftop pool and seating area is perfect to chillout after a busy trip or shopping in the souks. The Riad is good for access to the souks and old medina and should you want to venture further Aziz and his team are only too willing to help inform and advise you of the best options available. I highly recommend this place the food we ate there was outstanding and cooked with love and care. It was a peaceful and relaxing stay - an oasis of calm inside the bustle of Marrakech. First visit to the city and wont be the last!! Love Love Love this place. Thank you RIad Les Trois Mages for making this trip so wonderful. K.Walsh 26.5.16
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I recently stayed in Les Trois Mages for 3 nights with friends. It was our first visit to the city and it certainly won't be our last. Aziz ands his team couldn't have made us more welcome. The rooms were gorgeous the ambience sublime and the food amazing. The riad is very central and just a short walk to the souks and main square. All in all a fabulous stay and I'd highly recommend the riad to anyone planning a trip to Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The team headed up by Aziz made our experience relaxing friendly .  Food was typical Moroccan. Room. The staff went out of their way to ensure we were made to feel comfortable and looked after. Aziz helped plan site seeing trips around the city. I would look forward to returning again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a few days in Marrakech and staying at Les Trois Mages made our holiday really special as the place is lovely and the staff are wonderful.    We stayed in two different rooms and I really recommend staying in the Bahia suite even for a night as it is stunning.    Aziz and the ladies made us feel very spoilt they are so kind and helpful. Breakfast was very good we also had dinner and lunch once. The couscous and the chicken skewers were excellent.    The best thing about the riad was the rooftop terrace and the plunge pool. I don't know where the other guests were but we never had to share the terrace and pool with anyone else! I would definitely recommend a riad with a rooftop pool as opposed to a pool downstairs in the courtyard like in a lot of other riads. It can get quite 'cold' downstairs and it is in the shade.    Location is good but you are not as central as other riads which are closer to the attractions. However we walked nearly everywhere so it isn't that far.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location in the Medina with very straightforward access to all the sites/the souks. Food (both breakfast and dinner) was excellent and the service from Aziz (the manager)/all the other staff was friendly and very helpful. Roof terrace with a pool an added bonus!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ricardo W wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: I stayed here this past summer and it was simply amazing. The caring staff really made it feel like home. They even did our laundry for us free of charge. The breakfast was always an experience. At night do yourself a favor and go up t the roof and enjoy the view.  10/10 would go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 2 nights (9 & 10 May 2016) in this beautiful Riad. Every room is so beautiful and unique. We are the only guests during our stay the manager Aziz offers me and my friend to one room each although we didn't accept his great offer but we really appreciate his thoughts. Aziz and his team are so helpful brought us to the good restaurant for dinner and spa for hammam..    I would highly recommend this beautiful Riad if you're staying in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A group of us have recently returned from this blissful retreat in the heart of the bustling Medina in Marrakesh. The Riad is a perfect oasis to unwind in having several areas to do so including a piano room and the rooftop pool. The bedrooms were decorated lavishly in a Moroccan style which I think you may miss if staying in a Hotel however we definitely felt that we had all the luxuries and comforts of a five star hotel.    The staff deserve the most recognition. We were humbled how kind they all were from Aziz who took care of all our needs to the cooks who ensured we got what we wanted when we wanted and where we wanted (we ate on the roof several times).    Thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Les Trois Mages for providing a much needed relaxing and welcoming break.    Some of our favourite places were Pepe Nero (scrumptious Italian food (Prawn risotto aubergine ravioli and apple tart)) Lotus Bar for drinks and entertainment and The Heritage for a wonderful spa day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: The best Riad in all of Marrakech!

Everything contributes to such a wonderful stay here - the room the location the rooftop pool the breakfast the staff and first and foremost - Aziz.
