Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Waqaas R wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Recently we have spent two nights in this Riad and I can say that although it is a bit pricy the Riad is really wonderful and offers a great service. The Manager Aziz is very helpful engaging and taking care of all your individual needs. Breakfast was very nice and tasty with a variety of options.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely Riad. Staff all from management to kitchen staff all so helpful. Heard stories about Marrakech not being safe for girls but we had a fab time and felt safe at all times. Hospitality at the Riad is fantastic from food to our security. Hoping to go again. I would recommend the Riad any time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karen P wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Just got back from another wonderful stay at this gorgeous traditional riad. The welcome you receive is second to none. Though my flight was late in I was still served breakfast on arrival and when I was shown to my room it was everything and more. I had not stayed in the Bahia Suite before but it was lovely to be able to have an early morning drink sitting on my sofa reading or relaxing in the afternoon out of the heat but still with the sunlight streaming in. As usual there were fresh flowers and I even had my own little fridge for water or whatever in my case some special milk for my protein drinks. The food was a good as ever and the manager and his staff do everything to make sure your stay is the best it can be. See you soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: annelies t wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We loved out stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. The staff were delightful and couldn't do more to help us out. We were travelling with 9 year olds and were worried about them being in a room that wasn't interconnecting but it was totally fine we all felt very safe staying there. A great position nice and quiet and lovely hosts. we would highly recommend it and would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Parul G wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: I cannot recommend this place highly enough. I absolutely loved our stay here. We stayed at the Bahia Suit and it was one of the most beautiful hotel rooms I have ever stayed in.  The service at this Riad is really top class. Everyone was very welcoming and helpful. Aziz gave us great guidance about places to see in Marrakech and restaurants to try. The kitchen staff was flexible to our requests for specific breakfast items. The food itself was awesome. We had breakfast on the terrace the two days we stayed there. Their mint tea was the best!  They made our stay so comfortable and memorable. if I ever find myself in Marrakech again I would love to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah Elisabeth wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Best place we have ever stayed
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at Les trois mages this Easter and it was hands down the best establishment we have had the pleasure of staying in. We had had to extend our stay due to changing flights and whilst our original room was not available for the extra night the changeover was made effortless. The food is wonderful- we had the lamb tangia at 10pm on our arrival- the portion was generous and it was delicious. Breakfast every day was equally good- a choice of eggs a variety of breads and pastries and fantastic local jams and honeys. We stayed in the bahia suite and it was beautifully furnished (like the whole riad!)  The roof terrace is a wonderful place to relax after a day in the souks plus (we've since learnt unusually for Marrakesh) the plunge pool is heated and catches the afternoon sun. The riad is full of nooks and crannies to read or relax in and as it only has 6 rooms never feels full.  Aziz the host is what made our stay so wonderful! He is a fount of local knowlegde- booking us a exquisite couples hammam and massage at another riad- it was incredibly affordable compared to others we saw advertised and amazingly relaxing.he was always on hand to give directions suggest running routes make recommendations order in bottles of wine or just have a chat. He put all our fears on our first visit to Morocco to rest and we had an unforgettable time! We're already planning our next trip to Les Trois Mages and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful riad in a great location
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages for five nights. We had an absolutely fantastic time staying in the Bahia Suite. The room was lovely with a fireplace for chilly evenings and a really comfy bed. The service in the riad was second-to-none Aziz is a wonderful host and his team are absolutely lovely and friendly as well. Breakfast was really good every day and was served to us on the roof terrace as the weather was perfect for this. We had dinner in the riad on our first night and the food was delicious and plentiful. It also happened to be my birthday during our stay and I was treated to a wonderful homemade cake as well as flowers and a card. The rooftop was great for lounging on a warm afternoon and the plunge pool perfect for a dip to cool down and relax in. We got some great advice about where to go in Marrakech from Aziz and had a really nice time at a hammam close by followed by a massage. The riad is a lovely calm oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of Marrakech a wonderful place to relax after some sightseeing or wandering around in the souks. It's about a 15 minute walk to the main square and to the Majorelle Gardens. Highly recommend this riad I would definitely stay again. A massive thank you to Aziz and his team for making our stay so enjoyable and memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A relaxing and beautiful place to stay
Review_Text: Our recent visit to Les Trois Mages for a second Easter break in a row was as superb as the first time. The staff are extremely attentive and could not make you feel more welcome safe and looked after. The rooftop terrace is a beautiful spot to relax after a walk around the local souks and you certainly feel away from the hustle and bustle. I would not want to stay anywhere else other than this riad on a future trip to Marrakech as it is simply perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great riad with helpful and attentive concierge service and rooftop plunge pool
Review_Text: Quiet beautifully decorated riad with 6 rooms and a central courtyard. Well place plunge pool on rooftop with many sun loungers and shaded areas to relax. We enjoyed traditional moroccan dinner and lunch made by in-house chef who aims to please. Our included breakfast of fresh fruit pastries yoghurt and bread made an easy start to each day. The manager Aziz is professional and thoughtful with his suggestions of activities (guided food tour through town spa hammam recommendations) and logistics (transfers) prior to our arrival and during our 3 night stay. Trois Mages was generous in allowing us to us our rooms for a late 7:45pm checkout for our very late flight for no extra fee.  Our teens the most critical of clientele loved this riad. If we had little children staying on the lower floor may be most convenient to avoid navigating the tile stairs. Strong wifi throughout the riad was a plus. Each room had heaters and electric blankets if needed. There are numerous British outlets and a few US adapters in our room. We found our first floor room and our teens main floor rooms comfortable and beautifully decorated.    We wish we would have exchanged minimal money at airport and waited for riad information about exchange bureaus around town with far better rates. The riad will take final payment for a far better rate (xe.com) using a number of currencies and a credit card. Dirham is best for shopping in souks. The location provides easy access to out of town activities like Berber village/two valley tour cooking class and souk access. Though it is a 15-20 min walk to Jemma al Fnaa there are many food craft shopping and spa hammams near Trois Mages. We found it most convenient and comfortable to eat dinner at the riad and wander the many areas of Marrakech during the day that way we were back at the riad at night. We never felt in danger as many tourists and locals are out at night but the meals were delicious and we could try many local dishes in the riad. The food was abundant and well prepared. We like the couscous the best compared to other couscous dishes we tried in Marrakech.    Trois Mages location incredibly helpful and attentive manager Azia made our stay relaxing and peaceful provided thoughtful logistic recommendations strong wifi throughout riad comfortable in own room and in the many alcoves quality toiletries and bathrobes for each occupant at a great value. We will stay here again for our next visit to Marrakech. This staff works to provide very good personalized customer service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had a wonderful 5-night stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. The Riad is a real oasis of calm after the hustle and bustle of the medina.    The staff could not have been more accommodating and we very much enjoyed those sumptuous breakfasts on the roof terrace!    We had a lovely meal at the Riad on the first night and would definitely recommend the dinners to other guests.    Thanks for making our stay extra special.    Juliette and friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sarah J. B wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: We loved our stay at Trois Mages. Aziz the manager was incredibly helpful before and during and after our stay always responding to emails promptly and always helpful.  The Riad is immaculate and beautifully maintained. Nothing is too much trouble the staff charming and the food is delicious and very generous. It really is an all weather Riad we had extremes of weather during our four days: from loungeing and swimming on the roof to sitting by the log fire with our electric blankets primed. They really have thought of everything!! It is also very conveniently situated in a v quiet back street within easy walk of the Jardin Majorelle or the Souk and main square. Defo want to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Moa K wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: We stayed 4 days at Les Trois Mages and enjoyed every minute of it. Staff location facilities and food - everything was fantastic and we would love to come back again some time. We stayed in the Arabesque room wich was beautiful and very comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wade K wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Stayed as a family (with 1 year old) in Bahai Suite. (Fireplace bed bathroom👌🏽)  - Authentic tranquil beautiful Riad  - Outstanding outstanding service  - Sensational food (lamb tagine🤘🏼)  - Cool 10/15min stroll to town square  Can't recommend highly enough for an authentic Moroccan stay.  Stay here 100%
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Gary J wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: Superb oasis in the heart of this exotic city
Review_Text: Great location and walking distance to anything that matters    Lovely staff - Aziz has helped us experience trekking in the Atlas Mountains  city walking tours restaurant and nightclub visits and even pizza one night delivered in the riad! #epicHost!    Authentic feel - the rooms are amazing.    We have been back twice now and have enjoyed our visit immensely.    Breakfasts are incredible...  We have organised a delish dinner within the Riad on both occasions and highly recommended    Basically book the place! Better still - get a group of mates along and have the entire Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We visited this Riad two years ago and vowed to return we were not disappointed. Aziz and his staff are expectional. We were a large group and hired the whole riad we were not the easiest group I am sure but we were treated like royalty nothing was too much! Aziz planned lots of trip and meals for us with transportation. I would advise anyone staying here to take advantage of the cooks we had a wonderful meal on our last night with entertainment it was fantastic. The breakfast is lovely with fresh fruit yoghurt pancakes pain au chocolat fresh eggs cooked however you wish fresh fruit juice. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend anyone staying here when visiting Marrakech. A HUGE thank you again to Aziz and all the staff here you are a credit to your industry.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful haven in the city and great staff
Review_Text: Loved our weekend here to celebrate a friends birthday. The staff are so lovely and really could not do enough for us. Great to be able to relax in such a comfortable space after exploring the city. Great wifi and food and the pool is heated. Will definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We just spent 5 nights here with our 2 year old and the staff could not have been more welcoming and accommodating (which is not always the case with a fractious toddler in tow!) we stayed in the Bahia suite which was gorgeous and spacious even with the extra cot. The location is perfect and the food was delicious - we ate there every night and it was like having a fresh home cooked meal at the end of a busy day. Aziz was an absolute delight from the word go any worries we may have had in navigating Marrakesh with a toddler disappeared with his assistance he even organised our itinerary and we spent a lovely day in the Atlas Mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I recently went on a girls weekend away in Feb 2016 and we stayed at the lovely Riad Les Trois Mages. The location was excellent to get a real feel for the culture and bustling markets of Marrakech. The Riad was clean spacious and very authentic but mostly importantly Aziz (riad manager) and his team (Nazia and Laila) were the perfect hosts and could not do enough for us. The evening meal which we booked in advance was delicious and the daily breakfast provided was plentiful enough so set us up for the day. We requested a last minute BBQ on one of the afternoons and they were more than happy to cater for the 7 of us. As we were the only ones staying in the riad at the time we were able to choose where we wanted to have our meals on the terrace by the pool or in the dining area.  The rooms were all en suite and the maids were attentive to our requests including putting the log fires on when it was a little cold in the evening.  Overall and excellent stay and I would definitely recommend Riad Les Trois Mages for a place to stay in Marrakech.

We were a group of 7 girls spending 4 days in Marrakech for a hen weekend. At first we were slightly apprehensive regarding the destination as people say it's unsafe for girls. This is not the case at all. The riad is located in the old town and is managed by a gentlemen called Aziz he and his team could not have been more helpful to us. Our itinerary was planned before we left the UK on arrival to the riad Aziz spent the time to go through each day with us advising where we should go and what to be aware of. The cook Sayeeda made us a lovely breakfast each morning one of the days Sayeeda cooked us a trafional Moroccan meal which was delicious. We also had Sayeeda prepare us lunch BBQ chicken skewers with salad. That too was very tasty.  The taxi company was brilliant this was arranged by Aziz the drivers were very polite English speaking with up to date cars. Club 555 is defo a place to go look on their Facebook page to see what offers they have we went on a Friday night which happened to be ladies night which meant ladies get free entrance and free alcohol all night drinks included were whiskey or vodka. All in all we had a brilliant time and I don't think this would have been achieved if we did not stay where we did and from the hospitality from Aziz and his team. He really is a credit to the Riad owners.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed here over new year 2015 so sorry for the late review! My finance proposed to me here and organised a private dinner on new years eve at the Riad. They made everything so special and we can't thank the Riad enough. The place is beautiful and every day when you come back from the craziness of Marrakech they make you feel at home with a cozy log fire and lots of mint tea.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our third visit to Les Trois Mages. As always good food and attentive and courteous staff. Aziz is a treasure. Whilst we did not need lots of guidance I overheard him introducing another couple to the delights of Marrakech and I was very impressed. From arranging taxis to booking dinner reservations he was excellent. A great place to unwind and relax. Will we be back? We certainly will.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Outstanding hospitality in a tranquil Riad
Review_Text: Having read the reviews of Riad Les Trois Mages my friend and I were optimistic about our accommodation but felt that it had to be seen to believed. We were not disappointed.    We received a generous welcome from the start: Aziz greeted us warmly at the door and we were immediately served complimentary mint tea (this is available throughout your stay. We were then given a map recommendations of where to visit eat and drink and made to feel at home. Aziz then left us to our own devices but made himself available throughout the trip and was more than happy to offer advice on the city.    The building itself is an oasis of calm a short walk from the Souqs and the main square beyond. There are six bedrooms on two floors around a central courtyard and three sheltered spaces on the first and second floors with chaises longues and sofas. One room has an electronic baby grand piano (complete with Real Book) and another has a fire (lit on request) a range of guide books and a scrabble set.    There is a also a roof terrace with comfortable seating a sheltered area and a small pool. This is a great spot to have your breakfast (fresh fruit and yoghurt pancakes eggs cooked to order bread rolls croissants freshly-squeezed orange juice mint tea coffee) if you are blessed with warm weather.    Having eaten in various places across the city during our trip we didn’t find better food than the delicious home-cooked fare served at the Riad itself. This needs to be ordered in advance - as well as requests for wine or beer.    This place can’t be recommended highly enough.

I can not recommend this riad highly enough it is a little gem in the Medina!! We booked it on the back of reviews on trip advisor and it certainly lived up to the reviews. Aziz was soooooo helpful even before we arrived in Marrakech arranging transfers from the airport a guided tour of the medina and a private hamman experience for our stay.    Food in the riad is excellent we ate in on our first night and the food was delicious. Breakfast each morning was continental style and plentiful kept us going all morning! We stayed in the Bahia suite as we needed an extra bed and the room was fantastic all toiletries and bathrobes provided and English tea on demand!    The location is great it only takes 5 minutes and you are into the bustle of the medina 10 minutes and you are in the main square. I would recommend booking a guided tour on your first morning to orientate and acclimatise yourself Abdullah our guide was very informative and took us to back streets we would never have found ourselves. We went to heritage spa for our hamman experience which I would also recommendcafe arabe in the evening for cocktails.    It has been a great 3 days away thank you to Aziz and his team for being so helpful and welcoming. If you are thinking of coming to Marrakech you must book this riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Judith J wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: A haven of peace and quiet - and great staff!
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech and Les Trois Mages was the perfect place to stay. Well located so that it’s only about five minutes walk from where your taxi can drop it’s a haven of peace and quiet. The rooms are tastefully decorated airy and spacious around a lovely central courtyard. We ate in three of our four nights stay simply because the food was of such a high standard and in such a generous quantities. Breakfast too was copious and taken on the pretty terrace. It was lovely to come back from the noise of the souks to take a dip in the pool on the roof. But the most important thing about Les Trois Mages are the great staff including Aziz the ever-helpful manager and Saida the wonderful cook. Warmly recommended – it would be difficult to find a better riad in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Jane W wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: The best way to see Marrakech
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed at Les Trois Mages for three nights recently and had a wonderful time. Everything has been said in the previous reviews - the room breakfasts service atmosphere and staff were just brilliant. We had dinner at the riad on our first night which was extremely good and easily the best meal of our stay. (The only problem was that there was too much of it!) It is a very short walk to the souks and the main square but once the front door is closed the riad is really quiet and relaxing (strangely even on the rooftop!) We did the whole day tour in the Atlas mountains which is highly recommended. Thanks so much to Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila for their care and hospitality and especially to Aziz who made sure we had the best time and made us feel so welcome. We will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Robert F wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: My friend Tash and I enjoyed a three night stay at Les Trois Mages and had a fantastic time. I was returning for the second time and somehow our stay was even better than the first time which was a 5* experience as well. The room was beautifully decorated comfy and clean; the service friendly warm and informative; the food and drink both delicious. Can't recommend highly enough and will be back again soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here for one night after transferring from another riad in the city. Phenomenal service ambiance room and food. We stayed in the Bahia suite which was gorgeous. Traditional Moroccan decor throughout and rooftop pool area for lounging were perks. We opted to have dinner at the riad which ended up being one of the best meals we had in Morocco (chicken pastilla). Aziz was wonderful and made us feel truly cared for during our stay. Hospitality and a beautiful riad made this a truly memorable stay at Les Trois Mages. Would definitely recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John M wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: The Excellent Riad Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: Partner and I stayed here over the New Year; it is a really excellent place to stay.  All of the staff were very attentive and friendly; our room was extremely clean comfortable and quiet; the breakfasts (and suprisingly the evening meals) were substantial restaurant quality and very tasty.  We went on the half day guided tour of Marrakech and the day long Berber trail - would highly recommend both (with good foot wear for the Berber trail).  Treat yourself come to Marrakech and definitely stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Neil M wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: A calming oasis in the Medina
Review_Text: I can't recommend this riad highly enough. The staff and manager without exception are supremely helpful and polite nothing was to much trouble. We emailed in advance and Aziz the manager sent us details of their menu and the tours they can organise so we were able to have everything planned before we got there and spend our holiday time relaxing and having fun rather than figuring out what to do. We can recommend the half day guided tour to get orientated and the full day Berber trail (wear shoes with a decent grip if you're going anywhere near a waterfall).    Also treat yourself to dinner in the riad one night... the food is fab! ...skip lunch as there's plenty of it. :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Natalie C wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we felt extremely welcome at Riad Les Trois Mages. Our room was comfortable and the riad was very clean; it had everything we needed. Aziz the manager was a marvellous host always offering tea when we arrived back at the riad after an outing and answering our many questions. We had a tasty breakfast every morning on the terrace and on our first night we enjoyed an evening meal at the riad which was really lovely. The portions generous. They lit the log fire in the dining area in the evening to make it even more special. We would highly recommend this riad. The staff at the riad could not have done any more for us - they were marvellous. The location of the riad was also perfect. Highly recommend. Aziz you are amazing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad is in a nice quiet alley in the medina. The roof is very nice with also a very cozy courtyard. We stayed in the Bahia suite and the Arabesque suite. Its certainly worth getting the larger suite as it has a sitting area and a fireplace. Both rooms had great bathrooms.    Aziz - who manages the Riad is extremely helpful and provided us with flexibility and options as well as making sure that our every need was met this is a symptom of the culture at the Riad as the rest of the staff is equally eager to make your stay comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just got back from a great New Years break in Marrakesh. Read Les Trois Majes was a great choice for us. Good location and friendly informative information from Aziz the Riad Manager before we arrived. The riad's decor is soft and inviting. The staff were so friendly an helpful. Food was wonderful especially the evening meal in a romantic setting.    We really enjoyed our stay and are happy to recommend to our friends in the future. Thank you for a very enjoyable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Josh L wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We spent part of our Christmas break with 3 generations of the family - 10 adults and 6 kids from 10 months to 7 years. Aziz and the whole staff were amazing making us feel so welcome comfortable and well-looked after. It was my life partner's birthday while we were there and they kindly provided cake and flowers to make the day special. Everybody at the Trois Mages were so lovely to the kids too. It made for a perfect family stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Susie W wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: 5* Customer service but wouldn't go back.
Review_Text: We stayed three nights during November 2015. The Riad is situated down a little back street a little off the beaten track-always a relief to get back to after the hustle and bustle of the main streets it's about 15-20 minute walk (moped dodge) to the square. The staff were very pleasant and super helpful sometimes a little too attentive- when you arrive after a 3 hour car journey it is a tad difficult to focus on a map of the town (and it's quite a complicated town) when you haven't even seen your room. -this said if we hadn't had the tour of The Map we would've been well and truly lost within minutes.    We were disappointed to find that although we arrived at 1o'clock in the afternoon this was already too late to be able to reserve any kind of evening meal so had to go out and fend for ourselves in a strange and difficult city. We booked an evening meal for the following night which was beautifully cooked and delicious slight mix up with puddings ordered but put right at the time and not charged for.    Our room felt quite small but was clean and adequate. The wifi service was excellent.    Unfortunately at some point during our stay in Marrakesh we contracted a very nasty stomach bug -which lingered for 2 weeks after we got home! This has quite likely marred our experience of the hotel as whilst trying to rest in our room in an effort to try to feel better we found the hotel to be a very noisy place to be constant crashing of crockery -like somebody unloading the dishwasher for 8 hours! Not very restful or tranquil. Even on the roof terrace.  I have no experience of any other hotel in Marrakesh -so it is difficult to say how this place rates comparatively however it is fair to say that out of the 3 places we stayed in Morocco it was our least favourite -perhaps Marrakesh deserves the 3 star rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent throughout. Authentic ornate and an absolute pleasure to stay there especially the rooftop pool to relax by in the evening sunshine.  A warm and friendly welcome and fabulous food upon our arrival.  Taxi arranged for a trip to the Atlas Mountains by Aziz who is a great host.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jurek B wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Coco Chanel said "A girl should be two things :classy and fabulous" .  And that is what our stay 6 day stay at "Les Trois Mages " turned out to be.  Cocktail of classy and fabulous.  Dear Aziz -you are the star of the place and manager -what can I say besides -thank you for great conversations and intro to the Old City.  Mouhsine lit the best fires in our fireplace in our Bahia suite and taught me how to make a great mint tea.  Both of you daily refused to lower the style.  We fell in love with medina and its people so easily because we could return from long labyrinthine walks to the tranquility of Les Trois Mages I"m sure.  Regards to breakfast ladies Saida NajiaLaila -thanks for the fresh fruit salads.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael V wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Aziz and his team looked after us extremely well from the moment we arrived and the fantastic dinner through to the personal attention each day including those great breakfasts on the roof. We could not have been better cared for. The Riad is a true oasis in a vibrant city. Thank you.

I can't find think of anything other than praise for this Riad and it's staff. We stayed for 3 nights in December the welcome was excellent and we felt that nothing was too much trouble for the staff in making our stay as smooth and comfortable as possible.  Location wise the Riad is a short walk from the main square and not too far away from any of the attractions within the Madina.  Our room was spotlessly clean and comfortable the lounge areas are well furnished and tea and coffee is available at all times.  I can't imagine staying at one of the big international hotels in Marrakesh when there is accommodation of this standard with the level of personal service offered for around £80 per night.  Thanks for a wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosemary K wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: This place is absolutely divine! Aziz and his team couldn't do enough for us we even got upgraded for free to the suite because it was empty (definitely pay to upgrade - the other rooms are lovely but the suite is out of this world!)    Thanks you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jacks W wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We spent a lovely 4 nights in the Riad in November and the whole thing was just wonderful. The Riad its self is beautiful and Aziz and his team made us feel like part of the family. The service food and room were all perfect and we could have stayed much longer. We will 100% be back!    Thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Damien S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Great service clean rooms lovely Riad very reasonably priced.    The staff of this Riad are second to none and their response pre trip and during our stay was always spot on and timely. The rooms are clean and well presented very homely and private with almost a feel of having a personal butler service.    The location of the Riad is approximately 10-15 mins walk to the main square and souks. Which is brilliant. You wouldnt want to be too near to the main square but you wouldnt want to be too far that you have to jump on a cab. Overall we spent £80 per night and it doesnt get better for the price!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Antonia B wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: This riad is heaven but so are many of the 100's in Marrakech. One thing that gives this one the edge is the grand piano which guests if they are so inclined may use for a little post dinner entertainment. My teenage daughters knocked out a few tunes complete with close harmony vocals. They gave up piano lessons at age 7 but what they have learnt from you tube tutorials was amazing. Who knew! A family highlight in a wonderful holiday location. Everything else at Les Trois Mages was wonderful too. Aziz helped me to print boarding pass for return flight. Husband had a great shave from the barber round the corner for £2.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tom A wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Why did we ever leave! After spending 4 fabulous nights at Les Trois Mages we moved on to a all inclusive resort on the outskirts of Marrakech for the remainder of our holiday; what a mistake!    This place had everything we wanted and more.  All the staff at Les Trois Mages were lovely and friendly especially Aziz who made our stay wonderful from start to finish.  The whole riad was beautifully done with lovely little touches all around. No better place to relax than by the rooftop plunge pool after a long day wandering the various alleyways of the medina only minutes away.    Thank you everyone at the Riad Les Trois Mages we will definitely be recommending you to all our friends and family :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Clare S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Cant' recommend this Riad highly enough. All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. As two females we really appreciated the top tips & map guidance from Azziz 2 (Azziz was on holiday) We enjoyed having our breakfast on the sun terrace every morning and got a taste for the complimentary mint tea whenever we returned from our days out. We stayed in the Gaspard room on the ground floor which was very comfortable with plenty of hot water for showers. The bottled water in the room was a bonus. We chose this Riad because of the night porter.  We plan on returning in two years.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: jim t wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: This riad is tucked away to the north of the Medina. Aziz and every one of his staff are friendly efficient and extremely helpful. We had a wonderful time here. Quiet room comfy bed hot shower and excellent food. The bonus being the roof terrace with a plunge pool. I would not hesitate to recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nuno Macedo wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: When service makes a huge difference
Review_Text: When I was choosing a special place for a short 3 days family get-together I was torn between a more modern accommodation in Marrakesh (outside the Medina) and a more authentic place like a Riad. At the end I decided to go for a Riad and have chosen the one that at a first glance would tick most of the boxes i.e. had a lovely terrace with pool would be within easy reach of a main street where a transfer could collect us/drop us off would certainly offer good service and where we'd feel special. Riad Les Trois Mages exceeded all of our expectations and I can certainly see why it has been rated so highly everywhere. Not only is a very good value for money but also delivers a genuine customer focused service with the whole team expressing themselves as part of your family as if the Riad would be your home away from home. From the very first emails where I requested so many things Anna (the owner) Aziz (the manager) were very prompt and delivered in every single aspect to make sure I'd have a very memorable stay. We had a 3 days plan very detailed and precise with places we wanted to visit and things we wanted to do and with the help from their partner tour agent Exotic Lines Travel they indeed made it happen. I'm very grateful for the effort of the whole team (literally every single one of them who in the absence of Aziz on annual leave and Anna in the UK looked after us so well). Kudos to all of them.    PS - make sure you've a lovely meal at the Riad authentic very well prepared traditional food a bliss. Lamb Tagine and Pastilla..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful stay, beautiful staff and stunning riad
Review_Text: The riad is absolutely beautifully decorated it is a stunning place to stay. It was perfectly located within the medina but close still to a road which has car access meaning you can move around the city easily. If you stay deep within the medina you would spend a lot of time trying to get in and out of it.    The riad itself has beautiful rooms and all decorated thoughtfully. The courtyard is wonderful to sit in and it had two sitting rooms - one of which has a piano and other musical instruments for guests to enjoy. The staff and the riad encourages you to relax and feel welcome and at home and we really did. There is a stunning rooftop as well with a pool and some sun loungers which is perfect to relax in.  We stayed in the Jade Room and this was lovely with a big four poster bed.    The staff were so kind and friendly and really made our stay special. Aziz was so kind and helpful and took a lot of time to explain all about Marrakech and places we might like to go. He organised a great deal of things for us and was always very happy and helpful. There is nothing that all the staff couldnt do for us including the lovely cooks and maids and organised anything we needed. The service overall was excellent and really made our stay special thank you to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful Riad with very attentive staff
Review_Text: We stayed in Jade and then Balthazar with a 2 night trip across the Atlas mountains and stay on the edge of the Sahara in the middle. Had an an absolutely amazing time for the whole holiday. We pre-ordered dinner for the first night which was lovely - a bottle of red was found without issue. Would also recommend a guided half day tour to get your bearings so you can then wander at leisure with more confidence.  We were able to get wine and beer from a local supermarket just outside the city walls and consume there without issue - not big drinkers but enjoy some wine on holiday in the evening. We enjoyed the peace of the Jardin Majorelle and the well presented Berber museum which are easily walkable from here and made a contrast to the bustle of the medina. Peeped in all the rooms when we were there on our own and they are all lovely. Thank you all for making us so welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were so fortunate to book this Riad! It is such an amazing place to stay in Marrakesh! It is very conveniently located inside the Medina a short 10-15 minute walk from Jemaa el-Fnaa Square as well as other important sites. The whole place is so beautiful and once you are inside you find peace tranquility and calm. Our room was beautifully decorated and spacious and very comfortable.  What I cannot stress enough is the excellent management and staff of the Riad. From the moment we booked the service was exceptional. They are such wonderful and welcoming people ready to cater to your every need. And the food is so wonderful basically homemade.  Thank you so much Aziz for your exceptional hospitality for all the information you shared with us and of course for the lovely birthday surprise! We had one of the best holidays ever and are looking forward to our next visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Loren M wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: amazing stay in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: this was exactly what we were hoping for. Moroccan elegance in the heart of the crazy Medina. easy to get everywhere. I would order your taxi through the riad. Aziz took care of us well. we also had dinner ordered for the first night which was perfect since we got in around 6 pm. I would highly recommend you have Aziz call Ydir to be your guide in the Medina. Yes you can try and do it alone and have fun getting lost everywhere but for a small amount of money Ydir spent 3 hours with us showing us around teaching us keeping us from getting too off focus. He helped us negotiate he showed us the better quality items and we were able to cover a lot more territory since we weren't always getting swept into the shops. It is a bit overwhelming. we now have a new friend in Ydir and next time we come over we will have him show us manufacturing and historic sites outside of the Medina and we will stay in the quiet beautiful Riad Les Trois Mages
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Yes you can try and do it alone and have fun getting lost everywhere but for a small amount of money Ydir spent 3 hours with us showing us around teaching us keeping us from getting too off focus. He helped us negotiate he showed us the better quality items and we were able to cover a lot more territory since we weren't always getting swept into the shops. It is a bit overwhelming. we now have a new friend in Ydir and next time we come over we will have him show us manufacturing and historic sites outside of the Medina and we will stay in the quiet beautiful Riad Les Trois Mages
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Damien S wrote a review Nov 2015

Review_Text: A very peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the medina. We had the 'Bahia' room the largest (I think) which was tastefully decorated in traditional moroccan style.    Staff were very friendly and helpful always willing to go out of their way to assist and guide. Food if ordered was simple but to a high stand. Breakfast was basic but it met the need!    The roof-top terrace was a welcome haven to grab some sun. The pool is small (not really a swimming pool) but is there to cool really. Iron sunbed frames don't really work in the scorching heat but not a major issue.    Overall we had a great stay here and would certainly return when we visit Marrakech again the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Molly H wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: The Riad is really lovely situated walking distance from the souks and the square. We stayed for 2 nights in the suite Bahia with a very comfortable bed and lots of space. The manager Aziz could not have been nicer he recommended good places to eat visit and spent time showing us on the map. He booked us drivers who worked with the hotel and were also very helpful and informative. We stayed there with 6 other friends and it felt like a private villa. The pool on the roof is perfect for cooling down and there are sun loungers and shaded areas to relax. Breakfast was great and all the staff were lovely. I'd certainly recommend this Riad for a weekend in Marrakesh with easy access to everything for the short time we were there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As so many of the other reviewers have noted the Riad Les Trois Mages is a lovely place to stay in Marrakech. It is centrally located within the Medina and an easy walk to most of the attractions in the city. After a day of walking around the bustling streets of Marrkech it was amazing how calm quiet cool and relaxing it was within the walls of the Riad. We stayed in the Melchior room and it was lovely. We took three trips organized by the Riad: a half-day guided tour of the Medina the day after we arrived (critical for figuring out how to navigate Marrkech's winding streets) a day long trip to the Ourika Valley and a day long trip to Imlil. All were extremely well organized and very much worthwhile. Riad manager Aziz's service was fantastic from the pre-trip email correspondence (arranging outings and taxi service from the airport) to check out. The food was fantastic. Breakfast was a delight each morning and the couscous we had for one dinner were among the best meals we had in Morocco. Overall we couldn't have been happier with our choice of the Riad and would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This riad is the perfect place to stay in Marrakech. It is located in the center of Medina walking distance to the main square and the souks. It offers a experience of a typical marroqui house with traditional decoration like from the fairy tale. We stayed in Jade room that was gorgeous. The service and attention by riad manager Aziz was spectacular very personal and helpful. The breakfast was something out from this world - delicious generous and served in such a beautiful way. Mint tea could be served any hour. If you are still deciding between staying in a hotel or a riad definitely go for riad! We absolutely loved it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Emma M wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: As the other reviews states this Riad is perfect for a stay in Marrakech the Riad is cool and beautiful decorated and the roof terrace and pool provide wonderful relaxation spot after the madness of Marrakech. The Riad arranged our transfers to and from the airport our half day walking tour and our hot air balloon ride; all of which were stress free and high quality. It is a three minute walk from the edge of the souk (which leads to the main square) and there is a handy second option for the walk if you want to avoid the souk after too much bargaining! Aziz 2 gave us a wonderful overview of the city upon arrival and some helpful tips to ensure we didn't pay too much for anything and avoid any sticky situations. Breakfast was lovely and served whenever suits the guest. The only slight negative for us was our evening meal whilst it was nice we didn't experience it as high quality as others have mentioned but it could be personal preferences. Finally our room was the Melchior; which is beautiful & recommend but it is on the ground floor beside the kitchen. Staff definitely try to keep noise to a bare minimum but if you did want a lie-in an upstairs room may be better...Overall I would highly recommend it!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: beautiful riad with a pool on terrace and amazing hospitality. The food is delicious and in-house cook is most special. Her Chicken tagine and couscous is probably the best I have ever had.  Room was very well designed with a a very ethic Moroccan feel.  I would totally recommend this Riad for all visitors to Marrakech.  The location is also pretty good as it is in Medina within walking distance of central square and many other local tourist spots.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: nigel f wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: A delightful Riad with a big plus - a wonderfully cool small pool on the roof with plenty of sun loungers. After a hard day's haggling in the medina this is the perfect place to cool down. Excellent attentive service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: victoria l wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: An oasis of calm in the middle of the wonderful chaos that is Marrakesh.  Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff are amazing. The food was exceptional  dinner on the roof one of the highlights.  We were a group of friends some new to Marrakesh the Riad is at the edge of the souk and a short walk to all the attractions. The team will guide you through your stay with advice and maps.  They will organise trips and book taxis  they will meet you from the airport the rooms all have air conditioning and are amazing. We will be returning in September
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mark I wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights when we arrived in Marrakech then returned for two nights just before we flew home. Aziz and his staff were very welcoming and took time to go through a map of the medina and places we might like to visit. They also have an excellent driver Mohammed who took us on a day trip to the Atlas Mountains. He was very accommodating and gave us a fantastic insight into life in the mountains. The Riad itself is beautiful with a lovely roof-top terrace where you can shade yourself if it is very hot they also have a little pool. We will definitely be returning to this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marissa E wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: We had a wonderful 3 day stay at Le Trois Mages and I would highly recommend it. It's located in the heart of Marrakesh but once you enter the riad you step into a haven of calm! The staff were all super helpful and friendly the rooms are lovely and the food is great. Make sure you have dinner there at least once..it's so worth it! The roof terrace with splash pool is an added bonus after a hot day in the souks. A big thank you to Aziz (number 1 and 2) and the team for making our stay there one of the real highlights of our Moroccan adventure. We hope to be back one day and will definitely tell our friends and family about Le Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne A wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: If I could give ten stars I would. I wanted to pick the best Riad in Marrakesh that was still reasonably priced and Les Trois Mages fit the bill. From the moment I booked our stay Aziz was on it--he contacted me by email right away with detailed information about our upcoming visit. We booked our airport transfer through the riad and even our lunch on arrival. Even when our flight had to be changed and I had to adjust our pick up time from the airport he was quick to respond and understanding of our situation. No hassles whatsoever.    When we got to the riad it was like stepping into an oasis a paradise among the hustle and bustle of the city right around the corner. It was so quiet and peaceful and the decor was pristine. We felt like Moroccan princesses. Aziz gave us time to relax in the courtyard and was not overbearing at all. Then he offered us tea and cookies and sat down with us to map out the city. We never felt rushed or unimportant. We might has well been the only guests staying there because of all the attention and kindness we were given. He booked our hamam/massage for us. We really didn't have to worry about anything.    We were especially delighted with the lunch that was prepared--in my emails I requested that we have something traditional and what we got was the most glorious tasty saucy juicy tanjin chicken known to man. If you want a taste of traditional Moroccan cookery you will not regret ordering in with the restaurant. This isn't a big chain hotel that's going to prepare your meal in a big vat for others to share. Even our breakfasts were prepared with love and detail and we enjoyed the spread that was before us every morning. I didn't get the ladies' names but they were so awesome and sweet. I could tell they work hard but they never look tired or moody and they always greeted us with a friendly smile.    Our room was equally wonderful; dressed in beautiful deep reds browns and oranges and our bathroom fixtures adorned with gold. Complimentary water was important as it was hot when we visited as was the air conditioning unit the cooled the room down quickly. When we came back to the riad late at night after observing and enjoying the excitement in the main square the night guy was quick to open the door and very welcoming.    Need I say more? The best thing you can do for yourself is book this riad. I did not regret it and I'm pretty proud of myself for picking the right place. Pat on the back for me. Our stay here was one of the best if not THE BEST part of our trip. :) thank you! Thank you!

This review is a bit late. We stayed in les trois mages in March. What beautiful place to stay. This riad made our holiday!!! We were welcomed by Aziz who made us feel so welcome straight away with tea pancakes. He went through the map of the area and the medina with us would have been lost without it. He even left us a bottle wine as I was celebrating a birthday.  Location is great it was close to centre so was easy to get up in the morning and see the sights and then chill by the pool for an hour or so in the afternoon or enjoy a game of checkers.  Would definitely stay here again. Thanks Aziz and the rest of the team in Les Trois Mages.  Breakfast was always amazing..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for the first week of our 2 week honeymoon. On our arrival we were greeted by Azziz. Azziz was so welcoming and kind and this set us up for the entire stay. All the staff were incredibly helpful and kind. Our room the Bahia Suite was stunningly beautiful and authentically styled. The riad is a welcome oasis in the midst of the energy and passion of the medina. The food was delicious the staff were so hospitable that we felt like family and the general ambiance was one of luxury and peace. We hope so very much to return here in the future and to celebrate with our new Morrocan family all that this beautiful riad and vibrant city have to offer. Thank you so very much for giving us this wonderful week xxxxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah U wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: The riad is lovely so peaceful despite all the hustle and bustle of the medina and the roof top Terrace is a great spot to relax.    It is in a great location with very easy access to the main square and also to the souks.    Aziz and his team cannot do enough for you they are always on hand to provide advice as to where to go eat and to give you instructions as to how to get places which are easy to follow.    One thing we did find is that they do tend to recommend some of the more westernised places to eat but they were all very nice!    You always get a very warm welcome when you come back from a day out and an offer of something to drink a really nice touch.    will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen P wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: I am back again to this delightful Riad in the old medina of Marrakech and it just gets better each time I come back. The staff are all amazing and treat like family and thoroughly spoil me every time. This really is a value for money place with 5 star service and accommodation. Long may it continue
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Ivars V wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Spent three nights there, excellent riad where to relax after intensity of Marrakech.
Review_Text: Room riad iteself and breakfast was excellent. Very helpful and friendly staff. Peaceful and quiet which is what was necessary after visiting medina. They arranged taxi to and from airport which was nice touch. Breakfast could be little bit larger. Definitely can recommend and would stay there again if returning to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Alan B wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We arrived with friends (a party of 4) for a 4 day break in April. From our initial booking to our last day we had fantastic service from Azis and his colleagues. This was summed up on our last day - We had a late flight and had spent the day haggling in the Souks for some last minute shopping and got back to the Riad exhausted and hungry. Azis arranged for us to have homemade bread cheese and olives before we left for our flight. What a great gesture and fully appreciated.  Tips - would highly recommend the 1/2 day guided tour on your first morning; we were taking to places by Abdul that we would never have visited and was very educational. The 1 day trip to the Ourika Valley in the Atlas Mountains with Mohammed was a highlight for it's beauty and the Market.  Overall we had a fantastic time and would very strongly recommend this Riad. Many Thanks to Azis and the Staff who made our short trip very memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Pauline R wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Great place, great staff, gorgeous Riad
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and this Riad really made it a super stay. The staff really went out of their way to make us feel at home. Nothing was too much trouble. From the airport pick-up on arrival a beautiful breakfast at 5 am on our day of departure and everything else in between. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in The Riad Les Trois Mages from the initial booking to our departure Aziz the manager and his fabulous team took care of everything arranging pick up to and from the airport and being on hand to give advice and offer suggestions to make our short stay amazing. The Riad is a fabulous place so calm and relaxing we felt comfortable the minute we walked in the decor and furnishings have a beautiful authentic feel the rooms are sumptuous  I would recommend without any hesitation and will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Delighted with Riad les Trois Mages
Review_Text: We were delighted with Riad les Trois Mages. We love to feel like we live in a place albeit temporarily when staying there on holiday but that can be a tricky feeling to achieve in a hotel on a city break. Here we felt like we were staying with friends who have a lovely home. The calm warm informative and personalised service provided by Aziz and his team is rare to find and well described in previous reviews and really does enhance a beautiful property in a great location. Super value for money lovely food gorgeous roof terrace.... so easy to recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Exceptional service in a beautiful Riad at great location
Review_Text: We had such a wonderful time at the Riad. Even before we arrived they were on email sorting out a driver to pick us up and answering any questions we had. The location is in an ideal area just down a short passage off a main road. As soon as you walk in its peaceful and your own sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious and we were always being asked if we wanted any refreshments (waterteacoffee all for free). The room was comfortable great shower and the rooftop was a lovely sun trap for chilling out.    Aziz and the rest of the staff thank you for such a wonderful experience I now understand why you get so many good reviews! I'll certainly be sending friends and family your way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This well-located riad was truly an oasis and home away from home during our stay in Marrakech. They can accommodate any request but they've probably already thought of anything you could want. The riad is beautifully designed and has a wonderful blend of modern and traditional Moroccan style. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay in Le Trois Mages. We had a lovely room and really enjoyed the sunny rooftop terrace in the mornings. Aziz the hotel manager was very helpful and accommodating and arranged a great three day trip to the Sahara with a very good guide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect location for haven from hustle and bustle.
Review_Text: We spent four nights in this peaceful riad in the heart of Marrakech. The team in this riad were beautifully gracious and smiley. They made us feel so welcome from the moment we arrived. Marrakech is a fabulous location for a cultural experience but I had no idea how good humoured the people would be. They help you to relax and reflect on the crazy busy city just outside their door. Fabulous experience. Highly recommend. We also ventured into the Atlas Mountains which I would also recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Brett W wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: A Gem amid the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We have just returned from a four night stay at Le Trois Mages and can't recommend it highly enough!!  As has been said in so many reviews the accommodation is a wonderful oasis of calm in the vibrant old city of Marrakesh.  The rooms are clean and beautifully furnished in the Moroccan style but it is the staff that really set it apart. Aziz the manager is always on hand to help with choosing what to see and where to visit . The kitchen staff provide a great breakfast in the dining area or on the pretty roof terrace and they are happy to make tea or coffee at any time which is very welcome after a day wandering around sightseeing. It really feels like a home away from home.  If you are visiting Marrakeh stay at this Riad and you won't be disappointed!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andreas S wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad well located very friendly and helpful staff with hotel manager aziz night porter muassin and the three great women in cuisine and service. We loved it so much that we stayed another 2 nights in the honeymoon suite after our trip to Morocco. Hopefully there will soon be another opportunity for a few days at this beautiful place to come.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I took my husband here for his 30th birthday. From the very first communication with Aziz I was fully confident that I had chosen our accommodation well. My e-mails were responded to promptly with all the information I had requested - and more helpful information I had not yet considered.    Upon arrival we were picked up by our driver (who Aziz had arranged for us) who was very friendly & escorted us right to the front door (he even carried all of our luggage for us). We were greeted by Aziz (Manager) who immediately offered us mint tea (my husband is now addicted!) & some lovely pastries. He then gave us a helpful map & talked us through various landmarks to look out for to assist our navigation back to the riad. This proved to become very helpful as it was our first visit to beautiful Marrakech.    We had a meal at the riad on the evening we arrived which was absolutely delicious & would thoroughly recommend sampling the wonderful dishes they offer.    More about the food - the breakfasts are amazing! They consist of fruit yoghurt pancakes breads pastries eggs - all completely fresh! And you can chose to have it in the courtyard the music room the lounge or in the sun on the amazing roof terrace. This set us up well for the days of exploring!    Every time we walked through the front door it was instantly calm & relaxing - a world away from the bustle of the streets! The riad itself it beautifully decorated & spotless throughout. It is located approximately 10-15 minutes walk from Jemaa el Fna Square (if you know the way & don't get distracted en route by the wonderful wares on display in the souks!)    Throughout our stay were were always greeted by smiling friendly faces - Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila.    We stayed in the Bahia Suite. Wow! What can I say? Pure luxury... If you can book it I would recommend it! Our fire was even lit for us on our last night as the weather had cooled considerably that evening.    We cannot thank you all enough for helping make our stay so special & can't wait to return to Riad Les Trois Mages!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed our last night here and I so wish we had stayed a different night as we literally didn't want to leave! It's so luxurious and we picked here as it was my birthday. As we were sunbathing and swimming in the rooftop pool a lovely bottle of wine was left in our room with a birthday card from the staff at the riad which was such a nice touch I actually thought my boyfriend had arranged it but then realised he's definitely not that romantic!  As we were leaving early for our flight home breakfast was arranged for us early.  Would highly recommend this riad if you're looking for somewhere luxurious understatedly stylish and comfortable. It's much pricier than what you'd expect to pay in marrakech but it's great for a treat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful stay at Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: Have just returned from a super 4 night stay at Les Trois Mages. It was recommended to us by a work colleague and exceeded all our expectations. The property is beautiful well located and offers rooms all with an individual character which are spotlessly clean and welcoming. As mentioned in all other reviews Aziz and the other staff did everything possible to ensure we had a wonderful stay. I would definitely recommend to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alexandra M wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Fantastic honeymoon at Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: My husband and I came to Marrakech for our honeymoon and picked les trois mages based on the wonderful tripadvisor reviews it had received. We were not disappointed. The property is beautiful with a lovely rooftop with a pool a gorgeous courtyard and multiple sitting rooms where you can enjoy a meal or cup of mint tea. The managers Aziz during the day and Mohammed at night were kind and extremely hospitable. They were happy to arrange anything your heart desired from tours to dinner reservations. We stayed in the beautiful and romantic Bahia suite and Mohammed built us a fire in the fireplace which was great. The in-house cooks were lovely and the food was great including the tasty (included) breakfasts. It is well-located and a quick walk to anywhere you'd want to go (or an even quicker super-cheap cab ride if its raining or you are in uncomfortable shoes). We had 4 star accomodations and service but for a fraction of the price of the hotel chains (why would you ever stay at one when you could get individualized service at a riad?!). I would suggest Les Trois Mages to all. You absolutely will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: All of the reviews are spot on. The beautiful riad along with fantastic staff made this without a doubt the best place we've had the pleasure of staying. Aziz and the other staff went above and beyond to ensure we had the best stay possible. Would recommend to all and only stay here on our return. Thank you!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This lovely riad really has the personal touch.  Aziz the manager welcomes you with mint tea pastries and takes time to sit with you and give a comprehensive guide to Marrakech.  He arranged our airport pick up and also kindly purchased bus tickets to Essaouira on our behalf with no surcharge.  The rooms are characterfuly decorated all with ensuite bathrooms and the benefit of electric blankets for the chilly nights. The roof terrace was great with the heated pool and loungers.  We took dinner in the riad the food lovely and equal to that served at the exclusive Maison Arabe at a fraction of the cost.The breakfasts were also lovely with warm fresh bread fruit yoghurt pancakes and eggs. Complimentary tea coffee and water were offered day and night.  To sum up i can't remember the last time i stayed in a property with such friendly high standards of service at such a reasonable price. As an exampletwo days after our stay and returning from Essaouira we had a six hour wait for our flight and were lugging suitcases around town. Cheekily i knocked on the door of the riad and asked if we could leave the cases there for the afternoon. Aziz welcomed us in offered refreshments and use of the riad to relax while we waited and also booked our transport to the airport. Exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gracie O wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: A beautiful Riad with great staff and delicious food.
Review_Text: I highly recommend staying in Les Trois Mages! Aziz is very welcoming and provides you with all the information you need to have a great time in Marrakech. The room was lovely and very comfortable and the whole Riad was spotlessly clean. The rooftop terrace is a particularly nice spot to relax. Breakfast was perfect and I would recommend having an evening meal in the Riad which we really enjoyed. With hundreds of Riads to choose from I'm really pleased we went for this one!    I can't find a single fault with our stay here and hope to be able to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bob M wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Thank you Aziz for making our 3 night stay fantastic. The Riad itself is beautiful and tranquil we loved the roof top terrace a fantastic place to sit in the evening with a glass of wine. Before we arrived Aziz had already emailed us to arrange for our arrival. We were made to feel at home the whole time and would reccommend this superb Riad to everyone. The Night Porter could not be more helpful even lighting the fire for us in the evening.  Top Tip - the Riad sells wine but alcohol is very difficult to find and expensive within the Medina so it is worthwhile bringing a bottle of your favourite tipple from duty free if you like something stronger.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a great place to stay. From the minute we arrived we were treated with 5 star hospitality. The night porter is a really friendly guy and having arrived late he was able to offer us some tips for where to eat and when we chose he rang ahead and booked a table for us. He even went to the bother of walking us towards the cafe so that we didn't get lost.    The girls worked really hard for us throughout our stay and were extremely accommodating for any of our requests. Aziz the manager is a lovely guy and provides an invaluable map with lots of tips and routes marked in it. I can't stress how important a good map is in Marrakech 😃 He provided us with lots of tips to help us enjoy our stay in Marrakech.    And if you enjoy a drink like we do they guys are able to organise some drinks to be brought to the Riad for you or can guide you to the nearest super market where you can get some booze! They are quite relaxed and happy for you to enjoy a drink or 2 on the terrace unlike some other Riad's.    Overall beautiful building great hosts excellent accommodation great location and probably one of the best Riad's in Marrakech.    Ian & Jane
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zach W wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: This was one of the best stays I've ever had in a hotel. The service was excellent and the people were so kind! Such yummy breakfasts! They were very helpful in arranging our affairs in a city that would have otherwise been insanely difficult to navigate. I look forward to returning in the future!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful place to stay, faultless service
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in March in the Arabesque room. The riad is beautifully decorated in traditional Moroccan style with a lovely courtyard and roof terrace with a small pool which is perfect for relaxing after a morning wandering around the souks. The staff are wonderful really trustworthy and nothing is too much trouble. All tea/coffee/water is free and the staff will bring you a drink up to the terrace whenever you like. We ate a meal here the first night and this was lovely too. Breakfast was also lovely - fruit yoghurt juice coffee pancakes and eggs.The riad also organised to get us some wine which was really helpful it meant we could have a drink in the evening when we got back to the riad. Aziz and Mahmout (riad manager and night porter) are very helpful and polite - made us reservations for restaurants organised airport taxis told us where to visit in the city and explained the best routes to walk on the map (location of the riad is 5 mins walk from the souk). The mint tea is amazing! I am so glad we chose to stay at this riad it really made our trip to Marrakesh perfect can't recommend it enough and for the price you pay it is excellent value for money. Thank you to all the staff at the riad for such a lovely stay. I have nothing negative to say about the place and if I every return to Marrakesh would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent four nights here in February 2015. The Riad is beautiful & very well maintained. We loved the peace & tranquility of the Riad. The Riad is perfectly positioned for exploring the Medina sights & souks. Everywhere was in very easy walking distance & we didn't need any form of transport during our stay. We visited as a group of 5 & had 2 rooms the Bahia Suite & Melchior room. both rooms were beautiful immaculately clean with lovely soft cotton sheets on the beds. A lovely touch was finding the electric blankets on on the bed - very welcome on a chilly night!!. There is a lovely tranquil roof terrace with heated pool. As it was pretty chilly at the time we were there we didn't spend too much time on the terrace - but it is the perfect place to relax in warmer months.  The staff at the Riad were all very helpful & friendly. In particular I have to mention Aziz the Manager. He really went out of his way to make our stay at the Riad so perfect. He was always on hand to answer any questions he booked restaurants for us (& arranged for a guide to take us to & from the restaurants as we would have got lost!!) & arranged our taxi to & from the airport - all of which ran smoothly with no problems. We were very impressed by the way he greeted us with mint tea & spent time explaining everything and provided us with an excellent map & instructions on how to get to the various places we wanted to visit. He always made sure that we had delicious mint tea whenever we were in the Riad. He is a real asset to Riad Les Trois Mages! In fact - with Aziz there to guide & advise us our guidebook was rarely used!  Aziz arranged for us to have a guide around the medina on our first day in Marrakech (book this in advance if you can). I would really recommend booking the half day guided tour if it is your first visit to Marrakech. Mohammed was outstanding - he took us to various sights which we wouldn't have found without him & he also took us into the Souks & explained about how to haggle & where to buy certain items. We were particularly fascinated by to see & meet some of the craftsmen working in the Souks & I doubt if we would have found some of them without Mohammed's guidance. Mohammed explained many things about the culture sights etc & was great at answering our many questions. A tour with Mohammed is a definite must!  We arranged to eat at the Riad on the first night & enjoyed a beautiful tasty meal - a great start to our holiday. 2 of us did the cookery class with Saida which we thoroughly enjoyed. We enjoyed going to the markets with her before our class to buy the ingredients. As our French was limited Aziz helped us by translating for us during our class which was a great help.  Breakfast at the Riad was delicious - fresh fruit yogurt local pastries etc. The perfect start to the day. There is good free Wifi throughout the Riad.  There is nothing I could fault about Riad Les Trois Mages & will definitely be back to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel Conway wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I had a fantastic stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. We received a warm welcome from Aziz and an unexpected (but amazing) breakfast when we arrived early in the morning and even a card from the staff and free bottle of wine when they realised it was my birthday! The room was beautiful and the riad is in a great location just 10-15 mins walk from the medina but the riad itself is a quiet and peaceful oasis from the bustling streets outside. The staff were helpful and gave us clear directions to the medina and souks and suggested some excellent places for dinner each night. We felt completely safe wandering the streets and we'd definitely stay here again if we came back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are thinking about booking a riad in Marrakech you have to book Les Trois Mages. We have stayed in top hotels around the world but the standard of accommodation facilities and particularly the staff made this one of our most memorable experiences anywhere. From the moment we booked Aziz looked after our every need. He was always present checking everything was in order and if he could do anything to help us. His recommendations for routes restaurants and general things to do were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble. Mouhsine is a gem. What a great man. He was so welcoming when we came back from our nights out always welcoming us with a smile offering to light us a fire and make us a drink. He even walked us to our taxi one morning when I'm sure he should have been finished working. Saida's cooking was amazing and her constant desire to please us by serving us food and drink wherever we wanted it was very much appreciated. The room itself was beautiful and very very clean. This is an authentic Moroccan house where we truly felt like family. Why did we ever stay in a characterless hotel when we came to this city before! If you are going to Marrkech book Les Trois Mages and let Aziz take care of all your other arrangements for you. That's what I'd do next time. Even the taxi's he booked for us were a high class of vehicle with polite drivers unlike the petite taxis in town. Oh how we wish we were back there right now. Thank you to all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best service of my time in Morocco!
Review_Text: I can't say enough about Riad Les Trois Mages! The accomodations are lovely. However the real jewel in the crown is the amazing staff.
