They are always helpful and there all the time to attend to your every need.    I in fact left my favorite sunglasses behind upon leaving. The manager Aziz found them and was able to get them back to me in NYC. Now that's great service!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Nick R wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We sent two nights at this riad at the end of our vacation and the experience was amazing. Much like all the other reviewers state the rooms are fantastic the riad is an oasis of quiet and the staff could not have been any better. Aziz and Mouhsine made sure we had everything we needed at all times arranged for the taxi to take us to the airport at 6:30am and even cooked us breakfast at 6am. We had one dinner in the riad and Saida's cooking was amazing. We're so glad that we chose to have our final dinner in Marrakech in the riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends
Reviewer_Location: Staten Island, New York, United States

Review_Text: We spent 3 nights at this Riad which we picked after reading the rave reviews on this site. The Riad lived up to expectations - mainly due to the fantastic customer service as nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We were met by Aziz and given tea and pastries while we checked in. He also spent time showing us the main sites on the map and giving us directions to the main square complete with landmarks to look for - extremely helpful as it is very easy to get lost in Marrakech! Aziz also arranged a private day trip to the Ourika Valley and Atlas Mountains for us which was a little more expensive than the group trips but definitely worth the extra cost as we had a private driver.    We were in the Arabesque room which was perfectly sized for 2. Noise does carry from the other rooms and the courtyard but if you are a light sleeper like me you will probably be travelling with earplugs anyway! The room is equipped with AC which we didn't need given the time of year and also an electric blanket for the cooler winter evenings. The bathroom is large and clean with traditional decoration and comes with both towels and bathrobes plus complimentary toiletries.    There are only 6 rooms in the Riad so it never felt busy or crowded. We spent some time sunbathing on the roof terrace which also has a small pool. All areas were clean and well kept. Breakfast was included as part of the price and was excellent - fresh fruit and yoghurt pastries bread and eggs - plenty to keep you going for the day.    The Riad is well located only a 15min walk from the main square and the souks. If you are looking for accommodation in the Medina then I can't imagine anywhere being any better value for money or providing better service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John H wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Just returned from a 4 day trip to Marrakech. A great place to visit especially at this time of the year. The Medina area was fascinating and the weather good enough to sit outside and relax. What made the holiday special was the Les Trois Mages Riad a really beautiful place to stay right in the heart of the Medina. The Riad only had 4 or 5 rooms so you were never crowded and received great personal service. Aziz and his team organised 2 super trips (a guided 1/2 day walking tour of the Medina and a day trip to the Atlas Mountains) - both to be recommended. The drivers guides and all the Riad staff really looked after us make sure that you have at least 1 meal in the Riad good quality and very reasonably priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent the last couple of nights of our 11 day Morocco trip at this beautiful riad. It's beautiful peaceful and an absolute oasis in the delicious madness of the medina. A wonderful way to wind down and relax after a 4 day desert excursion. I was in the Balthazar room and it was clean beautifully decorated and the bathroom a good size and very nice. The staff was welcoming professional and helpful. The location is great for both inside and outside the medina. There is a wonderful spa a short walk away that is a must (the one past the taxi stand). The courtyard is nice and the rooftop stunning. I recommend going up in the morning with a book and coffee as well as sunset with a cocktail. This is not a party house but we did stay up late having cocktails (we purchased offsite and brought in as not to drink everything they had!) and playing cards (they have a nice library of movies books and games). I highly recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful riad; excellent staff. We'll be back!
Review_Text: This was our first trip outside of Europe and was by far the most welcoming beautiful place we have ever stayed. We were in the Bahia suite which is just stunning. The log fire was welcome in February too but breakfast on the terrace was worth a little chill - the sun warms the place and little birds joined us for breakfast every morning which never failed to make me smile.    The food was absolutely delicious; whether it was the interesting variations at breakfast every morning home-made cake with tea after a long day out or a fabulous dinner. We were extremely well looked after by all of the staff. Aziz and Mohammad could not have been kinder or more attentive hosts and Sadia's cooking was amazing - we thoroughly recommend her cooking class.    We would also thoroughly recommend a guided tour of the Medina; a lovely man named Mohammad took us around and gave us a fascinating view into life in Marrakech. We were also taken on a number of day trips by a lovely man also named Mohammad who was really helpful knowledgeable and just generally good company. We had a wonderful time every day and almost all of our activities came either directly through or recommended through Aziz at the riad.    I cannot think of a better way to explain our experience at this riad other than that it felt like a proper home away from home. We felt welcome and comfortable every moment of our stay there. The decor is also sumptuous and we cannot recommend this place enough.    We absolutely hope to return one day. It is testament to how amazing this place is that we are writing a review - we often mean to after staying in lovely places but this one has taken us out of our technological lethargy!    Liz and Paul Lumsden
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wouldn't hesitate to stay again or recommend to friends
Review_Text: Aziz was a welcoming attentive and knowledgable host who along with the staff did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. On arrival Aziz took the time to go over the map he supplied familiarising us with the area and answered any questions we had. We stayed in the Arabesque room on the first floor. The room was spacious clean and stocked with fresh towels a safe a bottle of water and heated blankets. The Riad is a short walk from restaurants the souks etc. Bottled water tea and coffee was available free at any time. The whole experience exceeded our expectations and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or recommend to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lara H wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Always welcoming and generous with their time and patient with our needs the team at les Trois Mages will look after you well.  The rooms are all gorgeous and the communal spaces comfortable and relaxing.  Its in the Medina about 15 mins walk to the main square its a good location and close to the beautiful Majorelle Gardens.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As a small family with two kids aged 6 and 2 this place is absolutely perfect. It is a welcome break from the hectic medina.    Rooms are large clean and beautifully furnished. Food is great - breakfast is good but the dinner we had one night was nothing short of an amazing home cooked meal. The rooftop terrace is a treat and the pool is very nice.    Aziz and Aziz are extremely courteous and helpful - the rest of the staff also so so sweet.    In the chaos of leaving we forgot to leave the tips that were so well deserved - we are so sorry!

We stayed for 6 nights in February and we couldn't find fault. Aziz and his team are always available to answer questions and nothing seems to be a problem. The breakfast is very tasty and big keeping us fuelled for most of the day. The rooms were clean and comfortable with an unlimited supply of water and tea should you require it.  The location is ideal to explore the many streets of the souks and the map Aziz supplies you with is detailed enough to help you should you not want to become too lost. And if you need to relax from the hustle and bustle of the Medina then the Riad is lovely and quiet with the roof top terrace and pool offering a lovely place to relax.  A really great place to stay in the lively and exciting world of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pascale B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: The beautiful Riad which is a haven is just perfectly situated right in the heart of the Medina; around the corner Mystic Marrakesh is inviting you to discover it all which I did. Aziz the manager and his staff who I want to thank for all the hospitality are beautiful people with the heart on the right place and great professionalism.  All I can say is I will be back ! Thanks !

Review_Date: Carol C wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages for 5 nights and the accommodation and hospitality Aziz and his team provided ensured that we felt welcome supported and had all we needed to have a fantastic time exploring this wonderful city. We extend our thanks for that and would highly recommend this lovely riad - a calm oasis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Melissa K wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: The above reviews are all true! Our recent Feb 2015 stay at Les Trois Mages was FAB. My friend and I arrived at the Riad to the welcoming sight of tea pastries and a gorgeous lunch on the roof. We walked around with mouths agape as we toured inside: indoor open courtyard several lovely lounge areas (one with fireplace!) ornate tilework everywhere and great rooftop (with pool) for hanging out and eating meals.The entire place is extremely clean tidy and the staff is fantastic. Nothing is too much for them to arrange. The head of the Riad Aziz was amazing; from his prompt email responses prior to our arrival to helping us organize our few days in Marrakech to giving us city maps and going over detailed directions.. He was super friendly and made us feel so welcome throughout our stay. Mouhsine the night guard always greeted us warmly when we came through the door at night by making us tea and pastries. The kitchen staff served us nothing short of glorious feasts either in the open courtyard or on the rooftop (one morning was chilly; they brought us blankets!) Housekeeping was superb; always providing a large bottle of spring water for the room and fresh robes in the bathroom. Speaking of bathroom: ours had gorgeous tilework hammered copper sink and faucets and stone shower (a work of art in itself). Les Trois Mages is conveniently located inside the [um mildly] chaotic medina but once you walk inside the Riad it becomes a serene retreat. Oh and the beds have electric heating pads under the sheets (a GLORIOUS invention for those chilly Moroccan winter nights). Never knew how amazing it could be to sleep in a heated bed. Aziz emailed us after we left Morocco to make sure we made it to the airport and if we got home ok. He could not have been more gracious.    Loved my time in Marrakech and would return to THIS RIAD immediately if I returned!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Shuhena B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We loved it. A true 5* experience with a toasty fire to begin with to a cosy hamam bathtub to relax in. Be warned - The electric blankets will keep in you bed longer than you thought you'd be! The riad is very close to the airport and train station so we got to and from both very quickly. Mouhsine is so lovely and entertaining and responded to all of our requests like we were at home. Breakfast on the roof terrace was divine and Aziz was super helpful with everything. The music room was a definite highlight and the whole riad is a truly magical experience we would love to come again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Highlight of our stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights in January and it was the highlight of our trip. I booked the Bahia Suite as it was my boyfriends Birthday and I am so glad I did - it was such a beautiful riad and the friendliness of the staff was second to none.    We had a flight delay but the very professional Aziz was prompt in reconfirming our driver would still pick us up at the later time and escort us to the Riad. We met the lovely night guardian Mouhsin who really took care of us our whole stay - from tea and biscuits as soon as we checked in to delicious coffee and breakfast very early in the morning on the day we left. Even when we wanted to have our dinner on the roof terrace on our first night Mouhsin kindly obliged and set up a lovely table for us and when we realised how cold it was would help bring our food to our room. Every night when we returned to our room and were feeling chilly Mouhsin would kindly light the fire for us. On our first day when we were ready to venture out Mouhsin popped out of nowhere and walked us to the main taxi point - what a gentleman!    Nothing was a problem for the team - the lovely ladies would make us eggs and crepes for breakfast every morning - where we sat in the beautiful patio and Aziz would help us plan our day with the map which he had already marked with all the main landmarks.    We loved coming home to our Bahia Suite every night the hamman style bathtub was beautiful the bathrobes were clean and soft the electric blankets a pleasure on the chilly January nights! I would recommend eating at the riad - my favourite meal was the grilled sardines and lamb tagine.    Aziz the manager was very kind and helpful - he printed out our boarding passes ready for our flight home and arranged our taxi back to the airport. On our last evening he left a bottle of wine and birthday card in the room for my boyfriend.    I would definately recommend anyone visiting Marrakech to stay at this lovely riad - the pool on the terrace is perfect for a quick dip the food decor and service is wonderful and you are right in the old Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We spent a week at Les Trois Mages and thoroughly enjoyed it ! We can only echo other comments that the Riad is well placedcomfortable and friendly. In fact the staff were so welcoming and helpful we felt safe and secure a respite at the end of weary days .After this trip we want to see more of Morocco generally but would certainly include a stay at Les Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely stay in Riad Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: We have just returned home after a week in the Riad and I would like to thank the satff Aziz Saida Mouhsine Najia & Laila for making our stay really nice. They were so warm and friendly and couldn't do enough for us..  I had a birthday while we were there and they gave me a beautiful display of flowers and a lovely card. It will be a birthday I will not forget!    On our arrival Aziz gave us a map and spent time with us going over it and pointing out places of interest and good places to eat. The breakfast each morning was good and it set you up for the rest of the day. We pre-ordered dinner a couple of nights and it was lovely.  It was a good location for walking to most sights (includingJem El Fna Souks Jardin Majorelle). About 20-30 minute walk to Koutubia mosque and the Bahia and El Badi Palaces.  Would I go back? I would tomorrow if I could!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the riad. Very well run riad with brilliant staff.    Great location being 10-20 minute walk to most sights (includingJem El Fna Souks Jardin Majorelle). About 20-30 minute walk to Koutubia mosque and the Bahia and El Badi Palaces.    Very peaceful ambience in the riad and well decorated. Nice rooftop terrace which would be a great place to relax when the weather is slightly warmer.    We stayed in the Bahia suite which was very spacious and had its own fireplace large bathtub/shower and electric blankets with heating/AC which was great with the cooler weather in January.    The staff couldn't have been any better. Very approachable and helpful. Provided hot drinks whenever required. Particularly the manager Aziz who was always there to help and make sure we were happy. Organised our airport transfers and excursion to the Atlas mountains with no fuss at all. Also sat down with us on arrival to help orientate us and gave us a map with recommended restaurants and sights with the best routes from the riad marked on.    Brilliant stay highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Salwan b wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay in this magical place. Everyone was warm and friendly and couldn't do enough for us.  The hosts were attentive friendly and keen to help. The food was amazing and made to order at any time you like especially breakfast  We liked the area too - no hassle from anyone here... people are respectful and friendly and it is just beautiful. And for active people there are lots of things to do - beautiful treks The best way to bok is with day tours from marrakech on tripadvisor I recommend this for any one stayd at this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brenna F wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Our family had a wonderful time at this Riad! It was lovely safe and the care was very personal. One of the highlights of our stay was the cooking class Aziz arranged for my daughters and I to take with the Riad's brilliant chef Saida. We accompanied Saida to the outdoor market used by locals and watched how carefully she selected and bargained for every ingredient. Saida really took my daughters under her tutelage and shared her secrets for spicing meats and vegetables. What a delightful way to spend the morning. The best part was it culminated in a fabulous lunch on the rooftop terrace -- the best meal we enjoyed during our 2 week trip to Morocco! On a different day we found ourselves wandering (in the wrong direction) and an employee of the Riad happened to see us and came over to volunteer her help. These are truly kind people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful Service, Beautiful Space, Ideal Location
Review_Text: A friend and I stayed at Les Trois Mages for two nights and we were thrilled with our experience because of the incredible service provided by the staff the beautiful room and spaces in the riad and the convenient central location.    SERVICE  We booked the room through Expedia and we were pleasantly surprised when the manager Aziz reached out by email to tell us more about the riad and to see if we wanted the hotel's help in arranging transportation from the train station. He offered useful and prompt advice on booking train tickets and he stayed in touch with us before we arrived. On the day we arrived Aziz gave us the most thorough and helpful explanation of the city giving us clear instructions on the riad's location relative to the key attractions so that we could easily find our way in a city where it's very easy to get lost. The service continued to be excellent with what we considered lavish breakfasts and always 100% friendly interactions with all the staff.    SPACE  The riad itself is beautiful and it felt like an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The rooms were lovely and comfortable but it was the common spaces that really won us over. The middle of the riad is open air and it opened on to a beautifully furnished music room with a piano and guitars and a wonderful entertainment room with a fireplace tons of books and games and a music system. We were honestly knocked out by how beautiful the riad was.    LOCATION  Les Trois Mages has an absolutely perfect location. It's located in the medina which means that you're only a 30-minute walk at most from basically anything you want to see in the city from the palaces to the new city where there are restaurants galleries and shops. The souks (basically a bazaar of vendors selling Moroccan slippers clothing woodwork metalwork spices and much more) are only a 10- to 15-minute walk away and the famous Jamaa el Fna square is about 20 minutes away. The best part of Les Trois Mages' location is that it is still relatively easy to find just two short turns off a main street. The alleys of Marrakech are definitely a labyrinth but Les Trois Mages was always easy for us to find our way back to which was especially nice because we were two money traveling together and often coming back to the riad after dark.    All to say staying at Les Trois Mages was the best decision of our time in Marrakech and we highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: fiona a wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: My family and I stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for 3 very enjoyable nights. The staff were attentive and interested and the food excellent. My sincere thanks go to Aziz and the other staff for helping us celebrate my son's 16th birthday so delightfully. Aziz provided an exquisite chocolate cake and the other staff provided a 'birthday table' for us on the roof terrace complete with balloons rose petals. flowers and 'happy birthday' music. The whole thing was done with utmost grace and efficiency. We were very touched this will be a lasting memory for us all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Truly a haven away from the rush of the city
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for a week - there is no denying that this is one of the most beautiful places I have ever had the fortune to call home for a while!    On arrival we were met by the night guard who found us and our taxi (our driver couldn't find the riad!) and led us into the coolness and welcoming arms of our new home. Our induction was short and we were soon in our room before we headed out to find some food (pretty brave of us really it was dark out!) following some great directions.    So many reviewers have said it but it cannot be overstated enough - Riad Les Trois Mages is an oasis of calm in what can be a fairly intimidating city. This was my first time in Marrakech and will in all honestly likely be my last however I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this as the very best place to stay if you want to be in the 'old' quarter.    The lovely ladies who work in the riad couldn't be more attentive; nothing is too much trouble and they're always available if you need something. I would certainly recommend dining one evening; the tagine is beautiful. It was my birthday while we were staying and Aziz organised a lovely cake for me allowed us to eat on the rooftop and even decorated the area with balloons and streamers! A perfect evening.    Our only downsides would be the visitation of a couple of cockroaches to our room - I'd never seen one before in my life and don't ever wish to again! I suppose one should expect this kind of thing in Morocco really; they did put down some sort of deterrent and we only saw one more after that. Still not a nice surprise though! Additionally if you have a room on the ground floor you can be woken by early breakfasters....but I'm an early riser so this didn't bother me. Staying in August we wanted to be out and about early so we could get back before it got too hot outside to be in the souks!    If you're going to Marrakesh I promise you this is the place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mark S wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful oasis with first class service
Review_Text: We had a wonderful four days stay in the "Les trois Mages" in December 2014. The riad is a wonderful oasis in the middle of the busy and hectic Medina of Marrakesh. Beyond the entrance door you enter a place of peace an quiet.  Especially the excellent service cannot be complimented enough. Hotel Manager Aziz and his friendly team do a fist-class job. I can't remember the last time I felt that welcome in a hotel.  The Riad's location is perfect to explore the wonderful city and a good starting point for several trips.    All in all a nearly perfect stay. We will come back for sure and will not hestitate to recommend the Riad to our friends and colleagues.    Best regards  Sabrina + Mark
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I'm just back from a three night stay with two friends at Les Trois Mages over New Year and i can't recommend it enough. The hospitality and warmth of Aziz and his team was second to none - there was always helpful tips & advice on hand for our stay and lots of delicious mint tea!    The attention to detail in the riad is also very impressive - the decor is beautiful and seemingly little things like a mobile phone for us to use to make local calls and adaptors in the rooms meant we were left wanting nothing.    Sun loungers and small pool on the rooftop made it the perfect oasis after a day in the souks as well.    I can't recommend this riad enough it was an absolute delight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We have just left Marrakesh a busy hectic place but we still are feeling the peace and beauty of our stay in this jewel of a riad. When Aziz greated us with his charm and kindness we realized we were in for a treat. The Riad is lovely. The staff can't do enough to please you. Mint tea and treats await you any time. The breakfast was yummy and the very special dinner Azuz arranged to bring in for our New Years Eve was just wonderful. We sat in the side room with a beautifully set table and a roaring fire to keep us warm. The beds were comfortable and the towels soft. There is a baby grand piano that plays beautiful music. We would stay here again. Oh by the way there is a heated pool on the rooftop! Omg! The Medina is a crazy place and the riad was the perfect get away from the din.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Very nice stay. First class service
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trios Mages for 4 nights in December. It was wonderful. The hospitality of Aziz and the staff was amazing. It is an oasis in the middle of Marrakech. We had dinner there one night by the fireplace and it was one of the the best meals we had in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were made to feel at home from the moment we arrived at this fantastic Riad. It's a bit disconcerting when you arrive in Marrakech in the dark and are taken down a narrow alleyway to the unassuming front door but once that door is opened and you are welcomed with mint tea it is not long before you relax into the beautiful surrounds of the Riad.  We stayed 4 nights in total 2 nights at the start of our holiday in the Bahia suite and then we returned after 3 nights on a Desert trip to the Melchior room for another 2 nights. Both rooms were fabulous spotlessly clean and with everything you could need for a short stay the electric blankets were much appreciated as the evenings can be very chilly in December!  What makes this Riad truly exceptional is the staff Aziz Mouhsine Saida and Najia make a fantastic team nothing was too much trouble for them. The welcome we received from Mouhsine on our first night made us feel like we were visiting old friends and the meal Saida cooked was delicious - as good if not better than any other meal we had during the week.  Many thanks to Tony and Anna for allowing us to enjoy your wonderful Moroccan retreat- we will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just left the Riad Les Trois Mages after a three night stay. We were very impressed by the quality of the accommodation and particularly the high level of service. Nothing was too much travel for Aziz the manager who went out of his way to look after us and make sure we had a good stay. We chose the riad after exhaustive (and exhausting!) research on Trip Advisor and we don't feel we could have found anywhere better to stay.

Review_Date: Sherry M wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: But not where google maps says it is! The owner told us he had tried to contact google about it many times. It is actually in the medina of marrakech. This riad is as it is advertised with the rooms being very clean & nicely decorated. The pool & lounge area on the roof top terrace are great! The owner is a very nice man who will give you a map & explain were everything is in Marrakech. He even has a cell phone in each room with his number preprogrammed in it that you take with you in case you need anything! Or get lost. Lol. The only problem is in finding the front door it is down a tiny alleyway with no sign for it except a small plaque on the front door. I recommend contacting the owner before you arrive and he will come out and greet you! I wish we had spent more time here! As we were the only guests that night in the riad he gave us a free upgrade to the suite! Gorgeous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julia B wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Not only is Riad Les Trois Mages a beautiful riad well-maintained and centrally located (5-10 minute walk) it also feels like a home away from home. From the moment we booked the room to the moment we sadly had to leave we were taken care of above and beyond our expectations. All aspects of the riad are spectacular and the staff are absolutely amazing and accommodating. The food was delicious and could be varied to our taste. There are many wonderful things I could say about this riad and the staff but instead I will just say that everything was perfect - I absolutely recommend staying at Riad Les Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: tony h wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: a fabulous riad very friendly staff and a great manager in Aziz. Always on hand with his local knowledge. a truly great riad around a 10 minute walk to the main square but well worth it as you pass many locals that you would miss if you were more central.  this is a good choice for your stay in marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect place to stay in the Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad Les Trois Mages for 6 nights. The Riad is perfectly situated in the Medina of Marrakech and its architecture is in the typical beautifully restored Riad-style. The service of the staff was excellent. Would definitely consider to come back when in Marrakech the next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: scott s wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: This is a great spot to stay to see Marrakech. To get to the main square takes about 10 to 15 minutes walk. Souks are about 10 minute walk away. Both Azizs were very helpful and looked after as well. Aziz organised a very good tour for us organised taxis for us and booked a restaurant for us. Aziz even went out of his way to buy Supratour bus tickets for me as you cant buy them outside of Morocco. This is outstanding service.    When you arrive Aziz takes the time to show you a map and highlight things to see and shows you how to walk there.    Riad feels safe and nothing is too much of a problem for them. Stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in an excellent location
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in September. We chose this Riad after reading the positive reviews and it didn't disappoint.    From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so at home and were welcomed with fresh cakes mint tea& juice. We were provided with a map that had been highlighted with various landmarks and routes so that when we ventured out onto the manic streets of Marrakech we wouldn't get lost!    Our room was lovely beautifully decorated and very traditional. Air con was quiet too!    The breakfasts each morning set us up for the day. We could choose whether to eat in the courtyard or up on the roof terrace and it was always served with a smile.    On our first night we pre ordered a meal as we were arriving quite late at night and didn't want the hassle of venturing out for food. That meal was beautiful can definitely recommend the lemon chicken tagine!    The pool area was a welcome relief from the heat. Although not big it was lovely to be able to sit and read while dipping toes to keep cool. There were also plenty of shaded areas on the terrace if you prefer that to the sun.    This Riad is simply beautiful and in a brilliant location. What makes it extra special though are the attentive and friendly staff who go out of their way to help with any queries/questions about the local area or excursions etc. Also the little touches like the complimentary bottled water and tea& coffee all help set this Riad above and beyond the rest.    Stay here you won't regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: elisabeth m wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: As soon as you step into the Riad you feel at home. It is full of moroccan charm and character. Our rooms (melchior - double- and gaspard -3 singles) were beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Aziz the manager speaks fluent english and organised the pick up from and to the airport and the guide for us in the atlas mountains. All worked like clockwork. Staff is excellent warm hearted and very friendly. My children watched the cook prepare the pancakes for breakfast and had a taster as well. Best breakfast I had in Morocco!  The roof terrace has a small pool with lounges and a resting area very relaxing and beautiful.  Highly recommended would go back there anytime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Mages is a charming and romantic Riad very well located in the old city where they go beyond to make sure you have everything you need. In my case Aziz the manager went to help me negotiate the purchase and design of some Moroccan furniture from a master craftsman who spoke only Arabic. Then he made sure the items were completed as promised as well as arranged for the transport after I had long left the hotel. Nothing is complicated for them and they also know when to leave you alone when you want your privacy. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is recommended.... Job well done.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the first moment we contacted the Riad to book our stay until we left every member of staff was helpful warm and engaging. We booked a driver to collect us from the airport he was on time and easy to spot we even got a mini tour from him as we drove along he pointed out places of interest for us new to the currency we got in a bit of a dither about the tip but he refused it (maybe because we were trying to give him the equivalent of £20?? LOL). We had also booked dinner for the first night...it was huge! And really tasty.  We had the Arabesque suite again beautifully decorated clean and comfortable. There was always a fresh bottle of water put in our room each day too.  As others have said Aziz is the star of the show...when we arrived it was the evening before 'The Feast of the Lamb' the Muslim equivalent to our Christmas he explained all about the holiday gave advise on where to go eat and drink as many places are closed at this time and generally went out of his way to be accommodating in every way. He also arranged for a small fee to get someone to pick up our train tickets to Fes for us so we would have more time to enjoy the city.  Breakfast was lovely especially the fruit cocktails with yoghurt. We would also like to thank the night guardian who was always quick to ensure we had coffee or tea when we got back from our evening of wandering.  All in all there was nothing to find fault with in this lovely riad and we would recommend a stay here to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Harriet M wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Just come back from a four night stay loved the Riad and the staff couldn't have done any more to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Aziz speaks fluent English he gave us helpful advice and directions when we arrived which were invaluable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Incredible Service - hope to visit again soon
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for five nights at the end of September and I cannot recommend it enough. We found the riad through Trip Advisor - it 100% lives up to its great reviews.  We booked our taxi from the airport through the riad and were greeted by a super friendly English-speaking driver who drove us in a comfortable KIA Sorrento to our riad.  Upon arrival Aziz (#2 as he called himself as Aziz #1 was on vacation) sat us down in the courtyard where we were served mint tea and pastries while he talked us through a highlighted map and asked us what we wanted out of our trip. We ended up also booking an Imlil mountain tour through the riad and a half-day camel trip -- both highly recommended.    The first night we were given the suggestion of eating at Cafe Arabe (also a great spot!) and were walked out to the main car park and given directions by the night manager Mouhsin. I was thoroughly impressed that he went to the effort to walk us out of the riad and make sure we didn't get lost.    The staff were incredibly attentive always asking us if we wanted more tea water travel suggestions etc.and always offered us the option of eating in the courtyard or upstairs on the gorgeous rooftop terrace. They knew my boyfriend and I both by name and always asked us how our day went with genuine interest.    The riad is situated in Old Town (the area of Marrakech surrounded by the city walls). My boyfriend and I found it very easy (and safe!) to walk all over Old Town from the riad as it's in a fantastic location for the main sights.    Thank you for a memorable stay - I really hope to visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kevin J wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: This is a wonderful Riad specialising in English visitors in it's 6 rooms. The rooms are well decorated in Moroccan style with a few modern twists. Staff are really really helpful and work hard to make your stay enjoyable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a special trip- our 40th wedding anniversary.  We have not found more attentive staff anywhere than here at this charming comfortable riad. It is well situated and quiet. We adored our suite. From our initial contact by email through to our stay requests for advice on where to visit transport etc nothing has been too much trouble. What a delightful trip this has been.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Luke O wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Silver service dining meets silver service living
Review_Text: If its not the stunningly presented rooms the rooftop oasis or the quiet surroundings that exceed your expectations than the professionally presented and unconditionally attentive Aziz definitely will. After my partner fell ill to a case of the Morroccan tummy misery Aziz was quick to provide us with all the water and toilet paper we needed which is a big thing in Morrocco and allowed us to extend our checkout which was a great help. The breakfast was delicious the shower pressure and temperature was amazing and the complimentary water tea and coffee was well received. I cannot recommend this place more highly!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I stayed here with my partner for his birthday and the staff were amazing! Aziz arranged for a birthday cake for him and even left a bottle of wine and card in his room! The room we stayed in the melchior was beautiful and the riad was so peaceful. The location is perfect only a walk away from the souks and main square. I would definatly recommend this riad to anyone staying in marrakech 10/10!

We stayed in Les Trois Mages for 4 nights and could not recommend it highly enough. One of the aspects we appreciated the most was an introductory talk by Aziz which was invaluable when trying to find our barings in a city which doesn't place a high premium on signposts.  The standard of cleanliness was extremely high the breakfasts were delicious and filling. We particularly liked the fact that we could order poached scrambled eggs etc which we really enjoyed. The staff were always smiling and helpful which we appreciated as Marrakesh is very different from most of the other countries we've visited.  One of our highlights was a recommendation by the riad to have dinner at Dar Zellij which about ten minutes walk away. A footman is sent to collect you and the walk there is absolutely magical as there is no traffic en route and the buildings and streets are hundreds of years old you see Marrakesh as it must have been in the 17th century. The dinner is a set 3 course meal and you can choose to pay either approx £28 or £38 pounds. I won't say anything else other that you're missing out if you don't go for so many reasons. All of the other recommendations for eateries were spot on.  We would not have enjoyed our holiday so much if we didn't have such great advice. Just loved it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our 7 night stay was excellent in every way. Wonderful hospitality from all the team ideal location a jewel amidst manic but mesmerising souks of Marrakech. Thanks to Aziz and staff for a memorable time in your charming riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen P wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: One "must do" on a visit to Marrakech
Review_Text: I am just ending another perfect visit to Riad Les Trois Mages in Marrakech. This is one place that should be on everyone's bucket list. A visit here is a chance to live in a traditional riad as opposed to an impersonal luxury hotel or even many other riads which are too modern in style to be cosy and welcoming. Here the rooms are traditionally decorated the riad is small so all guests get to meet over breakfast or on the roof terrace if they want but there is room for all to have their own personal space too. Breakfast is pretty much whatever you like and dietary requirements are catered for as well. Any other meals can be ordered daily and are prepared individually. The staff are delightful and nothing is too much trouble. There must be a reason I have returned 6 or 7 times.........
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Amazing - at any time we could request a hot or cold drink! We often enjoyed a pot of tea after finding our way through the vendors to get back to the Riad. Cold beer or wine is also served.  Staff are really responsive to any need and smile all the time.  One night we had dinner on the roof terrace - very pleasant. Breakfast is plentiful and fresh    The pool is only a few feet deep so only suitable to wet oneself.    Room are large and arranged around the central courtyard.    Large lounge area downstairs with interesting books and well chosen background music playing.. A second relaxing area has a piano and guitar just beckoning someone to play them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Harriet R wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Fabulous riad the staff were really friendly and knowledgable about the surrounding area. Great that they all spoke great English for us too. They provided some great recommendations of local places to go for lunch dinner and drinks which were all fabulous. Would definitely recommend. No reservations at all!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Milena R wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: I cannot praise this riad enough! It is well worth 5+ stars. Lovely decorations and atmosphere warm welcoming. The staff was outstanding - catering to all our needs providing us with useful navigation info through Marrakech; breakfast was delicious and freshly prepared. Wish we could have stayed longer and taken a cooking class. Will not hesitate to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Les Trois Mages and genuinely cannot rate it highly enough. We were immediately made to feel welcome by Aziz the manager who provided excellent information on local attractions/navigating the crazy world of the Medina/haggling/restaurants.... All the staff were friendly and helpful constantly making sure you had everything you needed. We stayed in the Bahia Suite which was exquisite. The entire Riad is beautifully decorated with so many lovely touches. The terrace and pool were a very welcome relaxation area. If you are travelling to Marrakech I honestly would suggest you stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the second we turned up in this wonderful peaceful oasis we felt totally at home. Food was fantastic - especially the fish & morocan salads - we only ordered enough for 1 but it was more than enough for 2! Bahia suit superb - absolutely no complaints at all. Staff - Aziz Saida Laila Moushine - wonderful.    Breakfast massive! If you want to order dinner ensure you order it at breakfast or else you may be out of luck.    Get dinner on the pool terrace at 8 pm - listen to the call to prayer - amazing.    Make sure you take the guided tour round the souk if you are unsure of the layout. He saves you money by doing the bartering for you & takes you to the non-tourist part which is cheaper.    Take pre-loaded travel cash card (eg from post office) as so easy to get money out from ATMs - plenty of them about & better rate than the bank.    Roof top pool an absolute dream you can get a bottle of beer in the Rhiad for 25 Dirhams & wine for 120 (approx 13 to the £).    If you miss TV take your ipad as wifi is free. Lovely outside areas to read or even play piano in.    Aziz can order you taxis from & too the airport (150 Dirhams). Main souk about 10 mins walk. Get the preserved lemons & Ras El Hanout!    Would not hesitate to go back.    Thank you Aziz!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lived up to all our hopes and wishes
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped inside to the moment we left Les Trois Mages and especially it's friendly staff (every one of them) made our stay in Marrakech a wonderful experience. Our room was beautiful and we were looked after so well. The rooftop pool area was so relaxing. We would not hesitate about going back. We stayed in a few different riads on this holiday to Morocco and Les Trois Mages stands out as a very special place to stay- luxurious and at the same time homely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and when we arrived the manager spent quite a bit of time walking us through a map of Marrakech and suggesting things to see. The breakfasts (included) were great too! We'd definitely stay there again.

Review_Title: great riad, with plenty of nice touches to make it a great place to stay
Review_Text: after visiting a number of riads on our trip this was a great riad to stay at last. With free refreshments it meant we had Moroccan tea and water on tap. room had A/C great en suite and little touches that made you feel as home like sheet and duvet if you required.    great restaurants recommended the only disappointment was Aziz the fluent English speaker host was only about on our last night to discuss payment and airport transports. The staff although not all fluent English speakers worked hard and were welcoming and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ben B wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Title: Beautiful boutique riad (garden based house) very centrally located
Review_Text: Really lovely hotel - helpful and friendly staff lovely rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and definitely will recommend it to others. Plenty of nice little touches and the roof even had a nice little pool (more a for a dip that laps!).    Location is good - it is a short walk to the central areas but feels a little calmer than those areas; don't be alarmed as you approach the hotel - the area might not look the best but it seemed safe to us and we didn't feel nervous going back late at night.    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bath Preservation Trust wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed for 5 nights and celebrated a 50th birthday. We could not have been happier with our choice of riad selected because of the plunge pool on the roof and the excellent reviews. Aziz and his team really are the perfect hosts making you feel at home and providing every sort of information required to make the stay completely stress-free. We wandered in to the kitchen to help ourselves to ice drinks or plates etc and loved the laughing ladies who cooked and served the meals. Breakfasts are substantial but with a range of options and each day we explored the city full of energy after the comforts of the room and refreshments. On our last night we requested an evening meal and ate it on the roof under the floating linen hangings over a low table and soft calico sofas. It could not have been more perfect - with fading heat and the mesmeric call to prayer at dusk. We were privileged to have stayed during Ramadan and felt honoured to witness the riad staff - and the whole city - observing the strictures of this festival.    We did not visit any other riads but spoke to other guests who had transferred to Les Trois Mages after being dissappointed with their first choice. We could see that nothing was too much trouble to arrange and the graciousness with which Aziz and team operate is humbliing. We could not recommend more highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Leslie G wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: An Oasis in the middle of Marrakech Madness
Review_Text: We had the most amazing time here. Aziz the manager arranged for a taxi to collect us at the airport and deliver us practically to the door. At the riad we were greeted with mint tea and pastries and Aziz spent a good half hour giving us an orientation - pointing out on a map some sights to see how to get to the souks and the square and even gave us a few tips on bargaining.    The riad itself is a dream - between our gorgeous and comfy room (Jasmine) the rooftop oasis and its pool and the wonderful music room and its mini-library we often found it hard to tear ourselves away to see the incredible city of Marrakech. As for the location all the major sights are within an easy walk - the square and souks are about ten minutes away depending on how long it takes you to make your way through the hordes of friendly Moroccans stopping you to say hello (and detour you through the tanneries - be firm!).    The food at the riad was excellent. Saida is brilliant cook and the meals we had here were excellent value and as good as the posh restaurant we went to on our last night.    Finally if you have time do look into the excursions offered by the riad. We went on a tour of the Berber villages and our guide Mohammed was friendly well-informed and delightful company.    We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aliza M wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: This was by far the best and most beautiful riad we visited. The management and staff were so incredibly friendly and accommodating - even leaving the read to pick up a pizza for us. We were looking for a driver to drive us to the Casablanca airport in the middle of the night and the management arranged everything for us! They even let us stay at the riad during the day after check-out. Everything was so clean and beautiful. There are multiple eating areas and food is excellent. They also allow guests go into the kitchen at any time and grab free bottled water. The pool is beautiful and there are amazing cushioned pool chairs to lay on. There are also multiple instruments (including a piano) and beautiful areas outside your room you can hang out in. Definitely a five star experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The Three Wise Men of Marrakech
Review_Text: Les Trois Mages is really special. Recommended to us by Rachel Blech from SheherazadVentures this riad is in the heart of the medina and beautifully appointed with rooms named after the three wise men – we stayed in Balthazar the wise Arabian scholar (we couldn’t find the 12 litre bottle of champagne of the same title though the ‘wine did floweth’ at dinner earlier). The colours fabrics and furniture along with gold fittings in the bathroom made us feel fully indulged! We made friends at dinner including the owners Annamay from Donegal and her partner Tony and the tagine of fresh fish cooked by ‘in-house’ cook Saida was simply sublime. The riad is full of surprises on the roof terrace there is a swimming pool and snug chill-out zones and off the central courtyard there is a music room with piano and assorted instruments – the perfect party room. We experienced a very warm welcome great generosity and hospitality. We want to go back again and again. We can think of nowhere better to stay (and have a party!) when in Marrakech.    Declan and Angela.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was my second stay at the Riad Les Trois Mages and it was just as beautiful as I remembered. This time I was eager to share it with my girlfriends so for a small extra cost three of us slept in the Melchoir room. My friends were absolutely delighted with the Riad: from the roof terrace to the music room absolutely everything is as pictured - if not better! Breakfast is plentiful and fresh and the lunch absolutely fantastic - some of the best food we had out there.    Where the riad comes into its own is the staff. Aziz was absolutely wonderful in welcoming us providing a very detailed and clear map - if we could follow it anyone can! Nothing was too much trouble and the complementary mint tea is always a bonus. I unfortunately became ill on my last night - and the women on duty took the best care of me. Fresh honey and orange water was delivered to my door slices of orange to suck on iced flannels and a huge fan - everything someone with heat stroke could possibly desire/need was delivered to me without fuss/extra cost. I couldn't be more thankful.    We went on the guided tour something which we found both fascinating and informative - and had dinner every night in the square. The highlight of the trip for me has to be our hammam experience at the Heritage Spa. It is also worth visiting the Henna Cafe (which is near the spa) as it not only does fantastic food and henna which is the authentic brown (not black and cheap like in the square) but is also a non profit organisation for those in need. As a group of three female 20 year olds we were worried that we would be a target for trouble. And whilst we were a subject of great attention never once did I fear for my safety.    I would 100% recommend this Riad to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Cant recommend this Riad enough.. We stayed 5 nights in total- 2 nights and then another 3 at the end of our trip. staff are seriously friendly- and knowledgable and kind. Breakfasts are great- have it on the rooftop terrace and its just perfect- fresh fruit juice yoghurt pancakes some days fresh bread eggs quite flexible.. and served with a smile.  we did the atlas mountains trip through them- had a great day with Mohammed he was also super- had a great day. would recommend that. we did some transfers with them too- to Essaoira and also the airport- again- professional and good service.  Kitchen is always open- guests are welcome to get water anytime from the fridge and let them know if you need anything else.  Position is good- about 10mins walk max to the beginning of the markets and a little convenience store very close by.  rooms are beautiful- we stayed in 3 different rooms thanks to a kind upgrade:) all were special though and i think any room here would be lovely. All clean and very well decorated.  enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stay here and go on their guided tours
Review_Text: We arrived by train from Casablanca and asked Aziz the manager to arrange transportation to the Riad. We would never have found it without the driver. We had prearranged a tour of the High Atlas Mountains on our first day. Mohammad was an excellent driver and was originally from the Berbers. He told us stories about life there and about life in Morocco. We went on a Tuesday and stopped at a local souk. They slaughter the goats sheep and other animals that day. The produce was exceptional. The sights and smells of the souk were wonderful. People park their donkeys in the back. We also stopped for a tour of a local Berber home with a great shop nearby. The mint tea is truly delicious. Normally I like basic tea but was surprised I liked this tea. We ate lunch by a river and it was delicious. I would recommend taking a half day tour of the medina. Our guide was very informative and helped us barter and took us all through the souks. He showed us landmarks to follow so we wouldn't get lost. The third day we took a tour to the Atlantic seaport town of Essaouira. We had our driver from the first day. It is a wonderful laid back town as compared to Marrakech. Mohammad stopped at a women's cooperative for Argan oil. They showed us how Argan oil is made. We couldn't resist stocking up! Also we stopped to see the goats in the Argan tree. An amazing sight. Another stop was at a thuya wood store. The pieces are beautiful! Our rooms at the Riad were simply charming. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were spacious. Each room has its own style and charm. It is wonderful not to have a tv but there is free Wifi access. Water tea coffee and a very delicious breakfast is complimentary. There is an area on the rooftop for relaxing under umbrellas or dangling your legs in the pool. Aziz and staff really want the guests to have a good experience at their Riad. It is truly relaxing here. We ate dinner one night and the grilled fish was delicious. The location is excellent and there is a grocery store within easy walking.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Having stopped at this riad for 3 days in June I can highly recommend it.  The staff are very helpful showing you the maps of marrakesh & will even show you how to get about.  The breakfast is very good fresh fruit pancakes eggs bread etc.  when returning from a day out they would always offer you a cold bottle of water which can be a god send.  One last thing is the pool is a godsend. I would return here without hesitation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A perfect place to stay when visiting Marrakesh.
Review_Text: We have just returned from a short stay at Les Trois Mages. We were there to see the sights of Marrakesh and celebrate a 30th birthday. The riad is a lovely oasis to retreat to when the heat gets too much!  All the rooms are beautifully decorated comfortable and spotlessly clean. Aziz and his team went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay and nothing seemed to be too much trouble.  A good breakfast set us up for a day of sightseeing and an evening meal on the roof terrace was very special.  The riad is well located for the souks and good restaurants are a short walk away.  A lovely place to stay.

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and cool.
Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of May and loved it.    The staff were amazing by far the most helpful we've ever experienced and everything else from the rooms to the food and the upstairs terrace and pool were perfect.    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Perrine R wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: What a lovely place to stay to visit Marrakech. Thé rooms are pretty large well decorated and really clean! The atmosphere is really peaceful and the staff is keen on giving advices to make your staying as perfect as possible. The swimming pool on the roof is a bless!  Finally the breakfast is really good:fresh fruits morocan pancakes bread honey jam...  Many thanks to Les 3 mages! We'll definitly go back to this Ryad whenever we visit Marrakech again!

What a wonderful Riad in peace and tranquility beautifully decorated throughout. Rooms spacious and airy including bathrooms. A delightful roof top terrace complete with a small pool just what you need after a busy day shopping.  The staff were all very friendly and welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. A very big thank you to Mousin who served us a fabulous dinner on roof terrace complete with red table cloth and roses. Will be recommending this wonderful Riad to all our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A really tastefully developed Riad in the heart of Marrakech thoughtfully done great pool area on the roof most importantly really genuinely nice staff who gave effortlessly good service with nothing being too much trouble couldn't recommend highly enough.  Some pointers on Marrakech not of all which were obvious from pre-trip research:  Buy drinks Duty Free local drinks can be bought from supermarket but are expensive branded drinks are very expensive. You can wear shorts ( men ) ladies take some care. Final point: Random acts of kindness are very unlikely to be so be warned no matter how much on guard you are there will be someone with a very convincing story ready to offer you help. Do not fall for it ( we did....) ! Don't look lost go into a shop and ask for help if you need it !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: victoria l wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Very helpful staff everything done for you. We had dinner on the roof it was truly a magical experance and the food amazing.  The pool was a life saver due to the very high temp for the time of year.  Very easy to get to the souk and square.  All rooms were beautiful  Cant wait to go again in september longer stay this time
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A sanctuary in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Fantastic riad delicious traditional food welcoming and attentive staff.  The raid is a most welcome sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech. The rooms are great with AC for when it gets really hot in the city! The rooftop terrace and pool was a fantastic place to settle down after tackling the souks and the main square. The riad itself is a very easy to follow 5 minute walk from the main square.  Aziz and the rest of the staff were fantastic catering for all our needs providing advice and even making our bookings for us. We could not have asked for more from them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew F wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Tranquility in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Les trois mages is well located just a short walk from the souks and from there to Djema el Fna. Yet as soon as Aziz welcomed us we entered a world of calm and tranquility. The ground floor has a lovely airy courtyard surrounded by comfortable lounging areas. We very much enjoyed breakfast on the lovely roof terrace and the room and bathroom were spacious and cool. The shower was good and the bed was the most comfortable we experienced in Morocco. Best of all Aziz and his team are so helpful and kind. A great find.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: STEVEJ R wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the riad for 4 days during april/may 2014. it has a perfect location in the heart of the medina 5min from the souks and close to the main square and the many restaurants. The riad itself is wonderful we had a wonderful room and the rooftop terrace with the pool was the perfect place to relax and chillout after the bustle of marrakech. Aziz and the rest of the staff were perfect hosts and made us very welcome arranging day trips and taxis for us without any problems at all they even left my girlfriend a card and flowers in the room for her birthday which was nice.The inclusive breakfast was delicous and fresh. We both would highly recommend this riad to anyone looking for a place to stay in marrakech. Many thanks to aziz and the team for a lovely stay. steve and helenswanseauk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Experience the life of an Arabian Princess or Prince!
Review_Text: This is a 5 star Riad - from the location of the Riad the clean and beautifully decorated rooms to the home cooked tangias and of course the helpful and friendly staff. If you want an elegant Moroccan experience and to experience a day in the life of an Arabian princess... stay at this Riad!    We traveled from London to Marrakech and stayed for 4 days. From the moment we booked to after we arrived back in London Aziz and Mousin (the hotel managers and super stars) took fantastic care of us. They were just wonderful - organising taxis for us and ensuring our comfort and safety at all times (we are two female travellers). The owners happened to be staying at the Riad that week and they were warm and extremely helpful. One of them is a talented pianist and it was a pleasure to hear him play!    We read the reviews before we booked this Riad - all the positive comments are true. Lovely breakfasts on the roof top terrace the roof top pool and sun beds to take in the sun quiet and spacious rooms rooms for reading and relaxing off the atrium... a perfect place to relax.    We are so glad that we stayed here and will be recommending this place to all our family and friends.    Thanks Anna Aziz and Mousin!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Peace and quiet in the bustling Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: An authentic Riad in the heart of the Medina. Unpretentious and original with friendly and attentive staff for whom nothing was a trouble. Unusually for a Riad the pool was on the roof terrace which makes it more user-friendly rather than the more usual ground floor plunge pool. A comfortable base from which you can explore the Medina Marrakech and places beyond. The manager Aziz was extremely helpful in arranging dinner reservations and taxis with reputable operators.  All-in-all a delightful restful and authentic Moroccan vacation enhanced by a warm welcome and charming staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A haven of peace amongst colourful bustle
Review_Text: A beautiful Riad in the midst of the old Medina. Beautifully furnished and decorated with wonderfully relaxing rooms and open spaces the roof terrace in particular with the pool a heavenly place to relax and recuperate after a hectic day in the souks. The staff are without exceptional wonderfully attentive without ever being intrusive and nothing is too much trouble. Assif is a mine of knowledge and will find arrange and advise on all matters to perfection. Please visit this wonderful Riad if you are thinking of visiting Marrakech I promise you won't regret it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed here last year (sorry for the late review). The Riad is an oasis within busy Marrakech and lovely to come back to after a day out sight seeing. We stayed in the lovely large Bahia suite. The Riad itself is charming with many different seating areas to make you feel as if you had the place to yourself. Loved the roof terrace where we had a quiet afternoon reading dozing and cooling off in the plunge pool. We had dinner here on our first night and food was the most delicious we had during our trip. I highly recommend a half or full day guided tour of Marrakech as soon as you arrive. Apart from learning about historic sites and places of interest within the old town which you may otherwise miss if you were on your own it was useful having the guide to help us gain our bearings and point out landmarks so we could navigate our own way in the coming days on our own. Overall fab time at this Charming Riad which I would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely riad in Marrkaesh although I struggled to find it - the location on Google maps is not where it's actually located it's a few streets away so a local boy offered to help me find it but then got irate when I didn't have enough to give him as I didn't have any coins left. The owner of the riad was kind enough to give him something though.    The room was beautiful and Aziz was lovely ensuring I had some tea and cake upon arrival. It was a shame that I was there for only one night and had an early flight the next day as I didn't get there until late afternoon.    I booked an early taxi for my morning flight with Aziz and asked for a wake up reminder just in case I slept through my alarm but didn't get the reminder so luckily I didn't sleep through. Also I had to wake up the night watchman in the morning and then I started to panic when the taxi driver wasn't at the hotel to escort me to the taxi (I was too scared to hunt out a taxi in the dark in the early hours of the morning) but the night watchman took me to him as the taxi driver too was asleep and not answering his mobile.    I was meant to travel with my husband but he couldn't make it at the last minute so I think if I was travelling on my own I'd stay a bit closer to the town centre as I felt a bit freaked out dragging my suitcase around and not finding the riad's location when I was on my own but the room and the riad itself was lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Just spent three nights and very pleased with our choice. Good location - easily reached from bus station or taxi. Easy walk into centre of Medina. Very helpful staff - lots of advice upon arrival and tea/coffee/water available all the time. Lovely roof terrace for relaxation and plenty of restaurants to choose from.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Charming ambience wonderful service (Aziz was a standout in Morocco for help) and the food was amazing. The Fresh squeezed OJ in the mornings with special crepes were wonderful. Dinners were among he best we had in Morocco. Room was large and reasonably quiet. Cozy places to relax and the rooftop warm pool was a welcome relief from chaotic busy days in medina or touring. Located in the heart of the action. Staff are all welcoming and wonderful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed in Les Trois Mages for 5 nights. From the very start all the staff were extremely helpful and made us feel at home and looked after. The riad is an oasis of calm is beautifully decorated and has lots of communal areas to sit and relax. Our room (Bahia suite) was stunning. The location was also good as we were about a 20 min walk from the main square with lots of shops and places to eat along the way. There is also a lovely little plunge pool to relax in on the roof. We loved the city and loved having our riad as a little haven to come back to and relax. They also helped with booking our excursions/restaurants etc and nothing was ever too much to ask. Thank you so much to  Aziz Mouhsine and the ladies for looking after us so well!

My husband and I stayed in the Bahia Suite for 5 nights and loved every moment! The Riad is fantastic and although located inside the walls of the medina it is very quiet and peaceful inside. Aziz and his team couldn't have been more accommodating. All very friendly and Aziz even walked with us on our first day to get some lunch so we didn't get lost. I would certainly recommend this place to others and we would definitely stay here again. The roof terrace and pool were our afternoon favourites after being out all day. Would also recommend to do the half day guided tour the riad offers around the souks - was vey helpful as it was our first trip to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosita R wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: Fell in love with this place!
Review_Text: Aziz was a great host - gave me advice told me where to go helped me out with a very decent tour and most of all was a great guy.  Being a lone traveller at times is a bit daunting so it definitely helped to have him there.    The place itself is great very clean & cosy and a lovely roof terrace for late night drinking. I can't recommend the place anymore.  Thanks again for making my week extra special Aziz  Rosita
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Richard T wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: Can't recommend Les Trois Mages highly enough. From the seamless collection at the airport to the delicious breakfasts on the roof terrace the service was impeccable. Aziz the manager looked after us really well and made sure we had everything we needed as well as giving us good local knowledge and advice. The Riad is decorated beautifully throughout. The bedrooms are lovely and the relaxation areas and roof terrace are perfect for spending a few peaceful hours. It was about 35C when we went so having the small roof pool was an added bonus.    We did eat in for lunch and the food was good but there are some nice restaurants nearby (10 min walk) that we would recommend. Le Jardin Restaurant had a lovely peaceful atmosphere and great food. Le Terrace Des Epice was quite cool - food was ok but not great. Le Tobsil was our favourite (pricey but very good)    We had a guide (Mohammed) on the first day to show us round the souk. Good way to get your bearings early on and we can also highly recommend Mohammed as a guide. We took our daughter who was 14 and enjoyed the whole experience but not sure I would take kids much younger unless they were used to exotic travel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: This is the place to stay
Review_Text: From the first e-mail acknowledging our booking to the dinner on our final night the service and attention to detail was superb. An 11 bedroom Riad it has a small staff who are all friendly competent and become well known to the guests.. They remember your preferences and are always available. The location on the edge of the old town is good and the public rooms and bedrooms are beautifully furnished in Moroccan style. There is free Wi-Fi. The breakfasts are generous and the dinner we had on our last night was excellent. .Bedrooms on the first floor are varied and quite private. Some are on the ground floor adjacent to the public space so meeting your fellow guests is usual. There is a terrace with a small pool. We visited in March so a bit too early in the year to breakfast there We all loved our stay and would strongly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: frank h wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: Just spent 8 nights at 3Mages. Great service from everybody - lovely breakfasts and dinners on the nights we ate "in". It's amazing that the place can be so quiet and comfortable considering the situation. A few steps from the front door your are In The hustle and bustle of daily life in the Medina. Being a bit older than the average guest (we are in our 80's) we were happy to spend our mornings on the roof terrace and then go out for lunch and to explore. It has to be said that Moroccan food offers limited choices for a long stay and we tried to eat somewhere different most nights. La Bagatelle and the Rotisserie both in Rue Yugoslavie in the new town were really nice and reasonably priced. For our last night Mamounia - about £60 per head but good food luxurious surroundings and friendly service - almost as good as Les Trois Mages!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The location about 15 mins walk from the main square was just about right for us giving an interesting walk in to souk area.  The decor of the rooms was stunning and atmospheric giving a true flavour of Marrakech.  However where this place really scores is it's staff from the manager Asis down to the cooks who prepare breakfast nothing is too much trouble.  Mint tea is on tap throughout the day to wash the dust of the city away. Breakfast is tasty and a good fuel-up preparing you for forays in to the souk and beyond.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I enjoyed a wonderful 3 nights at the Raid this March.    Nothing was ever too much for the brilliant staff who looked after us with such diligence. Aziz in particular was a star.    The beautiful building in great upkeep was clean cosy and most welcoming. The downstairs lounges are spacious and provide a calm environment from the hustle of the Medina the roof terrace and pool likewise.    We stayed in the Jade room and it was perfect; 4 poster bed great shower a safe and plenty of space.    Breakfast on the terrace was tasty and very hearty delicious local pastries with fresh yoghurt fruit and the best orange juice.    Easily accessible to both the souks and the nearby Majorelle gardens plus drivers can take you close by in a cab very handy when tired!    We recommend doing a cookery class run by the Riad so much fun to go to the market and source ingredients and then make your delicious lunch.    Thanks again to the team at les 3 Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely riad in the northern end of the medina
Review_Text: We only stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages for one night after a desert tour before heading home early the next morning so we didn't have much time to fully enjoy this lovely riad. We had the two rooms on the ground floor which were colorful and comfortable. The architecture of our room was a little tricky in that there were several different steps of varying heights between the bedroom sitting area and bathroom which was a bit challenging in the dark. Off the main courtyard were two lovely living areas one blue room with a player piano and the other red room with a fireplace that was lit in the evening. There were lots of books and games available for guests to use. Being late March the weather was just right so we didn't have to bother with either heat or AC.    I read some of the other comments about noise of other guests.
