This is a natural effect of all the riads we stayed in -- with rooms surrounding a center courtyard hearing the sounds of other guests who are up later or earlier will inevitably filter through to your room. Although I did not need them at Trois Mages I keep earplugs handy for those situations which can also help with the early call to prayer especially if you are a light sleeper.    We had dinner at the riad which I would highly recommend. I had a delicious vegetable soup while the others enjoyed the briouats -- stuffed pastries. For a main meal my husband and I shared a delicious beef tanjia served with vegetables and my daughter and her friend shared an enormous chicken pastilla.    We were traveling with 3 sixteen year old girls who were anxious to get back to the Jemaa El Fna square for one last walk around and some more henna (we spent a week in Marrakech before the desert tour). I was reluctant at first as the riad is a bit to the north. However it felt good to walk and didn't really take that long -- maybe 15-20 minutes. It is actually a pretty straight shot to get there once you know the way and Aziz was very helpful supplying us with a map and making sure we knew the landmarks.    We arose early to a delicious breakfast of eggs different breads fresh squeezed orange juice and coffee. My only regret is that we didn't have enough time to really get to know the people and the riad. We loved Marrakech so maybe we'll be back one day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Amanda M wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Had a wonderful time at the Riad! We arrived late on a Saturday night were welcomed by the night guardian who served us mint tea in the lounge and recommended a nearby restaurant for dinner. He was extremely helpful and walked us part of the way there as Marrakech is a very easy place to get lost in!    The riad is very well cared for with several beautiful sitting areas and a lovely rooftop terrace where we had breakfast each morning. The manager Aziz was so helpful and friendly. He made reservations for us for dinner made recommendations on places to visit and sat with us several times just to chat and tell us about the area. He made us feel very at home!    We also took a cooking class with the riad's chef Saida. It was an unbelievable experience! We started by going to the market with her to buy ingredients for our lunch it is truly amazing to see her haggle with the vendors over the beautiful fresh ingredients on their carts. After shopping we went back to the riad where we prepared our lunch in the courtyard...briouats (shredded vegetables wrapped in pastry and fried) and a chicken tagine with preserved lemon olives and vegetables. Saida was very instructive and such a joy to work with!    The riad is very well situated a 10 minute walk to the souks about a half hour walk to the new town and very near several excellent restaurants. Very highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laura Wheeler wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Riad Les Trois Mages for the 2nd time and was certainly not disappointed. I have been to Marrakech several times but after finding this place last year I didn’t feel the need to consider any other accommodation for this trip. This year I travelled as part of a group of 4 (2 couples) and had just as amazing a time as I did with just my mother last year.    I don’t want to repeat what so many others have already said so will merely reiterate the key points: beautiful riad great location lovely rooms stunning terrace and pool but most of all amazing staff! Aziz and the whole team were just perfect they made our trip.    As many people have mentioned before the riad is very peaceful and quiet and being a group of 4 we were very conscious of not wanting to disturb the other guests or to take over. That said we were all in desperate need of relaxation and so chose to spend a lot of our time relaxing in the riad in between popping out for meals and sightseeing. Being such a small riad it is hard not to take over but the staff couldn’t have been friendlier and more understanding –we were continually offered tea coffee and water even though we spent most of our time upstairs on the terrace (we did feel guilty and tried to help with the carrying of trays up and down the stairs)!    Thanks for having us and we look forward to returning next year :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Just had a 3 night break in Marrakech and stayed in this wonderful Riad. The accommodation itself was lovely and had everything we needed and the food (and wine) was good too. However it was the staff that really made it such a superb stay. Everyone from the kitchen staff to Aziz the Manager were friendly and helpful and seemed to want to make our stay as enjoyable as possible - which they did. We had Morrocan tea and pastries upon our arrival and while we were waiting for our taxi to the airport on our last day they brought us tea and cake (just out of the oven - delicious). The breakfasts were excellent and two of the mornings we were offered breakfast on the wonderful roof terrace despite this meaning the staff had to trail up a long flight of stairs with several courses no-one seemed to mind in the slightest. We booked a day excursion via Aziz to the Ourika Valley in the Atlas Mountains which I would highly recommend and our driver was really friendly and good fun and provided us with lots of information about the region. Aziz also recommended several great restaurants (the best by far was 'Le Comptoir') booked us a table and transport to and from - we didn't need to do a thing. Overall we had a fabulous trip and very much enjoyed staying in this oasis of calm in a sea of chaos.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I have just spent three nights at the Riad les Trois Mages then three nights in Essaoiura and back to Les Trois Mages for our last night. Our time in this Riad was just prefect. From the moment we arrived Aziz made every possible effort to make sure our every need was met and spent much time explaining all we needed to know in order to enjoy Marakesh The rooms were beautiful clean and full of Morrocan character especially the suite in which we spent our last night. All the staff were smiley and extremely helpful nothing too much trouble even when walking up to the terrace laden with the lovely breakfasts we enjoyed in the morning sunshine. We so enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay. Aziz and all of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. I would not hesitate to book this Riad again. It was a place of calm in a very busy setting. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and 12 other friends stayed at the Riad Trois Mages from March 7th to 10th. Our stay was simply flawless. The Riad is beautiful clean well organized and with all commodities. However what really made the difference was the kindness professionalism and eagerness to do the right thing displayed by the host. Aziz and the team are simply amazing. They made us feel so much at ease and made the whole stay a pure bliss.  The food at the Riad was prepared on site and was simply delicious. This goes from the fresh danishes and pancakes made by the cook for breakfast to the beautiful dinner we had on the Saturday.  Overall I could not fault anything and I will heartwarmingly recommend the Riad to anyone interested in spending a great time with friends amongst beautiful surroundings and friendly people!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Wonderful stay, highly recommended, amazing staff
Review_Text: I wanted to start this review by saying a huge thank you to Aziz the Manager who could not do enough for us during our 3 night stay at this wonderful Riad.    We hired the whole Riad as a group of friends. The rooms were clean well equipped and well designed.    The Riad staff made us breakfast lunch and dinner and the food was beautiful they bent over backwards to ensure we had a good stay recommending other restaurants and organising a tour of the Medina as well as airport transfers.    The roof top terrace was gorgeous with lots of seating areas and a small swimming pool. There were two seating areas on the ground floor which had books and board games and a piano.    Our flight wasn't until the evening but we were allowed to stay beyond the check out time and were given free Moroccan tea and biscuits such a lovely touch that you don't find in corporate hotels.    The bathrooms had free toiletries beautifully designed in the Moroccan style. The rooms don't have a TV but this was welcomed as it meant we could just enjoy ourselves and forget about work and home for a few days.    I highly recommend this Riad I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Again a huge thank you to Aziz and his colleagues for making our trip a memorable one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Another world through the door in the wall
Review_Text: We have just returned from a wonderful four day stay at this Riad and would thoroughly recommend it. From the moment we stepped through the door we felt at home and welcomed we ate at the Riad on our first evening and the meal was very good the breakfasts were also excellent freshly squeezed orange juice warm rolls pancakes and home made jam you could also have eggs cooked to your liking. The Staff are all lovely Aziz was so helpful in organising excursions for us and airport transport we felt so well supported. My husband had his birthday while we were there and they kindly gave him a card and gift it was such a lovely touch all in all a very nurturing experience lovely staff lovely rooms lovely Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: francoise d wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: A small very friendly well-run Riad. A warm and welcoming atmosphere. A very nice decor in keeping with Maroccan style and tradition. The room was very clean and the water hot. We only took one meal but it was very tasty specially the homemade apple tart.  Great breakfast.  Wish we could have stayed a few more days.    Francoise
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kate S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: I stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages last May for a Hen Weekend. We couldn’t have picked a better place. The staff and facilities were amazing. The Riad was completely authentic with spacious bedrooms and a beautiful (well needed) roof top pool. We had dinner at the Riad on our first night which was a real welcoming to Marrakesh. Absolutely delicious. I couldn’t fault this Riad in anyway. Even though it was a 20min walk from the 'main town' I prefered being just outside of the main hustle and bustle and enjoyed walking in taking Marrakesh in.  I've been to Marrakesh a few times and would recommed this over 4/5 star hotels. If you're going to Marrakesh you need to do it properly and stay here.  Have a will continue to recommend this Riad to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lucinda B wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: A drop of tranquility in a bustling city.
Review_Text: We stayed at Le Trois Mages for 2 nights and cannot fault it. Every member of staff were kind and helpful always willing to being complimentary teas coffees and water. There are only 6 bedrooms and so the hotel has an intimate family feel at the same time as having complete respect for your privacy. The night manager was there to greet us as we returned from dinner each night and although the Riad can't serve alcohol the honesty bar was always available!  We spent our Sunday cooking with Saima an amazing woman who guided us through the food markets in order to buy the produce for lunch we then proceeded to cook Tagine and couscous dished which we then enjoyed with a glass of wine up on the roof terrace.  Loved the stay and would thoroughly recommend a stay here....the hotel is a little tricky to find first off so I would suggest looking at a map before arriving as the road is not accessible by taxi so you need to be dropped off at the top of the road about a 100m walk to the front door.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tracy T wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Our stay at Les Trois Mages was wonderful! The Riad itself was beautiful; our bedroom was lovely and peaceful. The breakfasts were very tasty fresh and filling. We also ate our evening meal there three times and each time it was gorgeous! Thank you so much to all the lovely kind staff. Aziz the Manager was always very attentive for anything we needed (which included numerous pots of tea!) Moussine who was on hand during the evening and first thing in the morning to look after the Riad. Saida the cook and the other ladies who all worked so hard at making our stay as enjoyable as possible. Nothing was any trouble and our stay exceeded our expectations. We stayed here for 4 nights and by the time we were due to go to the airport we didn't want to leave! This was our first visit to Morroco and we were so glad to have chosen here to stay as it has been so memorable. We will definitely choose to stay here again and next time we visit our daughters would like to stay too!    Tracy and Eamon Tansey
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tiffany W wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: The riad was beautiful even better than the pictures. Breakfast was delicious every morning and the dinner we had one night was one of the best meals we had!  The thing that stands out the most for the riad is the staff. Everyone was wonderful and so attentive. Aziz however went above and beyond.  I left my iPhone in the room at checkout and when we were on the plane heading to Spain he emailed twice asking if we were still here and if we could come back to get the phone. We couldn't unfortunately so he mailed the phone to my home in the US using HIS OWN MONEY. I don't think any American or European hospitality worker would have done that without hesitation. I cannot thank him enough.  The staff here are truly second to none.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tamara B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages and picked this riad because of the excellent reviews we read how right they were and more!! The Riad provides peace & tranquility from the sensory overload that is Marrakesh!  The rooms are beautiful and bed was very comfy the staff went out of their way to make us welcome and nothing was too much trouble this combined with a fabulous breakfast taken on the sun terrace every morning and some great restaurants for our evening meal made our 4 day break memorable and a fantastic experience. :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daman Chugh wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Went with friends and the property is lovely and so are the people. Night guard Moushine is a top lad he was so polite and helpful at all times.    Breakfast was amazing and they took note of every little details so if you wanted a certain thing a certain way they made sure the following days it was done without having to ask for it.    Moushine went out of his way to help us get food one night also when we were using the lounge he lit the fire and kept checking every hour to see if it needed more logs.    If i ever go Marrakech again will book no other RIad but Les Trois Mages. Top work guys you made our trip even better.    Daman
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Mouhsin the night staff person and Aziz the manager went out of their way to help us when we had a baggage issue and when one of us fell sick -- they were so generous and concerned Mouhsin went hunting for a large bag for us and came back after an hour; Aziz took care of my friend when she fell sick. You won't find this kind of personal kindness and out-of-the-way gestures in hotels in Europe or the United States.  The room we stayed in had windows that opened on to the courtyard -- the top half was covered by glass and the bottom had no window bars so we had to keep them closed. That was the only downside we could see about the riad that our room felt stuffy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Steph P wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: What a blissful little hideaway from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. From the rooftop terrace to the AMAZING service provided by Aziz and the team (they literally cannot do enough for you) this was just the best break away. If you're contemplating a stay in Marrakech 100% recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Claire B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: When going away I usually book a big hotel and go via a travel agent. This time we sought advice from Trip Advisor and we were so glad we did. Les Trois Mages offers a service that I have never experienced. Pure excellence! Just having 6 bedrooms you are treated to such a personal experience and made to feel like royalty. The staff are so attentive and kind. You arrive with a huge welcome and fresh mint tea and a complete explanation as to what you can expect from the area regarding trips and excursions that are available along with great recommendations from previous holiday makers. Aziz makes sure you are collected from the Airport with a professional english speaking driver and given a magnificent breakfast of fresh yogurt pancakes fruit and eggs. Along with copious amounts of tea and coffee and water included in your stay. There is a lovely roof terrace where we had breakfast with a heated pool. The fire is lit for you at night if you wish and the only thing you need to do is relax. Aziz makes it his duty to make sure you have everything you need and can he help you with anything. I can honestly say I have never been so spoilt and felt so cared for. At one point we left our camera at a busy restaurant. The staff popped on his scooter and drove to the restaurant to collect it for us. We were left alone when needed but could ask for anything and we were welcome with open arms and a friendly smile. I would most definitely recommend this lovely little Riad to everyone. The only two things I would advise to anyone staying in Marrakech in general would be to take ear plugs for the prayers in the morning that you can hear throughout Marrakech itself. (wherever you stay you will hear this) and be aware that it takes an hour to get out of the airport at passport control.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barry L wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Thank you so much Aziz and the team at Les Trois Mages for giving us a such a great introduction to Marrakech. Even before we arrived Aziz had arranged travel from the airport meals on our arrival day and an escorted tour of the walled town - highly recommended. The experience of staying in a Riad was perfect and really helped us to gain a true understanding of the style and culture of this exciting city.  An excellent first visit and if we return to Marrakech it will be to The Troi Mages!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: picked up at airport by English speaking driver taken to riad through narrow walk ways trying to avoid mopeds speeding past (like waki races ) an experience in its self arrived at riad and was greeted by AZIZ who made us feel at home treated us like king and queen the riad was fantastic lovely room fantastic roof top plunge pool (heated in winter) and cumfy seating all staff are fabulous plenty food and water service second to none thankyou
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julia M wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Our stay in the Riad was awesome everybody was so polite. Everything was clean and the breakfast was delicious. You get fresh orangejuice and coffee or tea on choice yogurt with fresh fruits fresh bred pancakes and egg if you want to everything with jam and honey. You also can get water tea or coffee whenever you want. The rooms were comfortable and there is a lot off space in the riad to chill-out after a day in the medina especially the beautiful rooftop-terrace.  The staff was so nice to us. Aziz can answer you every question you may have and will give you a really good map and overview of the city. Also he can arrange quite nice trips for you to the atlas-mountains or other places you want to see. Saida was cooking for us a really delicious dinner and was taking care of us the whole stay.  We both really recommend this Riad. You may can find cheaper ones but we don´t think that they would take care of you as much as the staff of this Riad did.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As some of the reviewers have said previously Marrakech is quite the experience! your first impressions as you arrive down the busy streets avoiding mopeds and pedestrians is the frantic nature of the place. The Riad however is absolutely fantastic. As you are shown through the building you find all these areas to sit and enjoy your time either eating drinking or relaxing. Aziz greets you and makes you feel so welcome as do all the rest of the team who are very helpful. We were given plenty of advice and there was always someone on hand. The room we stayed in was also impressive and just what you need after spending all day in the souks. We stayed in January and it was not as warm as I expected so dress appropriately!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakesh can be an absolutely overwhelming experience but Riad Les Trois Mages was an amazing oasis.    Before arriving Aziz was so incredibly helpful. He made sure someone was waiting for us at the train helped get us settled in offered a personalized map of the Medina and made sure we had his number in case we needed anything. He booked dinners for us and followed up on plans we had arranged ordered us car services (with amazing people who waited for us with no complaints and never left us high and dry... you'd think that's a given but it's not!) and was just an ace person to have on the front lines. He really made us feel like we were coming home when we walked into the Riad.    Our room to say the least was spectacular.. A welcome relief was a beautiful hot shower and a cozy bed with the most perfect linens and decor.    We also utilized having dinner at the Riad and it was equally exceptional.    I cannot say enough for this Riad.. The cost is minimal compared to the overall experience you will have at this home away from home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cameron F wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: We stayed here for 1 week & all I can say is...FANTASTIC. The location is great only a 15-20 minute stroll through the Souk down to Jemaa El-Fnaa. The staff were friendly attentive & always willing to answer any questions we had on the city or Moroccan life. The Riad itself was stunning. Lovely decor great rooms & a lovely rooftop terrace with a pool & places to sit. Cannot recommend this place enough. Shukran Aziz Shukran
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claudette B wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: The most outstanding feature of this Riad is the staff. We stayed here as a group of 7 for my 40th birthday and it was a truly fantastic experience. The riad itself is very well positioned and very quiet which is suprising given its proximity to the souks etc. As a group we had 4 of the 6 bedrooms but I personally stayed in the Bahia Suite which was fabulous and well worth the bit extra money but all the other rooms were lovely too.  Being December the temperature changed quite dramatically so we went from swimming in the heated pool or just lazying around it in the sun to snuggling up around the fire in the evening playing boardgames. We were lucky enough to do a cooking workshop with Saida too. What a wonderful woman! She took as to the local market and then showed us how to prepare tagines and other dishes after (including mint tea to which we also seem to have fall in love with while we were there). We then ate what we had prepared and it was delicious.  On another day we had booked into a hammam and Mouhsin was concerned we would not find our way and insisted on taking us there. Thank goodness he did as we would have never have found it alone.  For my actually birthday my mother and boyfriend had pre arranged some drinks snacks and a birthday cake with Aziz. for the evening before we went out. I can't tell you how fabulous the staff were at setting it all up and arranging it all and insisting on staying to sing happy birthday felt like they were part of the family by then. A memory that I will always treasure.    It is these little touches that made our stay truly memorable    Thank you to all the team for going out of your way to make us feel so welcome.  We will definitely stay here again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Graham S wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: I would like to say that everything was as I expected. The staff were very helpful both managers (Aziz and Mouhsin) couldn't do enough for all of us.  Even though it rained on one of the days the atmosphere only added to the experience.  The Riad is quite central to all the main attractions of Marrakech and we only had to ask Aziz or Moushin to book / help prepare events or guides for us.  Overall I would highly recommend Les Trois Mages to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A spacious relaxed gem of a place with some of the nicest staff I've ever met.    5 or 6 rooms over 3 floors means lots of nooks and crannies for as much peace and quiet as you want. And as you are in the centre of the medina you only have to step outside the front door to be swept away into the hustle and bustle.    Every member of staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we wanted and seemed to genuinely feel that we actually become part of their family. I've not experienced such attentive service in anything less than a five star hotel before.    The food was also wonderful - breakfasts and snacks of pastries and fresh fruit and bread on the roof terrace were divine and Saida's special prepared dinner was our best meal of the trip.    A special thanks to Aziz the local manager and to Moushine the night porter who were absolute gentlemen and who coordinated everything superbly. Aziz arranged a road trip into the Atlas mountains for us - amazing! - and an unforgettable visit to a luxurious hammam for the full Marrakech experience. ;)    We had an incredible stay and will certainly be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma H wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: At Les Trois Mages its the people that make the difference. The riad is beautiful and comfortable with a lovely sunny roof terrace with cute dipping pool and a cosy lounge with open fire which was wonderful on December evenings when it was a little chilly. The bedrooms are stylish and comfortable and the bathrooms are rustic yet chic. But really what the riad is all about is the team who run it - Aziz Mouhsine Saida Najia and Laila. They made us feel so welcome nothing was ever too much trouble and everything was done with a smile. By the end of our week it was like saying good bye to old friends. I highly recommend this riad to anyone looking for a restful retreat within the medina who appreciates excellent service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were so lucky to spend Christmas in the Magical Les Trois Mages. AzizMohsin  and all the team looked after us brilliantly and provided a magnificent rooftop Christmas feast  complete with musicians and dancers. The rooms were lovely and Mohsin lit the lovely wood fire at night to ward off chills. There were plenty of areas for relaxing and chilling out. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff here from restaurant & Hammam reservations souk tours  and mountain trips they can organise it all. Les Trois Mages was lovely and peaceful.  Cant wait to return. Go here it will exceed your expectations and you will leave refreshed  well fed and smiling :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul H wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: A very good hidden calm amongst the chaos of Marrakech you are in for a big surprise as you arrive at an unassuming doorway in a narrow alley to walk into an oasis of calm are beauty. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful and there are plenty of places to hide and relax within the Riad. It is amazingly cool in the central court yard where breakfast is served and you have the pleasent sound of the local finches singing while you eat. The breakfast are extremely good and enjoyable. Definitely recommend to anyone who wishes a retreat from the bussel of the Souks but in hand reach of them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dixie N wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: A wonderful Riad where the staff are honest generous and likeable. Each member of staff seemed to feel that they were our host always ready to talk through our day and help us plan the next. They brought us endless trays of tea and coffee with little pastries ( all free) and would bring us wine and olives even though they didn't drink. The staff presence was never intrusive and the Riad is so well arranged that you felt you were a private house party even though there were other people staying  When we ate in it was like a private dinner party with wonderful food and the breakfast was always sensational.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The perfect place to stay for our trip to Marrakech. The service was amazing.  We stayed in the Bahia suite which was perfect!  The staff at the Raid work very hard and made is feel so welcome.  To think that this place could exist amongst the madness of the medina.  The breakfast's were really lovely with fresh fruit and a different bread everyday.  I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this Riad to anyone.

Review_Date: janet m wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: What can i say a little Oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle of pedestriansmopeds bicyclescarts and Donkeys.  The Riad is a haven for relaxation you are met on arrival by Aziz during the day or Mouhassim in the eveningWe were met my Aziz he spoke fluent english and was so helpful nothing was to much trouble. Excellent Suite greeted with flowers and a bottle of wine from the Riad Excellent food and Excellent company all thanks to Aziz Saida(chef) and the rest of the staff.  And how can i forget the other guests Julie and Steve Marie and Maureen and of course the 2 friends we went with Lisa and John.  Well done to all you guys working in the Riad and guess what Aziz we could all be back.    Just one more thing if you are thinking of going to Marrakech dont worry about bringing an alarm clock    Jan and Mike
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Marie P wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: My sister invited me to join her for a holiday in Marrakech. I had no idea what to expect and to be honest was too busy trying to keep up with work before holiday to research. Thank goodness for big sisters! Sis stayed twice in Marrakech before this trip - the second time at riad les trois mages. I am so glad she chose to return to les trois mages. My first impression was slight unease as the journey showed how chaotic moving around could be - pedestrians/donkeys/people pushing hand carts/mopeds/bicycles/cars all vie for the little space there is. On entering the riad I could only feel peace and serenity comfort and a wonderful sense of bonhomie. Relaxation came naturally! Aziz Mouhassim Saida and Layla were always on hand to assist- Mouhassim ensured our safety even escorting me to local shop late at night to get snacks and juice for our last farewell night with fellow guests who became friends as we enjoyed their company over the holiday. I can honestly say no other hotel stay has given me so much pleasure. Unique unusual clean comfortable friendly great service - the review allows for 5 marks and "excellent" I would like to give it more and if lucky eniugh to ever come back to marrakesh would definitely want to stay at Les Trois Mages. (Would also enjoy it with the same company of people who stayed at same time - they also helped make our holiday so enjoyable - Julie Steve Jan and Mike - also lovely to meet Steve and Elaine Lisa and John. Happy special birthdays girls! X)

I went to Marrakech with my husband for my 50th birthday. After a pretty awful delay we finally arrived at this wonderful haven to be greeted by the charming Moushine who made us feel at home from the first moment.    Our room (Melchior) was stunning. Kindness was extended with the gift of a bouquet of flowers left in the room..lovely touch.    I thoroughly recommend the cooking class with the wonderful Saida. You get a chance to wander through the local market to source the produce and the chicken could not have been be any fresher !!! ( I will say no more) back to the Riad for tea then aprons on and let the cooking commence. A few hours later we sat and sampled what I can only describe as authentic moroccon cuisine. Delicious.    Aziz and the staff really couldn't have done any more for ustheir kindness and hospitality was second to none.    We met some very nice guests and we shared not only a few drinks but many laughs that we shall remember for a long time..    We simply cannot recommend this Riad enough and is the perfect retreat from the crazy hustle and bustle of what is a wonderful city.    Steven and Julie
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert R wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: My wife and I went with another married couple for a week at the end of October beginning of November and loved it. Aziz arranged two day tours for us one to Essaouria and one to the Atlas Mountains both of which were excellent and he was assiduous in ensuring we had all we needed. On our first night and on two more occasions during the stay we had dinner in the Riad which was excellent with the wine being a good deal cheaper than in those local restaurants that served alcohol. Moushine was equally helpful when Aziz was not there not least of all in organising a taxi to get us to the airport and the service from the ladies at breakfast and dinner was very good. We also used the roof terrace on occasions which was also lovely. We would strongly recommend the Riad. Our only sorrow is that we missed Aziz by getting back late from Casablanca - on our experience Moroccan trains do not always run on time - and so did not have a chance to thank him personally for his very great help.    Bob and Dixie
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We arrived late through busy traffic. Thank goodness we arranged an evening meal so we didn't have to go out. Mouhsin welcomed us and couldn't do enough. We saw Aziz the next day who sat with us for an hour. Very different from big hotels. The local chefs were friendly and produce good meals. Great breakfast is included. Marrakech is very busy but we would only return if we could stay at Riad Les Trois Mages. All the guests (mainly British) were lovely.

Review_Date: Elaine S wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: We spent a few nights at the Riad and absolutely loved it!!  We visited the Riad before booking and even then everyone was very helpful and kind.  Aziz is such a friendly and genuine person! He gave us precious advices/ tips which made us feel more confident in exploring the Medina! We just regret not speaking French or Arabic to interact more with Saida Moushine Najia and Laila.  The Riad is super clean with comfortable bed beautiful architecture and lovely staff. Oh and the breakfast was fantastic too!! Fruits yogurt great variety of bread/ croissants jams butter honey AND we were also offered eggs cooked to our taste!!  Make sure you have dinner at the Riad at least once! We are so glad we did! It was the best food we had tasted in months!!!  Also organise a transfer to and from the Riad. It is well worth it as you might get lost in the Medina.  We definitely recommend the Riad Les Trois Mages and cannot wait to visit them again!

It was our first time in Marrakech and we loved it. Aziz and Moushine were most helpful and made us feel very welcomed. They booked a great hike trip to Atlas mountains for us and arranged a visit in the local spa.    Our room was called Jade and it was lovely we also loved the roof terrace.    It was a fantastic experience and we will definitely be back.  Thanks guys!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My first trip to Marrakech began with a stay in this Riad in the Bahai room. We arrived in the early evening after a rather hectic Royal Air Maroc experience. Upon arrival in Marrakech what an eye opener to the uninitiated with the noise the chaos the people the motorcycles the cars the sheep... With each turn off of the main road the road shrunk from small to narrow to a virtual alley. The car parked at the entrance of one of these alleys and our driver walked us through a maze and after a couple of turns stopped at a large wooden door (I confess I was getting a little concerned at this point). The door opened and we were greeted by the friendly smiling face of Mouhsin (I apologize for any misspelling). And behind him...the Oasis: The courtyard of Riad Trois Mages. Our host immediately offered us a refreshment (as he did every night afterwards) then took us to the Bahia room upstairs. It was beautifully appointed and true to any photos professionally posted. Once settled Mouhsin recommended restaurants within close walking distance then promptly made a reservation for us on the terrace of the chosen restaurant without being asked. Be sure to stay at the Riad for dinner one night. The food is every bit as good as any restaurant you will find. The staff was always friendly and smiling (even when carting our breakfast or dinner up to the terrace for us!). Aziz the day manager is very pleasant professional and knowledgeable particularly with tips for surviving the Souks. Everyday was as enjoyable as our first impression that we believe set the tone for our entire trip in Morocco. We highly recommend this jewel. Be sure to book a room upstairs if not the Bahai room you will not be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen P wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: I have just returned from my 6th visit to this Riad and again I was not disappointed. My lovely warm welcome after the flight followed by a delicious meal sent me to bed already relaxing in my favourite room Arabesque. Aziz the new manager is a find! I noticed subtle differences like a new taxi service from the airport or incense and scented oils around which was lovely. He was around all day every day and always making sure guests had whatever they wanted. The maps he gave out had all been carefully marked with focal points to guide you and roads marked for walks and contact numbers for the riad and him - it must have taken hours but very helpful. As usual the girls who look after the rooms were keeping all up to scratch and Saida fed everyone excellently as usual. I had my dinner there every night and every night there was something different. See you all soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Stephen F wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Great value in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Ask for the Bahai room we loved it. Aziz was extremely helpful and Mouhsin even walked us to a restaurant the night of our arrival. Arranged airport pickup everything was seamless. Wonderful breakfast on the rooftop terrace. Perfect three cheers for the Riad Trois

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this Riad. The service was impeccable. The breakfasts were served to us in any room and on any floor including the terrace. This was a very pretty place and very clean. Azziz the manager was extremely nice to us and very accommodating. The staff were very nice and pleasant at all times. Every time we returned to the Riad we were offered coffee or tea again served to us anywhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing Oasis in a bustling city
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Mages was an unbelievable find. We were lucky to stay here during our first visit to Marrakech. From the time we made the booking I was emailing with Aziz to coordinate transfers dinners and tours and he was extremely responsive and quick with answers and solutions. The Riad was so lovely we had a hard time leaving to venture out into the souks! The rooftop terrace is lovely and the plunge pool is a nice way to cool off after a day of exploring. We felt extremely safe the entire time we were here. Either Aziz or Mouhsin the night guard were always available to answer questions or even to run out and get a Diet Coke for us! The location of the Riad is easy to find once you know your way around. Aziz will review the map with you upon arrival but I recommend arranging for a guide for the first day until you find your bearings. We arranged a tour with Mohammed and he was very nice and let us navigate our way back to the Riad from the square so we would be confident on our own. Meals were great we had two dinners and a lunch in addition to the daily breakfast. I cannot recommend Riad les Trois Mages highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adrian F wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Perfect place to stay. We came with another couple for my birthday. Aziz the manager and his team couldn't do enough for us and were so friendly. When we asked for something they didn't have they went and got it from the shops! Rooms were lovely and romantic and recently refurbished. Several stylish and relaxing seating areas and a great rooftop terrace with pool. Breakfast was lovely. Highly recommended a real romantic and relaxing Oasis from the noise and crowds of the town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo J wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Home away from home in the medina
Review_Text: I stayed as part of a G Adventures Local Living Marrakech tour and could not have been happier with my stay. I arrived alone and was greeted by the wonderful Aziz who manages the Riad. What a gentleman! He looked after me from start to finish and he couldn't have been more accommodating. He escorted me to and from my hammam treatment in the maze of the medina and waited with me for my taxi to the airport when my transfer didn't turn up. The Riad itself was luxury at its best. I had the pick of 5 bedrooms all of which were beautiful. The other staff were friendly and always smiling and always on hand with mint tea and assistance of any kind. I recommend anyone staying here do the cooking class which I enjoyed immensely even though I had saffron stuck in my nails for days afterwards! Particularly enjoyed the market shopping with Saida the Riad cook and of course the wonderfully laid out dinner we had prepared and cooked ourselves. One of the best experiences and definitely the best accommodation I had during a three month trip where I stayed in many hotels from budget to boutique to luxury. I would class the Riad as the perfect mix of boutique/luxury! Well done Aziz and team - keep up the great work! Jo
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A Tranquil Oasis in a Chaotic City
Review_Text: Our thanks to Aziz and his staff for a wonderful experience staying at Les Trois Mages. The riad was everything and much more than we hoped it would be. The location was a little hard to get to but thats all part of the fun in Marrakech makes it all the more mysterious. The Bahia suite was absolute magic. We especially enjoyed the trip to the markets with Siada and sharing in the preparation of our dinner. Hey Toni & Gina we enjoyed meeting you both. Perhaps we will all return to Les Trois Mages one day Inshalla.  Murray and Laura (Canada)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: An'Ton R wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: We had a wonderfull stay at Marrakech which was full of experiences and impressions which we will not forget so soon. One of the highlights of this stay was the Riad Les Trois Mages. This riad is the right mixture between European desire to have all clear and clean and the pulsating orientalic life. It was for us a real throwing table between both worlds. We could enjoy European standards and orientalic colours and smells in one and we could go out to experience the intensity of this real fantastic city and come back and feel europeanlöike and orientalic in one. So we loved it to stay there.  Architecture of this riad is fantastic and we loved the suite very much. Staff is very friendly and they were intensively engaged in fulfilling all our wishes. Special thanks to Aziz who is a very competent and friendly manager. He was strongly keen in helping us whenever we had a problem or a wish but he also offered us the right information on our questions on culture history and ways of living in Marocco and Marrakesh. Breakfast was top and we enjoyed it very much. We have already recommended the riad to friends and collegues. Anton (Toni) & Gina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay at this beautiful Riad was fantastic from start to finish – correspondence from the team before our arrival was very reassuring and upon on arrival our expectations were exceeded. The whole team looked after us amazing well making us feel welcome and at home spotlessly clean and the food was terrific. We went for a friends birthday and were definitely not disappointed – would highly recommend this riad to anyone travelling to Marrakech. Cant wait to go back and stay again! Lucy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for four nights for a friends birthday - 8 girls!!! Couldn't praise it enough. The riad was lovely and the staff were amazing! Felt so at home and totally relaxed- they could not do enough for us. The food was top quality and very reasonable!!!    I would not hesitate recommending it to anybody.    Sarah.

Review_Date: Kelly T wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: We recently stayed here for 4 nights. A group of 8 girls for a 40th birthday celebration. The staff are fantastic and the kitchen staff certainly feed you like kings. On arrival to the Riad it is up a dirty alley but do not be put off by this. Once you enter the Riad you will see why. Aziz arranged transfers for us from the airport and to local restaurants and spas. The plunge pool on the roof was nice to come home too after a walk around the souks. There is so much culture going on and this was quite scary for me on the first day. After a few hours I become accustom to donkeys people walking in the road people beeping their horns.    I would personally recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Victoria B wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: We had a brilliant 7-night stay in September 2013. Aziz and the team were exceptional throughout the trip.  Food *****  Room *****  (Bahia Suite)  Staff **********  (Baked me a surprise Birthday cake and decorated our room - attentive knowledgeable and went beyond our expectations everyday)    We would recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helen I wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights in the the first week of September 2013 and loved it. In insane loud Marrakech it is unbelievably peaceful as soon as you walk through the door.  Aziz arranged transfers for us from the other hotel we'd stayed at (and back to the airport) for a very reasonable rate which was added onto the bill. When we first arrived he then sat us down and gave us a map of the Medina explaining how to get to the souks and the square and pointing out some good places to eat and drink as well as giving a few handy tips for dealing with locals. There's more of this kind of info in the Riad's guidebook which is really helpful.  The roof terrace is idealistic with loads of comfy sun loungers as well as a proper cosy seating area. The plunge pool was always a good way to cool down after getting a bit too hot in the sun. The only down point is the interruption of the call to prayer which can't be helped anyway.  The room was lovely and always spotless with a comfy bed and good air conditioning. We were never woken up by the call to prayer but occasionally kept awake by other guests of the hotel chatting.  We ate in the Riad on one of the nights we were in the Medina and it was incredible food and very reasonably priced - would recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My husband and I spent a week at the Riad Les Trois Mages in July 2013. What a fabulous place to stay!! The staff are friendly and helpful and go out of the way to accommodate any request for information or travel in the area. The plunge pool on the roof was great to come to at the end of a hot day of walking around the city. The food was tasty - we had a couple of suppers there in addition to the breakfasts. The owners happened to be visiting when we were there and we found them delightful and very interesting conversationalists. All in all we would highly recommend staying there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and i spent hours researching a place to stay in Marakesh it was our honeymoon and also our first time away from the kids so it was so important to us that we found the right place. Thankfully our research payed off because we struck gold. Our taxi was organised a few days before we arrived and was added to our bill so nice to see your name in the airport and not have to worry about are you paying to much - plenty of time for that. On arrival after mint tea and a chat we were shown to our room a massive bouquet of flowers awaited us. We stayed in the Bahia suit which is absolutely stunning! (saw some of the other rooms too which were also amazing) Little things like having a fridge and an i pod stereo are not to be underestimated. Free bottled water ice. Many's the afternoon we spent sitting in the pool drinking a Gin and Tonic listening to music. The roof garden was one of the many reasons we chose Les Trois and it didn't disappoint. Complete nirvana away from the madness of the streets. The Riad is so close to everything and around the corner is a Big Riad/Hotel which is a great landmark for when you ineviatabley get lost. Souks and square are 10 mins away. Oh and the breakfasts! Sweet mother of god the breaky is fit for a king.  All this aside the best thing about the Riad for me was Aziz. I work in hospitality and would be fairly big into good service. Aziz is one of those managers who is always there when you need him but who also knows when to leave you alone. He gave his mobile no. and it was just a nice feeling to know he was there if we needed him. They don't molly coddle you there. It feels like your home. It kind of is. For musicians the Piano and guitar would be a nice addition to your stay.  I just cant say enough good things about the place. I'm not one for writing reviews this is my first but credit where it's due. Increadable increadable Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Frances H wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Fantastic and friendly Riad in Marrakech
Review_Text: We recently stayed here for 6 days with friends and we can't recommend Les Trois Mages highly enough. The Riad is an absolute sanctuary beautifully decorated and fantastically run by Aziz and his team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Sanctuary amongst the madness of Marrakech (enjoyable madness)
Review_Text: Where Marrakech was an assault on your senses and wore the traveller down Les Trois Mages was the most comfortable and peaceful retreat you could ever find. Brilliantly and comfortably decorated impeccably clean and expertly ran by Aziz and all the other Moroccan staff.    We loved this place so much we returned at the end of our Moroccan adventure. The food was amazing (thank you Saida) and Aziz could not be helpful enough. Anyone looking for the perfect map of Marrakech go see Aziz; very helpful. Day or night Les Trois Mages had an amazing ambience and the rooftop pool was a brilliant touch after a trip to the souks or Djemaa el-Fna. Much needed.    I have already recommended a stay at Les Trois Mages to some friends who are already planning a trip to Morocco and would highly recommend it to any body else considering Marrakech.    While you are there go to Le Jardin for a meal or cold drink too. :-)    Thank you Aziz and all at Les Trois Mages for making our stay so enjoyable.    Jay Bron & Portia (the 2 Kiwis!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My friend and I recently stayed in Les Trois Mages for three nights. What a fantastic place - lovely rooms great rooftop pool and terrace and such friendly staff. Aziz the manager was really helpful in terms of surviving our first trip to Marrakech souks and markets and generally helping us find our way around. All the staff were really friendly and we felt very well looked after. We would both highly recommend this Riad in terms of the place the staff and the location if you are considering a trip to Marrakech. If I ever visit Marrakech again I will definitely stay at Riad Les Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tom l wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at Les trois Mages for one night only with 3 friends. We were really pleased with it: great location beautiful place with a roof top swimming pool and last but not least amazing staff. Everyone was so kind and welcoming in a true Moroccan style. Aziz is a great host and not only he came to pick us up when we first arrived on La place Jemma el Fna he also offered us to check out late and use the pool and shower again on our last day whilst we were supposed to check out at noon...what a star (when it's 40 ° outside that's great..)  Thank you so much Aziz for having us we all want to come back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kevin D wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: First rate experience at Riad Les Trois Mages.
Review_Text: First trip to Marrakech for our family of four. Aziz and his team offer outstanding hospitality and I feel the trip would undoubtedly have been much less enjoyable without this Riad to retreat to each day. We would definitely recommend it to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: AMAZING experience at Riad Les Trois Majes
Review_Text: I organised a hen do of 14 to stay at Riad Les Trois Majes and we were all absolutely blown away by our experience there. Aziz and his team made us all feel absolutely at home and organised every element of our trip for us so that we could completely relax and focus on having fun. We had a wonderful wonderful meal prepared by the lovely Saida in the courtyard of the riad and Aziz arranged for Moroccan dancers to come which was fantastic fun.    The rooftop pool was also an absolute winner and rare to find in Marrakech.    I really couldn't recommend Riad Les Trois Majes more highly and think it particularly good to hire privately for group holidays. THANK YOU for helping me organise an incredible hen party!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: English owned and a Eng MNGR until next week a then Aziz (a lovely guy takes over). ABS Gent and credit to Riad. We were warmly greeted by Aidan and Staff. Given the lowdown and Map. Very helpful. Room Jade was OK colourful and nice shower area. AC worked but needs 20mins to get going WIFI worked in your room.    Usual lock and bolt story which is noisey and we are all around the courtyard which at breakfast time is annoying as laughing loud guests will wake you up.  Location very poor and again issues with your personal security. Be aware.    Staff are superb we met the owners lovely chaps & very good pianist and breakfast was the usual unimaginative Maroc breakfast.    all in all a mix bag but if you rented this place as a group (which you can) I reckon you will be very pleased and quite happy with your decision.    PS Hassan the fixed rate Taxi driver for this Riad please do not use him he is RIP off Merchant and very cheeky chap. He Tooks us for 200DH on a 100DH fare. IF he is ripping us off then I assure you AZIZ he ripping off all your guests. GET a new Driver is my advice and he owes us 100DH.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lindy G wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: Our first trip to Marrakech was undoubtedly made by a stay at Riad Les Trois Mages a true oasis of peace and tranquility amidst the madness that is Marrakech. spotlessly  clean and sumptuously decorated with a stunning cool roof terrace with splash pool. Take meals in your room on the terrace or in any one of the intimate corners of this beautiful house with great food and fabulous host management From Aziz and wonderful staff. Superb!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we were 5 girlfriends travelling for a svchool reunion Enjoyed our stay thooughl. the riad is stunning and we had the best time. the hospitality is the best i have ever seen and the service was always with a smile and we were not exactly the easiest guests. thanks for a lovely stay. just 1 change i would recommend is that the loghting in the bathroom 9we stayed in gaspard) was relly very very dim and difficult for women to get dressed and do make up. rest was perfect.  purnima and friends
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Julie J wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We were made to feel most welcome the moment we were picked up from the airport.  It is a beautiful riad that is an oasis of calm in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Aziz and Aiden were most helpful and Saida is an amazing cook........I am craving her cooking since returning!  The roof top pool and terrace is perfect after a morning of bartering in the souks.  Would recommend this riad without hesitation.......hopefully one day we will return!  Thank you Aiden and your team we had a fabulous stay x x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: A G wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: The Riad is fantastic and all the staff even better - the food was great and they couldn't be more helpful in organising tours for us. The rooftop plunge pool is great for lounging around in the afternoons after a morning in the Souks. Aidan was great from start to finish. It was clean and the rooms were beautiful. Not a bad word to say would definitely recommend! thanks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the moment I booked Raid Les Mages Aidan the hotel manager took us under his wing . Organising a transfer from the airport a cooking class and a special dinner nothing was a problem . The Raid was small making it an intimate stay getting to know the other guests .It was clean calm and had air conditioned rooms which made it pleasant to come back to after the bustle of Marrakech. We were treated regularly to mint tea and home made biscuits while relaxing on the roof top poolan added bonus to swim and relax by the pool in the sun .The breakfast was included and had a slight variety each morning so we never got board . A short walk into the main square made this a convenient location . I would highly recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Brief stay in gorgeous, cosy, quiet riad in great location
Review_Text: We stayed 2 nights in this great riad including our arrival night. The airport transfer arranged by the riad was seamless. We stayed in the Melchior room which has very beautiful decor and is comfortable and a good size. Only minor downside is that it adjoins the courtyard where people dine and was therefore not as private as we may have wished. The location is ideal - right in the centre of the Medina allowing you to walk everywhere and the riad staff were fantastic in providing directions and recommendations. We ate dinner on our arrival night and it was a great introduction to Morocco with a fanstastic tagine and good wine. Overall definitely recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mandi b wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: Perfect oasis in this hectic city!
Review_Text: Lovely Riad in a good location. Aiden and the rest of the staff at Trois Mages went out of their way to make you feel at home and accomodate all your needs as well as helping book all of our holiday requirements. Great food especially Saida's cooking! Fab terrace to chill out in or enjoy the rays and a dip in the pool. Definately recommend to anyone visiting the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: vince b wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: just back from a 10 night stay for our honeymoon.  we browsed for a long time trying to choose the perfect place to stay within the medina and this ticked all the boxes and we were not disappointed.  we stayed in the bahia suite which is the best room in the riad it was immense the bed was soooooo comfortable and had everything we needed.  the riad in its self is really just exquisite from the decoration to the fittings. its just such a lovely place to come back to after a mad day in marrakech. The terrace is amazing with the pool and the seating area.  The staff are second to none saida was just so accommodating and would always be on hand to help her cooking is amazing we ate in the riad twice and both times the food was excellent. The other girls working were brilliiant leila especially as she love my samba's lol.  Now onto moushin. You couldnt of met a nicer person ever he was always on hand to help you with bookings directions or anything you could think of. We cant thank him enough for making our honeymoon so special.  Can't forget aiden Who was so nice and helpful and just a bloody good bloke made such a difference having an english speaking manager to help out with places to go and booking taxi's.  We will definitely be back i cant imagine there is a nicer place in marrakech. If you need a riad this is the place to go.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: deb p wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Our first time in Marrakech we loved everything about our 6 night anniversary trip. The Riad was a delight. A calm clean relaxing haven just on the edge of the bustling souks. Perfectly located for all that we wanted to do. We could have just stayed there all day every day however as it was so pleasant to sit or lie on the terrace taking occasional dips in the plunge pool to cool offor to rest on the sofa's in the courtyard in the coolreading and drinking tea. Our room was exactly as promised on the website directly off the courtyard which I had worried might feel a bit exposedas other guests ate in the coutyard at breakfast but far form being an issue we enjoyed the proximity and I would happily choose the same room again although we peeked into the 'best ' room one day when it was empty and would love to stay in there too-it looked stunning! All the staff were very helpful and the food cooked by Sadia was delicious and could be ordered in advance at a time to suit. We returned from a 4x4 trip to the Atlas mountians (arranged by Aidan) to a wonderful dinner on the terrace served by Moushine who was always smilingwhatever the time of night! Aidan was always willing to help with suggestions pointers or to arrange trips-and to acquire wine for our meal too! I would recommend to everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have been to Marrakech once before with a friend and decided to return with my daughter as a surprise for her 21st birthday! It was wonderful we stayed at beginning of April. We were both impressed with our room 'Jade' which had a beautiful four poster bed and lovely spacious bathroom. Our taxi Hassan met us as planned at the airport and Aidan welcomed us to the house. He took us for a walk in the medina to find our bearings which was great as my daughter was able to guide us back each time we went out otherwise you could get very lost in the souks as we did one day! He was also there on hand when we had an anxious moment and required some first aid. We went out one evening to the crepperie and Aidan arranged for Hassan to take us and pick us up again. Nothing was too much trouble!    Saida Moushine Najia and Laila were always there to provide coffee or tea when we returned from our walks. Our room was made up every day and clean towels provided. It was wonderful to relax on the rooftop by the pool and have breakfast served to us. To sum up we had a wonderful time and will definitely return to Les Trois Mages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: julie f wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: I am so happy to have discoverded Riad Les Trois Mages the place is immaculate warm welcoming and staff are caring and always available for you.  Aiden the manager had great recommendations and suggestions of places restaurants things to do in Marrakesh.Location is ideal as a short walk from the busy square and soul yet in a quieter area.Nice reataurants cafes little convinience stores around.  The general atmosphere of the Riad is peaceful and relaxing the rooms are all decorated to a high standard.The food was delicious all prepared with fresh ingredients and local spices and the breakfast is different every morning. We were on the roof terace every morning to enjoy breakfast by the cooling pool...I haven't been as satified with a holiday accommodation for a little while so thank you all the team for a great stay- I will thorouly recommend to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved this Riad.So relaxing. The 4x4 day trip into the mountains is a must which was sorted out by the riad.Everything is in walking distance and an adventure every time you walk out of the door.Be brave but also be aware of your surroundings.Coming back to the riad for mint tea or great coffee mid day is lovely.The call to prayer at 5am may wake you but by day two we didn't hear it anymore.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Trois Mages    This was my third visit back to Trois Mages and I can not recommend it highly enough. A wonderful calm oasis within walking distance to the main souk.    Always authenticwelcoming and warm I look forward to arriving here. I have stayed in various Riad's in Marrakech all beautiful and unique in their own way however Trois Mages always feels like a long awaited exhalation.    Everything is so easy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Les Trois Mages - (The Three Kings) - was fitting for Kings (and Queens!).    I had done many hours of research looking for just the right Riad to fulfil a dream of visiting Marrakech - and Les Trois Mages more than exceeded expectations.    The service guests receive during their stay is superb! Aidan the Manager has absolutely the 'right' touch - always on hand to help and assist; interested in your stories and with effortless charm. Saida the Chef - whose smile and heart-warming greeting envelops you when you return from a 'bonkers' day haggling in the Souks - always ready with a pot of tea (English or Mint) and beautiful little pastries; her cooking is out of this world! Moussin the Night Manager who was always on hand and nothing was ever too much trouble even when we asked him to 'russle' up a little snack late one evening - not on the menu! And then the lovely ladies Lela and Nadj - who could never do enough and were always so kind and gentle.    Lasting memories: The service and smiles and kindness of everyone in the Riad - saying good bye on our last day - was like saying good bye to old friends. Our private dinner on the first floor Bou; Saida's cooking class - a highlight of our trip and a MUST DO for anyone who wants to visit; breakfast and eating lunch on the Terrace under azure blue skies and the sounds of the call to prayer; the beautiful bedrooms and sitting downstairs in the blue lounge listening to Nina Simone on the in-house CD player while Moussin went about the house putting on all the beautiful evening lights.    I have returned home with so many beautiful memories .... Go to Riad Les Trois Mages and experience these for yourself - and then sit like I am today looking out on a very cold and snow-filled landscape - and let these memories warm your heart!    May the Stars shine on all those at Les Trois Mages and on all who visit in the future - and be there to act as my guide when I return again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen P wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: This place is fantastic and try to go as often as work allows. I always get a fantastic welcome from the staff I am well fed and looked after and it is like going to my second home. The minute I arrive I relax. I love the homely décor and the fact that all the food is prepared to order each day and I don't get served English food - fabulous! Just love it and can't wait until my next visit in a few weeks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Our first time in Marrakech and this was a great place to stay. Such a good location close to the hustle and bustle of the souks and main square but in a quiet safe side road. Service was faultless and all staff were friendly and hospitable. Made use of the little rooftop pool which was lovely and warm and always clean. Would have no hesitation in recommending this riad to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title:
Thank you for all.
It was fantastic.
Review_Text: My friend and me visited this wonderful riad in november 2012.  At the beginning of our journey we had some trouble but as we arrived the riad we enjoyed our trip. Aidan and his team made a wonderful job:friendly and helpful.  Aidan helped in all situation.We have had in all moments a good feeling.  Thank you for the nice holiday:-)

We chose this riad because friends had stayed there previously and recommended it - it's in a great location about 15 minutes walk away from the main square. There's a great range of tours available and the staff are happy to arrange everything for you including booking restaurants (with some good recommendations available). The food in the riad was very nice - we had dinner the night we arrived and breakfast is served every morning. We had a couple of afternoons spent relaxing in the sun on the rooftop terrace (very peaceful given its central location) which was lovely.    Overall it was a brilliant stay and I'd recommend it to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great place friendly staff especially Moushin the night guard who due to our timing help us the most during our stay.    The Riad is located down a smaller but reasonably well lit alley and away from the main souk so it as quiet but we still felt safe walking there.    The taxi arranged by the riad for 20 euro was able to drop us right around the corner which is unusual for the medina. The night guard was very friendly and explained to us the areas of Marrakesh and showed us around the riad. Breakfast included in the rate was standard for Morocco but very nice on our second day they happily accommodated our early departure and prepared breakfast for us early.    We had two rooms they were both a good size with everything we needed the shower had plenty of hot water and the beds were comfortable. We found the whole property to be very clean and comfortable. The riad really feels like home with unlimited access to tea coffee and drinking water and reasonable honesty bar in the kitchen. The roof top terrace with pool is a great place to relax after the craziness of the medina and there was free wifi throughout and a solar heated roof top pool surrounded by lovely patio.    We pre ordered dinner for our first night for 20 euro pp for three courses expensive compared to the stalls in the medina but very well priced compared to other Riads and large restaurants. Overall it was very nice and well worth it. Aidan the manager was happy to ring and make reservations at other restaurants for us also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing Riad - Excellent staff - Good location
Review_Text: We chose to stay here purely on recommendation from friends who spent Christmas at this Riad. They raved about it. i'd say the Riad is in a good location perhaps 15mins (max) walk from the square and 10 mins walk from the entrance into the old town. The rooms are excellent and the roof top pool and sun loungers are awesome. The pool isnt big but large enough to cool down. Adian and staff are extremely friendly - some of the best customer service we have received abroad. We would certainly stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My hushand & I along with 6 others were there in Feb 2013 for 2 nights.  When dropped off at the top of the street by our ride - You would never know that this awsome place exsisted when you knocked at the door! WOW!  We were all truly surpriised to find this very unique little hotel. It was clean comfortable with very tasty food an electric player grand piano and just beautiful. The staff was knowledgeable and helpfu and offered great servicel.  The main squarewith all the sights & sounds took us about a 10 min walk from the Riad. Having a guide to assist you to & from the market would be the ideal. Many varitions of Moccocan food & sweets were served both hot & cold.  The Riad itself took me to another place in time! Definitely a place I would stay in again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were hoping for a unique local experience which was certainly the case at Riad Les Trois Mages. Rooms were beautiful and clean; breakfast included every morning; and knowledgeable helpful staff who were willing to arrange taxis; give recommendations and overall welcomed us always with a smile. Good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A home from home - total paradise - not to be missed
Review_Text: This is now my 4th attempt at writing this review. I just keep on getting distracted. But if there was ever an establishment that deserved a solid write up - it would be Riad Trois Les Mages so I will try again.    We visited in August 2012. We had been staying at a villa in Le Palmeraie - just outside the medina walls. It was peaceful and quiet and oh so very hot! We arrived in the centre of Marrakesh and it was still oh so very hot - but that is where the similarities ended. Gone was the twittering of the Chaffinches and the gentle hiss of the sprinklers - instead a barrage of noise - mopeds revving locals shouting horns tooting prayers blaring.. total chaos. As exciting at it was I was already started to wonder if we could really handle this for 4 days whole days.    Our taxi driver (Hussain I believe?) had been sent by Riad Trois Les Mages to collect us. We were very wary of riding with him at first. His unairconditioned beaten up (and dirty) 1980s hatchback was not all too reassuring. However he turned out to be a delightful character - insightful helpful and very amusing. Thank goodness he knew Riad Trois Les Mages well because we would not have found it without him. Away from the dust and the barrage of noise we arrived at the door of Riad Trois Les Mages - and stepped into our little piece of paradise.    Mouhsin was there to greet us. Mouhsin is possibly the sweetest man I have ever met. With a broad and welcoming grin he bowed his head to us and gestured towards the open air courtyard. It was cool it was calm and it was silent - bliss. Mouhsin walked us around the beautiful property from the music lounge to the reading room the terrace to the kitchen. He pointed out that we free to use absolutely anything on show including books instruments and even the fridge. I would describe the décor of this property as sumptuous elegance. The finishing touches are rich luxurious and bright while the overall feel remains light and spacious. The pool on the terrace is something quite hard to find in a Riad but it is an extra worth having at that time of year.    After our tour we were sat down to enjoy mint tea and a selection of Moroccan sweets. Mouhsin gave us a tourist map and carefully talked us through every item of interest on there marking out the best route to take. He kindly reminded us that he would take us anywhere that we weren't sure of or would organise transport if he couldn't. We were told time and time again that this was our home for the next 4 days and that we should treat it as such. Despite being incredibly attentive Mouhsin absolutely understood how to be on hand without being under our feet. He stuck that balance perfectly.    The food we had at Riad Trois Les Mages was some of the best we'd had anywhere in Morocco. Good honest home cooking from the lovely ladies in the kitchen who always had a warm smile for us. The dinner that we had there on the 2nd night was the most romantic that we'd ever had. Mouhsin dressed the table beautifully with a crushed red satin table cloth and candle sticks. I watched him while he worked and the attention to detail that he was putting in was incredible. We could tell how much he wanted it to be just perfect for us. As we sat down to eat Mouhsin and the cooks left us to eat alone. The only company we had was a little Chaffinch who sang his song as he flew from hanging lantern to hanging lantern. I've never experience a better setting for dinner in my life.    If one thing is for sure - we will be back again and again and again. We hope to bring friends and family with us next time as it would just be the perfect hang out spot for us all to enjoy together. My advice to you is to go and experience this magical little Riad for yourself.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very short stay over New Year!
Review_Text: My husband and I had a 2 nights stay at this Riad after returning from Sahara Desert. I have to say we enjoyed our stay here very much and would definitely recommend to those who are planning to visit Marrakech. The raid is located on a very quiet street approx. 15 min walk from the main square.
