At first we thought the location was a bit sketchy but after awhile we realize almost all riads in Marrakech are located in these side streets which give a sense of quietness from the chaotic main streets. It is also located very close to a main parking lot so if you ever get lost in Marrakech you can easily tell a cab driver to drive you back to this parking lot then there will be no issue finding your way back to this raid.    Another amazing experience in this raid is mainly from the manager - Aidan. He is the most sweetest hotel manager I have ever seen! He made us feel like home all the time and very accommodating. For our second night we had to catch a flight in the early morning so had to leave the riad at 1:30am and Aidan stayed up for us and helped us take the luggage to our driver who sent us to the airport. He was also so smily and helpful to all of our requests. I think he really made a huge difference to our experience.    Overall a great and memorable experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna R wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: This Riad was great in all respects! We stayed for three nights including Christmas. We were 5 people and stayed in 3 different rooms all of which were great. We ate breakfast lunch and dinner here several times and the food was SO AMAZING. They made us this soup called harira - if you go you must get this! We took a cooking lesson one day with the Riad's chef which was so fun. Every staff member was beyond friendly and helpful. I actually got deathly ill one day (think it was something I ate at a restaurant - should have just stuck with Trois Mages!) and one of the staff went with my boyfriend to the pharmacy to help him communicate and got me anti-nausea meds. We also wanted to go out one night and they were happy to arrange for a car to pick us up/drop us off at our destination. On Christmas they served us champagne and treats which was really nice of them. Will definitely go back if I ever make it to Marrakech again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michelle Connolly wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I stayed here with some girlfriends and we would definitely recommend it if you want an authentic riad experience with exceptional service. There are 5 rooms i think decorated quite traditionally. The rooftop sun terrace and pool is a massive bonus and we spent a few hours catching rays even in December! They provide towels and there are a few sun hats up there.    The riad is about a 15 minute walk from the square - once you find the quickest route. And it really is a calm respite from the craziness. The staff are all very helpful! Great suggestions for trips. And the breakfasts are delicious! Oh and they serve beer and wine at the riad! Overall fantastic experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anne C wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We came to stay at Les Trois Mage as a thank you present from my daughter and her husband. We enjoyed the stay immensely and felt very spoilt by the staff who were most attentive..nothing was too much trouble for them. In fact we almost felt like we had a personal butler in Aidan the manager who came and spent time with us each morning helping us decide what to do during the day and booking us trips drivers guides meals out etc...talking of the food it was of a very high standard the chicken tagine was gorgeous...and the chocolate mouse divine!! ( we had this 3 times!!) The atmosphere and ambiance in the Riad was magical! There are number of very comfortable and extremely tastefully decorated communal sitting rooms...sumptuous is the word! We benefitted from the roaring log fire as the evenings in November were a little chilly. During the day we benefitted from the lovely plunge pool and 'Arabian Nights' style tented area on the roof where we lounged and drank the fantastic mint tea on offer! We had a real treat at one of the Riad recommended and 2 minute walk away Spa's ..well worth the money fabulous massage and Hamam! The rooms ..well they were FABULOUS! We had the suite and felt like royalty with a sitting room as well as a sunken bed!! It was quite frankly like being on a television set for Aladdin!  WHilst we were there we sadly had bad news which cut short the holiday for my daughter and husband. The night porter was so kind and went the extra mile to help organise emergency flights back home we can't praise the staff enough they were all so kind.  The location of the Riad is fantastic it takes about 10 minutes to walk into the main square. We would recommend a guide when going into the souk as it is a bit of a rabbit warren!! We had one and think that if hadn't we might still be there!! We had a very interesting and enjoyable trip to the Atlas mountains with a lovely guide who knew his stuff....Aidan recommended & booked this for us at a very reasonable price!  It is a real haven of peace when you walk through the doors of the Riad you really wouldn't think you were in the bustling old part of the city...however take ear plugs because at 5.00am there is the call to prayer every day. It is no real problem and It didn't cause me any problems with the ear plugs...and my husband slept right through it!! HIghly recommended!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: NOLA P wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: My 30th birthday stay at Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: 12 frends and I stayed at Les Trois Mages for a long weekend to celebrate my 30th birthday.    We had the most fanastic time and would highly reccomend Les Trois Mages.    The Riad is magical each room beautifully decorated and no attention to detail spared. We really enjoyed and made full use of the communal spaces having a lovely breakfast served to us in the sunshine on the roof terrace each morning playing games next to the open log fire on an evening and enjoying the array of instruments in the music room.    The staff were all wonderful extremly warm friendly and accomodating helping us with anything we needed from preparing fresh teas and coffee all day and night cooking ordering taxis and helping us make table reservations. We also organised our transfere to and from the airport though Aiden and this proved to be very convenient. Aiden and his staff have a wealth of local knowledge and simply couldnt do enough for us. It really made our stay enjoyable.    We enjoyed a lovely home cooked lunch when we arrived at the Riad i would highly reccomend having at least one meal prepared by the staffat the Riad. Everything was very fresh and tasty and there was a good balence of meat and vegitarian dishes. We would have eaten more meals at the Riad if we were there for longer.    The riad always felt like a safe and tranquil haven to return back to after the hustle and bustle of daily life in the Madina. The only thing we would have changed is to have had longer to enjoy Les Tres Mages. We will definately be returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: helen g wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: quiet place in a busy city
Review_Text: this is a good place to relax after the hustle and bustle of the madina.the staff are frendly and aiden helpfull.we would recomend having a guide for at least a day as you could spend all day wondering around and missing thingsask for mohamed we had him for two days and he was fantasticvery informative and excellent english.we were only on b and b basis but the breakfast was very goodset you up well for the day.location is also good close to the souks and square.would deffinatley stay here again.it is also surprisingly quiet at night considering youre in the middle of it all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our 50th birthdays present to each other.
Review_Text: Having been to Marrakech more than once Marrakech is still an eye opener to me. The city is the real tale of two! with the old medena and the new very European quarter.  Les Trois Mages is hidden away in the medena and from the moment the entrance door opens is a haven away from the hassle and bussle of the streets. From the courtyard you can view straight to the blue sky above and the reason you came here relaxation and the more than warm winter sun which can be taken advantage of on the roof terrace.  During our 5 night stay we were looked after very well by all the staff morning noon and night. Morning it was breakfast on the roof terrace noon tea or coffee also on the roof terrace and in the evening after being out for dinner coffee in the sitting area next to a beautiful log fire.  We stayed in two rooms during our stay the Arabeque and the Bahia Suite both lovely rooms to stay in though the Bahia is the one to stay in if you can the bed is something special.  My best stay to date in Marrakech and probably not the last at les Trois Mages.  This was my partners first stay in the medena itself and though she was not too sure about being there the riad made it all worth while.  Thank you all again at Les Trois Mages for making our 50th birthdays treat so special. And thank you Aidan for the flowers in the room you sorted for me for Andrea.  A real little gem worth every penny.  Andrea and Steve now in cold UK.

This is a great place . We stayed 3 nights and wished we had booked four ( or more). Taxi from airport doesn't take long and should be booked in advance through the Riad. The rooms are lovely and there are several places to relax including the roof. We had the Bahia suite which we loved but feel sure that all rooms would be good. We ate lunch and dinner - both were very good and the food was plentiful. Staff are very good and friendly. For Marrakech first-timers take advantage of the walking tour - an easy introduction to the Medina maze.  Location is excellent - a short walk from the main square but not in a tourist street so surrounded by good safe local life.In the other direction just a few minutes walk away are the city walls and quick access to the new town.  This is an ideal place for a city break  made easier by no time differenece to UK when we visited in November.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A haven in the madness that is Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Mages with 2 other couples as a celebration of my wife's 50th birthday. The 3 night stay was a delight and Aidan and his staff were superb throughout. The location is right in the middle of the action so to speak as it is within the walls of the old town and easy walking distance of the Souks and renowned El Fna Square with its bustling and manic medina. Marrakech is not for the faint hearted as it really is like going back in time and poverty and hardship is there for all to see. It was safe though although at times slightly intimidating but that added to the excitement and atmosphere. The riad is gorgeous. Food superb. Staff could not do enough for you and Aidan knows all there is to know. He arranged for us to spend a day in the Atlas Mountains following the Berber Trail....it was one of the most amazing day trips we have ever taken and we have been to places like Thailand Vietnam Kenya and Dubai New York etc so have seen both sides of the way people live. To sum up Marrakech...it is a must place to visit and Les Trois Mages Riad played a big part in us having a superb time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Really lovely riad - beautiful rooms - lovely people. Would definitely recommend. Hot water mint tea and coffee available throughout the day. Lovely breakfasts. A pleasure to stay there. The riad was approx a 15 minute walk to the medina which means you are nicely away from the hustle and bustle but not great if you want to be a really short walk away from the sights.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My friend and I returned two years on for a repeat stay at Les Trois Mages for a couple of nights. Though the weather wasn't great we still had a wonderful time with a helpful transfer courtesy of Hassan another of Saida's fabulous dinners and a good night's sleep. Sorry that we cou.ld not go to Kasbah Toubkal as my friend was unwell but the staff at les 3 Mages could not have been more helpful or concerned. The usual peaceful and calm atmosphere soon made her feel better and now with unfinished business in Marrakech. Once again. We are already looking forward to our next trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anthony P wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Reading all the other Tripadvisor reviews our expectations were obviously high.Well there was no need for concernthis Riad is a gem.My wife and I spent four nights in The Bahia suite.Everything was organised perfectly.We had dinner on the first night the food was delicious.The following morning Aiden the manager had sorted a local tour guideshe was invaluable as this was our first experience of what is the chaotic charm that is Marrakesh.We also fond the city tour bus great and excellent value for money.The Riad was the most perfect place to relax after a long day in the city.We asked Aiden could he recommend a nice restauranthe suggested the Dar Yacoutthat was perfect.I said to my wife after a couple of days at the Riadit was like staying with old friends it is that friendly.The breakfast was superb with a good choiceand perfectly cookedwe took ours on the roof terracewhat a fabulous way to start the day.To sum upthe staff at the Riad gave us the most wonderful timeI would like to thank them all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo T wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: Lovely first night stay in Morocco!
Review_Text: We stayed here for just 1 night when we landed in Marrakech at the start of a weeks holiday. When we booked they were really helpful at arranging transfers from the airport. The reception when we got to the riad was wonderful. We arrived at about 9 in the evening and were greeted with mint tea and sweet snacks.  The room was lovely as was the whole riad. Very helpful staff and water tea and coffee available free when you need it. Also help to get to the transfer point for our next destination the following day.  Lovely place to stay and hope to go back to stay when planning a longer stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Chris B wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: An oasis of calm in the middle of the bustle of the medina.the riad is tastefully decorated in a traditional style. Aidan and his staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Tea and coffee was available at any time and they were happy to do any ironing you needed at no extra charge.  Breakfast and the evening meal we had on the day of departue was very good. The facilities on the roof terrace with the pool loungers and the availability of towels and sun hats was a welcome retreat from the heat of the day. Overall a very enjoyable stay and would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is a really elegant and well designed riad tastefully decorated calm and quiet location but right in the heart of the medina.    Aidan and the team are extremely welcoming and couldn't be more helpful! Nice roof terrace with sun loungers and a plunge pool very handy after a hot day haggling in the souks.    Food also very goodespecially the breakfast.    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lee M wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Just like to say what a beautiful and classy riad les trois mages is fantastic service both by the ladies who will make you mint tea whenever you fancy and also Aiden was great! the Riad looks even better in person and the quality of furnishing is amazing considering the heart of Marrakech is a few feet away its such a chilled out place! the terrace is fantastic and the plunge pool is perfect to just cool down in from 40 degree heat! The food at the riad is also amazing!!! Big thank you to everyone there we had an amazing time on our honeymoon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the riad for 8 nights I can honestly say the approach from the staff and in particular Aiden was superb. I never usually write reviews but I was taken back by the kindness shown to us. If we ever needed help or advice the staff would do everything to help us. The riad is wonderful excellent value for money comfortable and spacious rooms good breakfast with mint tea coffee or water available at anytime for no extra cost!!! The plunge pool and beautiful terrace is the perfect respite from the busy streets of Marrakech. We will definitely return to this wonderful part of the world and when we do there is only one place to stay our home at the riad Les Trois Mages!! Thank you for everything.

Review_Title: Lovely staff and tranquil haven away from the bustle
Review_Text: Travelling with family and friends with family all really well welcomed by the staff. Mousine was particularly helpful with recommendations of where to go insights into Marrakech and Moroccan culture/life (we were there during ramadan) and even booking and collecting tickets for our onward journey to Essaouira! The Riad is both stylish and comfortable and the rooftop pool is an absolute godsend. We booked for of the rooms (and had a nosey at the other room and suite) and would be delighted to stay in any of them. The Riad is just on the edge of the souks and a short walk brings you into the bustle of the souk and the Marrakech experience. Looking for a reason for a return trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Sophisticated, stylish and warm for this riad with caractere
Review_Text: We travelled 3 weeks in Morocco and after the buzz of Fez it was just a real pleasure to arrive at Les trois Mages...A warm welcome from Moushine who made us feel like we were at home...a little oasis in the heart of Marrakech the Melchior room (with silent air conditionning) with open doors on the pacio the clear water pool on the roof top the living areas the use of the kitchen to our convenience the percfect location and at last but not least...the valable help from Moushine...style and discretion. We just don't have anything bad to say WE LOVED IT!!  Oh yeah...one more point: even if we did not have the chance to meet the owners we were amazed by the customer service they provided us with...and being in the travel industry I know how difficult and rare this can be to find! (sorry for my English I am French!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucinda C wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: A haven amongst the heat and bustle of Marrakech. Aidan was very helpful; showing us the way to the main square on the first evening really helped us to get our bearings. The staff were very helpful and the riad was beautifully decorated in local style. It is well placed for exploring the city and a short walk from the beautiful YSL Marjorelle Gardens a lovely place to vist on a hot day. We visited in July; if you visit then get most of your sightseeing done in the morning as by the afternoon it is too hot to do anything!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent - Oasis in the Marrakech storm
Review_Text: We started and ended our stay in the 3 mages - and it was perfect.    We had dinner on the first night and it was defininatly worth it hassle free great food and a reasonable price.    The manager (Aidan) is great - he is helpful and all you can ask for in a manager.    The girls who loil after the place are great and friendly - it helps to speak French but it is okay if you don't :-).    Finally the night manager is good as well we came in late most nights and had great chats with him.    All in all a great place and we will come back - also you get a 10% discount when you come back.

Being fascinated by North African Muslim cultures we've been trying to visit Morocco since 1975! The opportunity eventually presented itself and after trawling through the vast number of riads and reviews here on TA and elsewhere our minds were finally settled on this room at the “Three Kings” in Marrakech.    Although our EasyJet flight from Manchester was delayed by about two hours the (arranged through the riad) transfer man was there patiently waiting for us and whipped us away to our home for the next four nights. We were so glad to have made this arrangement as we would have really struggled to find the house otherwise; Marrakech medina is a rabbit warren of twisting and turning streets many of which are only a metre or so wide!!!    Aidan the English manager welcomed us and we were in the room in no time. It's lovely! There are no hidden disappointments and the pictures are true to life. We had ordered meals for our arrival which were absolutely delicious and very filling Saida the cook is very obliging and cooks the meals (which are heavy on meat content) to perfection! All the staff at the riad were very good cheerfully providing pots of tea (tea coffee and water are available all the time without further charge) at all hours of the day or night and exactly to my specification!    Being in the medina Les Trois Mages is ideal for exploring this utterly fascinating area. Aidan provided us with a walking guide who was very personable and spoke excellent English and who took us through many tiny streets which were a hive of manufacturing activity. We would never have found these by ourselves and thought the expense of the guide to be money well spent! Afterwards we were able to find our way around the various souks which sprawled between the riad and the Djemaa El Fna without any difficulties. The walk took us about 25/30 minutes. Although it's only a half mile we kept stopping to look in shops etc. and it was the middle of summer with the temperature reaching 49c!    The availability of a laptop in the lounge was a very useful addition and the Internet connection was really quite fast. We need to have constant access to our emails for business purposes and were delighted to not have to hump our own laptop through all the security checks at the various airports.    Although quite 'authentic' and traditional the room door locking and plumbing were rather quaint possibly because of the historical French influence but perfectly adequate. (In fact you could have the shower jetting out hard enough to actually hurt if you wanted to!) Hot water was constant and plentiful as were the shower consumables and the white towelling bath robes were well large enough to stretch around my 'ample' girth!    We had a look at the roof terrace and pool which looked very welcoming and clean but were of no particular interest to us although the other guests were making frequent use of these facilities.    All in all I would not hesitate to highly recommend this riad and the room we occupied (Melchior) to anyone visiting Marrakech. On future visits we would certainly like to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place is a amazing we had a fantastic week here relaxing after the buzzing vibes of Marrakech this was a welcome place to return too Aiden the hotel manager was great extremly helpful arranged for the taxi to and from the airport and walked us down to the square on our first night. The rest of the staff were great we loved this place would highly recommend a stay here if your going to Marrakech.    One tip - If you get lost in the Medina or even look remotly lost do not take the advice of the boys on the street who will take you the long way round and ask for money for the privledge.    Thaks Aiden and staff for making our holiday what it was. We will defiantly return and we're be bringing the kids with us next time. Peter and Sally
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we had such a lovely time at Riad Les Trois Mages Saida and Laila were wonderful and so was Moushine. Aiden helped us out with booking restuarants etc we ate in some wonderful places we highly recommend Crystal at Pacha and Le Comptoir.    Hassan the taxi driver was such a brilliant character.    The Riad itself is lovely we were lucky enough to stay there for a few days on our own as there were no other bookings so had the roof terrace to ourselves. Saida made us lovely pizza for lunch made from fresh!    our room was perfect we were in the Melchior Room we only had to open the doors take two steps out and we were in the courtyard where breakfast was served our room was clean spacious and it was lovely that you could just leave the door open and pull the netting across.    There are no faults to be found with this Riad and especially not with the staff its such a laid back haven from the hectic and intense Marrakech outside the four walls it was so nice to come in from the chaos into the tranquil peaceful home from home we have already recommended to a few of our friends and highly recommend anyone to stay there its absolute bliss!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad for three nights. The Riad is peaceful and lovely and the Bahia Suite was large and comfortable. By all means take up the Riad's offer on a taxi from the airport. The medina can be a bit daunting for first time visitors. Aiden was helpful on all details and arranged a wonderful trip to the southern oases and Sahara which worked out very well. We had a very early departure before the normal breakfast hour but they arranged breakfast for us nonetheless. The one unexpected thing to be aware of is that all the rooms open onto the courtyard so you can hear some of what goes on below and in other rooms and if your windows are open other guests can see into your room. This Riad is a very lovely place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Absolutely wonderful oasis. I have just returned from a stay at Riad Les Trois Mages with 12 friends and can say this was exceptional I cannot fault this Riad and the wonderful staff in anyway. Their hospitality was outstanding and they cared for our every need and more. The staff and the Riad are wonderful and we didn't want to leave. I can guarantee you will not be disappointed if you stay here.  Thankyou very much to everyone who made our stay at Riad Les Trois Mages so perfectly wonderful.  Nikki
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the riad for 8 nights I can honestly say the approach from the staff and in particular Aiden was superb. I never usually write reviews but I was taken back by the kindness shown to us. If we ever needed help or advice the staff would do everything to help us. The riad is wonderful excellent value for money comfortable and spacious rooms good breakfast with mint tea coffee or water available at anytime for no extra cost!!! The plunge pool and beautiful terrace is the perfect respite from the busy streets of Marrakech. We will definitely return to this wonderful part of the world and when we do there is only one place to stay our home at the riad Les Trois Mages!! Thank you for everything.

Although quite 'authentic' and traditional the room door locking and plumbing were rather quaint possibly because of the historical French influence but perfectly adequate. (In fact you could have the shower jetting out hard enough to actually hurt if you wanted to!) Hot water was constant and plentiful as were the shower consumables and the white towelling bath robes were well large enough to stretch around my 'ample' girth!    We had a look at the roof terrace and pool which looked very welcoming and clean but were of no particular interest to us although the other guests were making frequent use of these facilities.    All in all I would not hesitate to highly recommend this riad and the room we occupied (Melchior) to anyone visiting Marrakech. On future visits we would certainly like to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place is a amazing we had a fantastic week here relaxing after the buzzing vibes of Marrakech this was a welcome place to return too Aiden the hotel manager was great extremly helpful arranged for the taxi to and from the airport and walked us down to the square on our first night. The rest of the staff were great we loved this place would highly recommend a stay here if your going to Marrakech.    One tip - If you get lost in the Medina or even look remotly lost do not take the advice of the boys on the street who will take you the long way round and ask for money for the privledge.    Thaks Aiden and staff for making our holiday what it was. We will defiantly return and we're be bringing the kids with us next time. Peter and Sally
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we had such a lovely time at Riad Les Trois Mages Saida and Laila were wonderful and so was Moushine. Aiden helped us out with booking restuarants etc we ate in some wonderful places we highly recommend Crystal at Pacha and Le Comptoir.    Hassan the taxi driver was such a brilliant character.    The Riad itself is lovely we were lucky enough to stay there for a few days on our own as there were no other bookings so had the roof terrace to ourselves. Saida made us lovely pizza for lunch made from fresh!    our room was perfect we were in the Melchior Room we only had to open the doors take two steps out and we were in the courtyard where breakfast was served our room was clean spacious and it was lovely that you could just leave the door open and pull the netting across.    There are no faults to be found with this Riad and especially not with the staff its such a laid back haven from the hectic and intense Marrakech outside the four walls it was so nice to come in from the chaos into the tranquil peaceful home from home we have already recommended to a few of our friends and highly recommend anyone to stay there its absolute bliss!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad for three nights. The Riad is peaceful and lovely and the Bahia Suite was large and comfortable. By all means take up the Riad's offer on a taxi from the airport. The medina can be a bit daunting for first time visitors. Aiden was helpful on all details and arranged a wonderful trip to the southern oases and Sahara which worked out very well. We had a very early departure before the normal breakfast hour but they arranged breakfast for us nonetheless. The one unexpected thing to be aware of is that all the rooms open onto the courtyard so you can hear some of what goes on below and in other rooms and if your windows are open other guests can see into your room. This Riad is a very lovely place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Absolutely wonderful oasis. I have just returned from a stay at Riad Les Trois Mages with 12 friends and can say this was exceptional I cannot fault this Riad and the wonderful staff in anyway. Their hospitality was outstanding and they cared for our every need and more. The staff and the Riad are wonderful and we didn't want to leave. I can guarantee you will not be disappointed if you stay here.  Thankyou very much to everyone who made our stay at Riad Les Trois Mages so perfectly wonderful.  Nikki
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the riad for 8 nights I can honestly say the approach from the staff and in particular Aiden was superb. I never usually write reviews but I was taken back by the kindness shown to us. If we ever needed help or advice the staff would do everything to help us. The riad is wonderful excellent value for money comfortable and spacious rooms good breakfast with mint tea coffee or water available at anytime for no extra cost!!! The plunge pool and beautiful terrace is the perfect respite from the busy streets of Marrakech. We will definitely return to this wonderful part of the world and when we do there is only one place to stay our home at the riad Les Trois Mages!! Thank you for everything.

Review_Title: Lovely staff and tranquil haven away from the bustle
Review_Text: Travelling with family and friends with family all really well welcomed by the staff. Mousine was particularly helpful with recommendations of where to go insights into Marrakech and Moroccan culture/life (we were there during ramadan) and even booking and collecting tickets for our onward journey to Essaouira! The Riad is both stylish and comfortable and the rooftop pool is an absolute godsend. We booked for of the rooms (and had a nosey at the other room and suite) and would be delighted to stay in any of them. The Riad is just on the edge of the souks and a short walk brings you into the bustle of the souk and the Marrakech experience. Looking for a reason for a return trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Sophisticated, stylish and warm for this riad with caractere
Review_Text: We travelled 3 weeks in Morocco and after the buzz of Fez it was just a real pleasure to arrive at Les trois Mages...A warm welcome from Moushine who made us feel like we were at home...a little oasis in the heart of Marrakech the Melchior room (with silent air conditionning) with open doors on the pacio the clear water pool on the roof top the living areas the use of the kitchen to our convenience the percfect location and at last but not least...the valable help from Moushine...style and discretion. We just don't have anything bad to say WE LOVED IT!!  Oh yeah...one more point: even if we did not have the chance to meet the owners we were amazed by the customer service they provided us with...and being in the travel industry I know how difficult and rare this can be to find! (sorry for my English I am French!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucinda C wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: A haven amongst the heat and bustle of Marrakech. Aidan was very helpful; showing us the way to the main square on the first evening really helped us to get our bearings. The staff were very helpful and the riad was beautifully decorated in local style. It is well placed for exploring the city and a short walk from the beautiful YSL Marjorelle Gardens a lovely place to vist on a hot day. We visited in July; if you visit then get most of your sightseeing done in the morning as by the afternoon it is too hot to do anything!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent - Oasis in the Marrakech storm
Review_Text: We started and ended our stay in the 3 mages - and it was perfect.    We had dinner on the first night and it was defininatly worth it hassle free great food and a reasonable price.    The manager (Aidan) is great - he is helpful and all you can ask for in a manager.    The girls who loil after the place are great and friendly - it helps to speak French but it is okay if you don't :-).    Finally the night manager is good as well we came in late most nights and had great chats with him.    All in all a great place and we will come back - also you get a 10% discount when you come back.

Being fascinated by North African Muslim cultures we've been trying to visit Morocco since 1975! The opportunity eventually presented itself and after trawling through the vast number of riads and reviews here on TA and elsewhere our minds were finally settled on this room at the “Three Kings” in Marrakech.    Although our EasyJet flight from Manchester was delayed by about two hours the (arranged through the riad) transfer man was there patiently waiting for us and whipped us away to our home for the next four nights. We were so glad to have made this arrangement as we would have really struggled to find the house otherwise; Marrakech medina is a rabbit warren of twisting and turning streets many of which are only a metre or so wide!!!    Aidan the English manager welcomed us and we were in the room in no time. It's lovely! There are no hidden disappointments and the pictures are true to life. We had ordered meals for our arrival which were absolutely delicious and very filling Saida the cook is very obliging and cooks the meals (which are heavy on meat content) to perfection! All the staff at the riad were very good cheerfully providing pots of tea (tea coffee and water are available all the time without further charge) at all hours of the day or night and exactly to my specification!    Being in the medina Les Trois Mages is ideal for exploring this utterly fascinating area. Aidan provided us with a walking guide who was very personable and spoke excellent English and who took us through many tiny streets which were a hive of manufacturing activity. We would never have found these by ourselves and thought the expense of the guide to be money well spent! Afterwards we were able to find our way around the various souks which sprawled between the riad and the Djemaa El Fna without any difficulties. The walk took us about 25/30 minutes. Although it's only a half mile we kept stopping to look in shops etc. and it was the middle of summer with the temperature reaching 49c!    The availability of a laptop in the lounge was a very useful addition and the Internet connection was really quite fast. We need to have constant access to our emails for business purposes and were delighted to not have to hump our own laptop through all the security checks at the various airports.    Although quite 'authentic' and traditional the room door locking and plumbing were rather quaint possibly because of the historical French influence but perfectly adequate. (In fact you could have the shower jetting out hard enough to actually hurt if you wanted to!) Hot water was constant and plentiful as were the shower consumables and the white towelling bath robes were well large enough to stretch around my 'ample' girth!    We had a look at the roof terrace and pool which looked very welcoming and clean but were of no particular interest to us although the other guests were making frequent use of these facilities.    All in all I would not hesitate to highly recommend this riad and the room we occupied (Melchior) to anyone visiting Marrakech. On future visits we would certainly like to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A very nice riad beautifully decked out. Really nice rooms and the spaces around to hang out like on the terrace or in the lounge or music space were comfy. Breakfast was delish as was dinner with a great range to pick from. Good location. Loved it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Location and welcome Peace and Quiet after the Medina!
Review_Text: Beautifully decorated Riad in ideal location for Souks Square and New City. We were able to walk everywhere. Dinner was a good idea for our arrival evening as one need's to be fully prepared for the onslaught that awaits outside!!! Nice roof terrace for chilling out. The suite was a pleasure to stay in although there was a problem with the drain from the bath whilst we were there which wasn't resolved during our stay - the smell unfortunately was rather overpowering.so no baths taken thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah P wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: Being at Riad Trois Les Mages is like being a cherished house guest. Aidan the English manager is a gem. The Riad is a conveniently located oasis from the vibrant souks the staff are loyal and really care about your holiday experience. It's stylish and upmarket at a reasonable price with a personal touch.  Don't underestimate the benefits of a venue you can buy a bottle of wine that's not from Morocco at a reasonable price or the location of the mini-pool on the roof terrace (rather than the more usual courtyard) which you'll actually use. The staff will happily organise a taxi or book a tour for you a real benefit in Marrackech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Magical!!! This is the second time I've stayed at Les Trois Mages and it is so beautiful!! I first stayed in 2008 with a friend. This time I went with my husband and our two children. Moushine remembered me from last time!! How amazing is that?? !! Even the room we stayed in. This riad has 6 bedrooms over two floors around the central courtyard. We loved just relaxing on the rooftop terrace whether lazing on the sunlounges while our children played in the pool or lying on the daybeds. It felt completely heavenly!!! The breakfast were delicious and the perfect start to the day. After spending our days wandering amongst the little alleys in the medina and shopping in the souks  it was wonderful to retreat to the tranquility of the riad. I really feel Les Trois Mages is the ONLY place stay in Marrakech.  Cafe Arabe and the Kozybar are definately on the must go list. Both have gorgeous rooftop terraces.    My verdict - the perfect break away from normal life.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Very helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are great ESP suites. Breakfast nice. Didn't try the dinner.

Review_Title: Fantastic, welcoming, beautiful, helpful Riad. A*
Review_Text: This was my second time in Marrakech and I decided to spend a little more on a Riad than last time - thank goodness we had a wonderful stay and I would recommend Les Trois Mages to everyone! Beautiful rooms first class service a homely atmosphere not far from the Souk free wifi and an English speaking manager (which makes a big difference in Marrakesh). Aiden and his team were indispensable to our entire stay in Morocco - I've now stayed in three different (supposedly) 4* hotels in Marrakesh and can safely say this is the only one worthy of the rating - others are pretty but the service is often slow/bad and they can't make your stay as relaxing and enjoyable as Les Trois Mages. On our last 2 nights we had booked another Riad and found ourselves reminiscing about this one instead. Worth every penny and more A*!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic riad great destination. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful great breakfast (and evening meal on the first night) and lovely rooftop terrace and plung pool.We really couldnt ask for more ! So many nice retaurants around but Pepe Neros well worth checking out.  We will definitely be back to Marrakech and Les Trois Mages !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Could not have been more helpfull
Review_Text: I have not travelled much and was a little bit terrified as our banger of a taxi drove into the manic Marrakech medina taking us to our riad. As soon as we walked in the door and were greeted with mint tea I felt the panic leave me and I isntatly relaxed into the holiday. Aidan came and sat with us and gave us some good maps and great adivce on bars/cafes/restaurants. He then walked up all the way to the square which is only 10 or 15 mins but greatly appreciated due to the hustle and bustle of the medina streets. The riad is in a residential/locals area so not that touristy which made me nervous the first time we walked into town but everyone is nice and friendly.    Our room at the riad was the Jade room. It was perfect big enough for us and our bags and very clean. The shower was great too something I really rate in a hotel. I saw it said in previous reviews but for some reason didnt take note until I did it for myself - the Riad food IS the best that we had in Marrakech. My only regret is that we only booked dinner for one night!    We went on from this Riad to Essaouira and then back to Marrakech for one night before flying home. The last night in Marrakech we stayed in a more expensive riad that is amoung the top 5 rated on trip advisor but I would genuinely rate this one up there too (and its better value!). Book it you wont regret it. Oh and book dinner too!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As regular travellers we dont compliment people and places as often as we should however we feel compelled to write a review for this magnificent Riad. Now a riad as apposed to a hotel is a very different thing in a hotel its just that a hotel in a riad or certainly our experience of this one is an oasis a home from home its just like visiting with friends. In essence its how all accomodation should be.    The initial booking process with the super helpful and prompt communication from Anna and Aiden was faultless and really helped us feel safe and secure about arriving in an unfamiliar city. We were as promised met at the arrivals hall by our driver complete with little sign with our names on it he then showed us to the cash machine (you cant take Dirhams into the country) he then took us on a very interesting journey into the riad which is situated deep in the Medina. We were taken down to the riad along well lit passageways and met at the door by Mohsine (never a nicer more gracious man have we met) and shown into the main area offered refreshments and left to settle. I really dont want to write this as a blow by blow account of our trip however every detail of our stay was so perfect that I almost feel I have to.    We were shown our fabulous room complete with gold snake head tap and wrought iron bed. Dinner was then served by the ever present Saida and we knew we had made the right choice the food was magnificent as was everything we ate during our stay.    Nothing was to much trouble for any of the staff Aiden the manager was superb attentitive and unobtrusive be it organising a guide for the souks or recommending a restaraunt. We hardly saw any of the other guest however when we did they were like minded travellers who were enjoying themselves as we were.    The location of the riad is a 10-15 min stroll from the main square either down a main street or the more adventurous way via the souks ideal to go out for the day or a bite to eat.    One night we really did feel like we were at home we had had a day of exploring had come back enjoyed some time on the beautiful and peaceful roof terrace came down stairs got a bottle of wine and lounged about whilst my fiance played the piano perfect. Where else can you do that?    The trip was so special for us and the riad so perfect that we got engaged one night whilst sitting on the terrace with our feet in the pool.    Go and stay here you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lee B wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: Perfect haven from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech!
Review_Text: Just got back from a long weekend in Marrakesh and I must say that Riad Les Trois Mages was the perfect choice for our trip. Its location was 'spot on' being a 10 minute walk to the main square and just outside the Souks. The staff were very helpful and friendly and made us feel at home throughout our stay. Saida cooked up a storm of a Tanjia on our first night which we enjoyed in the beautiful courtyard. Overall we were both very happy with our stay and would recommend it anyone who is heading to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When you think that I booked into this Riad entirely and purely on the basis of previous reviews to spend a weekend in a country I've never visited before has never been so easy or pleasant! I guess there is always a sense of trepidation when as a seasoned traveller like myself who is used to staying in hotels you usually know what you are going to get with the major chains. However this guest house is a jewel within the Medina and I can honestly say that I shall return sooner and for longer! The Riad is owned by Tony and Anna a couple from London and managed by Aidan an English guy who lives locally. They are all thoroughly nice people who can't do enough for you during your stay and I seriously mean that! The Riad is fairly non descript from the outside and may even concern you a little the first time upon arrival when walking down the alley ways. Your fears are immediately allayed once the door is opened and you step inside this contemporary Moroccan building which is of such quality that you won't want to leave. The ground floor rooms are comfortable and welcoming. The piano is open to anyone who cares to tinker and I spent a few hours listening to delightful music floating up to our room on the first floor. The welcome from the staff was very friendly and the whole place just soothing and relaxing. I could go on forever about this place but I'll stop by saying that you will have nothing but a good time here with extremely pleasant people wonderful rooms a superb terrace with pool and lounge chairs delicious food whether breakfast lunch or dinner and a great location with easy access to enable you to discover the Medina and it's magic!! Thank you very much Anna Tony Aidan Saida Moushine Najia & Laila. Loved it and see you all soon!

The Riad truly has a unique Moroccan setting with a pleasant atmosphere. Much more than what I expected. I am a traveler of exotic areas and the majority of hotels I have slept in overnight have the same basic dull plain and colorless rooms;a television of 10 inches a small decaying sofa and a view of the hotel garage. Archaic and nothing interesting. However in this Moroccan hotel we have beautiful plants exotic carpets an open courtyard that lets in a fresh breeze at night and a romantic setting of the stars. Once you enter you will be greeted by Aiden the hotel manager. He is a very resourceful and a delightful person to meet. He welcomes and accommodates guest. In addition Aiden has great tips if you have any questions or concerns about Marrakesh .    I recommend that you take a tour around Marrakesh. Aiden can arrange the tour. Bring money since there will be fees to enter museums palaces and gardens. The prices are low for each entrance.    The service is fantastic the staff members are very polite and sweet and therefore will all these varieties fused under one hotel I couldn't ask for a better stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for a week in March and loved it. Aiden arranged a taxi to pick us up at the airport. We were a bit concerned when we got out and walked down the side street but as when we got throught the door I knew we'd made the perfect choice. As soon as our bags were in the room we were given mint tea and cake then Aiden walked us to the main square through the souks to help us get our bearings - a sign of the brilliant hospitality shown all week. We stayed in Melchior for the 1st 3 nights - then in Bahia for 4 nights. Loved the rooms especially Bahia - there are only 6 rooms so it feel like you're a guest in someones home rather than a hotel. All the rooms and lounge area overlook the courtyard and the sun terrace was a welcome respite after a day exploring the crazyness of the city. Breakfast was served in the courtyard each morning and we also ate dinner there the 1st night. On our last night it rained heavily and as we had an early start we decided to stay at the riad but hadn't ordered dinner (dinner is only cooked if preordered) - Aiden came to the rescue by getting us takeaway of chicken and chips Moroccan style and a bottle of wine to wash it down. Altough the ladies in the kitchen didn't speak much english it didn't seem to matter - they just know how to take care of you. If you want to just chill out in the lounge area at night then the large open fire gets lit and tended for you with more servings of tea if required!    If you want a 5* hotel with people fawning over you and a restaurant bar and room that could be anywhere in the world then this is probably not the place for you. But if you want somewhere that makes you feel like you're in Marrakech with an authentic feel of the city 5* hospitality and an oasis of calm from all the crazyness of the souks then this is perfect.    NB - of all the tips you get about do's and don'ts when in Marrackech I'd say the ones to remember are -  you will get lost in the souks whether you like it or not even with a map so enjoy the adventure -  don't take a picture of anyone unless you're willing to pay them -  you will probably be charged by most people trying to show you the way so always carry small change just in case -  don't be afraid to say no when in shops even after haggling -  under no circumstances go to the leather tanneries unless you can stand the stench and then want to be royally rippped of by a queue of people from the men who run the tannery to their family/personal friend who owns the extortianate leather goods shop. Having told our 'guide' we only wanted to go if we could just look and had no intention of spending any money there (we had been warned about the tanneries) we were then faced by a group of very irate agressive people looking for very substantial tips - we refused to pay and made a hasty exit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages for 2 nights at the end of a 2 week tour of Morocco. My husband son and I all agreed that out of the 8 hotels/riads we had stayed in it was the nicest place we had stayed a perfect ending to our 2 weeks. We were extremely lucky to have the whole riad to ourselves and all the staff were very polite and helpful but discreet. Breakfasts were delcicious and our room was very comfortable defintely the fluffiest towels and the best shower pressue we had had on our whole trip! Great location - 15 mins walk to the souks. Can't wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed here with a group of friends for 4 days in mid-July and we rented out the whole riad. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome by the host Aidan and all his wonderful staff. All the rooms were beautifully presented clean and with air-con (a must if you visit Marrakech in the middle of summer!). There are also ipod docking stations in the rooms so you can listen to your own music and also a laptop downstairs for internet use. Breakfast was included in the price and served every morning and included a large variety of options - nothing was ever too much trouble for Saida and the others to prepare. The rooftop pool was lovely and there were sofas in the shade on the roof to take cover from the sun.    Location is perfect - about 15 mins walk down to the Souks. Aidan very kindly accompanied us down there so we wouldn't get lost! Be prepared to do a bit og haggling though and don't accept the first prices offered. You'll be surprised how much traders will reduce their prices!    Overall a wonderful stay made all the more enjoyable by Aidan and his wonderful staff. Thank you for helping to make this a great holiday!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Such a lovely and peacefully place
Review_Text: The choice of this Riad (there so many in Marrakech) had been absolutely the best! It is such a lovely peacefully and quite place. The best to disconnect from the busy life outside on the streets. Everything decorated in such a detailed perfect way with wonderful colourful taste and I have never felt more home in a Hotel than this time. There are plenty of salons where to rest the room was spacy and comfortable and so well decorated. The bathroom was a dream as well. The terrasse is wonderful with a small pool which was very refreshingas we stayed in the most hottest time a lot of comfi furnitures and all looks like 1001 nights dream. The staff was wonderful descrete and friendly felt like beeing part of a family. We did not ate there (also I am pretty sure we missed a lot!!) but we had breakfast which was really good. Perfect service! I absolutely highly can reccomend this Riad. The location is perfect we NEVER got lost so easy to go to the place Jamma el Fna. Arriving from airport we got collected and so we had no struggle also it is the most known part Riad larouusse. In total just a wonderful stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The riad was very nice! Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was very good: pancakes toast marmelade coffee tea orange juice honey melon. The rooms were clean and lovely decorated (we stayed at the Jade room). Also the pool and the terrace are very nice. To the Jamaa el Fna you have to walk about 15min if you find the shortest way through the souks ;-). We would come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we came through the arrivals gate to the second we all left the Riad waving a fond goodbey to Aidan and his wonderful staff we had the best time our every need was catered for throught out and nothing was too much trouble. Sadia's food was fantastic and Adian was the perfect host. After arranging our trips and outings with Aidan via e-mail and phone before leaving the UK I found everything was taken in hand by the time we arrived. The Riad is perfectly situated close to the medina (about 10 min stroll) and we found it easy to get back after the tour guide showed us around the first day. The 4x4 Atlas Mountins trip is a must as is the walking tour of the medina (its better to do this first then you know where you are!!!) the roof top pool is a blessing and we had a wonderful afternoon sunbathing and splashing around Sadia served our lunch under the tented seating area and then later Aidan arranged for a local couple to come and give us massages at the Riad rather than leaving our blissfull sanctuary to visit a Hamman. If your looking for a traditonal Riad with masses of features finished to a high standard with a family feel and great food this is the place for you. Highly recommended and I would love to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A beautiful oasis in amongst the bustle of Marrakech. We arrived late at night in our own personal taxi and enjoyed a delicious Morrocan meal prepared by Saida. We were the only guests during our stay and the staff couldn't do enough for us. The rooms are all individually and beautifully decorated and we enjoyed the roof terrace and plunge pool when the sun got too hot!  The riad was in a good location for those wanting a short stroll through the souks to the main square.  All in all a superb stay made perfect by the wonderful staff especially Moushine who made our holiday the most relaxing one for a few years. We will definately be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: John D wrote a review Jun 2011
Review_Title: We had a fantastic second honeymoon....
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed Marrakech and had an exciting and romantic 5 days here - helped enormously by the lovely staff and excellent customer service given by Riad Les Trois Mages. The Moroccan staff who run the Riad day -to-day were delightful and couldn't do enough for us. The Riad is tranquil and relaxing in is stylish in an unassuming way. It is also really easy to get into the central areas of the old Medina from the Riad - about a 10 minute walk.    Have a go at the cooking trip if you're a foody type - this was a fantastic experience organised through the Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for a few days over my birthday with my girlfriend. I can only repeat the excellent reviews already given. Beautiful courtyard area rooms etc and the most friendly and helpful staff possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful haven in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Great Dar about 10-15 mins walk from the central square and with plenty of sights nearby and near to many nice restaurants and bars.    Staff were helpful and friendly happy to organise airport pick-up etc. Breakfast was nice taken on either the terrace or in the courtyard.    We were in the Melchior suite more a large room but very comfortable and very quiet and peacefu.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Staff in this tasteful and beautifully done Riad who give you that home from home experience
Review_Text: This is my second stay at Les trois Mages. It is a Riad tucked away in an unasumming street which makes it all the more surprising and delightful when you step inside .  The rooms are simple morroccan chic  tasteful and comfortable . Ensuit Bathrooms with lovely touches . An airy court yard open to the sky and a roof terrace with comfy sofas and recliners to chill on . There's even a small shallow pool to cool off in . Most of all though  it is the staff who make this Riad special . They can't do enough for you . Then of course there's wonderful Marrakech  just a five minute walk takes you into the beginings of the bustling Souks .!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: lovely staff, amazing place, delightful setting, pool is a godsend
Review_Text: We have just returned and had the most amazing stay the rooms are delightful the staff could not be more friendly dinner on the roof terrace is a must the cooking is fab.    So so so friendly i pod docking staions in the room we were in so bring your i music! internet down stairs always avaiable. Bathrooms could do with more cleaning attention during our stay and toping up of the bath and shower products.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Place to Stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Riad.The rooms are cosy and the food was delightful.However what really makes your stay enjoyable are the staff who will go out the of way to make you feel at home.  Only suggestions for improvement - a) the rooms can probably do with a telly (but we didn't miss it much) and b) it will be nice to have a ala carte menu for dinner because sometimes you may not be hungry enough to do justice to the set menu :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We hadn't planned anything for our trip to Morocco wanting to decide what we wanted to do once we got there but at the last minute I opted to book a room at Les Trois Mages just for our first night there.    Les Trois Mages is positively gorgeous. Our room was beautiful decorated the bed comfy even the bathroom was beautiful. There are several sitting rooms as well as a gorgeous rooftop pool and a tented sitting area where we read and sipped wine throughout a rainstorm.    We found it to be very conveniently located. We were definitely glad to be in the medina. It was only about a 10 minute walk to Djamaa El Fna (typically longer for us as I shopped my way up and down our route each and every time.) We were able to walk to Jardin Majorelle as well as other areas of the newer section of town.    The staff is incredible. Moushine helped us get settled helped us sort through a slew of restaurant recommendations and even walked us to the restaurant so that we wouldn't get lost our first night there. We were so taken with Les Trois Mages that we planned the rest of our 2 week stay around when there were openings and Aiden helped us plan a fantastic itinerary and had so many really great recommendations. Aside from being great at their jobs Les Trois Mages staff is just incredibly friendly.    We will undoubtedly stay at Les Trois Mages whenever we have a chance to return to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John C wrote a review Apr 2011
Review_Title: The best service and nicest people you will find.
Review_Text: We have a two year old daughter and the people at this RIad couldn't have been nicer. Our first visit to a Muslim country and we found it to be very educational.    This was a little intense at first as the drive in was through the narrowest streets I've ever been on with nary a tourist face to be seen. The Riad is in the Medina though a healthy 15 minute walk from the center.    Once we got into the Riad it was fantastic. The nicest most eager to please people I've ever been involved with. They absolutely adore children and it shows. The GM Aiden is a terrific resource and was very helpful. It really felt like a special place inside the walls. Total family 'vibe' though we were the only ones with children. We never heard another guest and the experience was terrific.    The food they serve is really good and I would recommend at least one dinner in house. It's made with care by people who do. We were in the Melchior room which was big enough for the three of us. We tried for the suite but it was booked.    If you want to be pampered and served dinner by people you'd invite over for dinner - this is the place for you. Felt like someone's home and not at all the formal or impersonal vibe you can get in some hotels.    Luxe....? Not particularly but plenty nice for us and we generally stay in the 4 to 5 star range when it comes to lodging.    Absolutely recommended if you're not afraid of a little walking to get to the more central destinations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages for 3 nights. It's very close to the main square and markets (15 min walk). The riad itself is very clean and well presented with it's traditional Moroccan decor. Rooms were a nice size and very clean and well presented. It has a nice roof terrace to chill out in sun bathe or take a dip. The best part of all is the overall service and the staff on board. Very warm welcoming and made our stay a better experience. We got plenty of help from the riad manager in booking tours and restaurants ad well as tips on navigating the city. I would very much recommend the half day (full day also avail) guided tour early on in your stay as it made the rest of the trip easier in getting around. All in all a great experience and would strongly recommend.

Review_Title: Oasis of calm in a very busy city
Review_Text: The service from this riad from booking to leaving was first class. Aidan emailed us with useful information after booking and arranged a driver to collect us from the airport. We arrived to mint tea and croissants.  The rooms are lovelydecorated in a traditional Moroccan style with air conditioning. There are plenty of relaxing spaces in the riad from cool lounge areas to a lovely roof top terrace with small pool sun loungers and a shady area to sip tea.  All the staff were wonderful. Saida kept us well fed and Moushine looked after us very well.  Aidan arranged a trip to the Atlas Mountains for us and also recommended and booked restaurants for us.  This is a fantastic place to stay - we didn't want to leave !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A little oasis from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: All the staff at Les Trois Mages were helpful and friendly and we were made to feel at home immediately we arrived. Even the local taxi driver hired by the riad to collect us was part of the welcome as he spoke English and took charge of us straight away. Our room - Melchior - was delightful - loved the bathroom fittings! Saida cooked fabulous meals for us and we totally relaxed in the welcoming cosy atmosphere. We found having a guide to take us through the souks on the morning of our first full day there was very helpful and interesting. It was interesting how many days we were told by random men in the street that we were very lucky as today was the Berber market and they would take us there!! It's clearly the local tourist trap line so if you are prepared to pay a tip for being taken to a shop and spun a line about carpets or whatever then fine - just be prepared that all seemingly kindly offers to show you this that or the other always require a tip for their 'helpfulness'. But generally people were friendly and pleasant. There are plenty of interesting places to see and trips to take and Les Trois Mages was always lovely to come back to.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Don't be put off on arriving outside the riad as you enter you will see a beautiful peaceful retreat. The decor  In all rooms is very tasteful & spotlessly clean. The riad itself is a complete contrast to the craziness that is outside in the medina souks & square.

Review_Date: Jamie Ross wrote a review Apr 2011
Review_Title: Fantastic venue great ambiance, wonderfull staff
Review_Text: From the moment we met the Riad staff at the airport we felt we were in safe hands. The transfer was quick and well organised to the Riad. Upon arrival we met the staff and were immdetially welcomed by the manager Aiden. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. The food served in the Riad was as good if not better than in the more expensive restuarants in Marrakesh. We wish we had ate in more often as the settin and care the staff took to not only prepare the food but seve was excellent. The roof top sun area and pool is a haven from the hussle and bssle of the bust streets around tye riad. We took a number of the recomended excursions from the staff and all were very well organised and great value. We particularily liked the idea of a night watchman/helper the Riad have. On two ocasions late at night he was able to obtain last minute items from local shops.  The Breakfast does require a mention. Sitting in the big white towelling gowns supplied in the rooms whilst eating Fresh local produce cooked to order and plenty of it. Very good.  I thouroughly recomend Les Trois Mages at as a base to se Marrakesh as well as the mountains and Desert. Wonderfull hospitality and great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The riad was clean breaky everyday was fresh scumptious croissants only had one main lunch here on the first day as we was to busy venturing out the pool terrace was fab especialy after the medina souks and as you're tired and dusty great shower in the twin room. The riad location is north and still within the old city but is still a 15-20 minute (without getting lost) walk through the souks to the main square to be in midst of things is mostly in the south of the old city or new town. the only thing is the Gaspard roomm is on the ground floor - i would next time share a double especially if you are a light sleeper and like a lay in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad very nice looked after clean towels changed as often as you need them. pool on the terrace definately big plus. food also good. staff friendly. 10-15min walk to main square. However if not a big fan of souks and madness just round the corner and looking for luxury better stay in one of big hotel resorts outside medina.  Overall good experience. would recommend for anyone looking for more authentic stay in Morroco
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A haven amongst the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh
Review_Text: I was a little anxious about arriving so late (11.30pm) at the airport and having to find my way to the riad but was greeted by the local taxi service (Hassan) organised by Aidan so arrived safe and sound to be greeted by the night guardian and my friends who had arrived earlier had settled in and had met the other guests over a home cooked traditional dinner - shame I missed it by all accounts.  The room was comfortable even with three of us in it and after a good night's sleep we tucked in to a yummy breakfast before heading out into the souks and exploring the various sights that start only a few minutes walk away. Aidan's a good guide and also has lots of ideas on itineraries (trips to the mountains/coast) and recommendations for food etc.  It's lovely to return to the piece and quiet of the riad when you're tired and dusty to cups of tea (traditional or mint) and being able to relax by the pool up on the terrace or in the sumptuous lounges and just chill out.  The staff are all very friendly and welcoming which made our stay all the more enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I had certain requirements that I need for this trip as it was a birthday present for my partner. The whole trip ticked every box weather and culture.    But the Riad Les Trois made the whole trip complete. I cannot express how wonderful it was. I have stayed in 5 star hotels to Blackpool B&B's and I can say quite confidently this was the best of them all. Aidan and the staff made us feel right at home.    If I ever return to Marrakesh I won't think of staying anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Treated like Royality at the Riad of The Three Kings
Review_Text: Have just returned from our first trip to Marrakech we happened to arrive on the same day as the king of Morocco and the analogy stuck because we were thrilled with the royal reception at our little palace tucked away in the northern end of the Medina. Behind an unassuming brown door in unremarkable pink alley way we found ourselves in a beautiful haven with wonderful food stylish decor bowls of fresh roses everywhere a heated pool on the roof fantastically helpful staff and dozens of little touches that made us smile such as electric blankets and roaring log fires when the hot winter sun went down and a contant supply of complimentary mint tea and snacks on a silver tray when ever we felt inclined. The Riad is well located for the main attractions of Marrakech. It's a short walk north to the Marjorelle Gardens and south to the souks palaces and main square. Being first time visitors we particularly appreciated the great care and attention of the staff in helping us to plan excusions and nights out and in one case sending out a cheerful search party when I had clearly got lost. The atmosphere was very relaxed friendly and peaceful with only the odd bird swooping down into the courtyard or someone playing the baby grand in the music room to disturb the silence . The rooms are individually and lovingly furnished and a spare bed was added to our double room at no extra charge for my teenage daughter. We are already planning our next trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An oasis amongst the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful.For a first visit to Marrakech we thought the location was excellent. Plenty to do and see within walking distance and short cheap journeys by taxi for more to see. Breakfast on the roof terrace a must especially after the grey skies of London.Take advice from staff on best places to eatwe had some lovely meals.All in all a fantastic short break and have already recommended to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just arrived back from Riad Les Trois Mages and have to say its the best place I've ever stayed in. The staff are superb and eveyrthing was taken care of We were met at the airport by a driver who had been sent by the staff. It is only 20 minutes by car from the airport to the Riad.    We had a wonderful evening meal waiting for us the food was sumptous and beautifully presented    The 5 bedrooms are very tradtionally Morrocan and there are lots of places to relax within the Riad.    There is a lovely piano room with a Roland electric piano and guitars and other instruments for the musically minded and a wondeful lounge area where you can sit near the open fire in the evening take teaand read some of the numerous books that are available to guests.  .  Don;t miss the chance to have a day in the stunning Oureka Valley and trip to the waterfalls The excursion was arranged via the Riad at a reasonable price and our wonderful guide Ali was first class. and ensured that all our needs were met. We loved the visit to the traditional berber house in the valley and the camel rides.    The children loved the heated pool on the roof with the sun beds and the tented area were we took tea. We had a massage at Riad on the first day which was lovely.    We got lots of bargains in the Souk and enjoyed buying the local produce The bread fruit nuts dates and vegetables were all so fresh.    We want to go back next year and have already contacted the Riad to enquire about availability
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A peacehaven in the middle of chaos!
Review_Text: What a contrast as you go through the door! Peaceful restful and beautifully appointed. Excellent staff who could not be more accomodating and helpful. Heaps of character throughout.The most relaxing roof terrace ever. Food excellent. Outside join the excitement and chaos of Marrakech. An experience not to be missed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Boutique Hotel in Marrakech medina
Review_Text: The Riad is a real gem; it seems that every decoration piece room furniture and illumination were picked by an excellent interior designer...so beautiful...  it was a great pleasure to stay there and enjoy the hospitalityof Aidan and his team;  The Riad night guard also gave us a lot of advice about good shopping places in the medina back streets...  Riad Les Trois Mages is one of the most charming places we have stayed for many years...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Everything you wanted in a Traditional Moroccan Stay
Review_Text: This was definitely a very beautiful Riyad situated in the Medina. The service was impeccable we could always get Mint tea made and snacks whenever we were hanging out in the courtyard. There is a piano and sheet music so I got to play a few things while we were chilling. They made reservations for us for dinner booked a day-trip for us to Essoueria and was just overall very accommodating. You can definitely bargain for the price if it's low season which was when we were traveling and also bargain for the day-trip prices if you find something cheaper. There is internet available and wireless if you need it. Breakfast is served every morning either in the courtyard or upstairs on the rooftop - wherever you want! If you want eggs you can also ask for it as well. That's why I love bed and breakfasts!    I traveled with my fiance and another couple and we really enjoyed ourselves here. If you want to stay in the Medina this is a great place to have a more traditional feel. If you want something more modern then try something outside the Medina. It was our first time in Africa so Morocco was a great first country to start with and the Riad Les Trois Mages was great value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Fabulous sumputious decor service was outstanding the food was always freshly prepared and delicious and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable not only in the Riad but also in Marrakech at considerable inconvenience to themselves.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A wonderful, relaxing home in busy Marrakech
Review_Text: From our first dealings with Anna to meeting Aidan at the Riad every aspect was easy. The pick-up from the airport was welcome and the riad itself extremely comfortable and well-decorated.
