The food was very tasty and the menu extensive - it is worth eating there at least once. aid an and colleagues were full of good advice and provided contacts in other Moroccan cities. The surroundings were such that you can make friends with other guests and the pool although small was a welcome relief in summer!    The location is within the old city but is still a 15-20 minute walk through the souks to the main square which can be a problem if you want to be in the thick of things or if it is a very warm summer day. Also while the riad was very helpful in organising a guide the guide was more an observer in the maze of the souks rather than a help in bargaining. Indeed on a couple of occasions he encouraged that an offer was a good deal when we subsequently found that it wasn't. Still should have done our research and it is all part of the experience...    All in all a wonderful experience and we would not hesitate to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in this Riad over a long weekend celebrating a significant birthday and a similarly important wedding anniversary. I could write a huge amount about this Riad but the simple version is that this is an excellent place and we were absolutely delighted with our stay. The actual building itself is wonderful; tastefully decorated to a very high standard and ideally positioned about 5 minutes walk away from the entry to the Souk. However the real selling point about this place is the people. Quite frankly nothing was too much trouble everything exceeded expectations and you got a real sense that they took a genuine personal interest in their guests. The card and flowers we got on the morning of our anniversary were an unexpected bonus and I imagine typical of the care that they take over the little things. The meal we enjoyed on our first night was outstanding and although we tried (very hard) we never found anything that was close in terms of quality and flavour - and what we ate elsewhere was very good. We will remeber our stay for many years to come.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm in the madness of Marrakesh
Review_Text: The Riad and the staff made this a very chilled out place. The selection of rooms offer a different feel depending on which you slept in. The rooftop terrace was a perfect place to chill out and the cooking.... best taijin in Marrakesh and we had quite a few!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: encompassed all the benefits of a top class Riad in a great location
Review_Text: we were welcomed by all staff and all requests for help managed efficiently and with good grace.  Our room was lovely and clean- Bahia suite-and the menu was typically Moroccan and well cooked and served. Tea and water was available at all times which was brilliant and sitting up on the roof terrace by the pool in the november sunshine or under the stars was magical> The inner courtyard and Bou was beautifully furnished and it was lovely eating al fresco.  We loved it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: A haven in a mad city.
Review_Text: Great riad. Aidan and staff very helpful. Tips and maps much appreciated. If you have a GPS  take it and drop a waypoint for the riad. We got totally lost one evening. Everybody seems to wherever they stay. Loved the safe haven the riad offered. Pool was a bonus.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An excellent value, friendly riad with wonderful food. Almost like staying with family
Review_Text: From being picked up at the airport to leaving to try out a different resort everything went smoothly. The riad is small quiet and charming with friendly and helpful staff excellent breakfasts home-cooked dinners which were probably better than most restaurants and lots of helpful advice from Aidan. The roof was a good place to be in the afternoons with a plunge pool which is perhaps a little too warm and plenty of shade. We found it difficult to find our way on foot to Djema El Fnaa but taxis were cheap and plentiful and the riad is very conveniently sited for the souks and the new town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a lovely and homely stay here and what made our stay so enjoyable was the staff. Moussine was a lovely gentle man who was always there to help. Layla Najia and Sahida were also really helpful. Do eat here... the food was delicious and regret having not been able to eat here more. Aidan the manager was very helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A haven in the chaos of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at the beginning and end of our break in Morocco and would return here again in an instant. The riad was a real home away from home and made us feel immediately welcome with a lovely breakfast and scrambled eggs after an early start and long journey.    Our little boy fell in love with Saida - the amazing chef who cooked us some of the best meals we had in Morocco - and she happily let him follow her around and get under her feet in the kitchen!    We had originally tried to book one of their lovely double rooms but ended up in the Bahia suite which was a very beautiful mixture of modern meets traditional furnishings.    We arranged a guide around Marrakech and taxi driver through the riad both of whom we would recommend and nothing was too much trouble for the great staff here.    If you're looking for a riad with real character lovely staff and with some quiet away from the hustle and bustle of the souks then this is the one for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Oasis of Calm from Marrekech Madness
Review_Text: Great riad with wonderful staff and great cooking from Sahida - excellent advice on all things Morrocan from the very helpful Manager Aiden. Clean luxurious  relaxed and quiet. Just far enough away from the souk craziness but close enough to stroll down to the the biggest and busiest square in Africa Djemaa el Fna. Great for musicians with a grand piano guitars and strange Moroocan instruments that I dont know the name of. Wonderful roof terrace and pool to cool down. Best place to stay in all of Marrakech in our view.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: great place great food great location great people! a perfect place to relax in hectic and exciting Marrakesh.  giulia and chris
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: spent a couple of nights in this place last month and found it to be a wonderful riad. We had stayed at another riad earlier on in our trip which was distinctly average and were worried that this could be the same. This was dispelled immediately on our arrival as the manager Aidan and his team do everything to make sure you have a good stay. The meal on our first night was excellent with cooking to a very high standard the staff will always give you advice and help out where possible including guiding you to and from restaurants so that you don't get lost in the medina. The location of les trois mages is also good as it is away from the souks and the main square and is therefore in a more hassle-free area of the medina. The room was excellent and was also cleaned to a high standard. The roof terrace is lovely and the plunge pool very welcoming in the heat of the day. In short I would strongly recommend Les trois mages for any stay in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad is furnished to a high standard giving an authentic Morrocan feel the manager was very receptive and very accomodating for your individual needs. They were also able to organise a highly entertaining excursion programme.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What a great place to chill out and no shortage of space to do so with two lounges on the ground floor a lounge area on the balcony and a terrasse complete with a pool that is so welcome when the heat is on.  When you don't feel like pounding the city's streets you can happily while away the hours relaxing in the Riad itself.  Right in the Medina 5 mins walk from the souks.  Great staff too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent service, haven of peace and tranquility- Aidan, a priceless resource of local information.
Review_Text: An excellent level of service- particularly from the manager who gave us very useful advice and recommendations.    The rooms were very quiet and comfortable and decorated to a high standard. Air-con especially appreciated in 50+ heat. Great plunge pool.    Not far from any of the Medina's attractions
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A wonderful place to stay in an amazing town.
Review_Text: We found the Riad Les Trois Mages exceeded our expectations. In amongst the mind-blowing wonder and chaos that is Marrakech the riad provided the perfect retreat with beautifully furnished fully air-coditioned rooms with perfect en suite bathrooms.The decor and fixtures and fittings are of a high standard and comfortable in a homely and stylish way.The inner atrium provided a bright and cool place to eat and socialize in the evening while the roof terrace provided an ideal and secluded spot to sunbathe and cool off in a delightful splashpool. Aidan who manages the riad was a friendly and very helpful contact during our time there and made some great suggestions re places to visit and general assistance in all matters .We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the riad and would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone who wants a laid back yet high quality place to stay while in Marrakech.A definite 10 out of 10 in every department - we will be back !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Booked this Riad because of the reviews and we were not disappointed. Should be higher up the list. From the moment we arrived Aiden Saida and all the staff did all they could for us including roses and a card for me on my birthday. All the rooms are beautifully decorated and furnished and the rooftop pool was a godsend as it was HOT (not surprisingly for mid July!!) And all thats been said about Saida's cooking is true - better than some of the restaurants that come highly recommended. Aiden and Saida are absolute gems Aidens map got us around the souks and his recoomendations were all sound. We shall be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Following a 2 hour delay there was an amazing welcome and delicious meal provided by Saida and Moushine. Nothing was too much trouble and we can honestly say that we have never received better service on any of our previous travels. Mint Tea was served with delicious home baked cakes by Saida. Aiden was a mine of information and the advice and tips that he gave us saved our bacon on more than one occasion in the Souks. This was a two centred holiday the madness of Marrakesh combined with the heaven of "Les Trois Mages" Cant wait to go back !!!!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A perfect oasis of Moroccan style and hospitalty
Review_Text: I would recommend Les Trois Mages to everybody...It is perfectly situated being a 15 minute walk from the wonderful buzz of Djemaa El Fna the main square...The rooms are equisite and the hospitality is outstanding...The manager insisted on getting up at 4am to make us breakfast before we were due to leave and couldn't have done enough for us during our stay...I simply can't wait to go back...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad for 3 nights in JUly and really enjoyed our stay. Prior to leaving the UK we had arranged for an airport transfer and a meal for the evening of our arrival. Unfortunately Mr Ryanair had different ideas which led to us arriving 2 1/2 hours late. However the taxi transfer had remained at the airport to meet us the wonderful Mr. Ali who is one of the Riads regular drivers and he was was so helpful and pleasent and ensured that the journey to the Riad was stress-free. He gave us plenty of hints and tips for our stay in Marrakech on the way.  On arrival at the hotel the brilliant staff had managed to ensure that the food we had ordered for our meal was still really tasty although we were massively late. Throughout the 4 days we ate at the Riad on 3 occasions twice for dinner and once for lunch and on each occasion it was superb. It was far better than anything we had at other restaurants in town especially the kafta tagine with eggs.  The Riad itself is beautiful with lovely air conditioned public areas a beautiful courtyard and well maintained lovely decorated rooms with air conditioning which is a must at this time of year. Once the front door is closed the place is unbelievably peaceful.  It also has a very pleasent roof terrace with a canopied area and small plunge pool with plenty of sun loungers and towels supplied. Even here though the temperatures were very high so the free water and tea/coffee was very much appreciated.  The Riad also organised a day of excursions for us a morning tour of the Souk with a local guide Mr Mohammed and an afternoon to the Atlas Mountains with Mr Ali again. Both were excellent Mr Mohammed taking us to places we would otherwise never have seen or found within the Souk whereas Mr Ali once again excelled treating us like his family. He arranged a visit to A Berber families house and arranged for a guide to take us for a hike in the Ourika Valley.  If I had one very small criticism I would say that the Riad is on the wrong side of the Souk for my liking and was a bit of a walk back at night from where the action was.  Overall however highly recommended. I would say that the website pictures are a very good indication as to what to expect from this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I stayed at the Les Trois for my 40th birthday celebrations and was accompanied by 7 friends. We had the most amazing time which was enhanced by the fabulous staff at the Riad. They were all welcoming and helpful and always on hand with recommendations and advice. I can't recommend this Riad enough. Thanks Aidan and all for making it a trip to remember. Josie
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Mages was a delightful place to while away the hours after a busy day at the souks. Inside the Riad was an amazing atmosphere of calm and relaxation.  I enjoyed the gentle rhythms of the piano and the chirping of the visiting birds.  There were many books available to read and a selection of CDs  Having just finished my exams I decided to treat myself. I needed to declutter my brain from algorithms and equations. After my first day at the Riad my goal was achieved. I was in a blisful state of idleness and contentment.  The food was excellent and I found the staff to be more than helpful and very friendly.  I spent many hours relaxing by the pool and trying to forget I found a Ronan Keating CD in the CD collection. :-)  Overall; the Riad was excellent  the food was to die for the staff were amazing and I'm going back there next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Calm and laid back, nothing too much trouble, but pricey for quality
Review_Text: As per previous reviews this riad is a calm haven from the chaos of the souks but is in a great location for exploring central Marrakech.  The service we had from the staff was fantastic very friendly and nothing too much trouble - booking excursions dinner reservations taxis lunch when we arrived etc.  However for the price we paid we felt the quality of the riad was not as up to date and luxurious as it could have been - could do with some updating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose this accommodation from the list of many due to its location and because it looked impressive on the website photos. And the riad proved to be exactly what the web advertised and more.  The location is perfect because it's a very short walk to all the local sites.  The place is very tastefully decorated very clean spacious and airy. There are several lounges on different levels and everyone can find a place to relax on a sofa. Alternatively you can enjoy refreshing coolness of the pool.  Food is amazing - we tried breakfast and dinner and can only talk in superlative about the quality.  The staff are really friendly helpful and they made us feel at home from the first moment we got in. Ask any questions you have and they will all be answered and you will get advice and assistance if need be.  A couple of other things we found amusing. The beds were incredibly comfortable and there were birds entertaining guests by most pleasant singing!!!  Les Trois Mages is oasis of calm in anotherwise industrious and bustling Medina.  We will definitely return to this riad and would highly recommend to anyone looking for the complete Moroccan experience.  Niall & Tatiana
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm and great service
Review_Text: This riad was very good indeed; the staff were faultlessly polite and helpful doing anything they could to make our trip good. They even brought tea and cakes whenever we were peckish and didn't charge at all for this; large bottles of water are also free; one of the staff got up at 4 am to make us breakfast on our last day. The central courtyard is a scattering of tables and sofas some sheltered in alcoves and some open to the elements; the rooms are all individually decorated and spacious enough. The terrace had a small plunge pool and sunbeds and was a great place to unwind after a day in the hectic city. Only downside was it was difficult to get mobile reception due to the location but I guess this is the case all over the medina maybe. All in all a fabulous place.

Review_Title: Relaxing and quiet away from the Marrakech madness
Review_Text: Nice staff clean nice accommodation. The courtyard is especially nice to have breakfast / afternoon tea in. Complimentary mint tea / coffee/ water was most welcomed.    Aiden was very helpful with arranging taxis booking restaurant reservations etc - all gratefully needed when you are there for a short stay and don't have the time to fully acquaint yourself with the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad les trois Mages is a lovely riad. It is well located in Marrakech quiet yet not to far from the major attractions. Inside the riad its very calm and peaceful. The rooms are very nice and the terraces downstairs as well as on the roof are a perfecrt place to relax after a busy day in the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Coming from the states directly to a location like Marrakech can be a bit intimidating. Just the vast amount of differences can make your head spin.  I had about 1000 questions and Aidan answered every single one of them with a smile on his face. We felt very safe and all of our events were planned through the riad.  They also helped us with train reservations as you cannot buy these outside of Morocco. (big life saver) The Riad is VERY clean and the meals served by the onsite cook(sidaya?) were outstanding!! The location in the medina makes it easy to get around well about as easy as it can be within the medina.    No complaints! would love to visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A real haven of tranquility, tastefully furnished, attentive staff, great food, difficult to fault
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights here we arrived at 9pm and were taken to a restaurant so we could find it and get back very useful! Aiden was great in giving us advice and pointing out good places to eat. Spent a day in the mountains - very reasonable at ~£55 per person including lunch. We really valued arriving back at the Riad after getting lost in the souk to a drink and a dip in the small rooftop pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Trois Mages was an oasis of peace and tranquility following a day in the Medina! We received a warm welcome and found all the staff to be exceptionally helpful. We actually felt as though we were guests in someone's home and that nothing was too much trouble. We ate twice at the Riad and had a lovely meal each time cooked by Saida. Would not hesitate in recommending this Riad to family and friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An exceptionally charming and relaxing riad catering to all one's needs. Aiden (the manager) plus staff are all terrific and in a nice low-key way: friendly helpful and professional. And a special word of praise for this riad's very own chef Saida. Her cooking must rate amongst the best there is in Marrakech. After a long day getting lost in the souks or walking in the High Atlas why eat anywhere else ? Les Trois Mages is a tranquil home from home in this busy but exotic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A welcome oasis from the hustle and bustle - book it soon!
Review_Text: I booked Les Trois Mages after extensive research on the internet. I wanted a riad that could offer me and my partner a decent standard of accommodation within walking distance of all the main sights of Marrakech but I didn't want a riad that was so sleek and "boutique" that it didn't feel authentic. I'm so delighted that Les Trois lived up to my expectations. It's a smallish riad with a homely feel which is such a welcome relief after heat dust and bustle of Marrakech. It's run by Aidan who bends over backwards to ensure your stay is what you hope for and gives top tips on how to get the best from your trip. Saida the cook is fabulous and Moussin the night guardian is fantastic too. He even walked us right to the door of Le Foundouk restaraunt which we give 5 stars but is really hard to find on your own.    The rooms are very clean comfortable and perfect for a short break ( we stayed for 4 nights/5 days in total). The riad offers wi-fi and has a very sweet roof terrace with sun-loungers and a plunge pool. We got into the habit of sight-seeing in the morning eating lunch out and retreating to Les Trois for a siesta and a bit of sunbathing on the roof terrace during the afternoon before we headed out for our evening meal. Aidan will recommend where to eat (we weren't impressed with Cafe Arabe but Le Tanjia is excellent and so are their bellydancers and Le Foundouk was incredible for our last night). This was a perfect receipt for relaxation combined with culture!    The rooms aren't massive but why would anyone need a huge space when you have so much to see and do in Marrkech?? We stayed in both the Arabesque room and best of all the suite - the suite is my recommendation - pure delight.    The service is unassuming and efficient you get as much bottle water tea and coffee as you can manage here (and tea and coffee come with tasty cake or snacks yum!). I think Les Trois is perfect for people like us who are fairly accomplished independent travellers and while we like our home comforts we don't want to feel we're staying in some over-restored riad - Les Trois is the authentic article and so is the service.    I really can't find any fault and yes we would definitely visit again and have already recommended it to our friends.    Top tips for Marrkech - if you have a registered guide tell them upfront you don't want to be dragged into the stalls in the souks for a "sales pitch"!  Don't ride in a caleche ride (horse-drawn carriage) unless it has a SPANA band on its hoof - this denotes animal welfare standards are being adhered to by the owner.  Spend half a day at Le Jardin Majorelle - it's beautiful and the cafe serves exotic drinks and lovely grub.  Haggle for your life in the souks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The staff at Les Trois Mages helped to make our stay extra special.
Review_Text: I am the sort of traveller who likes to research their holiday to the nth degree & after reading all the positive reviews of Les Trois Mages on Tripadvisor I would have to agree with all that has been said. Having arrived in the evening with our 2 children (8 & 12) we were taken safely by the taxi organized by Aidan through the haphazard traffic of Marrakech & delivered at the riad. Although we had not emailed a menu choice ahead a delicious meal awaited us in the lovely courtyard & Moushine & Saida made us feel immediately at home. We had reserved the large Bahia suite & two comfortable beds had been made for the children. We thought the decor of the suite was very tasteful the bathroom was very nice (particularly the toiletries) & it had a lovely view over the courtyard. During our stay the plastic cover remained over the courtyard (I think the previous week had been rainy) however we were in Marrakech for a week & saw no rain although a couple of evenings were a little chilly. The following day Aidan took us through the map & landmarks before walking us to the La Place (15 mins) to help us get our bearings but we thought the location was ideal- as other reviews have pointed out it is easy to find & far away from the centre of the Medina to be a peaceful haven. Our kids loved the heated rooftop pool where towels & sun hats were provided. It is a shame that there is not a view from the roof but the tented area was lovely to chill out & the staff were kind enough to bring mint tea & yummy homemade cakes up the 2 flights of stairs each day of our stay. The bed was reasonably comfortable-very firm -but I was woken by the call to prayer although the rest of the family slept through! The 2 meals that we ate in the riad were good (background music provided by the "magic piano") & the breakfasts were excellent with beautiful breads fresh fruit & good coffee. The fire in the sitting room was lit every night & a few other guests were regularly eating in the riad. The one night we did eat out at Le Foundouk (v. good) Moushine escorted us there & upon paying the bill we found him outside waiting to see us home again! Overall we were delighted with the Riad & would love to return to Les Trois Mages & that is down to the attention to detail & caring & friendly service provided by all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Leon London wrote a review Feb 2010
Review_Text: I had been to Tangiers for the day so sort of knew what to expect but Marrakesh is much more frenetic. Even the very smart places in the old town are approached via rather scruffy streets and so it was with Trois Mages. When we first arrived we had to admit a slight sense of disappointment as it isn't as groomed and polished as it appears in the website photographs which make it look very glamorous. There are lovely touches in the furnishings and decor though  and it is a riad. However Aidan the manager and his Moroccan team soon made us feel at home and we really enjoyed our stay there. They will walk you to places if you are unsure book taxis and restaurants and arranged a lovely balloon trip. Aidan's restaurant suggestions are spot on. Although meals need to be booked they rustled up some supper when we arrived back frazzled after getting hopelessly lost and chilled our wine. Moshim the night watchman served us a lovely very early brakfast on two occasions. It is very much like staying in a family home with a retinue of staff to care for you. I would have liked just a touch more grooming but this is just my personal taste and experience. Would I recommend it or stay again.. most definitely yes!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We initally struggled to find the Riad but when we finally got there it certainly did not dissappoint. Such a beautiful and intimate place with amazing staff and owners. The fresh food they made us for breakfasts and dinner was delicious. The lovely cool building was such a perfect and peaceful haven to return to after the craziness of the Souks (which were about a 15 minute walk or £2 taxi ride away). The pool and roof terrace were a lovely bonus and a great place to relax and enjoy the sun. The rooms themselves looked lovely but on closer inspection could have some improvements made here and there. However I would recommend this Riad to everyone and definitely go there again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I am not even sure where to start as there are so many wonderful things to say about this place. The decor is fantastic and the whole riad is very very clean. Having breakfast on the rooftop terrace every morning sets you up for a great day. The staff are exceptionally lovely. Offering tea or coffee whenever they see you in communal areas. We brought our own booze which they chilled for us and served with olives figs and nuts. The food is absolutely divine and matches that of the best resturaunts and the other guests were fantastic.    All in all the BEST place I have ever stayed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent hideaway from the bussling souks
Review_Text: We had a lovely time staying for 4 days in Marrakech at Les Trois Mages. Laura was a godsend even prior to our arrival with emails of information and making arrangements. Briefing on where to go and what to see was honest and unbiased. and great to have from a Brit living the life in Morocco The rooms and roof terrace (with pool - which is excellent to have on the roof and not on the ground floor) where lovely but it was the staff that made it even more special. They cooked a mean tagine and couscous and looked after you as if you were part of the family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in the suite which had a gorgeous sunken bed and great romantic touches. We found it incredibly quiet and relaxing. The staff were incredibly friendly and Laura who owns the place is really sweet and helpful. The breakfast was generous and everything clean and tidy. The roof terrace offered great pool side relaxation and we certainly would have taken our evening meal on the roof if we'd been there longer.  When I checked on the map I was a little worried by the apparent distance from the main square. But dont be put off it's a short and pleasant walk into the craziness. I definitely preferred being a little further out as the center can be too much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful home with lovely staff amid the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech. It was a bit of a shock as we had never been to Morocco before. Everywhere there are small alleys full of people donkeys small carts small motor bikes bicycles water sellers and medicine men etc. The souk is full of colours smells of spices and new leather.    The staff of Les Trois Mages made our stay perfect. There was always support whether finding a nice place to eat or an unusual part of the Souk. Saida made us some wonderful Moroccan food. In fact we preferred to stay and eat at the riad. Some of the more western restaurants are quite expensive and actually worse than Saida's cooking. Our room was beautifully decorated. A lot of thought has been given to the decoration through out the riad.    Our most memorable part of the holiday was having breakfast on the terrace by the pool and listening to the 'call to prayer' in the background
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Extremely friendly service. Excellent facilites and location
Review_Text: It was our first time in Morocoo and we had lots of questions. Laura the manager knew the answer to all of them (actually she got her favourite colour wrong!) and was always on hand to help. Les 3 mages is the epitome of quiet efficiency and excellent value.    Food was refreshingly simple and very good. The riad is in a great spot in the NW of the Medina within an easy walk of everywhere you'll want to go. Close to the souks the gardens and not far from the French quarter.    Don't hesitate this is the one to book. Go for the top floor rooms or the suite.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Les Trois Mages was truly magical. We were looked after so well by Aiden and the beautiful cooks & staff. My husband flew me to Marrakesh for a surprise birthday gift. On the morning of my birthday Aiden presented a huge bunch of roses at my champagne breakfast. A gift from the hotel which was so sweet of them all. Aidan was an excellent host making us feel really at home showing us the route through the winding streets to the main square and souks plus attending to our every needs. He is extremely conscientious and has a good sense of humour. The owners are very lucky to have him working there as he is destined for much greater things!  The Riad is a slight hike from the main square (15mins+) situated in a back alley. The immediate route to this alley is somewhat dilapidated but as soon as you get to the lovely front door and step into the cool welcoming Riad a sense of calmness washes over.  Breakfast was the usual coffee (proper plunger coffee!) pancakes fruit salad toasts or whatever we wanted. Nothing was too much trouble to sort out.  The serene bedrooms were beautifully Tadelakt in the tradition style with soft warm colour choices and luscious bathrooms. A medium priced Riad with good choice of interior design that made it that bit special. What made the place was Aiden and the rest of the staff’s hospitality.  The only thing that would put us off staying there again in the future is the longish walk to the main square. After a long day and night walking for hours the walk back became a bit of a hike even though you could do it fast in 15 minutes. Although it was kind of nice as we met some lovely people on the way plus fed lots of stray cats who were grateful for the tins of mackerel. Patron Saint of the Moggie Kingdom that's me! Last time I was here I saved a cat and found it a home. We went to visit it after 10 years and was greeted by CousCous the cat lounging on the hallway chair! A nice retirement. Anyway I digress.... regarding getting back to the hotel at night.... You could always get a taxi to the alley by the hotel which would only cost a few £ but at the time we didn’t think to do that and I kind of liked the night time adventure even though my feet were killing me (and yes I was wearing sensible shoes!).  On my return home I open the book I had pressed all my beautiful birthday roses into and the scent of the petals filled the room bringing back the memories of our wonderful time in Marrakesh....  Thank you everyone at Les Trois Mages for making it that bit special and thank you my beautiful husband for some lovely memories... xxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Everything you could want from a Riad!
Review_Text: With so many riads available in Marrakech it took us a while to narrow down the choices but we found Les Trois Mages ticked all the boxes and was fabulous – great facilities (including rooftop terrace with pool and lovely rooms) brilliant staff (providing all the help we could need both in arranging our visit and while we were there) and good location (easy walk through the souks to the square).    The riad itself is relatively easy to find. Laura the Manager arranged a driver to take us from the airport to the riad and on arrival gave us a map and provided really useful directions making it almost impossible to get lost! The walk to the square though the souks is easy enough though you need to remember that motorbikes and donkeys have right of way. The food in the square is worth trying and Laura’s recommendations of bars around the medina (especially the Kosybar where you have views overlooking the medina and are eye level with the stork nests on the walls) were spot on.    The rooms at the riad are great – all en-suite and each with its own character. There’s also plenty of communal areas to relax in – downstairs there is a courtyard sitting room and music room and the roof top terrace is the perfect place to chill out with dinner and a few drinks. The pool itself is also bigger than the average plunge pool you tend to have in riads.    The staff helped make our experience in Marrakech and the riad itself exceptional. Laura provided us with so much advice and was helpful in arranging anything we needed including taxis drinks and day trips. Saida made us feel so welcome always on hand to provide anything we needed and cooking marvelous meals for us. Even after we left they were so helpful looking after our excess baggage while we spent 3 days hiking in the High Atlas Mountains and welcoming us back to shower and refresh before we travelled on to Fes.    Highly recommended for a very relaxing long weekend in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After trawling through loads of potential riads we settled on this one and we weren’t disappointed. Laura (the Manager) was extremely helpful and knowledgeable both in response to all our emails and when we arrived. It’s a good idea to ask the riad to arrange a driver to meet you from the airport as it’s difficult to find the first time. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the meal Saida cooked for us on our last night was absolutely delicious – as good as any we ate out. Eating on the roof terrace just the two of us with its beautifully lit pool and sumptuous tent was magical.    We booked the Bahia suite which was gorgeous. The bath was a real treat and the sunken bed area was so comfortable. There are two lounges on the ground floor – one with a grand piano and various musical instruments and another with a dining table and comfy sofas. However as the weather was so hot we spent most of our lounging time up on the roof terrace.    The riad is located about 10 minutes walk from the Jemaa El Fna but the walk through the souks was very enjoyable and interesting. Once inside the riad’s heavy front door you are cocooned from the noise outside. Also bottled water tea and coffee are available free whenever you want it.    My tip is not to wear comfortable shoes but to wear THE most comfortable shoes you have EVER worn. Your feet will ache because you will definitely walk more than you plan and you need to be agile to dodge the scooters and taxis whizzing past you.    Would recommend a pre-dinner drink in the Kozy Bar followed by dinner in Le Tanjia (just around the corner from the bar). The band was excellent and the belly dancing display was fun – even if you don’t want to join in. Check out the beautiful central lamp hanging over the atrium.    We were very disappointed with the Menara Gardens (to the west of Marrakech) having taken a taxi ride there especially to take photos. Apparently you can only get pictures of the pavilion with the snow-capped Atlas Mountains behind at certain times of the year. The water in the pool looked filthy and the whole place seemed very tatty and nothing like the pictures we’d seen.    Thank you Laura and all the staff for a fabulous time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have just got back from a fantastic trip to Marrakech with 2 friends of mine - we were taking our annual girly getaway & decided upon Morrocco - wanting to take in all of it's charms shopping & sights. After reading through reviews on Trip Advisor - our Riad had been decided upon...Les Trois Mages. Now I knew that it was good from what I had read but our stay there totally surpassed my expectations. The entire team of staff were so welcoming and friendly so much so we took to calling Saida (fabulous cook!!) "Mamman" as she really was quite literally like a mother figure! I cut my foot in one instance...and immediately she got changed into her traditional headscarf and dress and went out to get me some iodine. Then still not happy to leave me to fend for myself she applied it for me and then plastered my foot too! Quite literally the sweetest woman you will ever meet but in all fairness every single person there was fantastic!!  The Riad itself is relaxed elegantly furnished and an oasis of calm! You wouldn't think that just 5 mins away a hustling bustling souk is in full swing. The pool area up on the roof is a haven for the sun worshippers and if a bit of cool shade is more your thing there is a bedouin style tent up there provides that as does the outside seating area a floor down nestled above a courtyard - and as if that isn't enough there are two open parlours with comfy sofas a piano to play should you so wish or courtyard seating where you can sip a refreshing glass of mint tea!!  This place is a gem. It is simply flawless and provided us with the perfect accomodation to complement a perfect Marrakech getaway break!! :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A beautifully quiet relaxing well managed oasis in the madness that is Marrakech
Review_Text: First visit to Marrakech after many years thinking about it. Choosing a Riad is a daunting task with so many to choose from and at such a huge range of prices so our arrival at Les Trois Mages was in some ways an amazingly lucky accident. From the prompt a friendly meeting at the airport (Hakim) to our departure 5 days later Les Trois Mages was faultless. Laura the host/manager is delightful/knowledgeable/efficient/calm and tends to your needs in an effortless unflustered way whilst Saida the eversmiling cook rustles up great varied breakfasts of breads pancakes yoghurts eggs (anyway you want!). Do eat in the evening at the Riad at least once where Saida's food was as good as(if not better) than the much more expensive restaurants we visited. Nothing was too much for the staff whilst it was really a home from home with the use of the kitchen to prepare a couple of our own light lunches from supplies bought at a nearby supermarket. The location of the Riad was typically Marakhian down a narrow passage off a main road in the Medina but only 10 mins walk to the Jemaa el Fna and closer to the Medersa and the Musee de Marrakech and just north of the amazing souks. Apart from the calls of the Muezzins (and you can't escape them even at 4am) Les Trois Mages was great for a peaceful sleep with no traffic noise. A day trip to the Atlas mountains and the Ourika valley also with Hakim was another highlight and a real break from the noise smoke and chaos of the Medina. Finally a real big thanks to Hassim(I hope I've got his name correct) the night porter/caretaker who not only escorted us to a difficult to find restaurant on our last night then was waiting to escort us back as we left it  then got our breakfast ready at 6am so we could catch our early flight. I cannot understand how this ranks in the 70's for Marrakech it would be our No 1 recommendation
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: I DONT want to write this report
Review_Text: Beacause I want to keep this place all to MYSELF!! Its one of the best places I've ever stayed with the nicest and most capable staff ever. My wife says I have to write a report so here goes!!  We booked through Hipmarrakech very efficient and very honest in all dealings with them.  We arrived at the airport and were met by the Riad's chosen taxi driver and taken straight to the Riad which is located in the North Western part of the Medina.  The Riad manager Laura was there to greet us and Laura proved to be a font of sensible information on the area. We had read much about the now legendary Saida the Riad's Chef and chose to eat at the riad every night(we stayed 5 nights). This proved to be a good choice because the dinner served each night was superb. I even asked Saida to cook one of my favorite dishes from Alsace in France and the result was the most delicious Poulet au Reisling I have had for a long time. The general housekeeping was of a high standard. There was always hot water and fresh towels.  We met some super people staying there at the same time as us and the riad turned into a large houseparty. Great fun.  If you are thinking of visiting Marocco then do your homework. Its not for everyone. I noticed in many reports people moaning about aggressive shopkeepers people in the square putting snakes and monkeys on you to then demanding money for pictures. This is easily avoidable just smile and say NON to the shopkeepers and dont go near the snake charmers and monkey handlers. Its quite simple really!!  To finish--if you want your senses assaulted (in a nice way) with noise aromas colors and many fascinating people then go---But I'd really rather you did'nt beacause its MINE!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jamie N wrote a review Apr 2009
Review_Text: It was just such a treat to stay at Riad Le Trois Mages. Laura Saida and the rest of the staff were so warm and welcoming. There is a sense of tranquility and beauty every time we stepped into the Riad. Calm soothing authentic in every way. A true respite from the Medina and the perfect place to stay in Marrakesh. The Riad had exceeded my exepctations!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Visiting Marrakesh for the first time can make you feel a bit edgy. Booking a place to stay even more nervy. The walk to Les Trois Mages is part of what Marrakesh Medina is all about. Through the door to a marvellous Tardis that Dr Who would be proud of. Simple and effective is how I sum it up. Folks that want more need to spend more and keep out of the Medina. The rooms have character and live up to a Morrocan Riad in my view. The food and service from the team and the chief cook Siada was great. The small courtyard makes it all feel like a secluded oasis in a completely secure environment. The effect is one that makes you feel like you are part of a 'family'. The Riad has no alcohol license but a word in the right ear and you can bring in a bottle of wine. Tip: Laura the manager is partial to chocolate from the UK!!  The arrangements to collect and return to the aiport all worked without a hitch. What more can be said other than a great place to stay within the walls of the Medina. My wife and I loved it. I am trying hard to think of a downside and cannot. Visitng North Africa requires a nice safe haven and Les Trois Mages is it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Riad - amazing service and value!
Review_Text: We booked this Riad for a 5 night stay at the beginning on March - we were very impressed with the rate quoted - a lot cheaper than other local Riads. Cheaper doesn't mean you compromise on the standard of accommodation or service though - the decoration was beautiful our room was very comfortable and the service was top notch - nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. Breakfast was delicious (and filling!) every morning and there was such a lovely laid-back vibe to the place - you could help yourself to bottled water from the fridge and you could curl up in one of the living areas with a good book and be bought complementary mint tea (and even freshly made cakes/pastries!) which was a gorgeous escape from the madness that is the souk!    Dinner was fantastic and such good value - unless you're eating in cafes or the main square itself the restaurants are extortionate! The price we paid for three amazingly cooked courses with a bottle of wine was extremley good value and it was such a lovely setting it was as nice (if not nicer) as the restaurants we did visit. Special mention has to go to Saida the cook - not only did she provide fantastic food but she was so friendly - nothing was too much trouble and it was great trying to communicate in pigeon French!    Laura the Riad Manager was really helpful both before and during our stay - she helped us arrange some fantastic excursions including a 4x4 trip into the Atlas Mounains and the guide she booked to take us around the city on our first day was really informative helpful and very useful in a city where it's very easy to get lost!    As the riad didn't have its own hammam Laura arranged treatments for us as the gorgeous "Les Bains de Marrakech" - it was all booked for us and was very starightforward and was a lovely experience.    All in all we had a fantastic stay - Marrakech itself is a wonderful experience but one that can be daunting and exhausting - having such a lovely base to come back and relax in really made our holiday.    OK the location was a little bit further out but not more than a 15 minute walk into the Souks and the centre!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, Amazing staff and a pretty good location
Review_Text: We really liked our stay here. The cost seemed a lot to us after our other travels but Morocco isn't that cheap so maybe it was actually good value. We paid €85 a night from memory for the Arabella room.  The most special features are the staff and the decor. The Moroccan lady who runs the kitchen is so sweet and with our garbled French skills we could manage to have a nice conversation. Aidan who worked on the reservation/front desk was really personable and great. He took us for a walk to the big square so we could find our way back. Aidan also has a wonderful and great value flat of his own in Essaouira which I highly recommend staying in if you can.  The room was nicely decorated and once heated properly was very cosy. The bathroom did have a funny smell but I think it was damp that caused it. I think this is common in a Riad in Winter so I am probably wrong to complain but I didn't love the smell:)  The food was yummy and the games/books downstairs were a nice touch. This would be a nice romantic as well as fun holiday place to stay. We didn't use the roof/pool to its full capacity and recommend you do.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at les Trois Mages in January and fell in love with its charm and tranquility. To be within 15 mn from the main square yet feel like you are miles away from any civilisation is quite extroardinary. The peace within the riad is really enjoyable. The decor is so typically Maroccan that you feel like you are on the set of the "thousand and one night" film.  The staff was very welcoming and the main chef Saida is extraordinary. There is nothing that she cannot do. You tell her what you fancy eating (from the menu and sometimes outside of the menu)\and she does her utmost to make it for you.    The room itself was very comfortable and very warm despite the cooler temperate expected in January. Overall an excellent stay and I will definitely recommend to friends family and come back myself.    I would recommend that you check out this place urgently: it's just grand!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful 5 day stay at this lovely riad in the medina our room was extremely comfortable with one of the best beds I have ever slept in ! ( Suite Bahia )    The chef Saihida makes excellent cous cous  tagines soup etc etc - the food was always great.    All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and we would have no hesitation in recommending this great riad to anyone staying in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my girlfriend stayed in Marrakech for nine nights four in the Les Trois Mages and five at the Riad El Fenn. Although the Riad El Fenn is a truly wonderful experience and the service their was excellent it is put in the shade by a place like this when you consider what you get and what you pay for.    We had two nights in the wonderfull Bahia suite that features one of the best beds I have slepted in.  The last night was spent in the smaller but still nice Jade room.  From the moment we arrived we were made to feel like it was our home and quickly felt very at ease in our surroundings something that took considerably longer at the Riad El Fenn.  The first meal I had in the Riad was also the best meal I had the whole trip a meatball Tagine that I could have ate every night until I left.    As for the roof terrace I was amazed to read some of the reviews saying that it was shabby. Please take it from me that this was written by someone who has had nothing else to compare it too. It is a lovely little corner of tranquillity with a small heated pool several sun loungers and a small shaded area to hide from the sun. Definately a highlight of the Riad.    We spent a lot of time investigating Riads before we booked and like to think we made the right choice in Les Trios Mages. Marrakech can be quite intimidating at first but having a place like this to come back to makes the city easier to settle into.    All in all this is a superb little Riad and I would like to thank Aidan and the team for all the hard work and advice given to us during our stay. Anyone visiting Marrakech for the first time should stay here to experience the true Riad experience as this is really all you could hope for. It is certainly different from staying in a hotel as you really feel like you are staying in a big house with a great host rather than paying for a room. Places like this proves the point that price does not always reflect quality!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: High Praise for Les Trois Mages
Review_Text: This Riad should be ranked in the top 10 on the Trip Advisor. It is positively charming has a wonderful staff and management is comfortable and provides fabulous breakfasts (including eggs if we wanted them). It's located in a very convenient part of the Medina and very affordable. In fact we stayed in another Riad during our trip to Marrakech which IS ranked in the top 10 and the Les Trois Mages stands heads and shoulders above the former.    More specifics: Aidan who was standing in for Laura (out on maternity leave) was helpful and informative across the board (restaurants local sites guides etc.) and he also hooked us up with two great drivers for two different day trips to Essaouria and the Atlas Mountains. We later learned (by staying in subsequent Riads) that the recommendations at the LTM for excursions were probably better-priced for the same type of excursions.    Moushine (sorry for misspellings) the Night Guardian is a gracious kind cheerful soul who was tireless in making sure we were well taken care of for coffee internet access anything else we needed. He also showed us the way to restaurants at night by walking us. The other three staff members including Saida were equally kind and gracioius. Bottled water the best coffee in Marrakech and tea were available compliments of the house any time day or evening which we discovered was unusual and therefore all the more appreciated. Whoever decorated this Riad has an eye for charm and style (to which website photos do not do justice). Overall the staff was outstanding and made us feel very welcome and cared for during the four nights we were there. In short excellent value and a great place to stay in Marrakech.

Well what a delightful time we have just had in this endlessly fascinating but bonkers city! Made all the more lovely by the divine hospitality of the staff at Les Trois Mages.    From being picked up at the airport we were quickly transported into another world in the Medina and after a short walk were greeted at the riad by Aidan with the obligatory mint tea. (Made with fresh mint and green tea and poured from a great height)    Aidan was immensely helpful in organising our trip to the Atlas Mountains (top recommendation) a restaurant a massage and various taxis. We really appreciated his insight and guidance on these as well as which was the best wine to quaff. We were only a little disappointed that he had to stop pouring it for us and go to bed...ha ha.    The riad is extremely clean and comfortable and we were thrilled with the legendary Saida's home cooking and sense of fun. (It's great fun communicating in pigeon French and English.) We had the foresight to book lunch for our arrival which was taken on the sunny terrace. Then later dinner in the cosy furnished firelight of the salon.  Breakfast was varied and tasty too every day...perfect!    Finally not forgetting the night porter who looked after us too tending the fire leading us to our tour pick-up point and also making us the 'special' warming mint tea one chilly evening. (Doesn't involve alcohol you'll have to find out for yourself!)    All in all a wonderful stay and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned home after a three night stay at Riad Les Trois Mages and feel compelled to recommend this wonderful place to others. The city is a complete assault on your senses and can leave you feeling drained so the RLTM's peace & calm is the perfect antidote to the 'chaos' outside. Aiden Saida a & all the staff are hospitable to a fault and genuinely cannot do enough for you. In fact we felt more like welcome house guests than residents. The rooms are wonderfuly furnished and really do add a touch of luxury to Marrakesh after a tiring day in the heart of a vibrant city. Finally we tried several of the 'highly recommended' resteraunts from our guide book and indeed (generally) were left distinctly underwhelmed by the quality of most of the food out side the Riad. However our best meal (by far) was the beautiful Morrocan food that Saida prepared for us on the Riad's roof top terrace!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Cannot fault this wonderful Riad. We were welcomed very warmly by Sarah who explained the mysteries of Marrakech over numerous glasses of Saida's mint tea. Nothing was too much trouble from booking restaurants to our many requsts for the amazing tea.  The rooms are stunning and impeccably looked after. Each evening after a hectic day out in the city we were welcomed back by Saida  nothing was every too much trouble. The night guardian was very friendly and helpful  The roof terrace is an oasis of tranquility with area's to lounge and relax. Recommend sitting up on the terrace with a glass or two of wine relax and listen to the sounds of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I returned from Marrakech and Les Trois Mages on Monday 25th August and am writing this review just 2 days later and I wish I could be back there!    My husband and I spent 3 nights there having spent the previous 5 in Essaouira if we had known how wonderful this riad was to prove to be we would have managed the balance of days the other way around especially as we did not get the weather we hoped for in Essaouira and the Riad we stayed in there was nowhere near the standard of Les 3 Mages.    I have visited Morocco many times over the last 15 years and this has to be the best accomodation I have stayed in.  It is beyond me why anyone staying here would give the any less than full marks in all aspects.    The place is spotless maintained to a good standard by a group of wonderful staff headed up by Laura the UK manager who is fantastic and managed to keep her cool despite the heat and being 6 months preganant (no mean feat in itself).    We were made welcome from the moment we stepped through the door to the taxi arriving to take us to the airport.    The local information provided by Laura when we arrived was helpful to us and would provide invaluable to a traveller new to Marrakech. Laura also arranged a local guide for a half day for us (at 400 dirhams) which helped immensely with navigating our way through the historic sites that are largely unsigned. I would however advise that you explore the Souks on your own the guide will get commission on all your purchases and only takes you where he wants to go!    We did not eat in the Riad as we only had 3 nights but the smell of cooking food on the second night was wonderful and very tempting. if we had stayed longer we most certainly would have partaken.    The roof terrace is a joy (and anyone saying it looks tired is not comparing with similar in Morocco where the elements simply take their toll very fast on outdoor spaces). The air con in the room was greatly appreciated and unusual for Morocco the drainage in the bathroom was adequate and so it did not smell like something had died in the ensuite shower room.    It is not a case of if we go back to Morocco but more a case of when and when we do we will certainly be staying here again. A wonderful stay.    NB: If you are considering visiting Morocco and have not been before it is worth remembering that it is still only a developing country and there is a high level of poverty. This is not the Med you will be walking down dusty dirty streets that don't suit stilletoes and white silk summer dresses. It is also a Muslim country that does not have 45 bars on every street alcohol can be obtained but not as readily as it is at home and it is comparatively expensive. If you want a boutiquey or a boozey style holiday you are best advised to choose somewhere else and leave Morocco to those holiday makers who want to respectfully experience a culture vastly different to their own and yet still only a few hours away by plane. If that sounds like you I'm sure you will have an amazing time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a beautifyl Riad. We stayed here on honeymoon and although Marrakech was rather hot the riad provided a welcome and calm place to relax and enjoy the City. Centrally positioned and wihtin easy reach of Jemma al Fna you can easily access all the City has to offer or alternatively limit yourself to local eateries. Laura (manageress) is incredibly helpful in recommending places to eat and visit and local tips. We had a wonderful time and Saida the cook along with the other Moroccan staff are marvellous. Highly recoemmended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had two separate nights here at the beginning of August. On both occasions we were more than completely satisfied. In fact I would say this is the best place we have ever stayed partly because the riad experience itself is so unique.  The manager/s were both very knowledgeable about Marrakech and gave sound and useful advice on how to make the most of the city for what was actually a very short stay. They arranged everything from airport pick ups to buying train tickets (something which can only be bought from the train station itself so if you want fist class this is the best way to do it) They greeted us on both occasions offering coffee and pastries while they talked to us about our travels or needs.  The room itself was lovely. We stayed in "Melchior". It was on two levels with a bed surrounded by light curtains. Very chic and romantic. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. Towels and bath robes were on the back of the door.  Breakfast was simple but ample especially the berber pancakes with honey which we both loved.  On our second stay we were the only guests so had the lovely roof terrace to ourselves which allowed the indulgence that we actually lived the lifestyle ourselves!  In short nothing is too much for the staff at LTM. They are proud of their Riad even offering peeks into other empty rooms to see that everwhere is sumptious.  At the end of the night our return was awaited and tea offered. We were waited on from beginning to end of the day- and in short made to feel special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom

Review_Date: Marai L wrote a review Aug 2008
Review_Title: In Love With Les Trois Mages!!!
Review_Text: I love this place! It's great to have a really good standard of accommodation combined with excellent service.    This is a beautiful clean and well maintained riad. Our bedroom and shower-room were lovely spaces..which were also kept spotlessly clean.    We were incredibly well looked after from start to finish. Nothing was overlooked. Staff were helpful and flexible. We finally stopped eating out as Saida's cooking was so much more fabulous...great vegetarian tagine!    Les Trois Mages is simply a lovely place to stay and I would happily go back...again and again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner and I stayed for 5 nights and we found the welcome from the staff fantastic. Helen was fabulous very helpful informative and above all very good with the rest of the staff. It was with great surprise that Helen informed us that she would be leaving the riad. She did not give a reason but I know wonder if it is due to the previous review that "accused" her of "bullying" other staff. I feel that she is was one of the biggest assets the riad had and now have sadly lost.    The rooms were lovely and clean and decorated very well however it semed odd that the bathmats were bought from IKEA!!!!???? The terrace needs an urgent overhaul - a repaint and the tent has seen far better days. I did find the information book in the rooms a little dictorial and think the OWNERS need to address this and have a rewrite!    The food cooked by Saida is fabulous and she is a great character!    Would I go back? I think that I would need to look at reviews nearer the time and then decide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Have just returned from our first trip to Marrakesh and it was fantastic. The riad is absolutely stunning beautifully furnished with great attention to detail. We loved the terrace with the pool and sun beds and our favourite area on the terrace has to be the the tent very exotic and a great place to relax.  The staff at the riad are lovely from the time we arrived till we left they were helpful and attentive. Saida's cooking is a treat not to be missed. We ate in on the first night the meal was excellent the table had been beautifully laid and we felt thoroughly spoilt.  The riad is in a great location convenient for the square restaurants souks and shops. The manager's recommendations for places to visit were very informative. One of the highlights for us was the trip to the Atlas Mountains not to be missed a really fabulous day.  There is so much to see and experience in Marrakesh that you will need to return again. Les Trois Mages provides the peace and tranquility to enjoy this fascinating place and all it has to offer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The lay-out and interior of this riad is great and the staff are friendly. However I did not enjoy my stay here mainly due to the other guests who were loud obnoxious and threatned violence! Not the fault of the riad but I felt they did very little to control the situation. We were kept awake on the first night by the other guests who were drinking directly below our room. They were not told to keep the noise down and at 2am I had to ask them myself at which point one of them turned nasty. The gentleman working at the riad did nothing to control the situation told me to go back up to bed and the guests continued until 3am. Basically I didn't feel safe here and able to enjoy my stay and for the price we paid I'd have expected much more. I wanted to leave after the first night but they were more concerned about us paying in advance which I was also surprised with as I have never paid in advance whether it be a hotel riad or B&B. A great place if you don't experience any problems but if you do you're on your own.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed in Les Trois Mages for 3 nights in mid April '08 having booked through www.hipmorocco.com.    Very soon after we booked we received a friendly email from Helen giving us some background info organising the airport pickup (which I'd recommend for ease).    The riad itself is pretty with a great roof terrace. If you are looking for somewhere to relax and sunbath in the medina this is perfect - as well as a (little) pool there are around 10 sunbeds and its pretty quiet (calls to prayer not withstanding!).    Helen is very friendly and efficient - giving a good introduction when we arrived with recommendations for eating etc. She booked us a restuarant for our first night which was probably our best meal of the holiday (and my wife and I are quite foody). Another restaurant recommendation the next day was also excellent.    The staff are friendly and always willing to make you tea/coffee etc (for free) you can get free bottled water 24hrs a day. The food at the riad was OK but not that exciting - a fairly unadventurous mostly non-Moroccan menu. Breakfast was nice though and they are flexible as to where you have it (on the terrace or in the courtyard or elsewhere).    Location wise its about a ten minute stroll to the Djemaa-al-Fna -and less to the main souks. Its in a pretty good place.    We stayed in Bathazar which was nice - hot water always available in the reasonably powerful shower. Clean and spacious. We saw inside some of the other rooms and they were all nice.    Overall I'd really recommend this riad particularly as it costs a bit less than others of similar quality. We stayed elsewhere during our time in Morocco and this was the best riad we used.

Review_Title: Les Trois Mages is a legend....
Review_Text: This place is quickly becoming a legend. In the midst of the heat of the Medina Les Trois Mages offers the traveller a cool sanctuary in which to unwind and refresh. My arrival couldnt be any simpler. On arrival Hassan (cabby) was there to take me from the airport and within 15 minutes we had passed through a northern gate of the Medina Bab Moussoufa and onto the busy one way lane of Rue El Gza. The Riad is a short 5 minute walk from this Northern point and as I was to find in an excellent position for exploring both the central Medina Jemaa El Fna as well as for walking into the more newly developed surrounds outside of the ancient walled city.    When I arrived Helen was there to begin my initiation into the city. What sets her guidance apart from the rest is Helens obvious deep understanding of the place and the people and also her appreciation of my excitement at being here. Helens guidance and presence throughout my week long stay at the Riad was to prove invaluable. She oozes confidence and an explicit trust that Marrakech and its people will welcome the traveller; and so they do.....    The Riad itself is an oasis of calm elegance smart and clean. Its an ongoing work which is growing organically with the nurturance of its excellent staff team and its owners Tony and Anna. Nothing is too much trouble for these guys and their welcome feels like you've come home.    When I arrived I was unable to get a strong enough wifi signal to work on my laptop. Helen offered me use of the admin system at the Riad and within the day Tony arranged for an IT engineer and an electrician to install an extension to their system which was an instant solution which remedied the situation. The Riad offers excellent wifi internet access. Thus I was able to work unhindered.    The food at Les Trois Mages is becoming legendary. Saida's cooking is some of the best in the Medina and even though my french and arabic are dreadful negotiating my way around this menu with Saida was great fun. Each dish is individually prepared at your request and offers excellent value for money; aswell as giving a sound introduction to traditional Morroccan cuisine.    As the weather was between 37c - 40c the roof terrace and its pool meant that I could chill-out and cool right down as the summer sun began to dominate the Marrakchi skies. In the warm of the night the whole place is beautifully lit by traditional brass lamps studded with coloured glass.    Helens recommendations of where to eat and drink and what to see and experience outside of the comfort of the Riad were tried and tested by visitors before. Amongst them Cafe Arab (one of my most favourite haunts) an arabic fusion cafe with a tented terrace. Here a gently cooling mist is released from the shading canopy creating an easy chillout space where you can listen to ambient music and drink home-grown Casablanca beer by the bottle. The staff too are welcoming and I soon felt like I belonged.    So too was the Kosy Bar in the south of the Medina. Here you can watch the Storks come to rest for the evening in their huge nests upon the old city walls. As the sun sinks and the evening cools you can listen to impromptu performances from jazz musicians who seem to be simply passing through. The food here is good. It is a fusion of Morroccan-French with Japanese touch. Try the Poulet Terryaki - sound! Tip these guys well here it makes your next visit all the more pleasurable....    The Riad Les Trois Mages is a difficult place to leave (see the visitors book and the visitor who stayed within the walls of the Riad for 4 days!!!). The staff here become like family and the place has the feeling of a home from home. This place and its characters Helen Saida Tony Anna and the crew are becoming legend. Just awesome!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: what a wonderful stay we had here. the staff could not have been more helpful saida was a great cook and helen who manages the riad was the best host we had during our whole trip around morocco including arranging for us to be picked up by a very friendly and trustworthy taxi driver from the airport ( i would recommend doing this ). she sat us down when we arrived and talked us through a map of marrakech and suggested some fantastic places to visit and eat and drink. without this help we would have got very lost and wasted lots of time trying to find out where to go as marrakech can be quite daunting on your first visit. with helen's advice and help we breezed through our first day there and there could be no better place to go back to than this very central (only about a 15 minute walk through the bussling streets to the main medina) yet incredibly peaceful retreat with a gorgeous roof top pool .    we would recommend this to everyone and already have to our friends. we will certainly be returning and hope you enjoy your trip to morocco as much as we did. we would also recommend a trip to the atlas mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Mages for three nights 1st - 3rd April and can't praise it highly enough. Never having been to Marrakech we too pored over the internet before choosing. We almost decided on the Jardins de Koutoubia (a 5* hotel within the medina) but were SO pleased we changed our minds. We went there for a drink and it was big impersonal and the service was poor. (We asked for a branded spirit and got 'petrol' when we complained - they admitted it wasn't what we'd ordered and even tho' we didn't drink it it remained on the bill. A glass of water was accidentally smashed and altho' the waiter saw it happen he left us sitting with broken shards around our feet and on the path near the pool for half an hour.. but I digress)  The Mages is really lovely and clean and best of all friendly. I fail to understand how anyone can critisise Helen (the manageress) I have honestly never met anyone so helpful. She sat with us for ages on the morning of our arrival gave us maps detailing the best restaurants bars etc and giving us invaluable information about what to do and more importantly what not to do. It all turned out to be spot on. She steered us expertly round what can be a fairly overwhelming city. She was there every day and asked for feed-back on what we'd done the day before. we were very curious about many aspects of life in Morocco not related to our stay and Helen has lived in Marrakech for a number of years and knows so much about the customs and culture. She came out of the kitchen when we left and gave us all a kiss and a hug. Maybe you get out of people what you put in - anyway I can't thank her enough. ALL the staff are sweet and Saida is a smashing cook a very friendly lady who makes an enormous effort to converse even tho' our French is very amateurish and her English is scant.    Don't be put off by the street outside the Riad. The medina is ancient and the footprint can't be changed. The houses are all inward facing around central courtyards making the outside facades quite featureless which means you set off down narrow alley-ways thinking "What have I done? It's like Beirut ! I could have been in a hotel" but stick with it. When you open the front door into the Riad it's a different world. Fresh flowers beautiful decor and friendly faces and a much more authentic intimate experience. One word of warning - mind out for mopeds - they're flippin' lethal. Walk on the right single file!  High lights for us were the Cafe Arrabe (lovely lunch venue) Le Comptoir Nightclub and the Kosy Bar where we were blown away by the sight of the storks nesting on the walls of the Palais Bahia. (Our Riad roof-top guitar recital was a blast too - apologies to the other guests especially B & R)    Overall it was a marvellous few days and Les Trios Mages was the perfect place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A fabulous corner of the medina
Review_Text: We have just returned from a week long stay in Morocco of which we spent 4 nights in Marrakech at the Trois Mages.    Firstly the place was lovely clean fresh and very quiet. The decor is lovely (although I do agree about the hard mattress) the rooms are very comfortable and best of all the plumbing (which can be a problem over there) was fantastic powerful hot showers at any time.    The staff were great Sadia the two women who work with her and the night manager were all lovely. Although I disagree with what was said about Helen the manager I can understand a little bit.    She was fantastic with us the morning after we arrived she sat down and took the time to go through a great map she provided showed us in detail how to get to the centre and where to avoid (a result of which was we never got lost once the whole time) she recommended dinner at Tangia and Le Comptoir and made the bookings for us (both of which were excellent - I would especially recommend comptoir the food was fantastic and the decor is very buddha bar fabulous - although the belly dancers are a bit cliched). Anyway that was our first morning and she was friendly and helpful any time we saw her after that although she isn't there much. However on our last morning I overheard her being extremely rude to Sadia regarding cleaning which I thought was a bit much and when we left although she was standing in the kitchen she ignored us when we called goodbyes...but maybe she was just having a bad day so it's a small thing and the positives far outweighed that. Also we used Hassan's company to take us to Essaouira and on the return journey a few days later he was very helpful the driver was great and the price was €80 each way split between 6 people it's a 3 hour drive so I didn't think that was too expensive and was nice to know we could rely on the service.
